{"duration": "1:23:00", "runner": "Bounceyboy", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/super-mario-sunshine/3030-6649/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2> <figure data-align=\"right\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2714/340261-sms_delfino.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340261\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.5243902439024\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:152.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2714/340261-sms_delfino.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340261\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/2714/340261-sms_delfino.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Mario sweeping Delfino by surprise</figcaption></figure>Super Mario Sunshine is a 3D platformer for the <a data-ref-id=\"3045-23\" href=\"/gamecube/3045-23\" slug=\"gamecube\">  GameCube</a>, and the first true successor to its innovative predecessor, <a data-ref-id=\"3030-2931\" href=\"/super-mario-64/3030-2931\" slug=\"super-mario-64\">  Super Mario 64</a>.\u00a0 <br/>\u00a0<br/>The gameplay remains very close to that superb blueprint introduced in Mario 64, with a similar moveset, familiar enemy encounters, and generally comparable platforming elements throughout. However, the gameplay is a major departure from said formula in one aspect: the introduction of Mario\u2019s hydro-pumping backpack, <a data-ref-id=\"3005-3534\" href=\"/fludd/3005-3534\" slug=\"fludd\">  F.L.U.D.D.</a> <br/><br/>Mario utilizes F.L.U.D.D. throughout a majority of the game, and can apply it to a wide variety of different uses \u2013 most notably, the ability to Squirt objects and enemies that are due for a good rinse, as well as the ability to hover, which allows for a safe recovery from dangerous falls, and provides the aptitude to reach previously inaccessible areas.<br/><br/> <h2>Gameplay</h2> <figure data-align=\"right\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2714/340179-sms_mario.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340179\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2714/340179-sms_mario.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340179\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/2714/340179-sms_mario.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Mario with the water-blasting backpack, F.L.U.D.D.</figcaption></figure>Super Mario Sunshine has gameplay similar to previous Super Mario game, Super Mario 64. As with every <a data-ref-id=\"3005-177\" href=\"/mario/3005-177\" slug=\"mario\">  Mario</a> game, however, it adds new gameplay aspects and features. Likely the most important upgrade is the addition of F.L.U.D.D. (Flash Liquidizing Ultra Dousing Device). F.L.U.D.D. is a pack that Mario wears that can either spray water or use water power to have Mario hover. Other nozzles can be unlocked later: the Rocket Nozzle and the Turbo Nozzle. The Rocket Nozzle can shoot Mario several hundred feet into the air. The Turbo Nozzle can allow Mario to run at incredible speeds, even allowing him to run on water and break through thing s like doors.<br/><br/>Mario can also enlist the aid of <a data-ref-id=\"3005-700\" href=\"/yoshi/3005-700\" slug=\"yoshi\">  Yoshi</a>. When riding Yoshi, he can eat enemies, fruit, and even birds. Some of the birds grant a <a data-ref-id=\"3055-1984\" href=\"/shine-sprite/3055-1984\" slug=\"shine-sprite\">Shine Sprite</a> upon being eaten, while others give coins. After eating fruit, Yoshi can spit juice from the fruit. This juice can dissolve large orange blocks, which are obstacles blocking certain secret areas. The juice can also turn enemies into platforms. Based on the type of fruit, the color and effect of the juice are different. Yoshi can die in two ways that Mario can't: without eating fruit, Yoshi will die, and when Yoshi touches the water, he dies.<br/> <br/> The primary goal of Super Mario Sunshine is to collect Shine Sprites. These are in a variety of smaller levels, from the hub world of Delfino Plaza. Each Shine Sprite can be acquired by doing a specific task in the level. Every level has eight such tasks to be completed. After collecting a large enough amount of Shine Sprites, a new level is unlocked, Mario gets a new ability, or an event related to the plot. Shine Sprites can be collected in other ways, such as gathering enough blue coins (scattered around <a data-ref-id=\"3035-494\" href=\"/isle-delfino/3035-494\" slug=\"isle-delfino\">  Isle Delfino</a>) or eating certain birds. Not all Shine Sprites need to be acquired in order to gain access to the final level; only Shadow Mario related events.<br/><br/> <h2>Plot</h2> <figure data-align=\"right\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/13933/494416-super_mario_sunshine_3.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-494416\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.74857142857143\" data-width=\"350\" style=\"width: 350px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/13933/494416-super_mario_sunshine_3.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-494416\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/13933/494416-super_mario_sunshine_3.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/13933/494416-super_mario_sunshine_3.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure>The game opens with Mario, <a data-ref-id=\"3005-709\" href=\"/princess-peach/3005-709\" slug=\"princess-peach\">  Princess Peach</a>, and several of the Princess' <a data-ref-id=\"3005-845\" href=\"/toad/3005-845\" slug=\"toad\">  royal entourage</a> aboard a private plane, en route to <a data-ref-id=\"3035-494\" href=\"/isle-delfino/3035-494\" slug=\"isle-delfino\">  Isle Delfino</a>, a destination that everyone believes will be a tranquil escape from the every day grind of kidnappings, fire-breathing behemoths, and general mayhem that makes the Mushroom Kingdom such an unproductive working environment.  However, the holiday is brought to an abrupt halt as soon as the vacationing group touches down on the runway, when they discover a prominent work of graffiti that bears an apparent resemblance to the mustachioed plumber. Mario travels to the other end of the runway to seek help in clearing the obstruction, and is introduced to a talking, <a data-ref-id=\"3055-754\" href=\"/water-gun/3055-754\" slug=\"water-gun\">  water-pumping</a> backpack, nicknamed F.L.U.D.D. <br/><br/> <figure data-align=\"right\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5758/355114-supmarsun4.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-355114\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.64406779661017\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:64.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5758/355114-supmarsun4.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-355114\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5758/355114-supmarsun4.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5758/355114-supmarsun4.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mario collecting a Shine Sprite.</figcaption></figure>With the help of his newfound semi-sidekick, Mario is able to clean up the runway of all graffiti and restore it to its original state. However, no sooner is this act of goodwill completed than two of Isle Delfino's finest arrive on the scene to bring Mario under arrest for evidently fouling up several other areas of the island. After a fairly unfair trial, Mario is ultimately sentenced to clean the <i>entire</i> island of all of the pollution that blemishes it before he will be permitted to leave. Doing so will quite literally brighten up the place, as a good many of the island's \" Shine Sprites\" have gone missing due to the rampant vandalism.  These \"Shine Sprites\" traditionally gather at the \"Shine Gate\" in the center of town, and are the source of the pleasant rays that illuminate the island paradise; but, the malicious work of the real vandal has essentially scared them all away, leaving the island covered, in large part, by a persistent shadow.<br/><br/>By traversing the many areas of Isle Delfino, and working to undo the true culprit's defacement and overall trouble-making, Mario will collect and return the \"Shine Sprites\" to their rightful place and restore the island to its normal, immaculate state.", "deck": "When a luxurious escape to sun-drenched Isle Delfino takes a turn for the worse, it\u2019s up to Mario to clean up the newly sludge-filled paradise, clear his own name in a case of mistaken identity, and rescue Princess Peach from an elusive kidnapper \u2013 by all accounts, a typical vacation for the infamous plumber.", "aliases": null, "image": {"icon_url": {"duration": "1:35:00", "runner": "Ahamplan", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-between-worlds/3030-42402/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560131\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560131-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_02.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560131-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_02.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560131\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560131-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_02.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Familiar place, brand new adventure.</figcaption></figure><p>The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds is the first all-new <a href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda/3025-9\" data-ref-id=\"3025-9\">Zelda</a> title for the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/nintendo-3ds/3045-117\" data-ref-id=\"3045-117\">Nintendo 3DS</a> and the first major Zelda game to be released in the west significantly earlier than in Japan. The game was developed by <a href=\"/nintendo-ead/3010-463\" data-ref-id=\"3010-463\">Nintendo EAD</a> and released on November 22, 2013 in the west and on December 26, 2013 in Japan. It is the first Zelda title to be solo-directed by <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/hiromasa-shikata/3040-38953\" data-ref-id=\"3040-38953\">Hiromasa Shikata</a> who first worked on the franchise with <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-ocarina-of-time/3030-12572\" data-ref-id=\"3030-12572\">The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time</a>. A Link Between Worlds is set in the same incarnation of <a href=\"/hyrule/3035-13\" data-ref-id=\"3035-13\">Hyrule</a> as <a href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-to-the-past/3030-10276\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10276\">The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past</a>, and has its own unique alternate world players will discover and explore with <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/lorule/3035-4458\" data-ref-id=\"3035-4458\">Lorule</a>.</p><h2>Story</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560427\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560427-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_17.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560427-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_17.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560427\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560427-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_17.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The game takes place in both Hyrule and Lorule.</figcaption></figure><p>A Link Between Worlds is set a long time after the events in A Link to the Past (it's also set after <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-links-awakening/3030-3645\" data-ref-id=\"3030-3645\">Link's Awakening</a> and the two <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-oracle-of-seasons/3030-5895\" data-ref-id=\"3030-5895\">Oracle-</a>games) and stars a different <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/link/3005-191\" data-ref-id=\"3005-191\">Link </a>than the one who defeated <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/ganon/3005-512\" data-ref-id=\"3005-512\">Ganon </a>before. This new Link is the local blacksmith's apprentice who keeps being late for work because he has nightmares about <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/zelda/3005-5\" data-ref-id=\"3005-5\">Princess Zelda</a> being assaulted by a giant shadowy monster. Just as in The Minish Cap and Twilight Princess, Link is tasked with delivering a sword to Hyrule Castle but he gets turned away and tries to sneak into the castle by way of the Sanctuary.</p><p>There, a wizard called Yuga knocks out the young apprentice who later awakens in his house where he meets Ravio, the shopkeeper. Ravio tells him to go to Hyrule Castle and warn Princess Zelda of Yuga's evil plans but Link cannot stop him and so Yuga traps Zelda and the descendants of the seven sages in paintings and makes off with them. Link has to get them back and must wake the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/master-sword/3055-16\" data-ref-id=\"3055-16\">Master Sword</a> from its supposed eternal slumber. <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/sahasrahla/3005-19546\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19546\">Sahasrahla</a>, whose ancestor already assisted Link and the player in the SNES-title is again educating Link about his upcoming adventure.</p><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560430\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560430-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_20.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.61057692307692\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560430-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_20.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560430\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560430-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_20.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560430-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_20.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Like in A Link to the Past, there is again an alternate world that Link eventually travels to. However, this time it's not the Sacred Realm that has been corrupted by Ganon's evil wishes and turned into the Dark World. In A Link Between Worlds, this other place is called Lorule and is a land fallen upon dark times which used to be a lot like Hyrule. Lorule is governed by Princess Hilda, the direct counterpart to Zelda in Hyrule. Hilda is in need of a Hero to save Lorule but there is no one suitable around. Possible connections between Hilda and Yuga are still unclear as is the role of Ganon in Link's nightmares.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>A Link Between Worlds represents a major initiative to throw out many of the design conventions of the Zelda series and approach the basic game structure differently. The development team pushed for a more open, player driven experience in contrast to other recent Zelda titles. Instead the gameplay goes for a more open-ended approach, reminiscent of the original <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda/3030-11949\" data-ref-id=\"3030-11949\">Legend of Zelda</a>.</p><h3>Playing with Perspective</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560431\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560431-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_21.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560431-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_21.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560431\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560431-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_21.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560431-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_21.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>The game is presented from the traditional top-down perspective of early Zelda titles such as A Link to the Past and <a href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-links-awakening/3030-3645\" data-ref-id=\"3030-3645\">Link's Awakening</a>. However, gameplay and exploration are centered around playing with perspective, as <a href=\"/link/3005-191\" data-ref-id=\"3005-191\">Link</a> is able to flatten himself into a wall sketch so he can move on walls like a shadow. When Link is in this state, the camera perspective shifts to provide a three-dimensional side view of the immediate environment.</p><h3>Renting Items</h3><p>The biggest and most important new addition to the game is the item renting systems. In an effort to combat the linearity of recent Zeldas, players now get to rent all the major puzzle items from Ravio's shop.</p><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2526441\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2526441-zlcfzrfgevspn8uhme.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2526441-zlcfzrfgevspn8uhme.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2526441\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2526441-zlcfzrfgevspn8uhme.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2526441-zlcfzrfgevspn8uhme.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Ravio offers Link the opportunity to rent items for an affordable price as long as he wants or until he dies. In the event that Link meets an untimely end in a dungeon or facing off against an enemy, the little flying creature that accompanies Ravio will collect all the rented items and return them to the shop. When that happens, the item has to be rented again. Purchasing items is an option as well, though the price to own an item forever is quite steep. This places an unprecedented importance on rupees in this new Zelda game. Players find a lot more rupees in their adventure than in previous titles as there are mini-dungeons scattered all across Hyrule and Lorule that yield rupee rewards.</p><h3>Non-Linear Dungeon Progression</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2553657\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2553657-10039150175_85e4e87660_o.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2553657-10039150175_85e4e87660_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2553657\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2553657-10039150175_85e4e87660_o.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2553657-10039150175_85e4e87660_o.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Nintendo EAD introduced the item renting system to put more emphasis on freedom and let players roam the game world in the way they want and tackle dungeons in any order. The availability of the necessary items from Ravio's shop makes this possible.</p><h3>Exploring the World</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560428\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560428-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_18.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560428-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_18.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560428\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560428-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_18.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560428-3ds_zeldalbw_1001_18.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Link explores Lorule.</figcaption></figure><p>Hyrule's geography should be very familiar for players of A Link to the Past as it retains most of its characteristic layout. However, some notable changes have been made in the form of new passages that function as shortcuts between major locations and the addition of the aforementioned new mini-dungeons and caves that hide various treasures for Link to find.</p><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2553667\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2553667-10039240013_957af328cc_o.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2553667-10039240013_957af328cc_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2553667\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2553667-10039240013_957af328cc_o.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2553667-10039240013_957af328cc_o.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Another factor changing the way players perceive and explore the familiar Hyrule landscape is the wall-merge mechanic that turns Link into a flat painting. Just as it is used in dungeons to solve puzzles, it is used in the overworld to reach otherwise inaccessible places. On top of that, it is used to travel through tears \"between worlds\" and cross over into Lorule. This can again be used to reach different places previously not reachable by Link.</p><p>Getting around the world quickly is again facilitated by the familiar fast travel system from A Link to the Past by way of calling the witch Irene with a bell after which she will drop Link off at already discovered weather vanes like the one next to Ravio's shop.</p><h2>Items</h2><h3>New Items</h3><h4>Tornado Rod</h4><p>Used to produce an updraft so Link can reach higher places. Also has offensive use.</p><h4>Sand Rod</h4><p>Manipulates sand to form solid ground for Link to walk on or wall-merge in to.</p><h4>Yellow Potion</h4><p>Makes Link invulnerable for a brief period. Requirements: Yellow Monster Horn</p><h4>Purple Potion</h4><p>Damages enemies around Link. Requirements: Purple Enemy Guts</p><h4>Energy Potion</h4><p>Can be found in pots. Instantly refills the energy meter.</p><h4>Hint Glass</h4><p>The Hint Glass lets Link see hint ghosts that help Link solve puzzles if necessary. However, usage requires payment via 3DS Play Coins. Each hint costs 1 coin.</p><h4>Ravio's Bracelet</h4><p>Ravio's Bracelet is given to Link by Ravio and has multiple uses in this game. The most important being the ability to turn Link into a painting so he can walk along walls in his flat state. Another key function is that it activates the energy meter that determines the frequency with which players can use items before having to wait for a recharge.</p><h4>Foul Fruit</h4><p>This fruit can be purchased at the shop in Kakariko Village. It can be used to scare off or stun enemies.</p><h4>Scoot Fruit</h4><p>This fruit can also be purchased at the shop in Kakariko Village. It allows Link to warp out of dungeons.</p><h3>Known returning items</h3><ul><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/bow/3055-73\" data-ref-id=\"3055-73\">Bow</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/boomerang/3055-76\" data-ref-id=\"3055-76\">Boomerang</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/bomb/3055-97\" data-ref-id=\"3055-97\">Bombs</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/hook-shot/3055-383\" data-ref-id=\"3055-383\">Hookshot</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/hammer/3055-308\" data-ref-id=\"3055-308\">Hammer</a></li><li>Fire Rod</li><li>Ice Rod</li><li>Red Potion (Heals eight hearts) - Requirements: Rupees</li><li>Blue Potion (Full health refill) - Requirements: Rupees, Blue Enemy Guts</li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/lantern/3055-1978\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1978\">Lantern</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/butterfly-net/3055-2667\" data-ref-id=\"3055-2667\">Net</a></li><li><a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/bottle/3055-133\" data-ref-id=\"3055-133\">Bottle</a></li><li>Zora Flippers</li><li><a href=\"/power-glove/3055-3532\" data-ref-id=\"3055-3532\">Power Gloves</a></li><li><a href=\"/pegasus-boots/3055-4913\" data-ref-id=\"3055-4913\">Pegasus Boots</a></li></ul><h3>Finding Maiamai &amp; Upgrading Items</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560127\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560127-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_06.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.61057692307692\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560127-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_06.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560127\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560127-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_06.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560127-3ds_zeldalbw_comiccon_screenshot_06.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Items can be upgraded by finding Maiamais all over the world (100 in total) and returning a certain amount of them to the Mother Maiamai which will then reward Link with an upgrade for an item the player has purchased (not rented!) from Ravio's shop. Maiamais are stuck to walls (some in easily visible places, others must be located by following their cries) and can only be removed by using the wall-merge mechanic and getting behind them in order to pop them off the wall. Mother Maiamai can be found in both Hyrule and Lorule. An important detail is the fact that only items purchased from Ravio can be upgraded. Rented items are not eligible.</p><h3>Other Collectibles</h3><p>Finding Maiamai, heart pieces and collecting rupees is not the only thing Link spends his time on when not solving puzzles and fighting baddies. The latter will drop objects like guts, horns or tails which Link can use to trade for potions at the Witch's hut. These potions aren't limited to restorative functions like in previous Zelda games. They can be used to damage surrounding enemies, make Link invulnerable or heal him.</p><h3>Replenishing Resources</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2560532\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560532-triplebow.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2560532-triplebow.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2560532\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560532-triplebow.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2560532-triplebow.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The gauge on the left depletes as Link uses items and skills.</figcaption></figure><p>In A Link Between Worlds, collecting arrows or replenishing Link's bomb supply is a thing of the past as there is a new system in place similar to the stamina gauge from Skyward Sword. This allows Link to, for example, fire arrows until the gauge is fully depleted after which it has to refill before Link can continue to shoot arrows. All item usage and the wall-merge ability is tied to this mechanic, limiting Link's ability to mindlessly spam item attacks.</p><h2>Dungeons</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2570229\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570229-10840750476_8a3cd41f04_o.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.61057692307692\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570229-10840750476_8a3cd41f04_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2570229\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570229-10840750476_8a3cd41f04_o.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570229-10840750476_8a3cd41f04_o.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Evil ducks look even more evil.</figcaption></figure><p>The game's structure is loosely based on that of A Link to the Past in that there are four basic dungeons in Hyrule and another eight in Lorule. Only the first dungeon has to be completed before the player can freely choose the order in which to approach the remaining dungeons as all items necessary can be purchased or rented from Ravio's shop. Key items needed in a dungeon are telegraphed via a symbol at the dungeon entrance to avoid frustrating experiences.</p><p>Familiar dungeons from A Link to the Past are revisited and appear in new light just like the overworld due to changes in the environment and other changes brought on by the passage of time since the original game.</p><h2>Mini-Games</h2><p>As is typical for the Zelda series, there are a few mini-games available for Link to partake in with the chance to win some cash or heart pieces. A Link Between Worlds introduces some brand new ones.</p><h3>Octoball Derby</h3><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2565834\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2565834-kpc5d8y.png\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.6\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:60.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2565834-kpc5d8y.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2565834\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2565834-kpc5d8y.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2565834-kpc5d8y.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>In this mini-game, located in Lorule, Link whacks a ball fired at him by an Octorok to break vases scattered on the baseball-like field in front of him or knock over enemies.</p><h3>Chicken Evasion</h3><p>Here, Link has to evade the notoriously deadly cuccos for 30 seconds to get his desired rupee-reward.</p><h3>Treacherous Tower</h3><p>This one is a familiar challenge from the Zelda series. The Treacherous Tower is a combat challenge in which Link has to clear numerous floors of various enemies with the option to choose from three difficulty levels.</p><h2>Hero Mode</h2><p>After finishing the story for the first time, Hero Mode is unlocked. Similar to other recent titles in the series, Link will take higher damage (four times as much) but this time, there is also a \"hidden extra\" players can find on a second playthrough.</p><h2>StreetPass &amp; Shadow Link</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2570234\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570234-10840832684_4492533324_o.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"left\" data-ratio=\"0.61057692307692\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570234-10840832684_4492533324_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2570234\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570234-10840832684_4492533324_o.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570234-10840832684_4492533324_o.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Wanted. Dead or (not) alive.</figcaption></figure><p>The game supports <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/streetpass-functionality/3015-6609\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6609\">StreetPass functionality</a> in the form of Shadow Links being passed around. When speaking with a character in Hyrule called Gramps, he will tell Link about newly received StreetPass data. The player can create their own Shadow Link and equip them with two items before sending them out to StreetPass with other people. Each Shadow Link has an automatically calculated bounty attached to them which is determined by the amount of hearts the player has and the item combination equipped on the Shadow Link.</p><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2570231\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570231-10841026033_1f25c5b984_o.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.61057692307692\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/2570231-10841026033_1f25c5b984_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2570231\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570231-10841026033_1f25c5b984_o.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2570231-10841026033_1f25c5b984_o.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Link is battling a Shadow Link in the arena.</figcaption></figure><p>Once a player receives another player's Shadow Link data, they can challenge him to a duel in a dedicated arena and, upon winning, cash in the bounty set for that respective Shadow Link. The bounties appear in the game world in the form of signposts in front of Gramps but Shadow Link will only show up later somewhere in the world. There is no penalty for losing against Shadow Link, only the chance to win some precious rupees and the possibility to get achievements for winning battles with certain items.</p><h2>Digital Version</h2><p>File Size: 5,482 Blocks (685MB)</p><h2>Reception</h2><p>As of March 31, 2014 A Link Between Worlds sold 2.51 million copies worldwide.</p>", "deck": "The first original The Legend of {"duration": "1:15:00", "runner": "saintmillion", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/demons-souls/3030-24057/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Demon's Souls is a <a href=\"/third-person-perspective/3015-464\" data-ref-id=\"3015-464\">third-person</a> action, open-ended, dark fantasy, RPG <a href=\"../../dungeon/95-1131/\" rel=\"nofollow\">dungeon</a> crawler and <a href=\"/spiritual-successor/3015-425\" data-ref-id=\"3015-425\">spiritual successor</a> to <a href=\"../../fromsoftware-inc/65-760/\" rel=\"nofollow\">From Software</a>'s <a href=\"../../kings-field/62-1348/\" rel=\"nofollow\">King's Field</a> series. Its gameplay is largely <a href=\"/hack-and-slash/3015-469\" data-ref-id=\"3015-469\">hack and slash</a>-oriented, though it requires levels of strategy, thoughtfulness, and precise use of a <a href=\"/stamina-bar/3015-3569\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3569\">stamina meter</a> that are not common in the genre. Dungeons are filled with numerous enemies and traps, with each section ending in a <a href=\"../../bosses/92-229/\" rel=\"nofollow\">boss</a> battle. Along the way to each boss, players can <a href=\"../../summoning/92-99/\" rel=\"nofollow\">summon</a> other players to help them, or their own world can be invaded by another player.</p><p>Players can leave notes to other players on the ground over the <a href=\"../../playstation-network/92-2623/\" rel=\"nofollow\">PlayStation Network</a> using only a select combination of words warning them of upcoming dangers or giving advice on where to go; players can rate the \"note\" based on its validity. When a note is rated the person who created it is healed to full health in real time, or will be healed on their next connection to the game servers. There is also online co-op that involves joining other players' games for <a href=\"../../pvp-player-vs-player/92-346/\" rel=\"nofollow\">PvP</a> or co-op play to either defeat demons together or to invade and kill other players.</p><p>Although the game's servers were slated to go offline May 31st, 2012, rendering all the multiplayer elements <a href=\"/dead-multiplayer/3015-4333\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4333\">dead</a>, Atlus announced soon after that the servers will be kept running indefinitely.</p><h3>Influences</h3><p>In his <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/profile/7force/blog/dark-souls-design-works-translation-weapons-and-eq/99682\" data-ref-id=\"false\">Giant Bomb interview</a>, creator <a href=\"/hidetaka-miyazaki/3040-81280\" data-ref-id=\"3040-81280\">Hidetaka Miyazaki</a> mentioned the influence of several classic <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/games-based-on-comic-books/3015-4051\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4051\">manga </a>on his game designs for Dark Souls, including <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/saint-seiya/3025-1431\" data-ref-id=\"3025-1431\">Saint Seiya</a>, <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/jojos-bizarre-adventure/3025-377\" data-ref-id=\"3025-377\">JoJo's Bizarre Adventure</a>, and <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/berserk/3025-3216\" data-ref-id=\"3025-3216\">Berserk</a>. In another interview, he also cited <a href=\"http://www.vg247.com/2011/02/08/dark-souls-online-play-to-bring-back-the-feeling-of-old-dragon-quest-games/\" rel=\"nofollow\">the influence</a> of the early <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/dragon-quest/3025-160\" data-ref-id=\"3025-160\">Dragon Quest</a> games on Dark Souls. It was also influenced by <a href=\"/fromsoftware-inc/3010-760\" data-ref-id=\"3010-760\">FromSoftware</a>'s own <a href=\"/kings-field/3025-1348\" data-ref-id=\"3025-1348\">King's Field</a> series.</p><h3>Legacy</h3><p>Demon's Souls has resulted in many games that have taken inspiration from its high level of challenge and deliberately-paced combat (such as <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/dragons-dogma/3025-2510\" data-ref-id=\"3025-2510\">Dragon's Dogma</a> and <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-witcher-2-assassins-of-kings/3030-28178\" data-ref-id=\"3030-28178\">The Witcher 2</a>) as well as its unique implementation of <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/asynchronous-multiplayer/3015-4359\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4359\">asynchronous multiplayer</a>, which inspired games like <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/journey/3030-31772\" data-ref-id=\"3030-31772\">Journey</a> and even the <a href=\"http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2013-11-22-demons-and-dark-souls-inspired-the-ps4s-features-says-yoshida\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-ref-id=\"2013-11\">design</a> of the <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/playstation-4/3045-146\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a> console.</p><p>Dark Souls has had a strong influence on a number of action RPG titles and the video game industry in general. Developers of games such as <a href=\"/the-witcher-2-assassins-of-kings/3030-28178\" data-ref-id=\"3030-28178\">The Witcher 2</a>, <a href=\"/destiny/3030-36067\" data-ref-id=\"3030-36067\">Destiny</a> and <a href=\"/alienation/3030-47362\" data-ref-id=\"3030-47362\">Alienation</a> have <a href=\"http://www.polygon.com/2014/8/22/6056895/alienation-dark-demon-souls-ps4\" rel=\"nofollow\">cited </a>Dark Souls games as an influence. The innovative <a href=\"/asynchronous-multiplayer/3015-4359\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4359\">asynchronous </a><a href=\"/online/3015-559\" data-ref-id=\"3015-559\">online </a>multiplayer of Dark Souls also <a href=\"http://www.destructoid.com/demon-s-and-dark-souls-influenced-the-ps4-s-development-266215.phtml\" rel=\"nofollow\">influenced</a> games such as <a href=\"/journey/3030-31772\" data-ref-id=\"3030-31772\">Journey</a> and the development of the <a href=\"/playstation-4/3045-146\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a>.</p><h2>Story</h2><p><a href=\"../../king-allant/94-16896/\" rel=\"nofollow\">King Allant</a> had a magnificent kingdom in the land of <a href=\"../../boletarian-palace/95-2207/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Boletaria</a>. Striving to make his kingdom the best it could be, he enlisted the help of the <a href=\"../../the-nexus/95-2211/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Nexus</a> - a great tower harboring the souls of the dead. King Allant used the Soul Arts to improve life in Boletaria, making it prosper beyond its previous limits.</p><p>With time, King Allant was still unsatisfied. He demanded more. He knew where the greatest power of all was to be held. He took it upon himself to delve beneath the Nexus and awake the great being below, \" <a href=\"../../the-old-one/94-16895/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Old One</a>\". It was a being of indescribable hunger, a being which feeds on the souls of the dead, growing hungrier and craving more powerful souls with every soul it devours.</p><p>With the awakening of <a href=\"/the-old-one/3005-16895\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16895\">The Old One</a>, Boletaria began to be enveloped in a great fog. The fog spread outward, blanketing Boletaria in a haze of death. No man or woman who passed within the borders of the fog were ever seen again. Worse than that, the fog still grows, and if not stopped, will consume all in existence.</p><p>Warriors from all over were drawn to the fog. People seeking wealth, fame, power, and repentance all flocked to Boletaria. And yet the fog still grows.</p><p>The player takes on the role of a adventurer, crossing into the fog of Boletaria.</p><h2>Character Creation</h2><p>When starting a new character, the player chooses a gender and a place of origin (North, South, East, or West) and is able to <a href=\"/customizable-characters/3015-155\" data-ref-id=\"3015-155\">fine-tune</a> the character's appearance using a system of sliders.</p><p>The player must also select a <a href=\"/classes/3015-405\" data-ref-id=\"3015-405\">class</a> of sorts - however, classes in Demon's Souls are less concrete than in most other RPGs, serving more as examples of the various approaches the player might eventually decide on. The starting class only affects starting stats, gear, and - if applicable - magic spells. Any player can use any weapon, armor, ring, or magic regardless of initial class choice (though a few pieces of equipment are gender-specific.) The use of weapons, armor and magic is governed only by stat requirements, and rings have no restrictions.</p><p>Those who want to use magic or miracles must first attain at least 10 in both Intelligence and Magic before \"Wizard\" spells can be learned, and a 10 in Faith before miracles can be learned. Casting spells or miracles requires a Catalyst or a Talisman, respectively.</p><h3>Classes</h3><ul><li><b>Soldier:</b> (Soul Level 6) The default class, a balanced character geared for melee combat with no particular weaknesses or strengths. Starts with a set of plate armor, a broadsword, and a spear.</li><li><b>Knight</b>: (Soul Level 4) Physically strong and heavily armored, with the best starting shield, but lacking in Vitality compared to other melee classes. The bulky starting armor also greatly reduces mobility.</li><li><b>Hunter</b>: (Soul Level 6) A balanced character that is equipped with a bow, a one-handed <a href=\"/battle-axe/3055-2214\" data-ref-id=\"3055-2214\">battle axe</a>, a shield, and and leather armor.</li><li><b>Priest</b>: (Soul Level 6) A warrior of the light. Starts with a healing miracle, a mace, and chain armor.</li><li><b>Magician</b>: (Soul Level 6) A strong user of fire magic. Weak in physical offense and defense, and very little armor at the outset.</li><li><b>Wanderer</b>: (Soul Level 6) Melee fighter that specializes in lighter armor and Dexterity-based weapons.</li><li><b>Barbarian</b>: (Soul Level 9) Physically powerful with very high HP, but only comes equipped with two clubs and no armor. Has the highest starting soul level, tied with the Thief.</li><li><b>Thief</b>: (Soul Level 9) Lightly armed with a dagger and Dark Leather armor. Starts with very high Luck and Dexterity, along with a high Soul Level.</li><li><b>Temple Knight:</b> (Soul Level 4) A holy warrior who wields a halberd and casts healing miracles. Comes exceptionally well-armored with a suit of Mirdan Scale.</li><li><b>Royalty</b>: (Soul Level 1) Usually considered the easiest starting class. Lacking in stats, but has very rare starting gear such as an MP-regenerating ring, and can cast a fairly powerful, easy-to-use attack spell (Soul Arrow). The low Soul Level is also helpful to experienced players, as it allows more control over stat progression.</li></ul><h3><b>Starting Class Stats</b></h3><table><tbody><tr><th>Class</th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-vitality\" rel=\"nofollow\">Vit</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-intelligence\" rel=\"nofollow\">Int</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-endurance\" rel=\"nofollow\">End</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-strength\" rel=\"nofollow\">Str</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-dexterity\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dex</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-magic\" rel=\"nofollow\">Magic</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-faith\" rel=\"nofollow\">Faith</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-luck\" rel=\"nofollow\">Luck</a></th><th><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-slvl\" rel=\"nofollow\">Starting</a><br /><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/stat-slvl\" rel=\"nofollow\">Soul Level</a></th></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/soldier\" rel=\"nofollow\">Soldier</a></td><td>14</td><td>9</td><td>12</td><td>12</td><td>11</td><td>8</td><td>10</td><td>10</td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/knight\" rel=\"nofollow\">Knight</a></td><td>10</td><td>11</td><td>11</td><td>14</td><td>10</td><td>10</td><td>11</td><td>7</td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/hunter\" rel=\"nofollow\">Hunter</a></td><td>12</td><td>10</td><td>13</td><td>11</td><td>12</td><td>8</td><td>8</td><td>12</td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/priest\" rel=\"nofollow\">Priest</a></td><td>13</td><td>11</td><td>12</td><td>13</td><td>8</td><td>8</td><td>13</td><td>8</td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/magician\" rel=\"nofollow\">Magician</a></td><td>9</td><td>15</td><td>10</td><td>9</td><td>11</td><td>15</td><td>6</td><td>11</td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/wanderer\" rel=\"nofollow\">Wanderer</a></td><td>10</td><td>10</td><td>11</td><td>11</td><td>15</td><td>9</td><td>7</td><td>13</td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/barbarian\" rel=\"nofollow\">Barbarian</a></td><td>15</td><td>7</td><td>13</td><td>15</td><td>9</td><td>11</td><td>8</td><td>11</td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/thief\" rel=\"nofollow\">Thief</a></td><td>10</td><td>13</td><td>10</td><td>9</td><td>14</td><td>10</td><td>8</td><td>15</td><td>9</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/temple-knight\" rel=\"nofollow\">Temple Knight</a></td><td>11</td><td>8</td><td>13</td><td>14</td><td>12</td><td>6</td><td>13</td><td>7</td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/royalty\" rel=\"nofollow\">Royalty</a></td><td>8</td><td>12</td><td>8</td><td>9</td><td>12</td><td>13</td><td>12</td><td>7</td><td>1</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/19745/876601-demon63.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-876601\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.560546875\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/19745/876601-demon63.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-876601\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/19745/876601-demon63.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Demon's Souls plays a bit differently from most other <a href=\"../../hack-and-slash/92-469/\" rel=\"nofollow\">hack'n'slash</a> games. The combat system seems rather basic at first, but is very intuitive. It shows itself to be very intricate and robust, allowing for immense flexibility to adjust to the individual's play style.</p><ul><li>The player can do a light attack, heavy attack, <a href=\"../../block/92-1843/\" rel=\"nofollow\">block</a>, <a href=\"../../parrying/92-2485/\" rel=\"nofollow\">parry</a>, <a href=\"../../backstab/92-3236/\" rel=\"nofollow\">backstab</a>, <a href=\"../../riposte/92-4316/\" rel=\"nofollow\">riposte</a>, and a dodging-roll - all behaving differently based on what equipment the player currently has on.</li><li>Crossbows can be shot at range, while bows allow faster shooting and the option of manual first-person aiming.</li><li>The player can cast a range of <a href=\"../../evocation/92-5737/\" rel=\"nofollow\">offensive</a> and defensive magic spells with catalysts, and ask for miracles from <a href=\"../../god/94-7315/\" rel=\"nofollow\">God</a> to <a href=\"../../health/92-130/\" rel=\"nofollow\">heal</a>, <a href=\"../../protector/92-2468/\" rel=\"nofollow\">protect</a>, or attack with talismans.</li><li>To defeat demons, the player must learn to use the right weapon against the right enemy. Enemies each have unique weaknesses to certain attacks, spells, and usable items, while being strongly resistant to others. It is not wise to attack an armored enemy with a blade, nor is it efficient to use fire attacks on enemies made out of fire.</li></ul><h2>Game Areas</h2><ul><li><a href=\"../../the-nexus/95-2211/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Nexus</a>: Hub world, from which to access the 5 other worlds. Contains helpful <a href=\"../../non-player-character/92-967/\" rel=\"nofollow\">NPC</a>s that sell items, upgrade weapons and let you level up. In here you are also totally safe from Black Phantoms.</li><li><a href=\"../../boletarian-palace/95-2207/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Boletarian Palace</a> (World 1). Uniquely divided into 4 sections, as opposed to 3. Once the Palace of King Allant, it is now overrun by ghoulish humanoids and fierce Red- and Blue Eyed Knights. It is also home to two fire-breathing dragons, raining death from above. Deep within the Palace you can find <a href=\"/yuria-the-witch/3005-11180\" data-ref-id=\"3005-11180\">Yuria the Witch</a>.</li><li><a href=\"../../stonefang-tunnel/95-2208/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Stonefang Tunnel</a> (World 2). A network of mines, guarded by bosses that favor flame attacks. Best bring fire protection! Also contains a nest of <a href=\"../../crystal-gecko/92-3319/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Crystal Geckos</a>. Home also to the immensely helpful <a href=\"../../blacksmith-ed/94-11182/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Blacksmith Ed</a>. Most enemies here use the same style of attack and have the same weaknesses, so equipment strategies are best worked out here.</li><li><a href=\"../../tower-of-latria/95-2209/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Tower of Latria</a> (World 3). A prison tower. A cruel, inhospitable place rising up above a swamp. Powerful magical sentries guard the halls, with the upper spires the domain of evil gargoyles. <a href=\"../../sage-freke/94-11184/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Sage Freke</a> is imprisoned here. This world is not a place to learn how to fight, but rather a place to hone your skills once you've learned the controls and mechanics of your character.</li><li><a href=\"../../shrine-of-storms/95-2210/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Shrine of Storms</a> (World 4). An ancient mausoleum and burial ground surrounded by jagged, wind-swept cliffs. Home to agile skeletons, cruel Reapers that summon wraiths, and the occasional flying manta ray (Be ready to dodge as these like to attack you randomly). Within its bowels you may find <a href=\"../../saint-urbain/94-11196/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Saint Urbain</a>.</li><li><a href=\"../../valley-of-defilement/95-2212/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Valley of Defilement</a> (World 5). Possibly the most dangerous place of all, where the very environment is hostile. An atmosphere of decrepitude, decay, disease, and constant rain. Enemies include corrupted humanoids, insects, rats, and worse. Poison and plague are a common hazard here. Not for the inexperienced. Fire is helpful through most of this world.</li></ul><h3>Soul Form and Body Form</h3><p>At the start of the game, the player is in Soul form. In Soul form, the player has 50% of his total HP (75% with a ring found early on in the first level, the Cling Ring) but deals more damage to enemies. By killing a Boss, the player regains their body. In addition to having full HP and dealing less damage, the player can then also summon other players as Blue Phantoms to help him. However, the player can also be invaded by malicious Black Phantoms, other players that try to kill you. So if you want to prevent this, you'll have to stay in Soul Form. Additionally, when in Body Form, dying will cause a shift of World Tendency towards Black (explained later). Killing a Boss will result in a shift of World Tendency towards White.</p><h3>Souls</h3><p>Souls are the universal form of currency in the game. They are used for buying items, upgrading weapons and levelling up your character. Every enemy killed grants Souls, as does killing a Boss. You can also find Souls as items which you can use to gain a fixed amount of Souls. When you die in either Form, the Souls you were carrying are dropped where you died. You can then try to pick them up again, but should you die again before picking them up, those Souls are gone forever. In short, you can only regain the Souls you dropped the last time you died. Boss Demons have unique Souls which can be used to upgrade weapons, learn unique Magic or Miracles, or all of the above, so you'll have to make some tough decisions.</p><p>Below is a table listing each world's bosses in their likely order of appearance, the souls which they drop when slain, and the possible uses of each soul. Note that every soul can be consumed for souls if not used for another purpose.</p><table><tbody><tr><th>World</th><th>Boss</th><th>Soul</th><th>Uses</th></tr><tr><td><b>Tutorial</b></td><td><a href=\"../../vanguard/94-11215/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Vanguard</a>*</td><td><a href=\"../../grey-demons-soul/93-2150/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Grey Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Dozer Axe weapon; consumed for 1,500 souls</td></tr><tr><td><b>Boletarian Palace</b></td><td><a href=\"../../phalanx/94-11205/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Phalanx</a></td><td><a href=\"../../lead-demons-soul/93-2135/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Lead Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Scraping Spear weapon; consumed for 1,520 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../red-dragon/94-11221/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Red Dragon</a>*</td><td><a href=\"../../small-flame-scale-demons-soul/93-2139/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Small Flame Scale Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Consumed for 10,000 Souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../tower-knight/94-11206/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Tower Knight</a></td><td><a href=\"../../iron-demons-soul/93-2136/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Iron Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Warding magic; consumed for 18,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../dragon-god/94-11211/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dragon God</a></td><td><a href=\"../../dragon-demons-soul/93-2143/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dragon Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Fireball magic; Firestorm magic; God's Wrath miracle; consumed for 26,400 souls</td></tr><tr><td><b>Tower of Latria</b></td><td><a href=\"../../fools-idol/94-11212/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Fool's Idol</a></td><td><a href=\"../../doll-demons-soul/93-2144/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Doll Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Soul Ray magic; consumed for 7,600 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../maneater/94-11213/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Maneater</a></td><td><a href=\"../../mixed-demons-soul/93-2145/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mixed Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Needle of Eternal Agony weapon; consumed for 19,600 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../old-monk/94-11214/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Old Monk</a></td><td><a href=\"../../yellow-demons-soul/93-2146/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Yellow Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Insanity Catalyst weapon; Homing Soul Arrow magic; Soul Thirst magic; Banish miracle; consumed for 26,400 souls</td></tr><tr><td><b>Shrine of Storms</b></td><td><a href=\"../../vanguard/94-11215/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Vanguard</a>*</td><td><a href=\"../../grey-demons-soul/93-2150/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Grey Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Dozer Axe weapon; consumed for 1,500 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../adjudicator/94-11216/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Adjudicator</a></td><td><a href=\"../../swollen-demons-soul/93-2147/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Swollen Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Meat Cleaver weapon; Regeneration miracle; consumed for 13,200 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../old-hero/94-16905/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Old Hero</a></td><td><a href=\"../../hero-demons-soul/93-2148/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Hero Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Large Sword of Searching weapon; Second Chance Miracle; consumed for 36,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../storm-king/94-11217/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Storm King</a></td><td><a href=\"../../storm-demons-soul/93-2149/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Storm Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Morion Blade; Anti-Magic Field magic; consumed for 48,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><b>Valley of Defilement</b></td><td><a href=\"../../leechmonger/94-11218/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Leechmonger</a></td><td><a href=\"../../wriggling-demons-soul/93-2151/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Wriggling Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Poison Cloud magic; Cure miracle; consumed for 6,400 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../dirty-colossus/94-11219/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dirty Colossus</a></td><td><a href=\"../../eroded-demons-soul/93-2152/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Eroded Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Acid Cloud magic; consumed for 40,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../maiden-astraea/94-11220/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Maiden Astraea</a></td><td><a href=\"../../pureblood-demons-soul/93-2153/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Pureblood Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Blueblood Sword weapon; Death Cloud magic; Relief miracle; Resurrection miracle; consumed for 48,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><b>Old One's Prison</b></td><td><a href=\"../../maiden-in-black-demons-soul/93-2155/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Maiden in Black's Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Soulsucker magic; consumed for 60,000 souls</td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"../../beasts-demons-soul/93-2156/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Beast's Demon's Soul</a></td><td>Consumed for 200,000 Souls</td></tr></tbody></table><p><b>*</b>Optional</p><h3>Equipment weight and Stamina</h3><p>All equipment has a weight value associated with it. A character has a limit to the weight of his currently equipped gear, which you can increase by raising your Endurance statistic. When you are over half of that limit, your movement will be somewhat sluggish and you won't be able to roll nimbly. On the flipside, heavier armor provides more protection.</p><p>Stamina is what is used for all your actions. Sprinting, attacking, rolling, defending, everything costs stamina. When you're out of stamina your only option is to simply run. Stamina regenerates fast, however the heavier your armor, the slower it regenerates. Stamina can also be increased by leveling your Endurance stat, though this benefit stops after Endurance 40. Equipment weight has a big impact on how your character plays. Bigger, heavier weapons are also slower to use and cost more stamina to swing, but do more damage.</p><h3>World Tendency</h3><p>Starting out, each world has a neutral tendency. By killing bosses or Black Phantoms, you can shift the tendency towards White, and by dying in Body Form or killing helpful NPC's, you shift it towards Black. By reaching Pure Black or Pure White World Tendency, specific events are unlocked, such as doors opening or Unique weapons appearing. Some characters may turn up and either offer you side quests, or try to kill you, depending on Tendency. Also it effects the challenge of the game itself as well as drop rates. The whiter the tendency the players HP is penalized less in soul form and the player does more damage and drop rates increase on healing items, the blacker the tendency the enemies hit harder but release more souls on death and drop rates increase on rare items.</p><p>Note that World Tendency is affected by multiplayer, which is the server's median and changes depending on what others are doing. An example: If a majority of the players in the game are doing things in the world to change their tendency to black, this will affect the median appropriately, and likewise for white. The server median is based on sessions, so once you quit the game, the server median tendency is lost to you. It should also be noted that if you play online it will reset your World Tendencies to one level below White, so if you plan to do the Pure World Tendency events you should play the game offline by not logging into PSN.</p><h3>Character Tendency</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17388/1401753-tendency.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1401753\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17388/1401753-tendency.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1401753\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/17388/1401753-tendency.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Similar to World Tendency, certain actions will shift the tendency of your own character. Killing invading Black Phantoms or using the Resurrection spell on Blue Phantoms will bring you closer towards white , while killing certain NPC's or assassinating other players as a Black Phantom will shift you towards Black. Some weapons deal bonus damage based on your tendency, and you can earn unique rings for either Pure Black or Pure White Tendency. Lastly there is also a special NPC that only becomes available when a characters tendency is pure Black and certain extra conditions are met.</p><h3>New Game+</h3><table><tbody><tr><th>Lifecycle</th><th>Game Difficulty</th><th>Compared to NG</th></tr><tr><td>NG</td><td>Game difficulty has no modifier.</td><td>+ 0%</td></tr><tr><td>NG+</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 40% compared to NG (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 40%</td></tr><tr><td>NG++</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG+ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 51.2 %</td></tr><tr><td>NG+++</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG++ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 63.3 %</td></tr><tr><td>NG4+</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG+++ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 76.4 %</td></tr><tr><td>NG5+</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG4+ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 90.5 %</td></tr><tr><td>NG6+</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG5+ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 105.7 %</td></tr><tr><td>NG7+</td><td>Difficulty increased by approximate 8% compared to NG6+ (Neutral <a href=\"http://demonssouls.wikidot.com/character-tendency\" rel=\"nofollow\">CT</a> assumed)</td><td>+ 122.2 %</td></tr></tbody></table><p><strong>Note:</strong> From the 8th playthrough onwards, the difficulty will not increase.</p><h2>Multiplayer</h2><p>The game has a somewhat unique implementation of both player-versus-player and cooperative <a href=\"../../multiplayer-party-system/92-939/\" rel=\"nofollow\">multiplayer</a>. When in Body Form, the player can summon other players as Blue Phantoms to help, and other players can even jump into your game as black phantoms and try to assassinate you. At one point in the game a certain boss may even be replaced by a black phantom. To play in co-op mode you use your Blue Eye Stone while you are in Soul Form to create a blue soul sign which living players can see and interact with to summon you. To invade the game of a player in Body form you use your Black Eye Stone while you are in Soul form. Lastly there is a special Red Eye Stone that works exactly like the Blue Eye Stone except when you are summoned you are a Black Phantom, this stone is primarily used for organizing duels. The Red Eye Stone has two other unique traits, it is the only stone that can be used to create a soul sign when the player is in body form (your HP if summoned will revert to soul forum levels), and anyone killed by someone summoned via the Red Eye Stone will lose a level; likewise the Black Phantom summoned this way also loses a level if they die regardless of how it happens.</p><h3>Online</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17388/1401767-message.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1401767\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.61666666666667\" data-width=\"300\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 300px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17388/1401767-message.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1401767\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/17388/1401767-message.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/17388/1401767-message.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Trap ahead.</figcaption></figure><ul><li>One host can summon up to 2 players to play <a href=\"../../cooperative-play/92-108/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Cooperatively</a> in most sections of the game.</li><li>There is a thorough messaging system that allows players to leave hints, advice, or even tricks meant to help or deceive others. Messages rated as helpful will heal the player who created them.</li><li>Bloodstains will appear which show a 10 second segment of what a player was doing just before they died.</li><li>A player can \"invade\" another player's game and engage in direct <a href=\"../../player-vs-player/92-346/\" rel=\"nofollow\">PvP</a>, in one case it is even possible for a player to take the place of one of the <a href=\"../../old-monk/94-11214/\" rel=\"nofollow\">bosses</a>.</li><li>Upon finishing the game it is possible to receive an item which allows for mutual agreed upon PVP fights.</li></ul><h2>King's Field reference</h2><p><i>Demon's Souls</i> being called the spiritual successor to the <i>King's Field</i> series, <a href=\"../../fromsoftware-inc/65-760/\" rel=\"nofollow\">From Software</a> has nodded to the series with a few <a href=\"../../easter-egg/92-2/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Easter Eggs</a>.</p><ul><li>Among mentioned is the Legendary Moonlight Knight Bito of the <i>King's Field</i> games, he is also incorrectly called Vito in one instance.</li><li>A \"Large Sword of Moonlight\" an obvious homage to the Moonlight Sword featured in all King's Field games can be found in Demon's Souls.</li><li>Similarities between the status and inventory screens</li><li>The only character in Demon's Souls to start at level 1 is the Royalty, similarly every playable character in the King's Field series starts at level 1 and is a member of the nobility</li></ul><h2>Release</h2><p>On its release day in <a href=\"../../japan/95-37/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Japan</a>, the limited run of copies sold out instantly prompting From Software to have a second release date for another run of the game because of its unforeseen popularity. There are currently five different releases of the game: Japanese, Korean, Asian/Chinese, North American, and most recently a European release. Both the Korean and Chinese/Asian version of the game have been highly sought out by importers due to the fact they are in full English; the menus, dialogue and subtitles are in English; however, the <a href=\"../../instruction-manual-security-system/92-1153/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Manual</a> and Boxart is not. As of May 20th, 2009, <a href=\"../../atlus-usa-inc/65-6490/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Atlus U.S.A.</a> stepped in as publisher for an official North American release of <i>Demon's Souls</i> and offered a collectors edition to promote buying its version instead of just importing the game, the joking called it the \"Stop Importing It Edition\"; <i>Demon's Souls</i> was officially released in North America on October 7th, 2009.</p><p>Interestingly enough <i>Demon's Souls</i> went on to sell more copies in NA than in any of its other releases to date and is currently the all time highest selling release by Atlus U.S.A. (surpassing even <a href=\"../../shin-megami-tensei-persona-4/61-21373/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Persona 4</a><i>)</i>. As reported by <a href=\"http://www.1up.com/do/blogEntry?bId=9023027\" rel=\"nofollow\">1UP.com</a> at the Game Developers Conference 2010, an employee of Sony's Japanese branch named Yeonkyung Kim spoke at a panel on the US localization. He was quoted as saying \"That was a mistake, It should have come out as a first-party title.\" in reference to <a href=\"../../sony-corporation/65-3223/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Sony</a>'s decision not to release <i>Demon's Souls</i> outside Japan after seeing how successful it had been in the NA market.</p><p>On September 15, 2010, Atlus U.S.A. made an <a href=\"http://www.atlus.com/forum/showthread.php?t=7957\" rel=\"nofollow\">official announcement</a> on their forums. Demon's Souls had reached a milestone as a successful title and would be re-released as a <a href=\"../../playstation-3/60-35/\" rel=\"nofollow\">PS3</a> <a href=\"../../greatest-hits/92-1644/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Greatest Hits</a> title with new box art showing off its 2009 game of the year award from Gamespot and a new $29.99 MSRP. This is the first, and to date only, PS3 Greatest Hits title released by Atlus U.S.A..</p><h3>North American release</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33941/1093457-demonssouls_extras.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1093457\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.482\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:48.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33941/1093457-demonssouls_extras.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1093457\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/33941/1093457-demonssouls_extras.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/33941/1093457-demonssouls_extras.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Greatest Hits packaging</figcaption></figure><p>There are a few changes that <a href=\"../../atlus-usa-inc/65-6490/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Atlus</a> applied to the North American release. In addition to a standard edition of the game, Atlus also released a Deluxe Edition for an extra $10, containing a 150 page strategy guide and unique packaging. Those who pre-ordered either the standard or limited editions also received the full soundtrack and a 40 page art book. The game was released on October, 7th, 2009.</p><p>Improved Features:</p><ul><li>Released with all patches from the Asian version on disc.</li><li>Tidying up spelling errors and punctuation as well as more accurate English translations.</li><li>North American servers.</li></ul><h3>European Release</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/75414/1390252-contents.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1390252\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.67289719626168\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:67.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/75414/1390252-contents.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1390252\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/75414/1390252-contents.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/75414/1390252-contents.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Black Phantom Edition</figcaption></figure><p>On April 16th 2010 <a href=\"../../namco-bandai-games-inc/65-382/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Namco Bandai</a> stated that they would be releasing Demon's Souls in Europe. Much like the release in North America, there will be a Special edition of the game called the \"Black Phantom Edition\" and it will contain an art book, strategy guide and a soundtrack CD. The strategy guide is the work of the fan made Demon's Souls Wikidot website which was created by importers of the original Asian release. This version of Demon's Souls was released on June 25th, 2010 complete with its own set of unique European servers.</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><p>The <a href=\"../../original-soundtrack/92-189/\" rel=\"nofollow\">original score</a> for <i>Demon's Souls</i> was composed by <a href=\"../../shunsuke-kida/72-96663/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Shunsuke Kida</a>.</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Track Slumber</b></td><td>4:23</td></tr></tbody></table><p>It is worth noting the names of the tracks and their actual in-game presentation do not match in all cases. For example, <a href=\"../../the-penetrator/94-11207/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Penetrator</a> encounter in-game features the music from the Tower Knight track of the CD.The famous Japanese singer <a href=\"\">KOKIA</a> also performed two songs for the game: <a href=\"\">KARMA</a> &amp; <a href=\"\">Ningen tte sonna mono ne</a>.</p>", "deck": "Demon's Souls is an action-RPG developed by From Software and released in 2009. It quickly became popular within hardcore circles for its relentlessly steep difficulty level, deep combat system, and unique multiplayer integration.", "aliases": "Demons Souls", "image": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/8/82063/2555205-demsouls.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2015-06-03 21:45:53", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url":
