{"duration": "0:35:00", "runner": "Ghoul02", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/catherine/3030-32367/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/45192/1471538-2132423298_view.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1471538\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56291390728477\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/45192/1471538-2132423298_view.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1471538\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/4/45192/1471538-2132423298_view.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Vincent and Catherine.</figcaption></figure><p>Catherine is a puzzle action-adventure title for the <a href=\"/playstation-3/3045-35\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PS3</a> and <a href=\"/xbox-360/3045-20\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a> from <a href=\"/atlus-co-ltd/3010-442\" data-ref-id=\"3010-442\">Atlus</a>, developed by the team responsible for <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-3/3030-4473\" data-ref-id=\"3030-4473\"><i>Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3</i></a> and <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-4/3030-21373\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21373\"><i>Persona 4</i></a>. It is the first Atlus game designed specifically for HD-capable platforms and was released on February 17, 2011 in Japan and July 26th in North America.</p><p>Catherine's main menu is composed of four sub-menus: \"Golden Theater\", \"Babel\", Colosseum\" and \"Configuration\".</p><ul><li>Golden Theater consists of the story mode and it is also the name of a television program that appears within the game.</li><li>Babel is composed of additional, more difficult puzzle segments compared to the ones in Golden Theater. These puzzle stages are randomized so the blocks are arranged differently each time players attempt at completing the stage. There are four stages in Babel which are unlocked via the player's progress in the story mode on \"Normal\" difficulty or higher and there are single player and two-player options for this mode. Players will also be able to take part in online rankings where they will compete to finish the stages in the shortest amount of time.</li><li>Colosseum is a multiplayer competitive mode where two players will locally go through the games' action segments at the same time. Players will assume the control of sheep as their characters and the player who wins two rounds the first wins the match. Players must have cleared Golden Theater Mode in order to unlock Colosseum.</li></ul><h2>Story</h2><p><i>Catherine</i> follows the story of a man named <a href=\"/man-drinking-alone/3005-16017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16017\">Vincent</a>, an uninspired thirty-two year old software engineer who discovers that his childhood sweetheart <a href=\"/katherine/3005-16504\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16504\">Katherine</a> may be pregnant. While trying to figure out what to do, Vincent runs into a girl by the name of <a href=\"/catherine/3005-16284\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16284\">Catherine</a>, a stylish twenty-two-year-old. Vincent is plagued by nightmares shortly before he has a one-night-stand with Catherine; nightmares in which he's climbing a never-ending stairway and must reach the top in order to awaken and survive. Some of Vincent's friends also experience the same recurring nightmares.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>The game is largely split into three distinct parts: story, adventure and action. The story part mainly consists of conveying the game's story by anime and in-game event scenes.</p><p>The adventure part generally takes place at the <a href=\"/stray-sheep/3035-3434\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3434\">Stray Sheep</a>, where, as Vincent, players will trade text-messages with Catherine and Katherine as well as other individuals. Players will be able to choose preset sentences as a reply to the messages sent to them and the characters will react differently to different replies and could even send pictures depending on the reply. Vincent will also be asked to capture cell-phone pictures and send them to various people. At the Stray Sheep, Vincent will also be able to talk to his friends, drink alcohol and participate in various mini-games. New customers will visit the bar occasionally and their facial expressions and conversation options will change daily. Players can miss important conversation if they miss the opportunity to talk to a character at a certain moment.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1681023-2132437523_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681023\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.55288461538462\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1681023-2132437523_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681023\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/30280/1681023-2132437523_full.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Rapunzel Game.</figcaption></figure><p>In the Stray Sheep, players will find a jukebox that allows them to change the background music to other music featured in other parts of the game. The bar also features an arcade game by the name of <i>Rapunzel</i> that resembles Vincent's nightmares. In <i>Rapunzel</i>, players will guide a character up a tower of blocks and push them in order to create a stairway to reach the top, rescuing Rapunzel from the evil witch. <i>Rapunzel</i>, has over 50 stages with the difficulty rising with each one. Other customers of the Stray Sheep play the game too in addition to Vincent and if the player beats their high scores, more conversational options could potentially be unlocked.</p><p>During the action part that consists of Vincent's nightmare segments, Vincent will have to run from ghoulish monsters while avoiding them, avoiding obstacles and dodging other obstructions to get by. These stages are designed to resemble a giant flight of stairs composed of huge blocks and the goal is for Vincent to reach the top before the monster chasing him captures him.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1662423-trap.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1662423\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.0236686390533\" data-width=\"169\" style=\"width: 169px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:102.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1662423-trap.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1662423\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/31223/1662423-trap.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/31223/1662423-trap.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Trap Type Blocks.</figcaption></figure><p>Vincent will be able to push the aforementioned huge blocks in order to create pathways or steps. There are different types of these blocks, two of them being: \"Trap Type\" and \"Bomb Type\". The \"Bomb Type\" blocks explode when stepped on, destroying nearby blocks, while \"Trap Types\" deploy spikes from their top. Over time, the floor collapses so players are required to be quick and efficient as they climb the stages. If Vincent falls off the level or gets captured by a monster, it's game over. The level designs during these sections will be an apparent mix of <a href=\"/25d/3015-660\" data-ref-id=\"3015-660\">2.5D</a> and <a href=\"/3d/3015-1430\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1430\">3D</a>.</p><p>During these action sequences, sheep will sometimes block Vincent's path in order to make themselves survive. Vincent will need to push them away either by using his main weapon which consists of the pillow he carries or with the use of various tools (attacking the sheep with electricity, for example).</p><p>After ascending the stairs in these stages, Vincent will attain a sort of lobby with a large red carpet where Vincent will be able to speak with sheep men in order to get new information and learn new skills to use in</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1644076-2132434044_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1644076\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56284153005464\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1644076-2132434044_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1644076\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/30280/1644076-2132434044_full.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/30280/1644076-2132434044_full.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Vincent at the bar.</figcaption></figure><p>the stages. Players will also be able to exchange coins in order to purchase tools. At the end of the red carpet is a room called the \"Confession Room\", where Vincent will hear a mysterious voice that asks him strange questions. There, players will be asked a multiple choice question and the player's response will determine how they will progress through</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1644077-2132434045_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1644077\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1644077-2132434045_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1644077\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/30280/1644077-2132434045_full.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/30280/1644077-2132434045_full.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Vincent benefiting from his drunken state.</figcaption></figure><p>the game. If the player's connected online, they'll be able to see graphs showing how other players responded to the question and they'll also be able to see how players of different genders responded.</p><p>A liquor bottle icon at the bottom left of the screen indicates how <a href=\"/inebriation/3015-1836\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1836\">drunk</a> Vincent is. There are three levels of drunkenness that Vincent can reach. In order to get drunk, players will have to go to the Stray Sheep bar and order drinks among four types: beer, cocktails, whiskey and sake.</p><p>As players drink, Vincent gets hot and the liquor icon on the screen will be engulfed in flames. In the real world, this causes him to suffer from drunkenness which makes him to stumble around when trying to leave the bar to go home. Things change however when Vincent enters the dream world. In the <a href=\"/dream/3035-277\" data-ref-id=\"3035-277\">dream world</a>, on the other hand, how drunk Vincent is determines how powerful he is. The higher the level of the drunk meter, the faster Vincent moves.</p><h2>Development</h2><p>In an interview in Famitsu, character designer <a href=\"/shigenori-soejima/3040-90684\" data-ref-id=\"3040-90684\">Shigenori Soejima</a> stated that <i>Catherine</i> will feature some \"shockingly adult scenes.\" Composer <a href=\"/shoji-meguro/3040-89612\" data-ref-id=\"3040-89612\">Shoji Meguro</a> stated that the title is indeed adult-oriented and describes the music as being \"classic,\" \"adult-oriented\" and \"erotic.\"</p><p><i>Catherine</i> has been in development for two years. The game will be fully voiced and will have multiple endings as well. These endings will each have their own respective animated sequences. Atlus estimates that it'll take players about 20 hours to finish the game during their first playthrough. There will also be difficulty settings but it has not been said if they will alter the story in any way.</p><p><i>Catherine</i> has been through some major changes in relation to its theme as well as its visuals. Originally, Soejima wanted the game to follow a war theme but, following discussions with <a href=\"/katsura-hashino/3040-90683\" data-ref-id=\"3040-90683\">Hashino</a>, they decided to go with a theme revolving adult love.</p><p>Hashino did research for the depiction of the love triangle of Vincent, Catherine and Katherine in the game by asking the Atlus staff who have lived through similar romantic experiences. One of these interviews, incorporated into the first trailer for <i>Catherine</i>, was a woman who instead talked about the fact that she's only seen herself killing other people in her dreams as opposed to herself being killed.</p><p>All of the anime cutscenes within the game will be created by the Japanese animation studio: <a href=\"/capcom-production-studio-4/3010-1497\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1497\">STUDIO4\u00b0C</a> . The studio has spent approximately a year working on that aspect of <i>Catherine</i> and there will be more than the usual 30 minutes worth of anime cutscenes which can be found in the Persona games.</p><p>The game's composer Shoji Meguro has stated that the game's music can be split into four different categories: classical arrangements (one of which can be heard in <i>Catherine</i>'s first trailer as Bach's Little Fugue) for the action segments of the game, original jazz music for the event parts and string music during the anime cutscenes. The other category will be songs with currently unannounced elements.</p><p>Atlus have incorporated manual lip-syncing to the game's animation that differs from both the Japanese version and the English version as most of the game revolves around believable character interaction and drama.</p><p>The engine that the game uses is primarily the <a href=\"/gamebryo-25/3015-2021\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2021\">Gamebryo</a> engine.</p><h3>Origin</h3><p>The game's existence was first hinted at in the <a href=\"/psp/3045-18\" data-ref-id=\"3045-18\">PSP</a> game <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-3-portable/3030-27861\" data-ref-id=\"3030-27861\"><i>Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 Portable</i></a>. In this game, Vincent appears in the bar Club Escapade on certain days, though in the game he never reveals his name and is simply referred to as \"Man Drinking Alone\" in his dialogue boxes. (His name was later discovered by people looking at the game code where the name \"Vincent\" is attached to the character.) In conversing with <a href=\"/minato-arisato/3005-1425\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1425\">Minato Arisato</a>, he reveals hints related to his problems, though also states specifically that they are nothing that Minato needs to worry about.</p><p>It was cleared up in an interview preformed by <i>Shuukan</i> <i>G\u0113mu no Shokutaku</i> that Catherine is not considered part of Atlus' <a href=\"/megami-tensei/3025-525\" data-ref-id=\"3025-525\"><i>Shin Megami Tensei</i></a> franchise, or has any specific ties to the <a href=\"/persona/3025-456\" data-ref-id=\"3025-456\"><i>Persona</i></a> sub-universe outside of \"fake\" Vincent's cameo in <i>Persona 3 Portable</i>. The mole that the Vincent in P3P wears was said to be a sign that this is not the exact same Vincent as the one you play in Catherine.</p><h2>Characters</h2><h3><a href=\"/vincent/3005-16017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16017\"><b>Vincent</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679972-vincintwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679972\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679972-vincintwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679972\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679972-vincintwiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679972-vincintwiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Vincent</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/troy-baker/3040-93651\" data-ref-id=\"3040-93651\">Troy Baker</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/koichi-yamadera/3040-95084\" data-ref-id=\"3040-95084\">Koichi Yamadera</a></li></ul><p><a href=\"/vincent/3005-16017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16017\">Vincent Brooks</a> made his first appearance in <i>Persona 3 Portable</i> as a cryptic alcoholic without a name who told the player about his problems. Vincent is a 32-year-old software engineer who is a smoker and also drinker. He is unmotivated romantically, though he does have a girlfriend named Katherine whom he was childhood friends with. He is described as a \"herbivore\" figuratively, which in Japanese culture means that he cares more about his appearance and social projection than relationships and money. After meeting the <a href=\"/catherine/3005-16284\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16284\">Catherine</a>, Vincent starts having vivid nightmares.</p><p>Vincent is modeled after Vincent Gallo from the movie <i>Buffalo '66</i>. The team also decided to preserve the name.</p><h3><a href=\"/catherine/3005-16284\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16284\"><b>Catherine</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1556067-2132428941_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556067\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56529516994633\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30280/1556067-2132428941_full.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556067\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/30280/1556067-2132428941_full.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/30280/1556067-2132428941_full.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Catherine</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/laura-bailey/3040-45059\" data-ref-id=\"3040-45059\">Laura Bailey</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/miyuki-sawashiro/3040-98470\" data-ref-id=\"3040-98470\">Miyuki Sawashiro</a></li></ul><p><a href=\"/catherine/3005-16284\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16284\">Catherine</a> is a 22-year-old woman with a \"charming face\" and an amazing figure. She is described as being Vincent's type of woman. She and Vincent have a one-night stand after meeting out of the blue one day. She seems to be initially unaware of Vincent having a girlfriend as she lets Vincent know that she will not let him cheat on her.</p><p>In relation to her design, she represents a young and \"healthier\" love interest compared to Katherine. For technical purposes, her bust size was augmented in Catherine's 3D model compared to Soejima's initial drawings.</p><h3><a href=\"/katherine/3005-16504\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16504\"><b>Katherine</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33880/1558674-katherine_4.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1558674\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56451612903226\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33880/1558674-katherine_4.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1558674\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33880/1558674-katherine_4.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33880/1558674-katherine_4.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Katherine</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/michelle-ruff/3040-89891\" data-ref-id=\"3040-89891\">Michelle Ruff</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/kotono-mitsuishi/3040-97985\" data-ref-id=\"3040-97985\">Kotono Mitsuishi</a></li></ul><p><a href=\"/katherine/3005-16504\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16504\">Katherine Mcbride</a> is the 32-year-old girlfriend and childhood friend of Vincent. She works for an apparel maker in a middle management position and was reunited with Vincent at a class reunion five years ago. She hints that she may be pregnant with Vincent's child but this remains unclear.</p><p>She is meant to represent adult charm.</p><h3><b>Orlando</b></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679974-orlandowiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679974\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56216790648247\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679974-orlandowiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679974\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679974-orlandowiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679974-orlandowiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Orlando</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/liam-obrien/3040-97533\" data-ref-id=\"3040-97533\">Liam O'Brien</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/hiroaki-hirata/3040-99743\" data-ref-id=\"3040-99743\">Hiroaki Hirata</a></li></ul><p>A divorc\u00e9 and software engineer, <a href=\"/orlando/3005-17027\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17027\">Orlando Haddick</a> lives with and is a co-worker and bar mate of long time friend Vincent. He is 32 years old and, after his divorce, he has started to live a free and wild lifestyle. He advises Vincent that he should avoid marriage due to his own personal pitfalls with the subject.</p><h3><b>Johnny</b></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679976-johnnywiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679976\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56256256256256\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679976-johnnywiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679976\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679976-johnnywiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679976-johnnywiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Johnny</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor</b>: <a href=\"/travis-willingham/3040-98590\" data-ref-id=\"3040-98590\">Travis Willingham</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/takehito-koyasu/3040-43403\" data-ref-id=\"3040-43403\">Takehito Koyasu</a></li></ul><p><a href=\"/jonathan/3005-17028\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17028\">Jonathan Ariga</a> is 32 years of age. He is a friend of Vincent's and he works at his father's used car dealership, where he plans to continue the family business. He has strong convictions about marriage and believes that it's supposed to be had with one's fated partner.</p><h3><a href=\"/tobias/3005-17026\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17026\"><b>Toby</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679980-tobywiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679980\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56273291925466\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679980-tobywiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679980\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679980-tobywiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679980-tobywiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Toby</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/yuri-lowenthal/3040-81915\" data-ref-id=\"3040-81915\">Yuri Lowenthal</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> Kishou Taniyama</li></ul><p><a href=\"/tobias/3005-17026\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17026\">Tobias Nebbins</a> is 23 years old and has had little experience with women and love. He works with Johnny as a used car salesman and is willing to get married the second he gets a girlfriend. Toby has a crush on the bar's waitress, Erica.</p><h3><a href=\"/erica/3005-17194\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17194\"><b>Erica</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679993-ericawiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679993\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56294779938588\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1679993-ericawiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1679993\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679993-ericawiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1679993-ericawiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Erica</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/erin-fitzgerald/3040-92063\" data-ref-id=\"3040-92063\">Erin Fitzgerald</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> Junko Minagawa</li></ul><p><a href=\"/erica/3005-17194\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17194\">Erica</a> is 32 years old and a childhood friend of Vincent's. She waitresses at the Stray Sheep, the bar that Vincent, Orlando, Johnny and Toby frequently drink at. She has a sunny disposition and is the one to go to when looking for the latest town gossip. She enjoys taking advantage of Toby's feelings for her.</p><h3><a href=\"/master/3005-17658\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17658\"><b>Boss</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1680331-masterwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1680331\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56204379562044\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1680331-masterwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1680331\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1680331-masterwiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1680331-masterwiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Boss</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> Kirk Thornton</li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/norio-wakamoto/3040-40929\" data-ref-id=\"3040-40929\">Norio Wakamoto</a></li></ul><p>Barkeep at the bustling Stray Sheep, <a href=\"/master/3005-17658\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17658\">Boss</a> is the man to go to when trying to make new friends and be introduced or familiarized with the other patrons of the bar<i>.</i> He's supposedly seen his fair share of carnage in his day. What this exactly refers to is a mystery at this time though.</p><h3>Todd</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1680513-toddwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1680513\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.69190600522193\" data-width=\"383\" style=\"width: 383px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:69.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1680513-toddwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1680513\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1680513-toddwiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1680513-toddwiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Todd and Archie</figcaption></figure><p>Todd, another frequent patron of the Stray Sheep, can usually be found there with his subordinate, Archie. He works at the same company as Vincent's girlfriend, Katherine.</p><h3>Justin</h3><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> Doug Erholtz</li></ul><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1681197-justinwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681197\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56296296296296\" data-width=\"270\" style=\"width: 270px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1681197-justinwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681197\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1681197-justinwiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1681197-justinwiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Justin</figcaption></figure><p>A glasses wearing reporter for a local newspaper who often stops by the Stray Sheep. He was emotionally damaged by an incident from his past.</p><h3>Morgan</h3><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/richard-epcar/3040-21160\" data-ref-id=\"3040-21160\">Richard Epcar</a></li></ul><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1681198-morganwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681198\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.56445993031359\" data-width=\"287\" style=\"width: 287px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1681198-morganwiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1681198\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1681198-morganwiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1681198-morganwiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Morgan</figcaption></figure><p>Morgan is a police officer who visits the bar in uniform. He's been searching for the truth behind a particular crime for the past six years.</p><h3><a href=\"/midnight-venus/3005-17857\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17857\"><b>T</b>risha</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1694445-midnightvenus_wiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1694445\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.5615141955836\" data-width=\"317\" style=\"width: 317px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/31223/1694445-midnightvenus_wiki.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1694445\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1694445-midnightvenus_wiki.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/31223/1694445-midnightvenus_wiki.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Trisha</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>English Voice Actor:</b> <a href=\"/erin-fitzgerald/3040-92063\" data-ref-id=\"3040-92063\">Erin Fitzgerald</a></li><li><b>Japanese Voice Actor:</b> Junko Minagawa</li></ul><p><a href=\"/midnight-venus/3005-17857\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17857\">Trisha</a> is the host of an in-game television program named the \"Golden Play Theater.\" The game opens with her introducing Vincent and the rest of the major players in the story.</p><p><b>Lindsay and Martha</b></p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34135/1860708-lindsay_and_martha.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1860708\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.0361990950226\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:103.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34135/1860708-lindsay_and_martha.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1860708\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/34135/1860708-lindsay_and_martha.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/34135/1860708-lindsay_and_martha.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Lindsay and Martha</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"/lindsay/3005-19895\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19895\">Lindsay</a> and <a href=\"/martha/3005-19896\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19896\">Martha</a> are elderly identical twin sisters who sit in a booth next to Vincent and his friends at the Stray Sheep bar. They speak in an odd tandem and will gossip about the other bar patrons dropping hints and provide a bit of backstory about the lives of other people in the bar. They also love their beer and pizza.</p><h2>\"Love is Over\" Deluxe Edition</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/108792/1773867-catherine_deluxe_edition.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1773867\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.66774193548387\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:66.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/108792/1773867-catherine_deluxe_edition.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1773867\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/10/108792/1773867-catherine_deluxe_edition.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/10/108792/1773867-catherine_deluxe_edition.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Catherine \"Love is Over\" Deluxe Edition - $79.99 US.</figcaption></figure><p>A \"Love is Over\" Deluxe Edition was released for both Xbox 360 and Playstation 3 systems. This edition contains items that are directly from or inspired by the game world, including: the game itself, a pair of polka dot boxers (Sizing: Men\u00b4s Large) like the ones worn by Vincent during his manic nightmares, Vincent\u2019s \u201cEmpty Hearts\u201d T-shirt (Sizing: Men\u00b4s Large), a pillow case (Sizing: Standard/Twin) decorated with an alluring image of Catherine, a nod to the pillow tucked under Vincent\u2019s arm as he frantically races to escape the terrors that pursue him, and a pizza box for the \"The Stray Sheep\"; the bar that Vincent and his friends hang out in. In addition to the \u201cLove Is Over\u201d Deluxe Edition, ATLUS also revealed the Catherine Sound Track Disc &amp; Art Book which was available by reserving either the standard or deluxe edition of the game for either platform (Xbox 360 or PlayStation 3 system). The 36-page, full-color art book measures 5.25\u2033 x 6.75\u2033 and is packed with the character designs of artist Shigenori Soejima. The 11-track music CD features the best musical themes of the game specially remixed by composer Shoji Meguro.</p><h2>\"Stray Sheep\" Deluxe Edition</h2><p>The \"Stray Sheep\" Deluxe Edition is an Europe exclusive for the Xbox 360 and Playstation 3. The package apart from the game contains a pizza delivery box that serves as the packaging for the game, two Stray Sheep bar-themed coasters, a seductive Catherine poster that is exclusive to this edition and a replica of the Rave T-shirt that vincent wears in the game. The game launch is set for February 2012 release a full seven months after the USA release and costs \u00a354.99</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2579/1694916-l_p0015147441.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1694916\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.99\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:99.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2579/1694916-l_p0015147441.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1694916\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/2579/1694916-l_p0015147441.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/2579/1694916-l_p0015147441.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Catherine Original Soundtrack.</figcaption></figure><p>The soundtrack to Catherine was composed by Atlus veteran <a href=\"/shoji-meguro/3040-89612\" data-ref-id=\"3040-89612\">Shoji Meguro</a>. It was released February 23, 2011 in Japan.</p><p>Total length: <b>52:48</b></p><table><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">No.</th><th scope=\"col\">Title</th><th scope=\"col\">Length</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>1.</td><td>Yo</td><td>1:11</td></tr><tr><td>2.</td><td>It's a Golden on Instinct</td><td>1:36</td></tr><tr><td>27.</td><td>Departure</td><td>0:29</td></tr><tr><td>28.</td><td>An Die Freude</td><td>4:38</td></tr><tr><td>29.</td><td>Battle on Stage</td><td>2:58</td></tr><tr><td>30.</td><td>Up Up Up!</td><td>2:59</td></tr><tr><td>31.</td><td>Stage</td><td>1:57</td></tr><tr><td>32.</td><td>Rapunzel -Neme Entry-</td><td>1:01</td></tr><tr><td>33.</td><td>Rapunzel -Game Play-</td><td>1:21</td></tr><tr><td>34.</td><td>Rapunzel -Game Over-</td><td>0:11</td></tr><tr><td>35.</td><td>Awakening (Alternate)</td><td>1:40</td></tr></tbody></table><p> </p><p> </p><p>Instead of releasing the complete soundtrack in America Atlus included a selection of songs as a pre-order bonus. The included tracks are as follows:</p><table><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">No.</th><th scope=\"col\">Title</th><th scope=\"col\">Length</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>1.</td><td>Holst - Planets Suite \"Mars\", \"Jupiter\"</td><td>2:33</td></tr><tr><td>2.</td><td>Beethoven - Symphony No. 5 In C Minor \"Fate\" 3rd Movement</td><td>2:22</td></tr><tr><td>3.</td><td>Bach - \"Little\" Fugue In G Minor</td><td>2:59</td></tr><tr><td>4.</td><td>Dvorak - Symphony No. 9 In E Minor \"From The New World\" 1st Movement, 3rd Movement Scherzo (Molto Vivace)</td><td>3:10</td></tr><tr><td>5.</td><td>Rossini - William Tell Overture Part 2 \"The Storm\" And Part 3 \"The Ranz Des Vaches\"</td><td>2:19</td></tr><tr><td>6.</td><td>Borodin - Polovtsian Dances</td><td>4:37</td></tr><tr><td>7.</td><td>Mussorgsky - Pictures At An Exhibition \"The Hut On Fowl's Legs (Baba-Yaga)\"</td><td>2:28</td></tr><tr><td>8.</td><td>Bizet - L'Arle'sienne Second Suite \"Farandole\"</td><td>2:02</td></tr><tr><td>9.</td><td>Chopin - \"Revolutionary Etude\"</td><td>2:47</td></tr><tr><td>10.</td><td>Handel - Messiah \"Hallelujah Chorus\"</td><td>1:45</td></tr><tr><td>11.</td><td>Chopin - Piano Sonata No. 2 \"Funeral March\" 3rd Movement</td><td>2:31</td></tr></tbody></table><p> </p><h2>Trivia</h2><ul><li>The Japanese voice actor for the character <a href=\"/man-drinking-alone/3005-16017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16017\">Vincent</a> has been confirmed to be <a href=\"/koichi-yamadera/3040-95084\" data-ref-id=\"3040-95084\">Koichi Yamadera</a>, the Japanese voice actor for <a href=\"/spike-spiegel/3005-2923\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2923\">Spike Spiegel</a> of the anime Cowboy Bebop. Vincent and Spike both share a vague physical resemblance.</li><li>Catherine and Katherine's names are both spelled the same in Japanese (\u30ad\u30e3\u30b5\u30ea\u30f3). The two of them romanize out to 'Kyasarin,' leading to some (intentional) confusion in the game.</li><li>In order to show the appeal of <i>Catherine</i> initially, the designers filled the design documents with ''intense visuals''. Of these visuals was a picture featuring <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-4/3030-21373\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21373\"><i>Persona 4</i></a>'s <a href=\"/yukiko-amagi/3005-6113\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6113\">Yukiko Amagi</a>. This document was only meant to convey the game's mechanics; Yukiko won't make an appearance in the final game.</li><li>Originally, the two covers for the game were planned to have both characters in nearly naked, identical poses, but the developers feared that Katherine would lose out to the younger, sexier Catherine. Another early cover featured one girl holding a knife and the other a fork (you'll have to take your guess on who was holding which as that part was left ambiguous).</li><li>The in-game television program that the story mode of Catherine is told through, \"Golden Play Theater,\" is a reference to the Japanese program \"Golden Western Theater\" that aired in the '70s and '80s. It mostly showcased American movies. The opening animation to Golden Play Theater is also directly inspired, and nearly identical in style, to Golden Western Theater.</li><li>It was specified in a podcast that the Vincent who appeared in P3P is a Vincent lookalike. That's why he has a mole in P3P and not in Catherine. The Persona series and Catherine have no relation at all.</li><li>There's an easter egg in the bathroom of the \"Stray Sheep\" bar. If you enter the bathroom and look on the wall to the right of the mirror, there's a faded poster that has an image of <a href=\"/teddie/3005-6118\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6118\">Teddie</a> from <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-4/3030-21373\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21373\">Persona 4</a> on it. Teddie also appears as a plush toy near the end of the bar when Vincent is seated, and a <a href=\"/gekkoukan-high-school/3035-873\" data-ref-id=\"3035-873\">Gekkoukan High School</a> patch is visible on a poster in the back of the bar.</li><li>If Vincent sits at the bar, you can see a poster that says: \"Do Flirts Dream Of Sheep Man?\" This is a reference to the book, \"Do Androids Dream Of Electric Sheep\", a cyberpunk thriller by Philip K. Dick.</li><li>On the 7th Day in the Stray Sheep Bar; if you watch the TV, after listing the deaths of the day, the reporter will give a weather report. She suggests that you bring an umbrella because it's going to rain for the next few days. This is a reference to <a href=\"/shin-megami-tensei-persona-4/3030-21373\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21373\">Persona 4</a>'s \"weather\" game mechanic.</li><li>In the bar, if you go into the bathroom and look into the mirror you will see a flash of the next boss in the reflection.</li><li>While in the bar, after you order either beer, whiskey, sake or a cocktail you will receive trivia about the type of drink, ordering the same drink or drinks every time you are in the bar will award you with an achievement (a possible four).</li></ul><p> </p>", "deck": "The first game developed by Atlus for the PS3/Xbox 360. {"duration": "0:32:00", "runner": "EeveeSpirit", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/new-super-mario-bros-2/3030-38064/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>The game was formally announced during Nintendo's Direct video presentation on April 21, 2012. A number of screenshots were shown, featuring Mario in a <a href=\"/raccoon-suit/3055-1246\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1246\">Raccoon Suit</a> (including <a href=\"/p-wing/3055-4364\" data-ref-id=\"3055-4364\">P-Wing</a> meter!) along with a Golden Mario and golden enemies. The game will be released worldwide in both physical retail form and as a digital download via the <a href=\"/3dsware/3045-138\" data-ref-id=\"3045-138\">eShop</a>, making it the first Nintendo-published game to be released in such a manner.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>New Super Mario Bros. 2, like previous entries in the <a href=\"/new-super-mario-bros/3025-1546\" data-ref-id=\"3025-1546\">New Super Mario Bros.</a> series, is a side-scrolling platformer built in the vein of the earlier <a href=\"/super-mario-bros/3025-1899\" data-ref-id=\"3025-1899\">Super Mario Bros.</a> titles on the <a href=\"/nes/3045-21\" data-ref-id=\"3045-21\">NES</a>. This entry, however, puts a greater emphasis on coin collection. A new fire flower-like power-up grants Mario the power to turn enemies and blocks that are in his path into coins.</p><h2>Multiplayer</h2><p>During its 3DS showcase at <a href=\"/e3-2012/3015-7024\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7024\">E3 2012</a>, Nintendo revealed that New Super Mario Bros. 2 would feature local <a href=\"/cooperative-play/3015-108\" data-ref-id=\"3015-108\">2-Player co-op</a> with <a href=\"/mario/3005-177\" data-ref-id=\"3005-177\">Mario</a> and <a href=\"/luigi/3005-370\" data-ref-id=\"3005-370\">Luigi</a> throughout the full game, as opposed to the original <a href=\"/new-super-mario-bros/3030-8224\" data-ref-id=\"3030-8224\">New Super Mario Bros.</a> that had a dedicated Battle Mode for multiplayer. Both players have to stay on the screen at all times. If one of them fails to do so, they fly behind the other player in a bubble as if they had died and the other has to pop them out of it. The camera orientation in the cooperative mode begins centered on the player who is hosting the session, however each player can then fight for control of the orientation by ground-pounding the other.</p><h2>StreetPass Functionality</h2><p>The game's use of <a href=\"/streetpass-functionality/3015-6609\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6609\">StreetPass</a> encompasses a competitive mode reminiscent of EA's <a href=\"/autolog/3015-7018\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7018\">autolog/battlelog</a>. Since this game is all about gold coins, there are special challenges that make players run through three levels in a row with only one life with the goal to collect the most gold coins possible. This data then gets shared via StreetPass and other players can then challenge the high scores achieved by the original player.</p><h2>DLC</h2><p>During their post-E3 Nintendo Direct presentation, the company announced that the game would also support downloadable content in the form of new Coin Rush stages. Unlike past Nintendo DLC, this would be offered for a price. The stages were designed based on consumer feedback to the main game. All 30 Coin Rush DLC stages were bundled with the main game for the New Super Mario Bros. 2 Special Edition Nintendo 2DS which was released on July 4, 2014 in Europe.</p><h2>Reception</h2><p>New Super Mario Bros. 2 became the fourth 3DS game in the United States to surpass 1 million units sold, with a total of more than 1.45 million as of January, 2013.</p><h2>Compatible 3DS Features</h2><ul><li><a href=\"/nintendo-network/3015-7328\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7328\">Nintendo Network (DLC support)</a></li><li><a href=\"/mii-support/3015-270\" data-ref-id=\"3015-270\">Mii Support</a></li><li>Local Wireless Play (2 Player Co-op)</li><li><a href=\"/streetpass-functionality/3015-6609\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6609\">StreetPass</a></li><li><a href=\"/spotpass/3015-7202\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7202\">SpotPass</a></li></ul><h2>eShop Version</h2><p>Size: 2950 blocks (369 MB)</p><h2>Reception</h2><p>As of March 31, 2016 New Super Mario Bros. 2 has sold 10.25 million copies worldwide.</p><p>The game received mixed reviews with some people noting the worrn out New-series formula while others praised the inventive coin-rush mode and openly indulged collectomania.</p><p> {"duration": "0:38:00", "runner": "druvan7", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/mario-kart-double-dash/3030-18757/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/1061704-mario_kart_double_dash___title_screen.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1061704\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0\" data-width=\"0\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a  href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/1061704-mario_kart_double_dash___title_screen.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1061704\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/1061704-mario_kart_double_dash___title_screen.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The game's title screen.</figcaption></figure><p>Mario Kart: Double Dash!! is the fourth game in the <a href=\"/mario-kart/3025-507\" data-ref-id=\"3025-507\">Mario Kart</a> franchise. Released in 2003, it was developed by <a href=\"/nintendo-ead/3010-463\" data-ref-id=\"3010-463\">Nintendo EAD</a> and published by <a href=\"/nintendo/3010-90\" data-ref-id=\"3010-90\">Nintendo</a>. It is the only game in the series to allow players to have two characters per kart. The new gameplay features were generally well-received, with 87% from both GameRankings and Metacritic and it's often referred to by fans as the best game in the series.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/83448/1371094-double_dash__.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1371094\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75792988313856\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/83448/1371094-double_dash__.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1371094\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/83448/1371094-double_dash__.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The Double Dash!! boost in action!</figcaption></figure><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/27545/1881875-double_dash__.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1881875\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/27545/1881875-double_dash__.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1881875\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/2/27545/1881875-double_dash__.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/2/27545/1881875-double_dash__.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Another successful Double Dash!!</figcaption></figure><p>Mario Kart: Double Dash!! follows the traditional <a href=\"/mario-kart/3025-507\" data-ref-id=\"3025-507\">Mario Kart</a> formula. The player races through several courses in the <a href=\"/grand-prix/3015-3962\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3962\">Grand Prix</a>, winning new characters, karts, courses, and modes. The game also has a <a href=\"/cooperative-play/3015-108\" data-ref-id=\"3015-108\">cooperative mode</a>, in which one player controls each character in the <a href=\"/go-kart/3055-552\" data-ref-id=\"3055-552\">kart</a>. Up to two players or four players using co-op mode may compete in Grand Prix mode. One player steers the kart while the rear player holds an item and can throw it to the player up front at any time which also allows to hold up to two items. For the first time in the series, a kart can now activate the all new starting boost technique, the Double Dash!! This super boost can be achieved if <a href=\"/lakitus-start-signal/3055-1987\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1987\">Lakitu's Start Signal</a> turns green and both members activate the <a href=\"/rocket-start/3015-1823\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1823\">rocket start</a> at the same time. 3, 2, 1... <a href=\"/double-dash/3015-3017\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3017\">DOUBLE DASH!!</a></p><h2>Versus</h2><p>Players can compete without computer players in Versus mode. Four players race around the track together or separately as a chart keeps track of their points. Unlike previous entries in the series, placing 5th or lower will allow you to move on to the next race.</p><h2>Battle Mode</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/70944/1247894-mkdd_luigi_smansion.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247894\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/70944/1247894-mkdd_luigi_smansion.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247894\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/7/70944/1247894-mkdd_luigi_smansion.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/7/70944/1247894-mkdd_luigi_smansion.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Shine Thief is another game that you can play in Battle Mode.</figcaption></figure><p>Battle Mode features enclosed battle arenas in which players compete in a variety of ways, such as Shine Thief, Bob-Omb Battle, and Balloon Battle. In Shine Thief, all the players try and capture a <a href=\"/shine-sprite/3055-1984\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1984\">Shine Sprite</a> and keep it for an amount of time. In Bob-Omb Battle, players collect <a href=\"/bob-omb/3055-480\" data-ref-id=\"3055-480\">Bob-Ombs</a> and then throw them at each other in an attempt to steal all of their stars (stars are awarded for hitting another player with a Bob-Omb). In the Balloon Battle, players throw items at one another as they try and pop each others' <a href=\"/balloon/3055-720\" data-ref-id=\"3055-720\">balloon</a>s.</p><h2><a href=\"/time-trials/3015-1361\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1361\">Time Trial</a></h2><p>The only game mode that does not allow for multiplayer pits players against the clock to compete for the best time on a race course. Fulfilling specific requirements can unlock a Staff Ghost where they race against a record that was set previously by a developer of the game. You can also create your own ghosts and save them onto a memory card with free space.</p><h2>LAN Play</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14355/2402317-gm4e01_1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2402317\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14355/2402317-gm4e01_1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2402317\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14355/2402317-gm4e01_1.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14355/2402317-gm4e01_1.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Two systems are linked together for eight player multiplayer.</figcaption></figure><p>Up to eight Nintendo Gamecube systems can be linked together for multiplayer up to 16 players. This game mode has limited options of play as characters and karts are randomly chosen, only <b>Grand Prix</b>, <b>Versus</b>, <b>Battle</b> and <b>Shine Thief</b> modes are available for gameplay and other settings in the options menu are ignored.</p><p>Based on the save data located on a memory card for any patricipating system, you can play on the unlockable tracks or randomly be given a chance to play as an unlockable character.</p><p>To opt for multiple players, the screen orientation can be set to one screen, half split or quad split. Depending on the \"screens\" available allows for up to four players on one console. Starting a LAN game then asks to set the amount of participating players then press A to signal for ready. Depending on the screen split, non-participating players will be replaced by a black screen. (For example, on a four split setting with only one participating player, the other three screens remain blank.) When playing with 6-8 players across two systems, the framerate will be cut in half.</p><h2>Characters</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/27545/1975034-thanks_for_playing_screen__mario_kart_double_dash___.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1975034\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/2/27545/1975034-thanks_for_playing_screen__mario_kart_double_dash___.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1975034\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/2/27545/1975034-thanks_for_playing_screen__mario_kart_double_dash___.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/2/27545/1975034-thanks_for_playing_screen__mario_kart_double_dash___.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>All twenty playable characters in the game.</figcaption></figure><p>The twenty characters in Mario Kart: Double Dash!! are sorted by weight: Light, Middle, and Heavy. Depending on their weight, there are a certain amount of karts to choose from.</p><p>Note: Special item in parenthesis. The only exception is Petey Piranha and King Boo, whom get a random special item based from other characters.</p><h3>Light</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/875551-mkdd_baby_bros_fnpj.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-875551\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"1.1640211640212\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:116.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/875551-mkdd_baby_bros_fnpj.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-875551\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/7465/875551-mkdd_baby_bros_fnpj.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/7465/875551-mkdd_baby_bros_fnpj.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Baby Mario and Baby Luigi: A lightweight pair</figcaption></figure><ul><li><a href=\"/baby-mario/3005-2047\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2047\">Baby Mario</a> (<a href=\"/chain-chomp/3015-2986\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2986\">Chain Chomp</a>)</li><li><a href=\"/baby-luigi/3005-3556\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3556\">Baby Luigi</a> (Chain Chomp)</li><li><a href=\"/koopa-troopa/3015-2557\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2557\">Koopa Troopa</a> (Triple Shells)</li><li><a href=\"/koopa-paratroopa/3015-2558\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2558\">Paratroopa</a> (Triple Shells)</li><li><a href=\"/diddy-kong/3005-304\" data-ref-id=\"3005-304\">Diddy Kong</a> (Giant Banana Peel)</li><li><a href=\"/bowser-jr/3005-825\" data-ref-id=\"3005-825\">Bowser Jr.</a> (Bowser Shell)</li><li><a href=\"/toad/3005-845\" data-ref-id=\"3005-845\">Toad</a> (Super Mushroom)</li><li><a href=\"/toadette/3005-1296\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1296\">Toadette</a> (Super Mushroom)</li></ul><h3>Average</h3><ul><li><a href=\"/mario/3005-177\" data-ref-id=\"3005-177\">Mario</a> (<a href=\"/fireball/3055-120\" data-ref-id=\"3055-120\">Fireball</a>)</li><li><a href=\"/luigi/3005-370\" data-ref-id=\"3005-370\">Luigi</a> (Fireball)</li><li><a href=\"/peach/3005-709\" Egg)</li><li><a href=\"/waluigi/3005-785\" data-ref-id=\"3005-785\">Waluigi</a> (Bob-Omb)</li></ul><h3>Heavy</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" Castle</a></td></tr><tr><td>Dry Dry Desert</td><td><a href=\"/waluigi-stadium/3035-2067\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2067\">Waluigi Stadium</a></td><td><a href=\"/dk-mountain/3035-2066\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2066\">DK Mountain</a></td><td><a href=\"/rainbow-road/3035-60\" data-ref-id=\"3035-60\">Rainbow Road</a></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Battle Mode Stages</h2><p>In battle mode there are a total six stages to choose from, two of the tracks will become available when unlocked by meeting requirements in <a href=\"/grand-prix/3015-3962\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3962\">Grand Prix</a> mode.</p><ul><li><a href=\"/cookie-land/3035-2204\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2204\">Cookie Land</a></li><li>Block City</li><li><a href=\"/gamecube/3055-1237\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1237\">Nintendo Gamecube</a></li><li>Pipe Plaza</li><li><a href=\"/luigis-mansion/3035-475\" data-ref-id=\"3035-475\">Luigi's Mansion</a> (Unlockable)</li><li>Tilt-A-Kart (Unlockable)</li></ul>", "deck": "Mario Kart: Double Dash!! is the fourth installment in the Mario Kart series, following Mario Kart: Super Circuit from 2001. The game introduced a number of new gameplay features, most notably the inclusion of two riders per kart.", "aliases": "MK:DD", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/8/87790/2261112-box_mkdd.png"}, "date_last_updated": "2015-01-29 19:05:00", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-18757/", "number_of_user_reviews": 6, "original_release_date": "2003-11-18 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-7/", "id": 7, "name": "PEGI: 3+"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-6/", "id": 6, "name": "ESRB: E"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-19/", "id": 19, "name": "CERO: All Ages"}], "date_added": "2008-04-01 16:42:37", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-23/", "abbreviation": "GCN", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/gamecube/3045-23/", "id": 23, "name": "GameCube"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 18757, "resource_type": "game", "name": "Mario Kart: Double Dash!!"}, "platform": "Gamecube", "title": "Mario Kart: Double Dash!!"}
{"duration": "0:35:00", "runner": "TonesBalones", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/fast-racing-neo/3030-44357/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<p>\u00a0</p>", "deck": "A sequel to futuristic WiiWare racer FAST Racing League.", "aliases": null, "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/8/82063/2802527-frn.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2015-12-16 18:16:06", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-44357/", "number_of_user_reviews": 0, "original_release_date": "2015-12-10 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": null, "date_added": "2013-10-29 09:59:04", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-139/", "abbreviation": "WIIU", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/wii-u/3045-139/", "id": 139, "name": "Wii U"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 44357, "resource_type": "game", "name": "FAST Racing Neo"}, "platform": "Wii U", "title": "FAST Racing NEO"}
{"duration": "1:00:00", "runner": "Almarkowbender", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/crash-team-racing/3030-6196/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Plot</h2><p>Crash Team Racing opens with a <a data-ref-id=\"3015-22\" href=\"/cutscene/3015-22\">cutscene</a> showing each of the characters in the world of <a data-ref-id=\"3025-116\" href=\"/crash-bandicoot/3025-116\">Crash Bandicoot</a> enjoying what they are up to when suddenly they are teleported away. They are all shocked to see themselves gathered in one area, friend and foe alike. Before they have a chance to start attacking each other, a giant screen lights up in front of them, an alien by the name of <a data-ref-id=\"3005-4075\" href=\"/nitros-oxide/3005-4075\">Nitros Oxide</a> declares that he wants to race the best driver in this world and that if he, Nitros Oxide, wins he will turn the world into a giant parking lot. He says that he doesn't know who the best racer in the land is so he wants everyone to race against each other and he will challenge the winner. Once the player collects of all the Time Relics, CTR Tokens and <a data-ref-id=\"3055-445\" href=\"/crystal/3055-445\">Crystals</a>, Oxide admits defeat and returns to his home planet.</p><h2>Adventure</h2><p>Adventure mode is the single player story mode of the game. At the beginning you choose one character from the roster and find yourself in an open world environment. From here the player can access races through <a data-ref-id=\"3015-804\" href=\"/warp-zone/3015-804\">warp zones</a> similar to those seen in <a data-ref-id=\"3030-12909\" href=\"/crash-bandicoot-warped/3030-12909\">Crash Bandicoot 3</a>. After the player has finished first they can either go and play unlocked levels or complete Time Trial races or CTR races. Time Trial has the player attempt 3 <a data-ref-id=\"3015-1202\" href=\"/laps/3015-1202\">laps</a> round the track in a short specific time, the only way to achieve these is to master the quickest paths and smash time crates which stop the counter. In CTR races the player has to collect CTR tokens scattered around the level whilst still coming first place. Finally the other way to get CTR tokens in through challenges in adventure, the player must speed around the battle levels and collect crystals under a certain time limit. Completing races continues the plot of the game and unlocks more races and enviroments. After a set amount of races have been completed Boss Races become availiable from famous <a data-ref-id=\"3015-229\" href=\"/bosses/3015-229\">bosses</a> in the Crash franchise. Once beaten the Bosses open new enviroments for the player with new warp zones and challenges. While the player does not need to complete Time Trials and CTR token races they are used to unlock additional characters later in the game.</p><h3>Bosses</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5052/367018-ctr1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-367018\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 350px\" data-ratio=\"0.74857142857143\" data-width=\"350\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5052/367018-ctr1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-367018\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5052/367018-ctr1.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The game in action</figcaption></figure><p>The following are the boss racers you will encounter in the Adventure Mode;</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-12156\" href=\"/ripper-roo/3005-12156\">Ripper Roo</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-11696\" href=\"/papu-papu/3005-11696\">Papu Papu</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-14668\" href=\"/komodo-joe/3005-14668\">Komodo Joe</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-3980\" href=\"/pinstripe/3005-3980\">Pinstripe</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-4075\" href=\"/nitros-oxide/3005-4075\">Nitrous Oxide</a></li></ul><h3>Areas</h3><p>The game is spilt up into different five different areas where races are unlocked and played:</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><b>N.Sanity Beach</b></li></ul><p>Crash Cove, Roo's Tubes, Mystery Caves and Sewer Speedway.</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><b>The Lost Ruins</b></li></ul><p>Coco Park, Tiger Temple, Papu's Pyramid and Dingo Canyon.</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><b>Glacier Park</b></li></ul><p>Blizzard Bluff, Dragon Mines, Polar Pass and Tiny Arena.</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><b>The Citadel</b></li></ul><p>N. Gin Labs, Cortex Castle, Hot Air Skyway and Oxide Station.</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><b>Gemstone Valley</b></li></ul><p>Slide Coliseum, Turbo Track and bonus races.</p><p>As well as racing tracks, battle tracks are also available. These tracks are unlocked by completing cup races. They are utilised in multiplayer where up to 4 people can fight each other in a battle mode.</p><p>Skull Rock, Rocky Road, Nitro Court, Rampage Ruins, Basement Level, Parking Lot and The North bowl are the battle tracks available.</p><h2>Characters</h2><p>Crash Team Racing features 15 characters, 8 of which are unlocked from the start and are availiable in Adventure mode. These are:</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1699/461224-snap_sony_dvd_recorder_volume_20.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-461224\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1699/461224-snap_sony_dvd_recorder_volume_20.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-461224\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/1699/461224-snap_sony_dvd_recorder_volume_20.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Racer select screen</figcaption></figure><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-368\" href=\"/crash-bandicoot/3005-368\">Crash</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-1153\" href=\"/coco-bandicoot/3005-1153\">Coco</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-1289\" href=\"/doctor-neo-cortex/3005-1289\">Dr. Neo Cortex</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-2038\" href=\"/tiny-tiger/3005-2038\">Tiny Tiger</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-3068\" href=\"/dingodile/3005-3068\">Dingodile</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-15465\" href=\"/pura/3005-15465\">Pura</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3015-3286\" href=\"/polar-bear/3015-3286\">Pola</a></li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-3329\" href=\"/dr-n-gin/3005-3329\">Dr. N. Gin</a></li></ul><p>The following are unlockable characters:</p><ul class=\"plain-list\"><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-12156\" href=\"/ripper-roo/3005-12156\">Ripper Roo</a> - Unlocked by winning the Red Gem Cup in Adventure</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-11696\" href=\"/papu-papu/3005-11696\">Papu Papu</a> - Unlocked by winning the Green Gem Cup in Adventure</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-14668\" href=\"/komodo-joe/3005-14668\">Komodo Joe</a> - Unlocked by winning the Blue Gem Cup in Adventure</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-3980\" href=\"/pinstripe/3005-3980\">Pinstripe</a> - Unlocked by winning the Yellow Gem Cup in Adventure</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-3979\" href=\"/n-tropy/3005-3979\">Dr. Nefarious Tropy</a> - Unlocked by beating all his ghosts in Time Trial</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-15454\" href=\"/penta-penguin/3005-15454\">Penta Penguin</a> - Unlocked by secret code, at the main menu hold L1 and R1 then press: Down, Right, Triangle, Down, Left, Triangle, Up,</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3005-14582\" href=\"/fake-crash/3005-14582\">Fake Crash</a> - Unlocked by winning the Purple Gem Cup in Adventure</li></ul><h2>Power Ups</h2><p><a data-ref-id=\"3015-700\" href=\"/power-up/3015-700\">Power ups</a> can be collected by smashing into <a data-ref-id=\"3055-31\" href=\"/crate/3055-31\">crates</a>. Crates marked with a question mark will give you a random power up and spring box crates will give you <a data-ref-id=\"3055-585\" href=\"/wumpa-fruit/3055-585\">wumpa fruit</a>.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5779/297911-wumpazm6.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-297911\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 158px\" data-ratio=\"1.1139240506329\" data-width=\"158\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:111.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5779/297911-wumpazm6.gif\" data-ref-id=\"1300-297911\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5779/297911-wumpazm6.gif\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5779/297911-wumpazm6.gif\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Wumpa fruit</figcaption></figure><p><b>Wumpa Fruit</b> - When you collect 10 wumpa fruit 2 things will happen. You will get an increase in your top speed and it will modify any power ups that you get to make them stronger e.g. A <a data-ref-id=\"3055-1166\" href=\"/tnt-crate/3055-1166\">TNT crate</a> will become a <a data-ref-id=\"3055-1167\" href=\"/nitro-crate/3055-1167\">Nitro crate</a>. You can collect wumpa fruit by smashing spring box crates and you can also pick up loose wumpa fruit scattered around the track. If you have wumpa fruit and you are hit by an enemy racer or if you fall off the track the number of wumpa fruit you have will decrease.</p><p><b>Uka Uka/Aku Aku</b> - The Voodoo mask provides 3 different effects to the player for a limited time. A mask will spin around the player and they will recieve a noticable increase in speed, invunerability to other racer's power ups and the player can also hit other racers to cause them to spin out. When upgraded by wumpa fruit the power up lasts longer. Good characters will receive the <a data-ref-id=\"3005-1235\" href=\"/aku-aku/3005-1235\">Aku Aku</a> mask and bad characters will get the <a data-ref-id=\"3005-1377\" href=\"/uka-uka/3005-1377\">Uka Uka</a> mask, there is no gameplay difference between the masks.</p><p><b>Green and Red Bottles</b> - Green bottles can be dropped behind the player or can be fired foward. If a racer hits a green bottle they will spin out. When upgraded by wumpa fruit a red bottle is obtained instead. The red bottle has a similar effect to the green bottle but it also forms a raincloud over the player that hits it. The player is slowed down and also loses the ability to hop. Red and green bottles can also be used to deflect incoming attacks.</p><p><b>Homing Missiles</b> - <a data-ref-id=\"3055-857\" href=\"/homing-missile/3055-857\">Homing missiles</a> will lock on to the nearest racer in front of you when fired. They will follow racers until they hit their target but can be avoided by obstucting their path with track terrain or using a TNT/Nitro crate to destroy them. When upgraded by wumpa fruit they cause racers to spin out for longer. A triple version of this power up is also available where the racer gets 3 <a data-ref-id=\"3055-713\" href=\"/rocket/3055-713\">rockets</a> instead of 1 from a single pick up.</p><p><b>TNT and Nitro Crates</b> - A TNT crate can be dropped behind you to obstruct other racers. If a racer hits a TNT crate it will land on their head and countdown. The racer has 3 seconds to shake the TNT off before it explodes by hopping up and down. If caught in the TNT blast radius racers will spin out. When upgraded by wumpa fruit a TNT crate becomes a Nitro crate. Nitro crates have the same effect except they lack the delay and explode on contact. TNT/Nitro crates can be used to block incoming attacks.</p><p><b>Bowling Balls</b> - <a data-ref-id=\"3055-746\" href=\"/bowling-ball/3055-746\">Bowling balls</a> can be fired fowards or backwards. They travel in a straight line and explode on contact with either racers or terrain. They cause racers to spin out when hit and they can also be detonated by pressing circle again after they have been released. When upgraded by wumpa fruit they cause the racer to spin out for longer. A triple power up is also available where the racer gets 3 bowling balls instead of 1.</p><p><b>Warp Orb</b> - Once it has been fired, a warp orb will travel the course ahead of you and make anyone in the vicinity spin out. When upgraded by wumpa fruit, it lasts longer.</p><p><b>Green and Blue Shields -</b> Green shields when activated will protect you from a single attack or will eventually fade away if you are not hit. You can also fire the shield ahead of you like a bowling ball. When upgraded by wumpa fruit the shield turns blue and will protect you from more damage.</p><p><b>Timer</b> - When activated it will slow down all other racers to crawling speed for a short time. When upgraded by wumpa fruit the power up lasts longer.</p><p><b>Turbo</b> - A <a data-ref-id=\"3055-1209\" href=\"/turbo/3055-1209\">turbo</a> will give you a prolonged burst of speed like the boost gained from power sliding. When upgraded by wumpa fruit the boost lasts for longer.</p><h2>Turbo</h2><p>As well as the turbo gained from the power up turbo, boost can also be gained from a few different techniques:</p><p><b>Turbo Start -</b> At the begining of each race it is possible to gain a <a data-ref-id=\"3015-461\" href=\"/boost/3015-461\">boost</a> right from the go by timing your acceleration with the lights. If you time your acceleration to the half-way point between the last red light and the green you will get an instant boost.</p><p><b>Power-sliding Turbos</b> - Pressing and holding the R1 button around a corner will make you perform a <a data-ref-id=\"3030-16728\" href=\"/powerslide/3030-16728\">powerslide</a>. When the smoke from the exhaust turns black you can give yourself a small turbo by pressing the L1 button. You can do 3 boosts in one powerslide at a time. This technique is essential to getting the best times on tracks.</p><p><b>Jump Turbos</b> - Jump turbos are performed by hopping off the top of a ramp, hump or ridge and then landing. Once you land the boost kicks in. The longer you are in the air the more boost you get when you land. Jumping and landing on flat ground is not enough to inact the jump boost.</p><h2>Spyro 2 Demo</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6559/219310-spyro_the_dragon.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-219310\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 238px\" data-ratio=\"1.0840336134454\" data-width=\"238\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:108.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6559/219310-spyro_the_dragon.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-219310\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/6559/219310-spyro_the_dragon.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/6559/219310-spyro_the_dragon.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Eager players got an early look at Spyro 2</figcaption></figure><p>On the main menu screen, if the player types in the cheat code, \"Hold L1 R1 and press Down, Circle, Triangle, Triangle, Right\" they will unlock a <a data-ref-id=\"3030-1563\" href=\"/spyro-2-riptos-rage/3030-1563\">Spyro the Dragon 2: Gateway to Glimmer</a> demo.
