Eye</li><li><b>Weakness:</b> Gyro Attack</li></ul><h2>Ports &amp; Re-releases</h2><p>While the original game was released as a <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/virtual-console/3015-2925\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2925\">Virtual Console</a> title for the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/wii/3045-36\" data-ref-id=\"3045-36\">Wii</a> (on June 16, 2011), <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/nintendo-3ds/3045-117\" data-ref-id=\"3045-117\">Nintendo 3DS</a> (on May 16, 2013), and <a href=\"/wii-u/3045-139\" data-ref-id=\"3045-139\">Wii U</a> (on August 7, 2014), the game received some ports:</p><ul><li>An enhanced port, developed for the 1999 Japan-only <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation/3045-22\" data-ref-id=\"3045-22\">PlayStation</a> series <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/rockman-complete-works-rockman/3030-282\" data-ref-id=\"3030-282\">Rockman Complete Works</a>, retained the graphics and music from the original. However, this version includes an optional arranged soundtrack, the option to switch weapons without requiring the weapon sub-menu, an updated <a href=\"/heads-up-display/3015-180\" data-ref-id=\"3015-180\">HUD</a>, and a special \"Navi Mode\" that guides players in certain parts of the game. This version was later released in North America as part of the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/mega-man-anniversary-collection/3030-6141\" data-ref-id=\"3030-6141\">Mega Man Anniversary Collection</a> compilation for the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-2/3045-19\" data-ref-id=\"3045-19\">PlayStation 2</a> and <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/gamecube/3045-23\" data-ref-id=\"3045-23\">GameCube</a> on June 23, 2004 and the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/xbox/3045-32\" data-ref-id=\"3045-32\">Xbox</a> on March 15, 2005. The original PlayStation version was later released in Japan on the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-3/3045-35\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a> and <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-portable/3045-18\" data-ref-id=\"3045-18\">PlayStation Portable</a> (both via <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-network/3015-2623\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2623\">PlayStation Network</a>) on August 10, 2011. (This was later expanded to the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-vita/3045-129\" data-ref-id=\"3045-129\">PlayStation Vita</a>)</li></ul><ul><li>A \"faithful recreation\" was developed for the 2015 downloadable compilation <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/mega-man-legacy-collection/3030-49878\" data-ref-id=\"3030-49878\">Mega Man Legacy Collection</a> for the <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/xbox-one/3045-145\" data-ref-id=\"3045-145\">Xbox One</a>, <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/playstation-4/3045-146\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a>, <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/nintendo-3ds/3045-117\" data-ref-id=\"3045-117\">Nintendo 3DS</a>, and <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> (via <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/steam/3015-718\" data-ref-id=\"3015-718\">Steam</a>). Developed by <a href=\"http://www.giantbomb.com/digital-eclipse-software-inc/3010-532\" data-ref-id=\"3010-532\">Digital Eclipse</a>, this version features a \"Challenge Mode\" (where players must complete sequences throughout all six main NES games as fast as they can) and viewable art assets.</li></ul>", "deck": "Mega Man's former ally, Proto Man, creates an army of destructive robots and {"duration": "0:20:00", "runner": "Trogdor", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/mighty-gunvolt/3030-47469/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Mighty Gunvolt is free in Japan to players who download Azure Striker Gunvolt between August 20 and November 19, 2014. The same promotion is active for the North American release running three months starting on the day of release. Mighty Gunvolt was also offered out as a free download to all backers of the Mighty No. 9 kickstarter, as it also stars Beck, the main of that game.</p><h2>Story</h2><p>Being that this is a crossover game, the story is an odd merging of the stories from Azure Strike Gunvolt, and Gal Gun, both games made by Inti Creates. The story is presented to the player by two screens of text, which are as follows, complete with broken English and spelling mistakes:</p><blockquote><p>The other time, the other place: Experiments on humans started by the massive media group \"Sumeragi\" to audition for the next \"Muse\" idol. Their magic hand even reached female schools. Female students vanashed, and no new couples formed. Love was in a danger. \"Gunvolt,\" it's the name who we call the only one to fight them. It's no accident he was involved in the troubles. Together with angel \"Ekoro\" and robot \"Beck\" he fights to free successivefuly occupied major city facilities.</p></blockquote><p>Yes, those typos are in the game too.</p><h2>Characters</h2><p>Each of the three playable characters plays in a similar manner, with some unique abilities given to each. While all three can do the standard jumping and shooting, reminiscent of the 8-bit Mega Man games, only Gunvolt can do a double jump mid-air, Ekoro can briefly hover with her wings, and Beck is the only one able to slide dash under low objects. All levels have short alternative paths that only some of the characters will be able to reach thanks to their differing moves.</p><p>Each character also has a different charge-up attack. Gunvolt unleashes a powerful electric chain that he can move up and down in front of him, however he is unable to move while doing this. Beck can store a charge while moving that allows him to dash a short distance forward (different to his slide dash) that also damages enemies and can even be done mid-air. When Ekoro charges up her gun and fires it, a large heart shoots out that will \"mark\" an enemy. Now when she kills this enemy, instead of exploding, a halo appears over its head. The enemy is now an ally which will float behind her, shooting other enemies on screen until it takes enough damage to be destroyed once and for all.</p><h2>Levels</h2><p>Mighty Gunvolt has 5 levels: School, Train, Lab, Tower, and Mirror. Depending on which character the player selects to play the game, the levels appear in a different order. Specifically, Ekoro starts in the school, which is an 8-bit recreation of a level from Gal Gun complete with giant tentacled plant monster. Beck and Gunvolt both start on the Train level.</p><p>Several stats are collected about each level, which can be viewed when selecteing a save file. The game tracks Hi Score, Fastest Time, Max Combo, and Clear Rate for each level, making score and time attacks a good reason to replay levels.</p><p> </p>", "deck": "A crossover game between Mighty No. 9, Azure Striker Gunvolt and Gal Gun. Developed by Inti Creates for the Nintendo 3DS eShop. {"duration": "0:51:00", "runner": "Hornlitz", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/ape-escape/3030-13371/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Ape Escape is an action/adventure game developed by <a href=\"/sony-computer-entertainment-america/3010-313\" data-ref-id=\"3010-313\">Sony Computer Entertainment America</a>. The object of the game is to battle and capture monkeys that have gone rampant. It is also the first game to require the Dualshock controller, for it needed the use of both thumb sticks.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><h3>Gadgets</h3><p>The whole point of the game is to stop Specter and his evil monkeys. Your mission is to stun the monkeys with any combination of your items, and then capture them with the gadget known as the Time Net. This net captures the monkeys and sends them back to the present. More Gadgets would be given to you as you progress through the game. The available Gadgets are:</p><ul><li><b>Time Net -</b> The only Gadget that can capture monkeys (on land). Swing the right analog stick to swing the net.</li><li><b>Stun Club - </b>A lightsaber-like Gadget that stuns monkeys, and also harms various other enemies. Swing the right analog stick to swing the club.</li><li><b>Water Net -</b> The only Gadget that can be used underwater. It is automatically switched to when Spike is in water, and can shoot out nets to capture monkeys.</li><li><b>Monkey Radar -</b> A radar that is used to find monkeys. The closer Spike is to a monkey, the faster and higher-pitched the sound it emits will be. Once close enough, the camera can zoom in on the monkey and display a little bio. Rotating the right analog stick rotates the radar dish.</li><li><b>Slingback Shooter/Slingshot -</b> A slingshot that stuns monkeys. Can also harm enemies and hit buttons. Can shoot 3 different types of pellets: Normal, Guided, or Explosive. Pull back on the right analog stick to aim, and let go to shoot.</li><li><b>Super Hoop/Dash Hoop </b>- A hula hoop that gives Spike a speed boost, also allowing him to bowl over enemies. Spin the right analog stick to spin and charge the hoop. Once charged, let go of the stick to activate the boost.</li><li><b>Sky Flyer -</b> A little handheld propeller that allows Spike to rise up in the air. Spin the right analog stick to spin the Sky Flyer, and give Spike lift. Continuous spinning will not keep Spike airborne, but it will slow his descent.</li><li><b>RC Car -</b> A remote controlled car that can fit through small holes. Used to hit unreachable buttons, or to draw monkeys out of hiding. The right analog stick controls the car.</li><li><b>Magic Punch -</b> Obtainable after defeating Specter. An extendable device with what appears to be a boxing glove at the end, it is a powerful Gadget that can destroy boxes and walls that the Stun Club cannot. Tilt the right analog stick slightly for a weak punch, all the way for a strong one.</li></ul><p>Each of the gadgets has its own training room which must be completed to obtain it. These rooms can also be accessed in the warp room.</p><h3>Monkeys</h3><p>Each monkey has different characteristics and requires different tactics to capture them. For example, some monkeys are sleepy, which allows for an easy capture, while some are energetic, requiring the player to run around after them. Some are aggressive, which means that just running up to them could get you furiously punched, and some simply threw banana peels to make you slip. Some even carry firearms. Items have to be used in certain combinations in order to have the monkeys either be backed into a corner or become available to capture. You can also try going for a stealth approach. The lights on their helmets signify their statuses:</p><ul><li><b>Blue</b> - The monkey is calm. Nothing is amiss.</li><li><b>Yellow</b> - The monkey is suspicious and is on alert.</li><li><b>Red</b> - The monkey is alerted to Spike, and will attempt to run away and/or fight back.</li></ul><p>The color of a monkey's pants determines what type of monkey it is. Different strategies are required to catch different monkeys.</p><ul><li><b>Yellow - </b>Regular monkey. They can hit you, throw banannas to make you slip and sometimes they carry a gun.</li><li><b>Red -</b> Strong attacker. They fire rockets at you and also carry machine guns.</li><li><b>Blue</b> - Fast runner. They run really quickly. The dash hoop/super hoop is used to chase them.</li><li><b>White</b> - Great balance. They don't fall over easily.</li><li><b>Green</b> - Great vision. They fire rockets at you and are vigilant. They also wear 3D glasses.</li><li><b>Black</b> - Dangerous and wild. They wear black shades and have machine guns.</li><li><b>Light Blue</b> - Timid and gentle. Similar to a yellow monkey but less aggressive.</li></ul><h2>Plot</h2><p>There once was a monkey named Specter, who happily performed for humans at the zoo. But one day, the Professor accidentally drops one of his inventions, the Peak Point Helmet (Pipo Helmet). Due to curiosity, Specter tries the helmet on, and gains vast amounts of intelligence, and psychic powers. Now believing that humans treat monkeys cruelly, the megalomaniac Specter vows revenge on humans. He amasses an army of monkeys equipped with similar intelligence-boosting helmets (though less powerful than his own), and storms The Professor's lab. He plans to use the Professor's time machine to go back in time, and make monkeys the dominant species on the planet, instead of humans. Just then, Spike and his friend Jake/Buzz barge into the lab, right before Specter makes the leap back in time. He manages to go back in time anyways, as well as kidnapping Jake/Buzz and turning him into a mind-controlled slave. Aided by the Professor, his assistant/granddaughter Natalie/Katie, and his various gadgets, Spike must now go back in time to save Jake/Buzz, round up the rebellious monkeys, and stop Specter from changing history.</p><h2>Controls</h2><p>Since the game requires the Dualshock controller, it allows for a very unique control scheme (for its time). The character is moved with the left thumb stick, and attacks are done with the right stick. The R button is used to jump. The face buttons allow the character to select from a large variety of weapons, everything ranging from a laser sword to a remote controlled car. Attacks are done by moving the right stick in the direction you want to attack. There are also certain weapons that require the attack stick to be spun around quickly, such as a electric hula hoop that once spun fast enough will shoot the player forward quickly. This control scheme was incredibly innovative at the time and made the game much more immersive because it allowed the player to feel like they were much more involved in using the items in the game.</p><h2>Mini Games</h2><p>There are 3 mini games available to unlock in the warp room, each of which is unlocked after you collect a certain amount of Specter Tokens.They all make use of the thumb sticks in unique ways.They are:</p><h3>Ski Kidz Racing</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/262159-pre_ape_4_med.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-262159\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.77111111111111\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:77.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/262159-pre_ape_4_med.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-262159\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/56/262159-pre_ape_4_med.jpg\"/></a><figcaption> Spike skiing.</figcaption></figure><p>A racing game where you control your character in a skiing race. There are 5 characters to choose from (Spike, Buzz, Katie, the Professor and Monkey) and it is playable in split-screen for 2 players. You use the thumb sticks to control each of your skis individually. You go faster if you line them up correctly and gain additional boost if they are lined up perfectly. 10 Specter coins are required to unlock it.</p><h3>Specter Boxing</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/262158-rev_ape_3_med.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-262158\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.75777777777778\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/262158-rev_ape_3_med.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-262158\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/56/262158-rev_ape_3_med.jpg\"/></a><figcaption> Knockout punch.</figcaption></figure><p>A boxing game where you fight other monkeys in a championship. There are various monkeys to choose from and you fight in a tournament with each match becoming harder as you progress. The thumb sticks are used to control your monkeys fists. The different positions of the sticks allow for different moves like punching, blocking and swaying. A split-screen mode is also available. 20 specter tokens are needed to unlock it.</p><h3>Galaxy Monkey</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/44475/1468091-monkey_galaxy.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1468091\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5583596214511\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/44475/1468091-monkey_galaxy.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1468091\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/4/44475/1468091-monkey_galaxy.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/4/44475/1468091-monkey_galaxy.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption> Pigs in space?</figcaption></figure><p>A dual joystick shooter where you control a UFO. The left stick moves while the right stick shoots in the direction it is pointed. There is only one weapon but it can be upgraded by collecting P tokens. Enemies include expanding pigs, eyes, brown faces, saucers and steel balls. There is a co-op mode as well as a 3 minute time attack mode. 40 Specter tokens are required to unlock it.</p><p> </p><h2>PSP Port</h2><p>In 2005, an updated port of Ape Escape titled <a href=\"/ape-escape-on-the-loose/3030-7961\" data-ref-id=\"3030-7961\">Ape Escape: On the Loose</a> was released for the PSP. It had quite a few control differences, including being able to have only three items at the ready with the Triangle, Circle, and Square buttons as opposed to four on the original version. It changed the title of the level \"Wabi Sabi Wall\" to \"Tiki Tiki Wall\". Also instead of a skiing minigame, it was changed to a snowboarding minigame due to a lack of a second analog stick.</p><h2>Levels</h2><p>The levels in Ape Escape are divided into different time zones.</p><h3>The Lost Land</h3><ul><li>Fossil Fields</li><li>Wetlands</li><li>Dinosaur Area</li></ul><h3>Mysterious age</h3><ul><li>Thick Jungle</li><li>Mysterious Ruins 1</li><li>Mysterious Ruins 2</li></ul><h3>Primative Ocean</h3><ul><li>Crabby Beach</li><li>Coral Cave</li><li>Dexter's Island</li></ul><h3>Ice Age</h3><ul><li>Snowy Mammoth</li><li>Frosty Retreat</li><li>Monkey Hot Springs</li></ul><h3>Medieval Mayhem</h3><ul><li>Sushi Temple</li><li>Wabi Sabi Wall</li><li>Crumbling Castle</li></ul><h3>Futurama</h3><ul><li>City Park</li><li>Specter's Factory</li><li>TV Tower</li></ul><h3>Present Day</h3><ul><li>Specter Land</li><li>Final Get<b></b></li></ul>", "deck": "Specter, an evil, super-intelligent monkey, has traveled into the past. The story follows the adventures of <a href=\"/spyro-the-dragon/3005-967\" data-ref-id=\"3005-967\">Spyro the Dragon</a>, and his dragonfly companion <a href=\"/sparx-the-dragonfly/3005-10363\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10363\">Sparx</a>. The big new feature of this game is the Spyro's friends are also available as playable characters in their own special areas, each with different and useful abilities.</p><h2>Plot</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4938/215368-spyro.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-215368\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4938/215368-spyro.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-215368\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/4938/215368-spyro.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Spyro stares at a dragon egg for no reason.</figcaption></figure><p>Every twelve years, new dragon eggs are delivered into the realm of the dragons. This time around, an evil sorceress, her army of Rynocs, and apprentice, Bianca, have stolen the eggs. Spyro and his friends are the only ones who can retrieve the eggs, and stop the Sorceress' goals. As Spyro pursues the thieves responsible, he discovers a realm, called Avalon, which was once a home for dragons, but is now the place where the Sorceress resides. Spyro visits each forgotten realm to retrieve the eggs, with the help of different playable characters (<a href=\"/sheila/3005-10365\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10365\">Sheila</a>, <a href=\"/sgt-bird/3005-3955\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3955\">Sgt. Byrd</a>, <a href=\"/bentley/3005-10364\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10364\">Bentley</a>, and <a href=\"/agent-9/3005-3959\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3959\">Agent 9</a>). It is later revealed that the Sorceress is planning to use the wings of the baby dragons to create an immortality potion. This new facet of information forces Bianca to change sides and aid Spyro in stopping her. Spyro is finally able to kill the sorceress, and deliver all the baby dragons to the Dragon Kingdom.</p><h2>Homeworld and Levels</h2><p>The game spans four homeworlds which act as stations to other portals. Each Homeworld contains eight portals to separate levels: four standard levels, a speedway, a freed character from <a href=\"/moneybags/3005-10352\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10352\">Moneybags</a>' level, a boss confrontation, and a Sparx level. The four homeworlds and levels are:</p><h3>Sunrise Springs</h3><p>The levels found in Sunrise Springs are as followed:</p><ul><li>Sunny Villa</li><li>Cloud Spires</li><li>Molten Crater</li><li>Seashell Shore</li><li>Mushroom Speedway</li><li>Sheila's Alp</li><li>Buzz's Dungeon</li><li>Crawdad Farm</li></ul><h3>Midday Gardens</h3><p>The levels found in Midday Garden are as followed:</p><ul><li>Icy Peak</li><li>Enchanted Towers</li><li>Spooky Swamp</li><li>Bamboo Terrace</li><li>Country Speedway</li><li>Sgt. Byrd's Base</li><li>Spike's Arena</li><li>Spider Town</li></ul><h3>Evening Lake</h3><p>The levels found in Evening Lake are as followed:</p><ul><li>Frozen Altars</li><li>Lost Fleet</li><li>Fireworks Factory</li><li>Charmed Ridge</li><li>Honey Speedway</li><li>Bentley's Outpost</li><li>Scorch's Pit</li><li>Starfish Reef</li></ul><h3>Midnight Mountain</h3><p>The levels found in Midnight Mountain are as followed:</p><ul><li>Crystal Islands</li><li>Desert Ruins</li><li>Haunted Tomb</li><li>Dino Mines</li><li>Harbor Speedway</li><li>Agent 9's Lab</li><li>Sorceress' Lair</li><li>BugBot Factory</li><li>Super Bonus World</li></ul><h2>Playable Characters</h2><p>In a departure from the first two games, Insomniac introduced four new playable characters that can be unlocked as the player reaches each of the four worlds.</p><h3>Sheila The Kangaroo</h3><p>Sheila allows the player to jump to new heights. She is able to double jump and even super jump in order to reach extremely high areas. Her attacks involve kicks and a stomp which can be used following her jump.</p><h3>Sgt. Byrd</h3><p>Sgt. Byrd is a winged soldier able to fly and unleash rocket attacks from launchers attached to his sides.</p><h3>Bentley</h3><p>Bentley the yeti is armed with a massive club that he can use to crush enemies that stand in his path. He is also able to move heavy objects such as crates.</p><h3>Agent 9</h3><p>Agent 9 is a space monkey who is equipped with a laser weapon that he names 'Mr Laser Blaster'.</p><h2>Cheat Codes</h2><p>All cheat codes must be entered in the pause menu</p><p>99 Lives - R2, L2, R2, L2, Up, Up, Up, Up, Circle</p><p>Change skateboard into squid - Up, Up, Left, Left, Right, Right, Down, Down, Square, Circle, Square</p><p>2D Spyro - Left, Right, Left, Right, L1, R1, L1, R1, Square, Circle</p><p>Big Headed Spyro - Up, R1, Up, R1, Up, R1, Circle, Circle, Circle, Circle</p><p>Blue Spyro - Up, Left, Down, Right, Up, Square, R1, R2, L1, L2, Up, Right, Down, Left, Up, and X</p><p>Green Spyro - Up, Left, Down, Right, Up, Square, R1, R2, L1, L2, Up, Right, Down, Left, Up, Triangle</p><p>Red Spyro - Up, Left, Down, Right, Up, Square, R1, R2, L1, L2, Up, Right, Down, Left, Up, and Circle<br />Yellow Spyro - Up, Left, Down, Right, Up, Square, R1, R2, L1, L2, Up, Right, Down, Left, Up, Up</p><p><a href=\"/crash-bash/3030-15952\" data-ref-id=\"3030-15952\">Crash Bash</a> Demo - Hold L1, R2, and Square at the game menu</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><ul><li>\"Title and Sparx Levels\"</li><li>\"Sunrise Spring Home\"</li><li>\"Sunny Villa\"</li><li>\"Sheila's Alp\"</li><li>\"Cloud Spires\"</li><li>\"Molten Crater\"</li><li>\"Seashell Shore\"</li><li>\"Mushroom Speedway\"</li><li>\"Buzz's Dungeon\"</li><li>\"Midday Garden Home\"</li><li>\"Icy Peak\"</li><li>\"Enchanted Towers and Sgt. {"duration": "0:51:00", "runner": "Raikaru", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/ratchet-clank/3030-18309/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4745/224375-ratchet_and_clank_1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-224375\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.0433333333333\" data-width=\"300\" style=\"width: 300px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:104.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4745/224375-ratchet_and_clank_1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-224375\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4745/224375-ratchet_and_clank_1.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Ratchet &amp; Clank</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"/ratchet/3005-120\" data-ref-id=\"3005-120\">Ratchet</a> is a Lombax, a kind of feline type creature while <a href=\"/clank/3005-323\" data-ref-id=\"3005-323\">Clank</a> is essentially a small robot. Teamed up they make a force to be reckoned with. However where there are good guys there is always a bad guy and it comes in the form of <a href=\"/ultimate-supreme-executive-chairman-drek/3005-3237\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3237\">Chairman Drek</a>. A creepy space alien who wants to take over the universe and that's what you're here to prevent.</p><p>This is essentially a platform game with some basic level designs for you to run around in, these levels are filled with a variety of aliens and robots for you to dispose of in a variety of weird and wonderful ways. You can attack, dodge, blast and tactically jump your way into and out of any situation with an array of crazy weapons at your disposal.</p><p>The combat is 100% open in this game, you can do just about anything you want within reason. Providing you don't die of course, be it a laser to the head or falling off the nearest cliff. There are limitless ways to dispose of enemies, whether you want to use your Morph-O-Ray to turn them into Chickens, or use your <a href=\"/ryno/3055-494\" data-ref-id=\"3055-494\">R.Y.N.O</a> to obliterate all in your path.</p><h2>Storyline</h2><p>On a distant planet, a small robot manages to escape a production plant, only to be shot down while trying to get away in a small shuttle. Meanwhile, on the planet of <a href=\"/planet-veldin/3035-468\" data-ref-id=\"3035-468\">Veldin</a>, <a href=\"/ratchet/3005-120\" data-ref-id=\"3005-120\">Ratchet</a> is working on fixing his own ship at his garage. Suddenly, he spots something falling from the sky, landing not far from where he was working. He finds the small robot and brings it back with him, naming it ' <a href=\"/clank/3005-323\" data-ref-id=\"3005-323\">Clank</a>'.</p><p>When Clank has recovered, he shows Ratchet a message from an Infobot. It features <a href=\"/ultimate-supreme-executive-chairman-drek/3005-3237\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3237\">Chairman Drek</a>, explaining how his home planet of Blarg has become so over-polluted that it is becoming impossible to live there anymore. To solve this problem, Drek reveals his plans - taking large parts from various planets, from across the <a href=\"/solana-galaxy/3035-466\" data-ref-id=\"3035-466\">Solana Galaxy</a>, then combining them into one new area for the Blarg to live. Clank suggest they try to find <a href=\"/captain-qwark/3005-758\" data-ref-id=\"3005-758\">Captain Qwark</a>, the galaxy's most famous hero, to warn him of Drek's plans. Realizing his own planet is under threat, Ratchet agrees.</p><p>During their flight, Ratchet's faulty ship causes trouble again, and they end up crash landing at Novalis. While there, they receive a new ship from a native, and an infobot, containing an ad for Al's Roboshack, featuring Captain Qwark. They then fly on to Metropolis, to meet <a href=\"/big-al/3005-2937\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2937\">Big Al</a>. Although he doesnt know where Qwark is, and hadn't seen him since they filmed the advert, he does upgrade Clank, installing a Heli-Pak.</p><p>Eventually, they do find Qwark, and meet up with him at his challenge course at Umbris. After they complete the course, Qwark traps them, surrounding the pair with lava. Here, he reveals his involvement with Chairman Drek, hoping it will lead to a job oppurtunity on the newly formed planet. He then leaves them to fight a Snagglebeast, expecting they would both be defeated.</p><p>After they escape, Ratchet becomes angry towards Clank, and even more so towards Qwark, vowing to get revenge on the hero. After travelling to many planets, they manage to track down Qwark, defeating him in a space battle. After this, Ratchet sees Drek destroying a nearby planet and realises how un-caring he had become. He then vows to co-operate with Clank to try defeat Drek.</p><p>They gain more information about Drek's plans to use the Deplanetizer, and discover that Ratchet's home planet of Veldin is next in line for destruction. They rush back to the planet, and confront Drek. He proceeds to tell them how it was his plan all along to pollute his home planet, knowing he could make money selling land on the new one. A large battle between him and the duo ensues in which Drek is eventually defeated. Clank notices that the Deplanetizer's position has moved and is now pointing at Blarg, Drek's home planet. Before they can do anything, the machine activates and destroys Blarg.</p><p>After this, the two become overnight celebrities, featured in media across the galaxy.</p><h2>Weapons</h2><p>Over the top weapons became a staple of the series, after the first game introduced some wild and innovative methods of destroying enemies. Unlike later games, Ratchet &amp; Clank didn't feature the ability for weapons to gain experience and upgrade themselves. Instead Gold Bolts could be 'attached' to the player's arsenal to augment the power.</p><p>The weapons available in the game include:</p><ul><li><b>Bomb Glove (Free) Ammo: 40 Bombs</b></li></ul><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1070583-bomb_glove.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1070583\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.73977695167286\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1070583-bomb_glove.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1070583\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1070583-bomb_glove.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The Bomb Glove</figcaption></figure><p>The Gadgetron Bomb Glove is a staple weapon of the Ratchet and Clank games, with most other titles in the series featuring this weapon or one that is very similar. It deals moderate amounts of damage in a large area, however, ammo supplies are fairly limited compared to other weapons, so it is best used sparingly against closely packed groups of enemies. Ratchet aqcuires this weapon at the very start of the game along with his Omniwrench 8000</p><ul><li><b>Pyrocitor (2,500 bolts) Ammo: 240 Fuel</b></li></ul><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1070584-pyrocitor.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1070584\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.68591224018476\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:68.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1070584-pyrocitor.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1070584\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1070584-pyrocitor.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1070584-pyrocitor.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Pyrocitor</figcaption></figure><p>The Pyrocitor is first available to Ratchet from the weapons vendor on Novalis for the price of 2,500 bolts. It unleashes a swirling torrent of fire that deals with hordes of smaller enemies quickly, though its relatively low damage output is less effective at dispatching the larger ones.</p><ul><li><b>Blaster (2,500 bolts) Ammo: 200 Bullets</b></li></ul><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1072548-blaster.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1072548\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.79623824451411\" data-width=\"319\" style=\"width: 319px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:79.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1072548-blaster.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1072548\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1072548-blaster.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1072548-blaster.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Blaster</figcaption></figure><p>The Gadgetron Blaster can be purchased on planet Kerwan and is the second weapon available for Ratchet to buy. Due to it's high rate of fire and increased damage compared to the Pyrocitor, most players will use it frequently throuhgout the early stages of the game. It is most effective against single, large enemies. Rather effective against most of the games bosses, especially the final boss.</p><ul><li><b>Glove of Doom (7,500 bolts) Ammo: 10 Squads</b></li></ul><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1072554-glove_of_doom.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1072554\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.68041237113402\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:68.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34951/1072554-glove_of_doom.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1072554\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1072554-glove_of_doom.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34951/1072554-glove_of_doom.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Glove of Doom</figcaption></figure><p>The Glove of Doom can be bought on planet Eudora, costing three times as much as the Pyrocitor or Blaster. It differs from other weapons in the game in that it deploys small robotic 'Agents' that run up to any enemies they find and explode. This allows the player to use another weapon in conjunction with the Agents and deal more damage within a shorter time. The glove fires eggs which each carry four Agents.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092135-mine_glove.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092135\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75086505190311\" data-width=\"289\" style=\"width: 289px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092135-mine_glove.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092135\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092135-mine_glove.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092135-mine_glove.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Mine Glove</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Mine Glove (7,500 bolts) Ammo: 50 Mines</b></li></ul><p>A glove that threw hovering mines that would stay stationary until it detected an enemy. At that point it would home into them and blow up. Despite being rather slow, it is quite effective for an early weapon.This is extremely effective against melee enemies.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092138-taunter.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092138\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75333333333333\" data-width=\"150\" style=\"width: 150px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092138-taunter.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092138\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092138-taunter.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092138-taunter.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Taunter</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Taunter (2,500 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>A Gadgetron device used to emit insulting sounds in order to attract enemies. Enemies could then be lured into traps or destroyed by another weapon. The Taunter used no ammo. The taunter could also destroy boxes fom a short range.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092133-suckcannon.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092133\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.66013071895425\" data-width=\"153\" style=\"width: 153px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:66.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092133-suckcannon.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092133\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092133-suckcannon.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092133-suckcannon.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The suck Cannon</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Suck Cannon (Free)</b></li></ul><p>The Suck Cannon was originally created by the intellgent Blarg, however Gadgetron had claimed the Suck Cannon was a prototype nearing it's release date. It was not fully known who created the Suck Cannon however there were some interesting aspects of evidence. It functions as an overpowered vacuum cleaner. It sucks up small enemies and shoots them out as projectiles making its ammo infinite.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092139-devastator.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092139\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092139-devastator.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092139\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092139-devastator.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092139-devastator.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Devastator</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Devastator (10,000 bolts) Ammo: 20 Missiles</b></li></ul><p>The <b>PX6 Devastator</b> is a long-range weapon and is one of the cheapest long-range weapons in the Gadgetron collection. An effective menace to airborne enemies, it also had auto-tracking missiles that could lock onto enemies which made the Devastator not only powerful, but also accurate. It is first available on planet Batalia and used by the military as an anti-tank weapon.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092140-walloper.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092140\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75333333333333\" data-width=\"150\" style=\"width: 150px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092140-walloper.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092140\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092140-walloper.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092140-walloper.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Walloper</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Walloper (7,500 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>A Gadgetron-made weapon that resembled a large white punching glove. With a base price of 7,500 bolts on planet Gaspar, it is three times as powerful as a normal strike of the OmniWrench, and creates a temporary blue forcefield around the glove when it was used, protecting Ratchet from attacks.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092141-visibomb.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092141\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75333333333333\" data-width=\"150\" style=\"width: 150px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092141-visibomb.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092141\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092141-visibomb.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092141-visibomb.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Visibomb gun</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Visibomb Gun (15,000 bolts) Ammo: 20 Visibombs</b></li></ul><p>A teleguided missile-launcher that has the ability to see through the rocket's eye and allowed the user to control it. The weapon is generally used to pick off enemies at a distance, and although the user had to guide the missile theselves, they did not need to have a large amount of skill to use it successfully.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092142-decoyglove.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092142\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092142-decoyglove.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092142\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092142-decoyglove.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092142-decoyglove.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The decoy</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Decoy Glove (7,500 bolts) Ammo: 20 Decoys</b></li></ul><p>The <b>Decoy Glove</b> creates an inflatable copy of Ratchet that fooled enemies into attacking the wrong lombax, offering time for strategy. The weapon was invented by Gadgetron.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092146-no5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092146\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75853350189633\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092146-no5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092146\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092146-no5.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092146-no5.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Like this, exept the balls dont try to kill you.</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Drone Device (7,500 bolts) Ammo: 10 Drones</b></li></ul><p>When activated, it released six hovering bots that protected the user from incoming attacks or enemies. Once equipped, these bots would circle around Ratchet, and would take any damage he would have otherwise sustained. Other weapons and gadgets could be equipped while the bots were there, but they would disappear if Ratchet entered his ship or left the planet.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092144-rcteslaclaw.jpeg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092144\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092144-rcteslaclaw.jpeg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092144\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092144-rcteslaclaw.jpeg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092144-rcteslaclaw.jpeg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Tesla Claw</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Tesla Claw (40,000 bolts) Ammo: 240 Charges</b></li></ul><p>A powerful Gadgetron weapon which could be purchased once Ratchet first visited Oltanis. It shot out a constant stream of electricity at enemies, and was most effective against large numbers of small enemies, or a few stronger ones. Its name was a homage to Nikola Tesla. Also a weapon that is incredibly effective against bosses, especially the final boss.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092145-rcmorth_o_ray.jpeg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092145\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1092145-rcmorth_o_ray.jpeg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1092145\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092145-rcmorth_o_ray.jpeg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1092145-rcmorth_o_ray.jpeg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Morph-O-Ray</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>Morph-o-Ray (Free)</b></li></ul><p>Gadgetron's failed attempt to create a disintegration ray. Their failed result emanated a colorful ray that turned enemies into chickens. The chickens could then be hit to attain bolts.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1078045-ryno.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1078045\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1717/1078045-ryno.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1078045\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1078045-ryno.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1717/1078045-ryno.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The R.Y.N.O</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>R.Y.N.O. (150,000 bolts) Ammo: 50 Missiles</b></li></ul><p>The first Generation of RYNO technology, the R.Y.N.O (Rip Ya a New One) was available from the shady salesman in Blackwater city for 150,000 bolts.</p><p>Originally manufactured by the Blarg, as the ultimate in tactical offensive weaponry, but then banned in the galaxy for its extreme power, the R.Y.N.O. is only available from black market vendors. Featuring high-capacity, rapid-fire, auto-tracking missiles, this weapon was simply deemed too dangerous for civilian use.</p><h2>Gadgets</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248202-rnc_swingshot.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248202\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.9\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:90.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248202-rnc_swingshot.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248202\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248202-rnc_swingshot.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248202-rnc_swingshot.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Swingshot</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Swingshot (1,000 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>Available after completing Captain Qwark's fitness course on the planet Kerwan, this gadget fires hooks at Versa-Targets, allowing Ratchet to swing across gaps which he normally couldn't jump across. One of the most commonly used gadgets, and the only gadget in the Ratchet and Clank franchise that has appeared in every game.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248205-rnc_heli_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248205\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.97\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:97.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248205-rnc_heli_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248205\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248205-rnc_heli_pack.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248205-rnc_heli_pack.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>T he Heli-Pack</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Heli-Pack (1,000 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>Also acquired on planet Kerwan, the heli-pack gave Ratchet a lot more moves to use for his platforming needs, including the high jump, a boost giving Ratchet upward momentum only, the stretch jump, which launches Ratchet forwards and slightly upwards. It also had the ability to glide, making Ratchet fall at a lower speed, allowing him to glide across large distances.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248220-rnc_thruster_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248220\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.895\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:89.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248220-rnc_thruster_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248220\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248220-rnc_thruster_pack.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248220-rnc_thruster_pack.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Thruster-Pack</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Thruster-Pack (2,000 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>Acquired on planet Pokitaru, the Thruster-Pack is essentially the same as the Heli-Pack, but adds two new functions: The ability to Power Slam, which is a stomping move used to push buttons on the ground and the ability to hover, which is the only way to strafe in the first Ratchet and Clank game. The Thruster-Pack's Stretch Jump and High Jump are however slightly weaker than the Heli-pack's moves.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248263-rnc_hydro_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248263\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.92\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:92.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248263-rnc_hydro_pack.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248263\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248263-rnc_hydro_pack.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248263-rnc_hydro_pack.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>T he Hydro-Pack</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Hydro-Pack (2,000 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>Acquired on planet Hoven, the hydro-pack differs largely from the other backpack gadgets. It's only function is to increase Ratchet's speed underwater, which is not to say that it doesn't have many uses. It allows Ratchet to swim up against streams in the water, granting access to a few secret areas. It also made some timed underwater events possible to complete, such as the one found on planet Rilgar.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248268-rnc_trespasser_1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248268\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.74149659863946\" data-width=\"147\" style=\"width: 147px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248268-rnc_trespasser_1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248268\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248268-rnc_trespasser_1.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248268-rnc_trespasser_1.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Trespasser</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Trespasser</b></li></ul><p>Found on planet Aridia, the Trespasser allows Ratchet to hack invinco-locks. Invinco-locks consist of a small puzzle that Ratchet must solve by moving around 3 different circles that contain some items sending out beams of light, and some that can block beams of light. The objective is to get the beams of light to point into the indicated targets.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248278-rnc_hydrodisplacer.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248278\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.752\" data-width=\"250\" style=\"width: 250px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248278-rnc_hydrodisplacer.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248278\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248278-rnc_hydrodisplacer.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248278-rnc_hydrodisplacer.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Hydrodisplacer</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Hydrodisplacer</b></li></ul><p>Found by Clank at the Blarg Tactical Research Station, the Hydrodisplacer can drain and fill pools of water through stations located on walls near the pool.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248280-rnc_metal_detector.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248280\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75510204081633\" data-width=\"147\" style=\"width: 147px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248280-rnc_metal_detector.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248280\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248280-rnc_metal_detector.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248280-rnc_metal_detector.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Metal Detector</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Metal Detector</b></li></ul><p>This device can detect underground bolts and suck them up, providing Ratchet with additional income. It creates white-red beams depending on proximity to the bolts, becoming more and more red the closer to the bolts Ratchet is.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248283-rnc_pda.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248283\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.73\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:73.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248283-rnc_pda.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248283\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248283-rnc_pda.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248283-rnc_pda.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Gadgetron PDA</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Gadgetron Personal Delivery Assistant</b></li></ul><p>Given to Ratchet by Gadgetron seller \"Steve McQwark\", the Gadgetron Personal Delivery Assistant allows Ratchet to bring up the vendor interface anywhere in the world to resupply ammo and buy new weapons.</p><ul><li><b>The Hologuise</b></li></ul><p>The Hologuise allows Ratchet to disguise as a Sentrybot, allowing him to walk past some robotic units in the game unharmed. It is the only way to complete certain levels, such as planet Quartu. (Picture needed)</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248295-180px_grind_boots.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248295\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.93888888888889\" data-width=\"180\" style=\"width: 180px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248295-180px_grind_boots.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248295\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248295-180px_grind_boots.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248295-180px_grind_boots.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Grind Boots</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Grind Boots (2,000 bolts)</b></li></ul><p>The grind boots are bought from a gadget engineer named Fred at a discount after saving his life. The grindboots allow Ratchet to slide across various surfaces, such as grindrails and train lines.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248307-rnc_magnet_boots.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248307\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248307-rnc_magnet_boots.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248307\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248307-rnc_magnet_boots.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248307-rnc_magnet_boots.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Magnet Boots</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Magnet Boots</b></li></ul><p>The Magnet Boots are found by Clank on planet Orxon, and allow Ratchet to climb walls and hang upside down on some surfaces, generally ventilation shafts. Since all of Ratchet's weapons are made of metal, he may only use the wrench while using the Magnet Boots, because the wrench has a magnetic field of its own. This makes Ratchet swing the wrench in a higher position while wearing the Magnet Boots. He also may not jump while using the boots.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248317-rnc_sonic_summoner.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248317\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.73484848484848\" data-width=\"132\" style=\"width: 132px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:73.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248317-rnc_sonic_summoner.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248317\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248317-rnc_sonic_summoner.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248317-rnc_sonic_summoner.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Sonic Summoner</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Sonic Summoner</b></li></ul><p>Acquired by trading the Blackwater City Hoverboard Race Prize with Skid's Agent on planet Aridia, the Sonic Summoner attracts Sandmice from nearby Sandmouse houses. The Sandmice will hover around Ratchet for a while, attacking nearby enemies.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/72094/1248323-rnc_pilots_helmet.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1248323\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.2781954887218\" data-width=\"133\" style=\"width: 133px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:127.8%\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248323-rnc_pilots_helmet.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/7/72094/1248323-rnc_pilots_helmet.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Pilot's Helmet</figcaption></figure><ul><li><b>The Pilot's Helmet</b></li></ul><p>Found on Planet Gaspar, the Pilot Helmet allows Ratchet to use his ship in aerial dogfights against enemy ships on Pokitaru, outside the Gemlik Base and to take out the defenses at Drek's Fleet.</p><ul><li><b>The O2 Mask</b></li></ul><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/24/249943/2672976-6845123990-02mas.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2672976\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.0967741935484\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2672976\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/24/249943/2672976-6845123990-02mas.jpg\" helping the Jowai Resort owner on Pokitaru out. The O2 Mask provides Ratchet with Oxygen, which Lombaxes need to survive. It allows Ratchet to stay underwater for an infinite amount of time. It also allows him to survive in poisonous atmospheres such as the one found on Orxon. It also allows him to be in places where there is no Oxygen, such as outer space.</p>", "deck": "Ratchet &amp; Clank is a platformer adventure game that follows two heroes, Ratchet and Clank, on their {"duration": "1:30:00", "runner": "zorlaxseven", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-links-awakening-dx/3030-8881/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/107492/2132422-zelda_title.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2132422\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.9\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:90.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/107492/2132422-zelda_title.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2132422\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/10/107492/2132422-zelda_title.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Title Screen</figcaption></figure><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX is an enhanced re-release of <a href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-links-awakening/3030-3645\" data-ref-id=\"3030-3645\">The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening</a>. The game was released for the <a href=\"/game-boy-color/3045-57\" data-ref-id=\"3045-57\">Game Boy Color</a> in 1998 and features <a href=\"/link/3005-191\" data-ref-id=\"3005-191\">Link</a> getting stranded on <a href=\"/koholint-island/3035-166\" data-ref-id=\"3035-166\">Koholint Island</a> where he discovers that he must awaken the <a href=\"/wind-fish/3005-3501\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3501\">Wind Fish</a> if he ever wants to go home.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">In order to awaken the Wind Fish and get off of Koholint Island, Link has to battle his way through eight dungeons and collect eight Instruments of the Sirens. In each temple there are many enemies, one or more sub-bosses and one main boss (in this game called Nightmares); each Nightmare can be defeated with the aid of a specific item located in the associated dungeon.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">When Link has acquired all the instruments, he must climb up to the peak of Tal Tal Mountain and play the \"Ballad of the Wind Fish\" in order to awaken the Wind Fish.</p><h2>Version Differences</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/107492/2132427-zeldaawake_5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2132427\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.89655172413793\" data-width=\"319\" style=\"width: 319px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:89.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/107492/2132427-zeldaawake_5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2132427\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/10/107492/2132427-zeldaawake_5.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The new color dungeon.</figcaption></figure><ul><li>The cartridge is black instead of grey signifying that it is compatible with both the original <a href=\"/game-boy/3045-3\" data-ref-id=\"3045-3\">Game Boy</a> and the <a href=\"/game-boy-color/3045-57\" data-ref-id=\"3045-57\">Game Boy Color</a>.</li><li>A color palette has been added.</li><li>A new dungeon that uses color-based puzzles has been added. If the game is being played on the original Game Boy, two skeleton guards will block the player from entering.</li><li>The Photo Shop and the photography <a href=\"/side-quests/3015-338\" data-ref-id=\"3015-338\">side quest</a> have been added.</li><li>The title screen has been changed; the Wind Fish's Egg is now surrounded by clouds.</li><li>The Stone Slabs and Stone Slab Fragments in dungeons have been replaced by Owl Statues and Stone Beaks. This allows multiple statues (and therefore hints) in a single dungeon.</li><li>The Start Menu has been altered to show the different tunics if the Select button is pressed.</li><li>The secret ending has been changed; it now shows a portrait of <a href=\"/marin/3005-18827\" data-ref-id=\"3005-18827\">Marin</a> changing into a seagull instead of her <a href=\"/sprite/3015-491\" data-ref-id=\"3015-491\">sprite</a> flying across the screen with wings.</li><li>A <a href=\"/super-game-boy-enhancement/3015-4804\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4804\">Super Game Boy</a> background has been added.</li><li>Additional dialogue has been added, such as when the player obtains the Seashell Sword or the second boss giving a more specific hint as to his weakness.</li><li>The genie boss now throws his fireballs more slowly.</li><li>The hint for the second dungeon has been rewritten so it describes the enemies rather than name them. The hint, as originally written, named the enemies, but these names were only included in the Japanese manual and not in any other version.</li><li>Players can no longer skip all of a character's dialogue by pressing the B button.</li><li>Fade in/out effects are less exaggerated, such as using a bomb or a dungeon warp.</li><li>The Select screen jump <a href=\"/glitch/3015-511\" data-ref-id=\"3015-511\">glitch</a> no longer works.</li></ul><h2>The Photo Shop</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">One of the major additions to The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX is the photo shop side quest. In northern Ukuku Prairie is the photo shop, where Link can have his photo taken. Once this has happened, the photo will be placed in the player's very own photo album, entitled \"The Travels of Link.\" From then on the photographer will appear to take photos of various events throughout the game, each of which will be added to the album. These photographs can then be printed off using the Game Boy Printer.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">There are a total of thirteen photographs in the game, however only twelve can be collected in a given playthrough as the first photograph contains a choice depending on whether or not Link is a willing participant in the photograph. As some of the photographs are of specific scripted events or have specific prerequisites, they can be missed entirely if the player has not obtained the photo album yet, e.g. the photo of Link opening the gate to Kanalet Castle.</p><h2>Virtual Console release</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">On 7th/8th May 2011 (the year of Zelda's 25th anniversary), Link's Awakening DX was released on the 3DS <a href=\"/3dsware/3045-138\" data-ref-id=\"3045-138\">eshop</a> as part of it's <a href=\"/virtual-console/3015-2925\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2925\">Virtual Console</a> line-up. As with all Virtual Console releases, this is an exact, complete version of the original cart with no added content or 3D enhancements (though the Game Boy Printer is not compatible with this version). As with all Virtual Console titles, the player has the ability to create restore points when quitting the game, allowing the player to begin right from where they left off at the start of the next play session. Link's Awakening DX is priced at $5.99 in the US, \u00a35.40 in the UK and $9 in AU.</p>", "deck": "The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening DX is a 1998 remake of the 1993 Game Boy game.
