{"duration": "2:20:00", "runner": "Zmaster91", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/the-legend-of-zelda-four-swords-adventures/3030-7856/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p><i>The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Adventures</i>, first released in Japan as <i>The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords</i>, is an action-adventure game in <a data-ref-id=\"3010-90\" href=\"/nintendo/3010-90\" slug=\"nintendo\">Nintendo's</a> The <a data-ref-id=\"3025-9\" href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda/3025-9\" slug=\"the-legend-of-zelda\">Legend of Zelda</a> series. Four Sword Adventures was released for the Nintendo <a data-ref-id=\"3045-23\" href=\"/gamecube/3045-23\" slug=\"gamecube\">Gamecube</a> in Japan on March 18, 2004 and in North American on June 7, 2004. The <a data-ref-id=\"3045-4\" href=\"/game-boy-advance/3045-4\" slug=\"game-boy-advance\">Game Boy Advance</a> can be used as a controller when using the Nintendo GameCube Game Boy Advance Cable bundled in the North America game version. Graphically the game looks similar to the original <a data-ref-id=\"3030-35064\" href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-to-the-past-four-swords/3030-35064\" slug=\"the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-to-the-past-four-swords\">Four Swords game</a> which previously appeared on the Game Boy Advance and drew a lot of inspiration from <a data-ref-id=\"3030-10276\" href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-to-the-past/3030-10276\" slug=\"the-legend-of-zelda-a-link-to-the-past\">A Link To The Past</a> but with added <a data-ref-id=\"3030-18508\" href=\"/the-legend-of-zelda-the-wind-waker/3030-18508\" slug=\"the-legend-of-zelda-the-wind-waker\">Wind Waker</a> effects. The game follows the tried and tested formula of other games in the franchise with familiar enemies, items and bosses popping up along the way.</p><h2>Hyrulean Adventure</h2><p>Hyrulean Adventure is the main story mode of the game and it follows the adventures of Link after he has been split into fours. The game can be played in single-player with either the Game Boy Advance or Gamecube controller or with up to four players using the Game Boy Advance only. In single player you take control of the green link and the way you control all four is by selecting different Unit <a data-ref-id=\"3015-1433\" href=\"/unit-formations/3015-1433\" slug=\"unit-formations\">Formations</a>, to solve puzzles or have the Links take turns fighting enemies. In multiplayer each player takes control of one of the different links (green, red, blue, purple) separately. When playing using a Game Boy Advance the action will swap between the screen and the handheld, allowing for you to search areas independently without the other players. The player must battle enemies and work together with the other Links to collect enough force gems and solve puzzles, certain enemies will change colour so that only the corresponding Link can do damage. In this game the player can only carry one item at a time, at certain points in the game different Links will need to be carrying different items. Through the duration of each stage it is required that you collect enough force gems to power up the four sword and you will not be able to complete the stage until you have done this. At certain points in the game you will find a <a data-ref-id=\"3055-4912\" href=\"/moon-pearl/3055-4912\" slug=\"moon-pearl\">Moon Pearl</a> which will allow you to travel to the dark world which is represented on your Game Boy Advance screen and is required to advance in some situations. The story consists of eight worlds each with 3 stages and a boss fight to complete at the end.</p><p>In multiplayer mode you can also access the Tingle Tower from the hub world, within this you can complete against the other players in competitive mini-games. There are eight different mini-games to play, you unlock mini-games by completing the second stage of each world. Mini-games range from horse racing to <a data-ref-id=\"3015-6079\" href=\"/cucco/3015-6079\" slug=\"cucco\">cucco</a> wrangling. The multiplayer has become famous in some circles for the griefing that can be caused, players can pick up other players and throw them off cliffs or use bombs and fire to kill other players and steal their <a data-ref-id=\"3055-44\" href=\"/rupee/3055-44\" slug=\"rupee\">rupees</a>. At the end of each stage the game rates each player on his performance from first place to fourth place judging them on things such as force gems collected, enemies defeated, lives lost. In addition to this the players are forced to vote on things such as the most helpful player and the most troublesome player in what is the only incentive to prevent you from throwing little Jimmy down a canyon and hogging all the best items.</p><h3>Tingles Tower Mini-games</h3><p>The winner of a mini-game in the tower will be rewarded with a force fairy. Tingle will reward the winner of the game and also the player who collects the most force gems, if one player wins and collects the most force gems then he alone gets rewarded.</p><ol><li>World 1 - Bucking Bronco - A straightforward horse race against the other players.</li><li>World 2 - Cucco Wrangling - In this mini-game the player must catch as many cucco's as possible and throw them into the pen before the time expires.</li><li>World 3 - Hammer Tag - In this game one of the players will randomly be \"on\" and must try and make the other players \"on\" by hitting them with his hammer. In this game you can travel between the dark and light world and if you are the player that is \"on\" you will move faster than all the other Link's.</li><li>World 4 - Monster Hunting - The player who can defeat the most enemies within the time limit wins the game.</li><li>World 5 - Volley, by Golly World - In this game the players play volley ball but you can only hit the ball when the colour corresponds to you.</li><li>6 - Mole Melee - A twist on whack-a-mole where only the designated Link's can hit the corresponding moles.</li><li>World 7 - Monster Hunting Returns - The only upgraded event that is in the tower, in this version there is more enemies and they are harder to kill.</li><li>World 8 - Bonus Level - The last mini-game is a mini dungeon for the players to complete.</li></ol><h2>Shadow Battle</h2><p>Shadow battle is the true competitive mode of Four Sword Adventures, using the Game Boy Advance as a controller two to four players can battle it out as the different coloured Links until only one is left standing. If the time expires and there is more than one link left alive then the match is declared a draw. You can change some of the settings before you battle, for example setting handicaps, turning items off and if you select \"<a data-ref-id=\"3005-852\" href=\"/vaati/3005-852\" slug=\"vaati\">Vaati</a>\" he will appear at the end of the game and throw a giant bomb onto the map. There are 5 different maps for you to choose from in the shadow battle mode and once you have completed the Hyrulean Adventure once it will unlock the dark world versions of these maps. Throughout the battle orbs will appear with items in them for the players to use.</p><h3>Shadow Battle Arena's</h3><p>There are five area's to do battle on in the Shadow Battle mode, after you complete the game the game it will unlock dark world versions of the same arena's.</p><ol><li>The Field - This stage is a grassy stage with a house in the middle. Players have to watch out for traps and hidden objects.</li><li>The Tower of Flames - The main feature of this stage is the lava in the middle which can harm the players.</li><li>Hyrule Castle - A stage in front of Hyrule castle, there are enemies patrolling outside in the light world but you can find items to use in the dark world.</li><li>Tower of the Wind - On this stage players can hide in the dark world and operate switches to drop bombs onto the light world.</li><li>Above the Clouds - On this stage there is a rotating flame jet that will harm the players, there is a lever on the stage that the players can use to change the direction the flames are travelling.</li></ol><h2><b>Story</b></h2><p>The game takes place an undetermined amount of time after the events of four swords. The game begins on a dark night with a stormy cloud and dark feeling covering all of Hyrule, sending people into panic. <a data-ref-id=\"3005-5\" href=\"/zelda/3005-5\" slug=\"zelda\">Zelda</a> calls upon Link, and sends him to check on the <a data-ref-id=\"3055-4909\" href=\"/four-sword/3055-4909\" slug=\"four-sword\">Four Sword</a>, believing that Vaati has escaped. Zelda then journey's to a temple and calls upon the six maidens to open a portal to the Four Swords Sanctuary. Once the portal was opened, a dark figure of Link appears and seals away the six maidens. Link decides to follow after the dark figure and takes the Four Sword, when he does Vaati is released and Link is split into four. The four links are awoke by <a href=\"http://zeldawiki.org/Kaepora%20Gaebora\" rel=\"nofollow\">Kaepora Gaebora</a> , who informs them they must destroy the dark Link, rescue the maidens and Princess Zelda and seal Vaati away once again.</p>", "deck": "Create four-player mayhem to either vanquish the evil hordes of Vaati, or to blast each other into submission using the GBA link cable. ", "aliases": "The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords+\nThe Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Plus\nZelda no Densetsu: 4tsu no Tsurugi+\nZelda no Densetsu: Yottsu no Tsurugi+\n\u30bc\u30eb\u30c0\u306e\u4f1d\u8aac\u30004\u3064\u306e\u5263+", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/8/82063/2593599-fsaclean.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2014-01-22 13:15:49", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-7856/", "number_of_user_reviews": 6, "original_release_date": "2004-06-07 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-6/", "id": 6, "name": "ESRB: E"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-7/", "id": 7, "name": "PEGI: 3+"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-19/", "id": 19, "name": "CERO: All Ages"}], "date_added": "2008-04-01 15:43:50", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-23/", "abbreviation": "GCN", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/gamecube/3045-23/", "id": 23, "name": "GameCube"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 7856, "resource_type": "game", "name": "The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Adventures"}, "platform": "Wii", "title": "The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Adventures"}
{"duration": "0:50:00", "runner": "Blood_Thunder", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/bioshock/3030-17280/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/24/10800-levine9.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-10800\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 425px\" data-ratio=\"0.64941176470588\" data-width=\"425\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:64.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/24/10800-levine9.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-10800\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/24/10800-levine9.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>No Gods or Kings. Only Man.</figcaption></figure><p>Bioshock is inspired by themes in Ayn Rand's novel <i>Atlas Shrugged</i>. At the time of it's release, Bioshock was lauded by critics for its peerless storytelling and fascinating story. To enhance the story beyond what is directly experienced by the player, Bioshock uses <a href=\"/audio-logs/3015-2038\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2038\">audio diaries</a>. These diaries follow different characters through the rise and fall of the city of <a href=\"/rapture/3035-66\" data-ref-id=\"3035-66\">Rapture</a>. At times, ghosts will also appear in the city showing very brief fragments of the actions of certain citizens of Rapture. Bioshock is also well known for not taking player control away during scripted events, allowing the player to experience literally everything through the eyes of the protagonist.</p><p>The player does not directly see any of the coup of Rapture in BioShock, instead arriving sometime afterward in the year 1960, discovering a desolate city filled with insane, drug-addled citizens. The player hears about Rapture's golden era--and the events that led to its demise--through a series of audio logs that serve as diary entries for the past inhabitants of the city. Touted by <a href=\"/2k-games/3010-360\" data-ref-id=\"3010-360\">2K</a> as an \"FPS-RPG\" and a \" <a href=\"/spiritual-successor/3015-425\" data-ref-id=\"3015-425\">spiritual sequel</a>\" to <a href=\"/2k-boston/3010-4951\" data-ref-id=\"3010-4951\">Irrational's</a> highly revered <a href=\"/system-shock-2/3030-8870\" data-ref-id=\"3030-8870\">System Shock 2</a>, it has gameplay similarities to both <a href=\"/system-shock/3025-313\" data-ref-id=\"3025-313\">System Shock</a> games as well as <a href=\"/deus-ex/3030-17533\" data-ref-id=\"3030-17533\">Deus Ex</a>. It is possibly an indictment of the current gaming generation that BioShock has been lauded as such an original game, when in fact it copies so many structural elements from said predecessors' gameplay (such as non-linear player-character development, moral choice in plot progression, immersive setting and story).</p><p>To its credit, however, BioShock is more of an exploration-focused <a href=\"/first-person/3015-330\" data-ref-id=\"3015-330\">first-person</a> shooter that makes streamlined, simplified use of some of its predecessors' mechanics, such as the use of audio logs as a storytelling device, a hacking <a href=\"/minigames/3015-116\" data-ref-id=\"3015-116\">minigame</a> (reminiscent of the classic puzzler <a href=\"/pipe-dream/3030-2779\" data-ref-id=\"3030-2779\">Pipe Dream</a>), and special abilities. While being primarily built on <a href=\"/unreal-engine-25/3015-992\" data-ref-id=\"3015-992\">Unreal Engine 2.5</a>, BioShock is also one of the first games to be produced using features from <a href=\"/epic-games/3010-149\" data-ref-id=\"3010-149\">Epic's</a> <a href=\"/unreal-engine-3/3015-86\" data-ref-id=\"3015-86\">Unreal Engine 3</a> and appeared on both the <a href=\"/xbox-360/3045-20\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a> and the <a href=\"/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a>. On October 17, 2008 Bioshock was released for the <a href=\"/playstation-3/3045-35\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a>. This version of the game features a new 'Survivor' difficulty mode as well as other in-game add-on content. Downloadable \"challenge rooms\" are also available; these put the player in a race against the clock while working through brief, <a href=\"/puzzles/3015-932\" data-ref-id=\"3015-932\">puzzle-oriented</a> levels. The Playstation 3 version ships with Trophy Support, just as the Xbox 360 version, of course, contains <a href=\"/achievements/3015-29\" data-ref-id=\"3015-29\">Achievements</a>.</p><h2>Plot</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/927235-screenshot_27_xl.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-927235\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/927235-screenshot_27_xl.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-927235\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/7465/927235-screenshot_27_xl.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Welcome to Rapture.</figcaption></figure><p>Set in 1960, BioShock begins with a plane crash, with the player character, named <a href=\"/jack/3005-4149\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4149\">Jack</a>, being the only survivor. The player takes refuge in a lone lighthouse in the middle of the ocean. A <a href=\"/bathysphere/3055-719\" data-ref-id=\"3055-719\">bathysphere</a> leads down into the bowels of the <a href=\"/underwater/3035-719\" data-ref-id=\"3035-719\">underwater</a> city of <a href=\"/rapture/3035-66\" data-ref-id=\"3035-66\">Rapture</a>. A message from the city's creator, <a href=\"/andrew-ryan/3005-424\" data-ref-id=\"3005-424\">Andrew Ryan</a>, talks of his vision for Rapture, a utopia without ethical or moral barriers. However, from the looks of things, Ryan has failed in realizing his vision.</p><p>A man named <a href=\"/atlas/3005-925\" data-ref-id=\"3005-925\">Atlas</a> contacts Jack in the bathysphere and helps to lead him through the city, which is filled with genetically modified <a href=\"/splicers/3015-647\" data-ref-id=\"3015-647\">Splicers</a>, <a href=\"/little-sisters/3015-1111\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1111\">Little Sisters</a>, and their guardians, the <a href=\"/big-daddy/3015-624\" data-ref-id=\"3015-624\">Big Daddies</a>. Atlas also tells Jack about <a href=\"/adam/3015-43\" data-ref-id=\"3015-43\">ADAM</a>, stem cells harvested to enhance the abilities of the human body. The abuse of ADAM has driven the Splicers mad and the material is what the Little Sisters constantly search for throughout Rapture.</p><p>Atlas instructs Jack to kill the Little Sisters and take the ADAM from them in order to use special abilities called <a href=\"/plasmid/3055-24\" data-ref-id=\"3055-24\">Plasmids</a>. However, another ally in Rapture, <a href=\"/bridgette-tenenbaum/3005-1072\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1072\">Dr. Tenenbaum</a>, tells Jack to save the Little Sisters and promises to reward him if he obeys.</p><p>Atlas soon tells Jack of his wife and child, who are hiding from Splicers in a submarine. When Jack reaches them, however, Andrew Ryan destroys it, supposedly killing Atlas' family. Atlas, enraged, asks Jack to kill Andrew Ryan.</p><p>Jack reaches Andrew Ryan, who reveals that Jack is actually his son and was born in Rapture two years prior. Genetic modification allowed for him to age rapidly. One of Rapture's pioneers, <a href=\"/atlas/3005-925\" data-ref-id=\"3005-925\">Frank Fontaine</a>, \"programmed\" Jack to obey any order uttered with the phrase \"Would you kindly\", a phrase that Atlas has repeated many times. Jack was the one who crashed the plane and was brought to Rapture on purpose, with the goal of killing Andrew Ryan.</p><p>Ryan orders Jack to kill him, using the phrase \"Would you kindly.\" Forced to obey, Jack kills Ryan with a golf club. Shortly after, Atlas reveals himself to be Frank Fontaine and leaves Jack to die in the city. Dr. Tenenbaum saves him, though, and deactivates the \"Would you kindly\" trigger phrase control Fontaine has over him. Jack then proceeds to Olympus Heights and finds Lot 192 which reverses a heart stopping mental control Fontaine was attempting to kill Jack with. Tenenbaum then instructs Jack to don a Big Daddy suit so the Little Sisters can lead him to Fontaine. When he reaches him, Fontaine, pumped up by massive quantities of ADAM, has acquired almost superhuman abilities.</p><p>Upon defeating Fontaine, three endings are possible. If the player rescues all the Little Sisters, the game ends with Jack and the Little Sisters leaving Rapture and the girls growing up to live their lives. If the player harvested two or more, but not all the Little Sisters, Jack kills the Little Sisters and takes their ADAM. If the player harvests all of the Little Sisters, the same ending is shown but with Tenenbaum's narration being angrier.</p><h2>Weapons</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/102336-25.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-102336\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0\" data-width=\"0\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a  href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/102336-25.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-102336\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/102336-25.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/102336-25.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Gunning it with a Big Daddy.</figcaption></figure><p>The game features an array of traditional weapons that can be acquired throughout the game. The player carries all of the weapons at once, so all of the weapons are available at any time. Each weapon can be upgraded twice, using special kiosks called \" <a href=\"/power-to-the-people/3055-930\" data-ref-id=\"3055-930\">Power to the People</a>\" machines. Each weapon can also carry three types of <a href=\"/ammo/3055-533\" data-ref-id=\"3055-533\">ammunition</a>. The weapons in the game are as follows:</p><ul><li><a href=\"/wrench/3055-147\" data-ref-id=\"3055-147\">Wrench</a>: A simple melee weapon acquired at the beginning of the game.</li><li><a href=\"/pistol/3055-59\" data-ref-id=\"3055-59\">Pistol</a>: A standard six-shooter, it is the first firearm acquired.</li><li><a href=\"/machine-gun/3055-608\" data-ref-id=\"3055-608\">Machine Gun</a>: An automatic weapon that holds a large number of bullets.</li><li><a href=\"/shotgun/3055-114\" data-ref-id=\"3055-114\">Shotgun</a>: A close-range weapon that packs quite a punch.</li><li><a href=\"/grenade-launcher/3055-252\" data-ref-id=\"3055-252\">Grenade Launcher</a>: A large weapon that can be upgraded to fire different kinds of explosives such as heat seeking rpgs.</li><li><a href=\"http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P9G9NSfKlus\" rel=\"nofollow\">Chemical Thrower</a>: A device that fires various substances like napalm, liquid nitrogen, and electrical gel.</li><li><a href=\"/crossbow/3055-107\" data-ref-id=\"3055-107\">Crossbow</a>: A long-range weapon best used against single opponents.</li><li><a href=\"/camera/3055-247\" data-ref-id=\"3055-247\">Research Camera</a>: This \"weapon\" allows the player to research various enemies and gain bonuses on damage and acquire various tonics.</li></ul><h3>Weapon Upgrades</h3><p>Weapons are upgraded at Power To The People machines. The machine shuts down after one upgrade has been applied. The upgrades do not cost anything and also cause cosmetic changes to the weapons in addition to the listed effects. The wrench is the only weapon that cannot be upgraded at a Power To The People machine.</p><p><b>Pistols</b></p><ul><li>Increased Damage</li><li>Increased Clip Size</li></ul><p><b>Machine Gun</b></p><ul><li>Increased Damage</li><li>Decreased Recoil</li></ul><p><b>Shotgun</b></p><ul><li>Increased Damage</li><li>Increased Rate of Fire</li></ul><p><b>Grenade Launcher</b></p><ul><li>Increased Damage</li><li>Immune to Damage self-fired Grenades</li></ul><p><b>Crossbow</b></p><ul><li>Bolt Breakage Chance Reduced</li><li>Increased Damage</li></ul><p><b>Chemical Thrower</b></p><ul><li>Decreased Chemical Consumption</li><li>Increased Range</li></ul><h2>Key Characters</h2><p>This is a list of the characters who either have major roles in Bioshock or encounter the player at some point in the story.</p><ul><li><b><a href=\"/jack/3005-4149\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4149\">Jack</a>:</b> The silent protagonist of Bioshock. He survives a plane crash and stumbles upon Rapture. Early on, Jack gains the ability to use Plasmids (his first one being the Electro Bolt).</li><li><b><a href=\"/andrew-ryan/3005-424\" data-ref-id=\"3005-424\">Andrew Ryan</a>:</b> The founder of Rapture. Andrew Ryan is an antagonist in Bioshock and he taunts Jack throughout the game.</li><li><b><a href=\"/atlas/3005-925\" data-ref-id=\"3005-925\">Atlas</a>:</b> Jack's mentor and guide in Rapture. Atlas gives Jack instructions and helps for a majority of the game.</li><li><b><a href=\"/brigid-tenenbaum/3005-1072\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1072\">Tenenbaum</a>:</b> A German scientist who helped develop ADAM. She wishes to protect the Little Sisters and urges the player to do so.</li><li><b><a href=\"/js-steinman/3005-1080\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1080\">Doctor Steinman</a>:</b> A doctor who's gone insane with his obsession with perfection. He performs surgery on people to make them physically perfect, yet his insane obsession with his job drives him crazy and causes him to often perform unwanted surgeries on people to correct their \"imperfections\"; often these people die from being horribly mutilated.</li><li><b><a href=\"/peach-wilkins/3005-6311\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6311\">Peach Wilkins</a>:</b> A member of Frank Fontaine's smuggling business. He encounters Jack in Fontaine fisheries.</li><li><b><a href=\"/julie-langford/3005-19422\" data-ref-id=\"3005-19422\">Julie Langford</a>:</b> The scientist responsible for creating Arcadia, which is where she encounters Jack.</li><li><b><a href=\"/sander-cohen/3005-1262\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1262\">Sander Cohen</a>:</b> An artist who runs Fort Frolic in Rapture. He also produces theatrical performances for the city. When he encounters Jack, he makes him take pictures of his four disciples after they've been killed and mounts them as part of a masterpiece.</li></ul><h2>Hacking</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17172/1182918-bioshock.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1182918\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.595\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:59.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/17172/1182918-bioshock.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1182918\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/17172/1182918-bioshock.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/17172/1182918-bioshock.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Hacking in BioShock</figcaption></figure><p>Performing hacks on various machines in the game can make things a lot easier. Everything from security bots to safes can be hacked. Hacking machines can help you evade security systems, supply you with hidden items, and give you discounts on items at vending machines.</p><p><a href=\"/hacking/3015-1154\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1154\">Hacking</a> is done with the hacking mini-game, which is highly reminiscent of the classic computer game <a href=\"/pipe-dream/3030-2779\" data-ref-id=\"3030-2779\">Pipe Mania</a> (<i>Pipe Dream</i> in the United States). The goal is to successfully move fluid through a tube set on a grid of tiles from a starting location to and ending location, both of which are just outside the grid and, thus, not modifiable by the player. The player reveals pieces of the tube one at a time and may swaps tiles to continue the tube and keep the fluid moving. If the fluid is hindered in its progress either due to player error or by hitting certain tiles such as overload tiles and security tiles, the mini-game is failed and, depending on the gravity of the failure, security bots may be deployed to eliminate the player. An auto-hack tool can allow for a hack without using the mini-game. Hacking ability is greatly enhanced and simplified through the strategic equipment of certain engineering tonics. Also, the Winter Blast plasmid used on a machine just before hacking will slow the progress of the fluid considerably.</p><h2>Vending Machines / Kiosks</h2><p>Various <a href=\"/vending-machine/3055-200\" data-ref-id=\"3055-200\">vending machines</a> and kiosks are found throughout the game. The different types are as follows:</p><ul><li>Circus of Value: A place to purchase a variety of items. Ammo, first aid kits, and EVE Hypos are all available here.</li><li>Ammo Bandito: A vending machine that supplies ammunition.</li><li><a href=\"/gatherers-garden/3055-887\" data-ref-id=\"3055-887\">Gatherer's Garden</a>: This vending machine allows you to use collected ADAM to purchase Plasmids and Tonics.</li><li>Gene Bank: This machine allows you to customize your character, switching Plasmids and Tonics.</li><li><a href=\"/power-to-the-people/3055-930\" data-ref-id=\"3055-930\">Power to the People</a>: This machine allows you customize weapons. Each individual machine can only be used once.</li><li><a href=\"/u-invent/3055-921\" data-ref-id=\"3055-921\">U-Invent</a>: This machine allows you to combine different items to create more helpful ones.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/vita-chamber/3055-3386\" data-ref-id=\"3055-3386\"><b>Vita-Chambers</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5370/1271923-vita_chamber.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1271923\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:62.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5370/1271923-vita_chamber.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1271923\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5370/1271923-vita_chamber.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5370/1271923-vita_chamber.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Vita-Chamber</figcaption></figure><p>Whenever the player's HP reaches zero, they \"respawn\" at the nearest vita-chamber, large man-sized tubes scattered throughout Rapture. This only works with the main character Jack and the explanation to why it doesn't work for splicers is that it was in its testing phase when Rapture fell. Vita-Chambers serve as a <a href=\"/checkpoints/3015-292\" data-ref-id=\"3015-292\">checkpoint</a> of sorts, even though the game can also be saved at any time through the start menu. Unlike traditional checkpoints, enemies injured or killed since reaching the Vita-Chamber will remain so when the player is respawned. However, weapon ammunition will remain at the same level as when the player was killed and the player is also given only a fraction of his maximum health. Since there is seemingly no penalty for using Vita-Chambers many players have bemoaned this design decision for making the game too easy \u2014 given enough time and patience, a player wielding only the wrench can slog his or her way through even the toughest battles.</p><h3>Moral Choice</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6436/505710-bioshock2_0.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-505710\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 404px\" data-ratio=\"0.56188118811881\" data-width=\"404\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6436/505710-bioshock2_0.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-505710\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/6436/505710-bioshock2_0.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/6436/505710-bioshock2_0.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Little Sister</figcaption></figure><p>Near the beginning of the game, the player is given the choice of either harvesting the Little Sisters (effectively killing them) to gain a large amount of ADAM, or rescuing the Little Sisters for a significantly smaller amount of ADAM. Rescuing Little Sisters will, however, allow the player to access certain plasmids and Xbox 360 achievements unavailable through the \"evil\" method of play, and for each 3 that you rescue you will receive a gift from Dr. Tenenbaum. Depending on exactly how many Little Sisters you harvest or rescue, the game's ending is affected. If you save all the Little Sisters you get a one hundred point achievement.</p><h3>Security</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1836466-bioshock_security_camera.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1836466\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"1.4030769230769\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:140.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1836466-bioshock_security_camera.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1836466\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/11986/1836466-bioshock_security_camera.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/11986/1836466-bioshock_security_camera.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>A hostile security camera. Hacked cameras have a green light instead of red</figcaption></figure><p>Jack has to deal with the security of Rapture throughout Bioshock. The security force includes cameras, turrets, and flying bots called Security Bots. All three of these can either be destroyed or hacked by Jack to get them on his side. Hacked turrets and bots will automatically fire on enemies, and hacked cameras will target enemies and trigger the alarm against them (which causes a wave of bots to come flying in and attack them). In addition, there is a Plasmid called \"Security Bullseye\" that, when thrown onto an enemy, will cause cameras and turrets to target said enemy.</p><p>All three types of security forces can be temporarily disabled by zapping them with the Electro Bolt or Winter Blast plasmid. Turrets and bots must be hit with the Electro Bolt or Winter Blast before being hacked; security cameras do not.</p><h2>Development</h2><p>The original story for Bioshock was drastically different. It centered around a deprogrammer, someone who forces a person to abandon religious or social group allegiances. The main character's mission was to rescue someone from a cult and adjust them mentally to a regular life. However, the plot underwent significant changes by the time development on the game was announced in 2004. At that time, the game's setting was changed to a World War II-era underground laboratory. When the laboratory was uncovered by scientists in the 21st century, they discovered an ecosystem formed by the experiments in the lab.</p><p>The developers used a heavily modified version of the Unreal Engine 2.5. They also hired a water programmer and water artist to create the stunning water effects seen in the game. Bioshock also uses the Havok physics engine for more lifelike ragdoll effects.</p><h2>Plasmids</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556689-140px_plasmid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556689\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 140px\" data-ratio=\"1.4214285714286\" data-width=\"140\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:142.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556689-140px_plasmid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556689\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556689-140px_plasmid.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556689-140px_plasmid.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Open bottle for Plasmid</figcaption></figure><p>Plasmids change your character's genetic information and provide him with specific abilities. A substance called EVE is needed to use these abilities. EVE is found in hypodermic needles, called Hypos in the game. It is carried by the character and can be acquired from enemies and purchased from Circus of Value vending machines. Plasmids are both found throughout the game and bought from the <a href=\"/gatherers-garden/3055-887\" data-ref-id=\"3055-887\">Gatherer's Garden Kiosk</a>. The Plasmids in the game are as follows:</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Description</th><th>ADAM Cost</th><th>EVE Cost</th><th>Damage</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" Splicers</li></ul></td><td>60</td><td>30</td><td>N/A</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556678-60px_hipno.png\" enemies</li></ul><ul><li>Can also be used on turrets, cameras and bots to slow down the water for better hacking</li></ul><ul><li>Upgradeable to level 3</li></ul></td><td>1- 60<br />2- 100<br />3- blast of wind at enemies</li></ul><ul><li>Only available with DLC or game patch 1.1</li></ul></td><td>1</td><td>1- 90<br />2- 120</td><td>varies</td></tr></tbody></table><p><u><b>NOTE</b></u>: N/A means the item is either given to you by a Little Sisters or found somewhere on Rapture.</p><h2>Tonics</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556690-150px_combat_tonic.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556690\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 150px\" data-ratio=\"1.4066666666667\" data-width=\"150\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:140.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556690-150px_combat_tonic.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556690\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556690-150px_combat_tonic.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556690-150px_combat_tonic.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Combat Tonics have a Green glow</figcaption></figure><p>Tonics upgrade your character and his abilities. There are three types of Tonics (Combat, Engineering and Physical) and they can either be found scattered throughout the Rapture or bought at Vending Machines.</p><p>The Gene Bank machine is used to place tonics into whatever available slots you may have at the moment.</p><h3>Combat Tonics</h3><p>These Tonics work on the player's offensive and defensive capabilities.</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Tonic</th><th>ADAM Cost</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" damage against security devices</li><li>Only available with DLC or patch 1.1</li></ul></td><td>1</td></tr></tbody></table><p><u><b>NOTE</b></u>: N/A means the item is either given to you by a Little Sister, found somewhere on Rapture or gained through researching the Splicers with your Camera.</p><h3>Engineering Tonics</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" you by a Little Sister, found somewhere on Rapture or gained through researching the Splicers with your camera.</p><h3>Physical Tonics</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556709-150px_physical_tonic.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556709\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 150px\" data-ratio=\"1.4066666666667\" data-width=\"150\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:140.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556709-150px_physical_tonic.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556709\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556709-150px_physical_tonic.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1556709-150px_physical_tonic.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Physical Tonics have a Blue glow</figcaption></figure><p>These Tonics will interact with the player's physical and physiological properties, namely with his/her Health and EVE, making the player a tougher, harder enemy to kill.</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Tonic</th><th>ADAM Cost</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1556877-60px_bloodlust.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1556877\" data-size=\"small\" somewhere on Rapture or gained through researching the Splicers with your camera.</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1548629-the_bioshock_ep_back.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1548629\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/6/62890/1548629-the_bioshock_ep_back.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1548629\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/6/62890/1548629-the_bioshock_ep_back.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img Bioshock limited edition version is an EP comprising of 3 tracks with song remixes by Moby and Oscar the Punk. Although the EP's official name is Bioshock EP, it quickly became known as \"The Rapture EP\".</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Track No.</th><th>Song Title</th><th>Running Sisters</b></td><td>03.56</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Downloadable content:</h2><h3>Xbox 360:</h3><p>On Dec 4th, 2K games released a patch as well as Downloadable content for Xbox 360 fixing some known bugs and adding some features:</p><p><b>Patch/title update:</b></p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/30/793994-picture_1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-793994\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" FOV</li><li>Fix for rare case where a partial cache is not cleared</li><li>Increased Atlas\u2019 volume in German</li><li>Fix for GUI sounds not playing during heavy action</li><li>Fix for not being able to take picture of Cobb in Rec</li><li>Possible fix for pauses or hangs when opening flash Bink movies</li><li>Fix for switching difficulty breaking achievement</li><li>Fix for small texture streaming bug</li><li>Fix for rare hang when a lot of things are going on at once</li></ul><p><b>Downloadable content:</b></p><ul><li>Added Disable Vita Chamber option</li><li>Plasmid Pack is included in this DLC (Machine Buster 1 &amp; 2, Vending Expert 1 &amp; 2, Sonic Boom 1 &amp; 2, EVE Saver)</li><li>100 point achievement called \"Brass Balls\". A player will gain it after beating the game on Hard without using any Vita Chambers . The player can always roll back to an earlier save if a Vita Chamber was used. The Vita Chamber Disabled option can be on or off as long as the player doesn't resurrect. (Note:this is currently untrue if a vita chamber is used with vita chambers turned on then it corrupts all saves in that play through, vita chambers must be turned off to get the achievement or you must make sure never to die.)</li></ul><h3>PlayStation 3:</h3><p>The PlayStation 3 contains all the updates of the Xbox 360 version.</p><p><b>20th November 2008 patch:</b></p><ul><li>Enables Add On Content functionality for the <i>Challenge Rooms</i> and <i>New Game Plus</i> (Add-On Content required to use this functionality)</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where large blocky pixels would show up whenever viewing the Bouncer and Elite Bouncer variants of the Big Daddy. Also fixes various other texture pixelation including weapons.</li></ul><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/30/796275-sniper.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-796275\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/30/796275-sniper.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-796275\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/30/796275-sniper.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/30/796275-sniper.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>A battle in the challenge room</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Fix for an issue where white/discolored bars would show up at the right and bottom sides of the screen during the plane crash / water scene at the beginning of the game.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where Big Daddy would occasionally turn black after the player dies and is then resurrected.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where some fire particles would shrink every time they were retriggered.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where Big Daddies would gush abnormal amounts of blood after being killed by a critical hit while having more than 10% health (i.e., from another Big Daddy\u2019s gun).</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where the game would crash when PS button hit during hacking when vsync turned to off</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for a rare issue where the game would hang caused by a deadlock between the renderer, Havok, and the main game threads.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where reflective water would sometimes be rendered with incorrect fog colors.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where audio subtitles would occasionally not go away, even after the audio finished playing.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where menu sounds were too loud.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where the autosave message wasn\u2019t localized.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for several issues where localized strings were too long. This includes the \u2018Cannot Carry:\u2019 message, ammo name lengths, weapon name lengths, and the Location in Fisheries \u2018Upper Freezer\u2019.</li></ul><ul><li>Fix for an issue where the game would hang if the player dies while using a combination lock with the Vita-Chamber option off.</li></ul><p>The patch was released by accident on 13th of November 2008, but was quickly pulled off.</p><p><b>Downloadable content - Challenge Rooms:</b></p><p>The Challenge Rooms are three levels intended to test the knowledge and skills players have learned while playing through the main game.</p><ul><li><i>A Shocking Turn of Events</i> \u2013 A Little Sister is trapped atop a Ferris wheel in an undisclosed location in Rapture. Using only the tools and environment around them, players must use their wits to create electricity to power the Ferris wheel and bring the Little Sister to safety.</li><li><i>The I in Team</i> \u2013 Using limited resources, and an even more limited arsenal, players must negotiate traps and find a way to defeat a Big Daddy using their wits instead of raw firepower.</li><li><i>Worlds of Hurt</i> \u2013 Step up and take on the most grueling challenge offered in the world of Rapture. Players must battle through eight rooms of Big Daddies, Splicers and the worst that Rapture has to offer. Accumulate Adam, build an arsenal of Plasmids, Tonics and Weaponry, and fight through to rescue the Little Sister.</li></ul><p>In addition to these three Challenge Rooms, two other additions are included in the package.</p><ul><li>The Official Premium BioShock Theme.</li><li>A new feature, <i>New Game Plus</i>. This feature will give players who have beaten the main game the ability to start a new game with the character data (weapons, inventory, research, etc.) carried over from the end of the game (if you beat the game after the patch was installed) or from a saved game of your choosing (if you beat the game before the patch was installed). When you install the Add-On Content, a \"New Game Plus\" option will appear on the menu screen allowing you to use this feature.</li></ul><h2>System Requirements</h2><p>System Requirements <i>As displayed on the back cover of the box</i>.</p><h3>Minimum Requirements</h3><ul><li><b>CPU (Processor):</b> Pentium 4 2.4GHz Single Core processor</li><li><b>System RAM:</b> 1GB</li><li><b>GPU (Video Card):</b> Direct X 9.0c compliant video card with 128MB RAM (NVIDIA 6600 or better/ATI X1300 or better, excluding ATI X1550).</li><li><b>Sound Card:</b> 100% direct X 9.0c compatible sound card</li><li><b>HDD (Hard Disc) space:</b> 8GB free space</li></ul><h3><b>Recommended Requirements</b></h3><ul><li><b>CPU (Processor):</b> Intel Core 2 Duo processor</li></ul><ul><li><b>System RAM:</b> 2GB</li></ul><ul><li><b>GPU (Video Card):</b> DX9 - Direct X 9.0c compliant video card with 512MB RAM (NVIDIA GeForce 7900 GT or better) / DX10 - NVIDIA GeForce 8600 or better</li></ul><ul><li><b>Sound Card:</b> Sound Blaster X-Fi series (Optimized for use with Creative Labs EAX ADVANCED HD 4.0 or EAX ADVANCED HD 5.0 compatible sound cards)</li></ul><h2>Xbox 360 Game Installation</h2><p>When installed on an Xbox 360 console running the current versions of the <a href=\"/new-xbox-experience/3015-2426\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2426\">NXE</a>, Bioshock requires only 4.7 GB of HDD space. However, if the game was installed under the preliminary (first release) version of the NXE, Bioshock takes up 6.1 GB of space. This is true even if the user has since updated their Xbox 360's dashboard to a newer version. The only way to take advantage of the smaller size is to delete the old installation and re-install the game.</p><h2>Artbook</h2><p>On March 16, 2009 the Cult of Rapture website announced that a limited edition artbook for Bioshock called <i>Breaking the Mold: Developer's Edition</i> was available for pre-order on the 2K online store. The standard version can be found on the Cult of Rapture website for download as a PDF file.</p><h2>Trivia</h2><p>Originally 2K Designed a Teleportation Plasmid that teleported the player out of danger, by marking a location that the player would teleport to when they used the plasmid, the plasmid was ultimately removed due to the fact that it could be used to break story events. A same sort of teleport plasmid did appear in <a href=\"/bioshock-2/3030-20827\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20827\">Bioshock 2</a> as an <a href=\"/easter-egg/3015-2\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2\">Easter Egg</a>, presumably based on the plasmid scrapped from Bioshock 1.</p><h2>Xbox 360 Games on Demand</h2><p>On August 6, 2009, BioShock became available on the Xbox 360's <a href=\"/games-on-demand/3015-3251\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3251\">Games on Demand</a> service. It costs $19.99 or 1600 <a href=\"/microsoft-points/3015-5685\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5685\">Microsoft Points</a>.</p>", "deck": "Venture into the mysterious, Utopian city of Rapture and discover what {"duration": "0:40:00", "runner": "DrTChops", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/dishonored/3030-35850/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/81005/2339900-7562405368_fc61d60604_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2339900\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/81005/2339900-7562405368_fc61d60604_o.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2339900\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/81005/2339900-7562405368_fc61d60604_o.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Dishonored places a large emphasis on stealth gameplay.</figcaption></figure><p>Dishonored, published by <a href=\"/bethesda-softworks/3010-786\" data-ref-id=\"3010-786\">Bethesda Softworks</a> and developed by <a href=\"/arkane-studios-sa/3010-1412\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1412\">Arkane Studios</a>, the studio behind <a href=\"/arx-fatalis/3030-10784\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10784\">Arx Fatalis</a> and <a href=\"/dark-messiah-of-might-magic/3030-15065\" data-ref-id=\"3030-15065\">Dark Messiah of Might &amp; Magic</a>, is a stealth action game set in the steampunk city of <a href=\"/dunwall/3035-3813\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3813\">Dunwall</a>. You play as <a href=\"/corvo-attano/3005-23124\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23124\">Corvo Attano</a>, the Lord Protector of the Empress of Dunwall. Her murder triggers a quest for revenge in which the player is tasked with assassinating various targets. The game presents a wide array of options for completing each mission while maintaining a challenge through unpredictable enemy behavior.</p><p>Although revenge is the driving force behind the narrative of Dishonored, the game offers complete freedom in how the player wishes to tackle every major objective. In fact, you can complete the game without being detected and/or killing anyone.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/16/161989/2341918-dishonored5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2341918\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/16/161989/2341918-dishonored5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2341918\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/16/161989/2341918-dishonored5.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>There are multiple ways to approach each level.</figcaption></figure><p>Dishonored offers an experience that can be vastly different depending on how the player chooses to play it. They can be a ghost, never being seen or heard as they complete your objectives; the assassin, leaving a trail of dead bodies in their wake, or a combination thereof. These choices are applied to the main assassination targets, as well. There is always a non-lethal option for the main target in a mission, but it requires a lot of extra effort from the player. Players have both health and mana bars that are refilled through consumption of potions, but mana will regenerate to a point based on how quickly they are using their magic based skills.</p><p>The story of Dishonored progresses in a linear fashion, but every mission in the story is its own sandbox, open to exploration. The rooftops, sewers, and even the ocean are explorable. Each mission is filled with secret areas and pathways, and there are usually a few NPCs to find that offer side-missions.</p><h3>Chaos System</h3><p>Dishonored keeps track of the player's actions with a \"Chaos\" system. The more the player chooses to kill, the more rats and plague victims will be roaming the city. The Chaos system also affects the story of Dishonored, making it much darker in tone if the player has killed many people.</p><h3>Skills and abilities</h3><p>Corvo is granted some unique abilities by the Outsider that are unlocked through the exchange of Runes. Runes are scattered across the various maps and unlock different skills based on their choice of how to play the game. Skills have two tiers, with the second being more expensive than the first, so players can have a few powerful skills, or an array of weaker ones. Choice in skills is permanent, so decisions on what skills to use must be made carefully.</p><ul><li><b>Blink:</b> The most important skill in Corvo's arsenal, this allows the player to teleport short distances both horizontally and vertically, though there is a distance penalty for vertical blinking. Level 2 increases blink distance significantly.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Dark Vision:</b> This skill reveals the outlines of being through walls including their line of sight. Level 2 also shows security systems and valuable objects.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Possession:</b> Allows players to take control of living things in their immediate vicinity for a short time, enabling them to travel through small spaces or hide. Level 2 allows players to possess humans.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Bend Time:</b> Slows down time for a short period, useful in both stealth and combat situations. Level 2 allows the player to stop time completely for a shorter duration.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Devouring Swarm:</b> Summons a pack of rats to attack the nearest living thing or eat nearby corpses to prevent future detection. Level 2 is a larger, more vicious swarm of rats.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Windblast:</b> Summons of gust of wind that will knock over enemies, douse fires, shatter wood and glass, and deflect enemy projectiles. Level 2 is a stronger gust.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Shadow Kill:</b> Turns stealth killed enemies to dust to prevent future detection by their comrades. Level 2 allows all killed enemies to be turned to dust.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Blood Thirsty:</b> Allows blocks and kills to build adrenaline, which once maxed allows Corvo to provide a devastating attack. Level 2 speeds up the rate of adrenaline and makes for a double attack which can kill multiple enemies.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Agility</b>: Enables players to jump higher. Level 2 allows them to run faster.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Vitality:</b> Increases maximum health. Level 2 allows for some health regeneration.</li></ul><h3>Combat</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/49445/2283592-au9bp.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2283592\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/4/49445/2283592-au9bp.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2283592\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/4/49445/2283592-au9bp.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/4/49445/2283592-au9bp.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Corvo with pistol and sword.</figcaption></figure><p>In Dishonored the player is always dual wielding, holding the sword in the player character's right hand and an item or spell in their left. Kills can be done in a detected or stealth mode, allowing for different play styles. In detected combat players can block opponents attacks, which leaves them open for deadly slashes or stabs, or simply slash and use gadgets to reach victory. Stealth kills require the player to sneak up undetected behind their target which will allow them to use lethal or nonlethal takedowns. A lethal take down is quicker while players must choke their victim during a non-lethal takedown. Players can also perform jumping assassinations from high locations onto lower platforms without taking damage. Combat is a completely avoidable scenario throughout most of the game.</p><p>Enemies in Dishonored often use the same tools as the player. Common enemies carry nothing but a sword or a club, while higher ranking enemies carry a gun or a crossbow, as well as a melee weapon. There are also enemies that have access to magic, though they are very rarely seen.</p><h3>Stealth</h3><p>There are a number of options for playing stealthily. Pressing the crouch button will darken the edges of the screen, indicating that \"Stealth Mode\" is enabled. While Stealth Mode is enabled, the sounds of player movement are muffled, and hiding in the shadows will reduce a nearby NPC's sight range. There is a lean function which allows for peaking around corners without the possibility of being spotted. Keyholes on closed doors can be peeked through to scout out a room before proceeding. Loose objects can be picked up and thrown to create a noisy distraction. The short sword can also be used to create distractions by bashing it against solid objects.</p><h3>Weapons and Gadgets</h3><ul><li><b>Sword:</b> Used for melee and stealth combat, it is also used in blocking. The primary tool in Corvo's arsenal and thus is always equipped.</li><li><b>Pistol:</b> For ranged takedowns, very loud. Can be equipped with explosive ammo.</li><li><b>Crossbow:</b> Handheld crossbow is a silent, single shot killer. Can be loaded with incendiary and non-lethal sleep darts.</li><li><b>Grenades</b>: Thrown explosive useful for large groups of enemies. There is a sticky variation as well.</li><li><b>Springrazor:</b> Proximity mine that launches razors in the general vicinity, ripping targets to shreds. Can be attached to walls, doors, and creatures.</li><li><b>Heart:</b> Detects Bone-Charms and Runes in the area</li><li><b>Rewire tools:</b> Allow Corvo to rewire traps and security systems on his enemies.</li><li><b>Bone-Charms:</b> Magic charms that are slotted to provide passive bonuses.</li></ul><h3>Upgrades</h3><p>While in the hub area, Corvo can fully upgrade his equipment by talking to an inventor named Piero. There are several upgrades to choose from, including accuracy and damage of ranged weapons, or an increase to the amount of grenades that can be carried. All of this is done with coinage that is found throughout the missions. Equipment will change visually, as well, as different parts are upgraded/modified. Some upgrades can only be gained after finding blueprints, which are obtainable through black market merchants or found on missions.</p><h3>Design</h3><p>Designer <a href=\"/viktor-antonov/3040-14115\" data-ref-id=\"3040-14115\">Viktor Antonov</a> wanted to blend a variety of time periods into a singular cohesive world, taking inspiration from <i>Gormenghast</i> by Mervyn Peake. The world is described as a \"futuristic steam-punk totalitarian London-esque environment.\"</p><p>Dishonored's world combines mysticism, industrialism, and Victorian aesthetics into a world that almost feels Lovecraftian.</p><h2>Story</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/13641/2240277-tumblr_m59bv6a5ig1rw6vtxo1_1280.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2240277\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:62.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/13641/2240277-tumblr_m59bv6a5ig1rw6vtxo1_1280.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2240277\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/13641/2240277-tumblr_m59bv6a5ig1rw6vtxo1_1280.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/13641/2240277-tumblr_m59bv6a5ig1rw6vtxo1_1280.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Corvo summoning a swarm of rats.</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"/corvo/3005-23124\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23124\">Corvo Attano</a>, the player-controlled character, is the renowned bodyguard of Empress Jessamine Kaldwin and guardian of the young princess Emily. Having just returned from a trip overseas, the Empress, not long after being reunited with Corvo, is assassinated while <a href=\"/emily-kaldwin/3005-24580\" data-ref-id=\"3005-24580\">Emily</a> is kidnapped, Corvo being framed for both. As a result he is imprisoned and sentenced to be executed. The mastermind of the plot, the shadowy Lord Regent, becomes the head of state in the Empress's absence.</p><p>An underground resistance movement seeks Corvo's aid, and there is much to be gained in return. Corvo must become the fist of vengeance for his fallen Empress and ensure the safety of Emily by assassinating or disabling allies of the Lord Regent, and eventually installing Emily as the new Empress before the Lord Regent gains complete control of the country.</p><p>The setting for this story is a steampunk universe; more specifically, the port city of Dunwall, separated from other nearby archipelagos by monster-infested waters. The main power source of the world is whale oil, a product that in the past had made Dunwall a wealthy trading hub. Political tensions run high, however, and due to a plague that has wiped out over half of the city, other countries refuse to help and eventually embargo the once powerful city. The plague is transmitted by rats who run rampant throughout the city, spreading the sickness to those that cannot afford the expensive elixirs that treat the malady. Much of the city is in ruins because of the plague, with victims wandering the derelict streets, while other parts are under martial law to prevent the spread. The population is oppressed by both financial and military constraints, hence many have turned to religion or black magic.</p><p>Corvo is a <a href=\"/stealth/3015-24\" data-ref-id=\"3015-24\">stealth</a> professional and beside his natural talent and new-found supernatural powers, he also has the ability to bend time, and \"<a href=\"/possession/3015-819\" data-ref-id=\"3015-819\">possess</a>\" living things, allowing players to take control and play as them for a short amount of time. Most important of these powers is the Blink spell, which allows the player to traverse the map both vertically and horizontally. These powers were granted to Corvo by a figure known only as <a href=\"/the-outsider/3005-24710\" data-ref-id=\"3005-24710\">The Outsider</a>. This supernatural being is the source of all magic in the world. Its nature, origins, and intentions are all shrouded by mystery.</p><p>The story will change depending on the decisions players make: the more death that Corvo causes, the grimmer the final outlook of the game. Similar to the <a href=\"/deus-ex/3025-146\" data-ref-id=\"3025-146\">Deus Ex franchise</a>, the game will require players to make tough choices without breaking the flow of gameplay, while giving the player a limited amount of time to do so.</p><h2>Downloadable Content (Single-Player Plot Add-On)</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2454693-1375813628-disho.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2454693\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7030/2454693-1375813628-disho.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2454693\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/7030/2454693-1375813628-disho.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/7030/2454693-1375813628-disho.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>\"The Knife of Dunwall\" has players taking on the role of Daud, whose assassination of a key figure in Dunwall sets the core story of the game into motion. After this murder, Daud seeks redemption and is visited by The Outsider, a morally ambiguous and ethically flexible supernatural figure.</p><p>Daud explores never-before-seen districts of Dunwall and seeks out Delilah, a new character in the universe. He also has access to new weapons and powers not available to the wronged Corvo Attano.<i> </i>The DLC was released on the Xbox 360, PS3 and PC on April 16 for $9.99/\u00a37.99 (800 MSP).</p><ul><li><b>New Powers, Weapons and Gadgets: </b>The mark of the Outsider empowers you with unique supernatural abilities. Call upon the Whalers to assist in combat with \u2018Summon Assassin\u2019, track down hidden Runes and Bone Charms with \u2018Void Gaze\u2019 and learn to use new variations to powers, including \u2018Blink\u2019. To aid in your dangerous exploits your customized arsenal of weapons and gadgets will include Chokedust to daze your enemies, whale oil powered Stun Mines to shock your targets, and a concealed Wristbow to launch sleep darts and explosive bolts.</li></ul><ul><li><strong>Explore More of Dunwall: </strong>Make your way through the Legal District and infiltrate the Rothwild Slaughterhouse, a steaming factory filled with colossal whale carcasses and their hulking butchers. Revisit the decaying Flooded District, the location of Daud\u2019s hidden base, first seen in the original game. Return to the scenes of key events in Dishonored with a new perspective, including the fateful moment that sets off Corvo\u2019s journey.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Choose Your Path: </b>On your search for answers, approach each mission with your own style. Your redemption \u2013 or your turn towards darkness \u2013 depends on your skills and the decisions you make. Discover the mystery behind Delilah in this stand-alone chapter, and then conclude Daud\u2019s story in the final add-on, \"<b>The Brigmore Witches</b>.\" The Brigmore Witches was released on August 13 2013 for Xbox 360, PS3 and PC for $9.99/\u00a37.99.</li></ul><h2>Soundtrack</h2><p>The <a href=\"/original-soundtrack-release/3015-189\" data-ref-id=\"3015-189\">original soundtrack</a> was composed by <a href=\"/daniel-licht/3040-100876\" data-ref-id=\"3040-100876\">Daniel Licht</a>. It is available on iTunes.</p><table><thead><tr><th>Track</th><th>Title</th><th>Length</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>01</td><td>Main Theme</td><td>2:08</td></tr><tr><td>02</td><td>Intro the Whaler</td><td>3:03</td></tr><tr><td>09</td><td>Flooded Suspense</td><td>3:05</td></tr><tr><td>10</td><td>Regent Exploration</td><td>1:45</td></tr><tr><td>11</td><td>Regent System Requirements</h2><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li><b>OS:</b> Windows Vista / Windows 7</li><li><b>Processor:</b> 3.0 GHz dual core or better</li><li><b>Memory:</b> 4 GB system RAM</li><li><b>Hard Disk Space:</b> 9 GB</li><li><b>Video Card:</b> DirectX 9 compatible with 512 MB video RAM or better (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 / ATI Radeon HD 5850)</li><li><b>Sound:</b> Windows compatible sound card</li></ul><h3>Recommended</h3><ul><li><b>OS:</b> Windows Vista / Windows 7</li><li><b>Processor:</b> 2.4 GHz quad core or better</li><li><b>Memory:</b> 4 GB system RAM</li><li><b>Hard Disk Space:</b> 9 GB</li><li><b>Video Card:</b> DirectX 9 compatible with 768 MB video RAM or better (NVIDIA GeForce GTX 460 / ATI Radeon HD 5850)</li><li><b>Sound:</b> Windows compatible sound card</li></ul>", "deck": "After the Empress is killed, her most loyal bodyguard, Corvo, becomes the prime suspect, and must track down those who murdered his charge and betrayed him in order to enact his bloody revenge.", "aliases": "Dishonoured", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/82063/2560870-dishonoredhigh.jpg", "medium_url":
