{"duration": "0:41:00", "runner": "warm_ham", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/super-meat-boy/3030-25114/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-2124823\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6087/2124823-supermeatboywal1.jpg\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.8\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:80.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6087/2124823-supermeatboywal1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2124823\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/6087/2124823-supermeatboywal1.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Super Meat Boy is an indie <a href=\"/2d/3015-1427\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1427\">2D</a> platformer developed and published by <a href=\"../../team-meat/65-7230/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Team Meat</a> for the <a href=\"/xbox-360/3045-20\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a> (via <a href=\"/xbox-360-games-store/3045-86\" data-ref-id=\"3045-86\">Xbox Live Arcade</a> on October 20, 2010) and <a href=\"/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> (via <a href=\"/steam/3015-718\" data-ref-id=\"3015-718\">Steam</a> on November 30, 2010). It was later released for the <a href=\"/mac/3045-17\" data-ref-id=\"3045-17\">Mac</a> (via Steam on November 18, 2011), <a href=\"/linux/3045-152\" data-ref-id=\"3045-152\">Linux</a> (first as part of some early <a href=\"/humble-bundle/3015-6612\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6612\">Humble Bundles</a>, then later via Steam on November 5, 2013), and the <a href=\"/playstation-network/3015-2623\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2623\">PlayStation Network</a> (for both the <a href=\"/playstation-4/3045-146\" data-ref-id=\"3045-146\">PlayStation 4</a> and <a href=\"/playstation-vita/3045-129\" data-ref-id=\"3045-129\">PlayStation Vita</a> on October 6, 2015). After originally being announced for WiiWare as one of the original release platforms and then canceled due to file size limitations, it at last received a Nintendo-release on <a href=\"/wii-u/3045-139\" data-ref-id=\"3045-139\">Wii U</a> ported by <a href=\"/blitworks/3010-9146\" data-ref-id=\"3010-9146\">BlitWorks</a> in early 2016.</p><p>It follows the titular <a href=\"../../meat-boy/94-10939/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Meat Boy</a>, a \"boy without skin,\" as he attempts to rescue his girlfriend <a href=\"../../bandage-girl/94-10940/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Bandage Girl</a> from the menacing <a href=\"../../dr-fetus/94-15922/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dr. Fetus</a> while avoiding a variety of deadly obstacles (most commonly <a href=\"/saw-blade/3055-502\" data-ref-id=\"3055-502\">sawblades</a>, <a href=\"/missile/3055-74\" data-ref-id=\"3055-74\">missiles</a>, and <a href=\"/laser/3055-140\" data-ref-id=\"3055-140\">laser beams</a>). The game is known for its tricky <a href=\"/masocore/3015-1165\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1165\">\"trial and error\" gameplay</a>, where players must use precise controls and an infinite amount of lives (with quick restarts) to clear each short level (filled with platforming puzzles of increasing difficulty) as fast as they can.</p><p>Like <a href=\"../../alien-hominid/61-17452/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Alien Hominid</a>, the concept for Super Meat Boy began as a <a href=\"/flash-game-origin/3015-6521\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6521\">free online game made in Adobe Flash</a> for <a href=\"http://www.newgrounds.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Newgrounds</a>. This game, originally called <a href=\"http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/463241\" rel=\"nofollow\">Meat Boy</a>, was released on October 5, 2008, followed by a <a href=\"http://www.newgrounds.com/portal/view/472826\" rel=\"nofollow\">map pack</a>. Super Meat Boy references other games and videos from the Newgrounds community, as well as the indie game scene at large (including <a href=\"../../n/61-13373/\" rel=\"nofollow\">N</a>, <a href=\"/aquaria/3030-6630\" data-ref-id=\"3030-6630\">Aquaria</a>, <a href=\"/vvvvvv/3030-29745\" data-ref-id=\"3030-29745\">VVVVVV</a>, <a href=\"../../i-wanna-be-the-guy/61-22845/\" rel=\"nofollow\">I Wanna Be The Guy</a>, and <a href=\"/braid/3030-20716\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20716\">Braid</a>). The game's development process was featured in the 2012 documentary <em><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indie_Game:_The_Movie\" rel=\"nofollow\">Indie Game: The Movie</a></em>.</p><p>While the XBLA version was the first one released (as part of Microsoft's <a href=\"/game-feast-2010/3015-5905\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5905\">Game Feast 2010</a> promotion) and includes <a href=\"/avatar-awards/3015-3749\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3749\">avatar awards</a>, the Steam version added more achievements (including challenges such as clearing all the levels in each world consecutively without dying, clearing bonus levels, and unlocking new characters), a fully-functional level editor (complete with an in-game level portal), and a new cast of platform-exclusive characters (most notably the <a href=\"/headcrab/3015-230\" data-ref-id=\"3015-230\">Headcrab</a> from the <a href=\"/half-life/3025-293\" data-ref-id=\"3025-293\">Half-Life</a> series). The PSN version, released near the game's fifth anniversary (and originally free for <a href=\"/playstation-plus/3015-5817\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5817\">PlayStation Plus</a> subscribers), features a brand new soundtrack (due to <a href=\"/danny-baranowsky/3040-99995\" data-ref-id=\"3040-99995\">the original composer</a> declining a new licensing deal) featuring Ridiculon (of <a href=\"/the-binding-of-isaac-rebirth/3030-40865\" data-ref-id=\"3030-40865\">The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth</a> fame), David Scatliffe (of <a href=\"/hotline-miami/3030-39452\" data-ref-id=\"3030-39452\">Hotline Miami</a> fame), and <a href=\"/laura-shigihara/3040-97575\" data-ref-id=\"3040-97575\">Laura Shigihara</a> (of <a href=\"/plants-vs-zombies/3030-25709\" data-ref-id=\"3030-25709\">Plants vs. Zombies</a> fame).</p><p><a href=\"/digital-rights-management/3015-1704\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1704\">DRM</a>-free versions for the PC, Mac, and Linux were also released through the <a href=\"/humble-bundle/3015-6612\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6612\">Humble Store</a> (also including keys for the Steam version). It also received a limited-edition retail release (titled <em>Super Meat Boy: Ultra Edition</em>), featuring an art booklet, mini-poster, and digital soundtrack.</p><p>The game will receive a touch-based sequel, titled <a href=\"/super-meat-boy-forever/3030-47680\" data-ref-id=\"3030-47680\">Super Meat Boy: Forever</a>, for <a href=\"/iphone/3045-96\" data-ref-id=\"3045-96\">iOS devices</a>, <a href=\"/android/3045-123\" data-ref-id=\"3045-123\">Android devices</a>, and PC (via Steam). This sequel maintains the heavy platform-based challenge while providing both a simplified control scheme and elements of <a href=\"/endless-runner/3015-7179\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7179\">\"endless runner\"</a> games.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/669/1406160-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_16.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1406160\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/669/1406160-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_16.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1406160\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/669/1406160-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_16.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>The objective of Super Meat Boy is to guide Meat Boy (or one of the other playable characters) past deadly obstacles to reach Bandage Girl, who will be promptly kidnapped by Dr. Fetus. Navigation of these obstacles requires extremely precise timing to pass. Failure means instant death and a quick restart from the beginning of the level. The player is given an infinite amount of lives and near-instantaneous respawns, but Meat Boy leaves a trail of blood to mark where he has been and what obstacles previously killed him. When a regular level is completed, a <a href=\"/instant-replay/3015-45\" data-ref-id=\"3015-45\">replay</a> showcases every attempt within the level simultaneously.</p><p>Characters have two abilities at their disposal: a <a href=\"/jump/3015-379\" data-ref-id=\"3015-379\">jump</a> button and an ability button. For Meat Boy (and most other characters), pressing the ability button engages sprinting. Some characters sprint automatically and replace the ability button with another power, such as <a href=\"/tim/3005-5730\" data-ref-id=\"3005-5730\">Tim's</a> ability to rewind time or <a href=\"/viridian/3005-16930\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16930\">Viridian's</a> ability to inverse his own personal gravity. To keep the difficulty in check, the game features extremely precise controls. Quickly tapping the jump button performs a small hop, while holding down the jump button performs a tall leap. Players can also stick to the wall (which may either slow their descent or slightly continue their ascent) and press the jump button again for a <a href=\"/wall-jump/3015-5\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5\">wall jump</a>. Some unlockable characters have special jumping abilities, such as <a href=\"/the-kid/3005-16987\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16987\">the Kid's</a> ability to double jump and <a href=\"/jill/3005-16969\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16969\">Jill's</a> ability to stall her descent.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/26/1283745-supermeatboy_release_2010_01_11_01_00_17_28.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1283745\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/26/1283745-supermeatboy_release_2010_01_11_01_00_17_28.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1283745\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/26/1283745-supermeatboy_release_2010_01_11_01_00_17_28.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/26/1283745-supermeatboy_release_2010_01_11_01_00_17_28.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Over the course of the game, new mechanics are introduced and obstacles become more complex. These include rising tides of lava, portals, magnetic fields, fans, lava rocks, and eventually enemies that hunt down the player character. All obstacles will result in instantaneous death upon contact. The \"<a href=\"/bosses/3015-229\" data-ref-id=\"3015-229\">bosses</a>\" are equally indestructible; instead of actually fighting them, these levels require players to navigate difficult puzzles under time restraints until a <a href=\"/cutscene/3015-22\" data-ref-id=\"3015-22\">cutscene</a> is triggered.</p><p>Players can also collect bandages scattered around certain levels to unlock characters and certain levels. In order for the player to keep Bandages, they must collect them and successfully reach the exit in one attempt. Some bandages require specific characters and all are difficult to collect, especially in the purple Warp Zones, where players must not only collect the Bandage, but clear each of the three levels with a limited number of lives.</p><h2>Levels</h2><p>Super Meat Boy features five main worlds, each with forty regular levels. The initial twenty levels are referred to as the \"Light World\". If the player is able to clear a Light World level under its par time, they will be able to access the \"Dark World\" counterpart (which shares the same basic geometry, but has a different appearance and increased difficulty). Each Light World version of the five main worlds also include a boss level, which must be completed in order to progress to the next world. Boss levels are unlocked after the player beats 17 out of the 20 Light World levels.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/669/1406229-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_66.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1406229\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/669/1406229-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_66.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1406229\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/669/1406229-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_66.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/669/1406229-supermeatboy_esrb_nyrt_720p30_st_66.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Meat Boy entering a Warp Zone. </figcaption></figure><p>Along the way, players can also find purple <a href=\"/warp-zone/3015-804\" data-ref-id=\"3015-804\">Warp Zones</a> within certain levels. These portals vanish after a set period of time during the level attempt, though reaching these portals makes the Warp Zone available in the level selection screen. Entering a Warp Zone will transport Meat Boy (regardless of which character reaches the warp zone) to a retro-themed zone which is notably difficult. Each zone comes with three levels that must be completed consecutively with a special version of Meat Boy. Bandages are found within these warp zones, but the player will only have three attempts per level to collect them and clear the Warp Zone. If Meat Boy dies during the final attempt at any level, all bandages found during the Warp Zone attempt will be reset, and the player will be kicked back to the level selection screen. Replays and par times are unavailable for Warp Zones.</p><p>Red Warp Zones function similarly to purple Warp Zones but are played instead with a secret character. There are no bandages in red warp zones but there are also unlimited lives. There are only five red warp zones, one in each of the main Light Worlds. Each main world also has a special \"<a href=\"/glitch/3015-511\" data-ref-id=\"3015-511\">glitch</a> zone\", reached by getting to Bandage Girl while she is in a randomly occurring \"glitch state\". Glitch zones feature no bandages and only one level, which is typically longer and more difficult than any of the world's Warp Zones.</p><h3>Chapter 1: The Forest</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"../../street-fighter-ii/61-243/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Street Fighter II: The World Warrior</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> Lil' Slugger (giant walking chainsaw driven by Dr. Fetus)</p><p>The Forest introduces buzzsaws, static sawblade launchers, and impassable tiles that crumble away soon after the player touches it.</p><h3>Chapter 2: The Hospital</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"../../castlevania/61-6673/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Castlevania</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> <a href=\"/chad/3005-15923\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15923\">C.H.A.D.</a> (mutated living abomination of blood and tissue)</p><p>The Hospital introduces fans, crawling slimes that stick to surfaces, floating enemies that bounce around aimlessly, piles of deadly needles, keys that unlock certain tiles, and timed laser beams.</p><h3>Chapter 3: The Salt Factory</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"../../the-adventures-of-lolo/61-5026/\" rel=\"nofollow\">The Adventures of Lolo</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> <a href=\"/brownie/3005-17017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17017\">Brownie</a></p><p>The Salt Factory introduces harmful salt, homing missile launchers, moving platforms, tiles that only crumble away after coming in to contact with a missile, and high-speed conveyor belts.</p><h3>Chapter 4: Hell</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"../../ninja-gaiden/61-1653/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Ninja Gaiden</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> <a href=\"/little-horn/3005-17018\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17018\">Little Horn</a> (monster made of Meat Boy corpses)</p><p>Hell introduces lava pits (that sometimes rise), moving lava rocks, portals, rotating eyes that slowly lock on to the player while shooting laser beams, and demon homing missiles that split in to separate small missiles on impact.</p><h3>Chapter 5: Rapture</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"../../mega-man-2/61-14026/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mega Man 2</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> Larrie's Lament (a group of enormous carnivorous worms)</p><p>Rapture introduces orbs that repulse the player, abominations (both running and flying) that head towards the player, and homing sawblade launchers.</p><h3>Chapter 6: The End</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"/pokemon-redblue/3030-3966\" data-ref-id=\"3030-3966\">Pok\u00e9mon Red/Blue</a></p><p><strong>Boss:</strong> <a href=\"/dr-fetus/3005-15922\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15922\">Dr. Fetus</a></p><p>Unlocked after completing Chapter 5, The End includes five regular levels (with both Light World and Dark World variations) that can only be played by Meat Boy and are designed to test the player's mastery of previous concepts. After completing all five levels, the player can face Dr. Fetus in a boss level. The boss level is divided in to two parts, featuring a halfway checkpoint and a Dark World variant unlocked after completing 85 Dark World levels.</p><h3>Chapter 7: Cotton Alley</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"/ghosts-n-goblins/3030-17031\" data-ref-id=\"3030-17031\">Ghosts 'N Goblins</a></p><p>Unlocked after completing Chapter 6, Cotton Alley is a special 40-level world that can only be played by Bandage Girl (who is, ironically, rescuing Meat Boy from Dr. Fetus). Despite the pink and cheery atmosphere, the levels are extremely difficult. There are no bandages in this world; the obstacles are mainly limited to giant buzzsaws.</p><h3>Downloadable Chapters</h3><p><strong>Intro Cutscene Tribute:</strong> <a href=\"/bubble-bobble/3030-4995\" data-ref-id=\"3030-4995\">Bubble Bobble</a></p><p>After collecting 20 Bandages, a bonus chapter (known as \"TEH INTERNETS\" in the Xbox 360 version and \"Super Meat World\" in the PC, Mac, and Linux versions) is unlocked that provides free <a href=\"/downloadable-content/3015-329\" data-ref-id=\"3015-329\">downloadable chapters</a>. This feature is not included in the PlayStation Network version.</p><p>Each downloadable chapter can contain up to 20 levels (with both par times and separate leaderboards) and an option to restrict the character chosen. While the \"Super Meat World\" version is populated by <a href=\"/user-generated-content/3015-129\" data-ref-id=\"3015-129\">user-generated</a> maps, the \"TEH INTERNETS\" version is developer-curated only.</p><p>Due to a problem with the map-uploading system, users cannot add any chapters to the PC, Mac, and Linux versions.</p><h2>Playable Characters</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4344/1639463-197595816.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1639463\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.54090601757945\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:54.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4344/1639463-197595816.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1639463\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4344/1639463-197595816.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4344/1639463-197595816.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>All of the game's playable characters. </figcaption></figure><p>Each version of the game comes with around twelve unique playable characters to choose from, half of them being platform-exclusive characters. They can either be unlocked by collecting bandages, reaching certain Warp Zones, or entering secret cheat codes in the character selection screen.</p><p>Each character has his/her own unique abilities that differentiate them from Meat Boy, such as the ability to double jump, perform unique jumps, or act differently around map tiles.</p><p>Boss fights, standard warp zones, and Chapter 6 can only be played as Meat Boy. Chapter 7 can only be played as Bandage Girl. Warp Zones that unlock new characters can only be played as their respective characters.</p><h2>Standard Characters</h2><h3><a href=\"/meat-boy/3005-10939\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10939\">Meat Boy</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676487-meatboy.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676487\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676487-meatboy.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676487\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676487-meatboy.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676487-meatboy.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Meat Boy</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Available by default. Made of <a href=\"/meat/3055-267\" data-ref-id=\"3055-267\">meat</a>. Heroic by nature.</li><li>Also unlockable in <a href=\"../../8-bit/92-5951/\" rel=\"nofollow\">8-bit</a> form (40 bandages), <a href=\"../../game-boy/60-3/\" rel=\"nofollow\">4-color</a> form (60 bandages), and <a href=\"../../atari-2600/60-40/\" rel=\"nofollow\">4-bit</a> form (80 bandages).</li><li>Achieving 106% completion unlocks Meat Ninja, who sacrifices the ability to be ranked on the leaderboards for the power to temporarily teleport out of existence right before he dies.</li><li>The Steam version has a secret re-skin of Meat Boy (named Potato Boy) that is only used for one downloadable chapter (tying into a Steam promotion for <a href=\"/portal-2/3030-21662\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21662\">Portal 2</a>).</li><li>The default character, he is the fastest in the game with the most pinpoint control.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/bandage-girl/3005-10940\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10940\">Bandage Girl</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676476-bandagegirl.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676476\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676476-bandagegirl.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676476\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676476-bandagegirl.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676476-bandagegirl.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Bandage Girl</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Only playable in Chapter 7. Made of <a href=\"/bandages/3055-362\" data-ref-id=\"3055-362\">bandages</a>. Only has eyes for Meat Boy.</li><li>Bandage Girl plays exactly like Meat Boy, only swapping his red blood trail for a pink trail of calamine lotion.</li><li>Known as \"Band-Aid Girl\" in the original <i>Meat Boy</i> Flash game. Her name was changed to avoid copyright issues.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/brownie/3005-17017\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17017\">Brownie</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676477-brownie.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676477\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676477-brownie.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676477\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676477-brownie.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676477-brownie.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Brownie</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Only playable via cheat code after completing Chapter 3. Made of <a href=\"/feces/3055-1449\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1449\">feces</a> and <a href=\"/cornfield/3035-2135\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2135\">corn</a>. One of <a href=\"/dr-fetus/3005-15922\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15922\">Dr. Fetus's</a> evil creations.</li><li>Brownie plays exactly like Meat Boy, only swapping his red blood trail for a brown fecal trail.</li><li>On the character select screen, quickly enter RB, RB, RB, B, B, B, X (when using the Xbox 360 controller), then choose any character.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/commander-video/3005-10834\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10834\">Commander Video</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676478-cvideo.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676478\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676478-cvideo.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676478\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676478-cvideo.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676478-cvideo.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Commander Video</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from the <a href=\"/bittrip/3025-1298\" data-ref-id=\"3025-1298\">Bit.Trip</a> series. 8-bit rainbow runner.</li><li>Unlockable in the chapter 1-12 Warp Zone.</li><li>Although the Commander is the slowest character in the game, he has the ability to stop his fall and float horizontally in mid-air for a limited amount of time by holding down the jump button.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/jill/3005-16969\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16969\">Jill</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676485-jill.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676485\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676485-jill.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676485\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676485-jill.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676485-jill.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Jill</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../mighty-jill-off/61-23387/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mighty Jill Off</a>. Masochistic lesbian shoe fetishist who will do <i>anything</i> to please the Queen.</li><li>Unlockable in the chapter 2-8 Warp Zone.</li><li>By pressing the jump button multiple times, Jill can slow her descent.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/ogmo/3005-16993\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16993\">Ogmo</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676490-ogmo.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676490\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676490-ogmo.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676490\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676490-ogmo.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676490-ogmo.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Ogmo</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from the <a href=\"../../jumper/62-1869/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Jumper</a> series. Failed experiment longing for freedom.</li><li>Unlockable in the chapter 3-16 Warp Zone.</li><li>Ogmo has the ability to double-jump horizontally, despite his weak wall jumping.</li><li>Resemblance to Meat Boy coincidental.</li></ul><h3>Flywrench</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676480-flywrench.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676480\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676480-flywrench.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676480\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676480-flywrench.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676480-flywrench.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Flywrench</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../flywrench/61-22418/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Flywrench</a>. Abstract wing-flapping spacecraft.</li><li>Unlockable in the chapter 4-18 Warp Zone.</li><li>Flywrench is very heavy and very unruly, but has a strong triple-jump and can slide up walls with a very thin frame.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/the-kid/3005-16987\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16987\">The Kid</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676495-thekid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676495\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676495-thekid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676495\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676495-thekid.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676495-thekid.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Kid</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../i-wanna-be-the-guy/61-22845/\" rel=\"nofollow\">I Wanna Be The Guy</a>. He wants to be The Guy.</li><li>Unlockable in the chapter 5-7 Warp Zone.</li><li>Sacrifices speed and jump height for the ability to double jump.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/alien-hominid/3005-660\" data-ref-id=\"3005-660\">Alien Hominid</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676484-hominid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676484\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676484-hominid.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676484\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676484-hominid.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676484-hominid.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Alien Hominid</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"/alien-hominid/3030-17452\" data-ref-id=\"3030-17452\">Alien Hominid</a>. Fragile alien invader; friend to children, enemy to the government, connoisseur of heads.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 30 Bandages. Formerly exclusive to the Xbox 360 version.</li><li>Pressing the run/action button while jumping allows the Alien Hominid to fire his gun downwards, slowing his falling speed slightly or increasing his jump height and wall-climbing speed.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/tim/3005-5730\" data-ref-id=\"3005-5730\">Tim</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676496-tim.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676496\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676496-tim.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676496\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676496-tim.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676496-tim.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Tim</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"/braid/3030-20716\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20716\">Braid</a>. Gentlemanly sort, seeks to rescue the princess. Has that time-rewinding potion.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 50 Bandages (Console versions only). Playable in the Steam version by inputting \"outtatime\" in the character selection screen, then picking any character.</li><li>Holding the run/action button rewinds Tim's position for up to three seconds and doubles as an invincible force field. Unlike in Braid, this cannot be used directly after dying.</li><li>To play as Tim on PC, type \"outtatime\" on the character select screen and select a character.</li></ul><h2>Console-Exclusive Characters</h2><h3><a href=\"/gish/3005-16994\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16994\">Gish</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676481-gish.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676481\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676481-gish.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676481\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676481-gish.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676481-gish.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Gish</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../gish/61-17602/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Gish</a>. Sentient glob of tar; seeks to rescue his human girlfriend.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 10 Bandages.</li><li>Just like the Headcrab and Goo Ball, Gish is able to stick to walls (by holding down the run/action button) and slide along ceilings (by holding both run/action and jump buttons down).</li></ul><h3>Spelunky</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676493-spelunky.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676493\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676493-spelunky.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676493\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676493-spelunky.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676493-spelunky.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Spelunky</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../spelunky/61-24999/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Spelunky</a>. Adventurer by trade. Never-ending cave explorer.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 70 Bandages.</li><li>Pressing the jump button while in the air causes an explosion, propelling Spelunky horizontally in a chosen direction. Then, while still in mid-air, pressing the jump button again causes another explosion, propelling Spelunky downward.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/pink-knight/3005-17321\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17321\">The Pink Knight</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676491-pinkknight.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676491\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676491-pinkknight.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676491\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676491-pinkknight.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676491-pinkknight.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Pink Knight</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../castle-crashers/61-20733/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Castle Crashers</a>. Heroic knight with a sweet tooth.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 90 Bandages.</li><li>While fairly weak in speed and jumping ability, pressing the jump button in the air causes the Pink Knight to flail his arms (\"flutter jumping\"), granting him extra height and distance based on the point during the jump it is used. He can also jump in mid-air if he runs over the edge.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/n-the-ninja/3005-4799\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4799\">N</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676488-n.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676488\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676488-n.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676488\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676488-n.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676488-n.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>N</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from the <a href=\"../../n/62-870/\" rel=\"nofollow\">N</a> series. Skilled ninja. Very fast. Limited lifespan.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 100 Bandages.</li><li>N is much lighter than the other characters, allowing precision air control. Pressing and holding the run/action button will cause N to start sprinting for two seconds, greatly increasing his run speed and potential jumping distance.</li></ul><h2>PC-Exclusive Characters</h2><h3><a href=\"/headcrab/3015-230\" data-ref-id=\"3015-230\">Headcrab</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676483-headcrab.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676483\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676483-headcrab.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676483\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676483-headcrab.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676483-headcrab.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Headcrab</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from the <a href=\"../../half-life/62-293/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Half-Life</a> series. Alien parasite. Seeks heads; create zombies.</li><li>Unlockable only in the Steam version by collecting 10 Bandages.</li><li>Just like Gish and the Goo Ball, the Headcrab can stick to walls (by holding down the run/action button) and slide along ceilings (by holding both run/action and jump buttons down).</li></ul><h3>Goo Ball</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676482-gooball.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676482\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676482-gooball.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676482\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676482-gooball.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676482-gooball.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Goo Balls</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../world-of-goo/61-20647/\" rel=\"nofollow\">World of Goo</a>. Incredibly unintelligent blobs of goo; like to become structures.</li><li>Unlockable only in the DRM-free version by collecting 10 Bandages. Playable in the Steam version by inputting \"ballgoo\" in the character selection screen, then picking any character.</li><li>Just like Gish and the Headcrab, the Goo Ball can stick to walls (by holding down the run/action button) and slide along ceilings (by holding both run/action and jump buttons down).</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/josef/3005-13966\" data-ref-id=\"3005-13966\">Josef</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676486-josef.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676486\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676486-josef.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676486\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676486-josef.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676486-josef.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Josef</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"/machinarium/3030-23648\" data-ref-id=\"3030-23648\">Machinarium</a>. Confused for trash, wants to find his way home.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 30 Bandages.</li><li>Josef has the ability to perform a helicopter spin, which increases his jump height, or jump in mid-air should he run off an edge.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/naija/3005-9064\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9064\">Naija</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676489-naija.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676489\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676489-naija.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676489\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676489-naija.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676489-naija.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Naija</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../aquaria/61-6630/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Aquaria</a>. Lone mermaid seeking the history of her lost people.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 50 Bandages.</li><li>Naija has the ability to transform into her Energy Form and fling herself at high speed through the air.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/runman/3005-17213\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17213\">RunMan</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676492-runman.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676492\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676492-runman.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676492\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676492-runman.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676492-runman.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>RunMan</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"../../runman-race-around-the-world/61-33266/\" rel=\"nofollow\">RunMan: Race Around the World</a>. Amazingly enthusiastic, nothing can keep him down.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 70 Bandages.</li><li>Runman can use his signature Star Dive to hurl himself long distances horizontally very quickly.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/viridian/3005-16930\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16930\">Captain Viridian</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676498-viridian.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676498\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676498-viridian.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676498\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676498-viridian.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676498-viridian.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Viridian</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"/vvvvvv/3030-29745\" data-ref-id=\"3030-29745\">VVVVVV</a>. Gravity-defying. Courageous. Cyan.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 90 Bandages.</li><li>Viridian has the ability to reverse his own personal gravity.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/steve/3005-17258\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17258\">Mr. Minecraft</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676494-steve.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676494\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676494-steve.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676494\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676494-steve.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676494-steve.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mr. Minecraft</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Cameo from <a href=\"/minecraft/3030-30475\" data-ref-id=\"3030-30475\">Minecraft</a>. Loves to build. Hates <a href=\"/creeper/3015-5979\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5979\">hissing green things</a>.</li><li>Unlockable by collecting 100 Bandages.</li><li>Mr. Minecraft can build solid tiles out of thin air and destroy tiles in front of him, allowing him to easily bypass almost all challenges.</li></ul><h3><a href=\"/tofu-boy/3005-17277\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17277\">Tofu Boy</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676497-tofuboy.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676497\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1676497-tofuboy.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1676497\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676497-tofuboy.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1676497-tofuboy.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Tofu Boy</figcaption></figure><ul><li><a href=\"/joke-character/3015-1835\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1835\">\"Cameo\"</a> from <a href=\"http://features.peta.org/super-meat-boy-parody/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Super Tofu Boy</a>, a parody game by the militant animal rights group PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals). Wishes he were Bandage Girl's boyfriend. As <em>if</em>.</li><li>Playable only in the Steam version by inputting the code \"petaphile\" in the character selection screen and picking any character.</li><li>Tofu Boy, being malnourished due to iron deficiency, cannot run or jump as well as the other characters, making it impossible for him to clear the vast majority of levels.</li></ul><p> </p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14741/1689160-smb_soundtrack.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1689160\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14741/1689160-smb_soundtrack.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1689160\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14741/1689160-smb_soundtrack.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14741/1689160-smb_soundtrack.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Nice To Meat You soundtrack Cover</figcaption></figure><p>Super Meat Boy's old school soundtrack was engineered by <a href=\"/danny-baranowsky/3040-99995\" data-ref-id=\"3040-99995\">Danny Baranowsky</a> of dB Soundworks. Composed of 34 tracks, it is available at <a href=\"http://www.meatboymusic.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">meatboymusic.com</a>.</p><p>A two-disc soundtrack titled \"NICE TO MEAT YOU\" has also been released, with an additional 39 songs for a total 73 tracks. It contains new remixes, menu and cutscene music, and some unused songs. The CDs feature the sawblade motif seen on the retail install disc.</p><p>Playable <a href=\"/rock-band-3/3030-27919\" data-ref-id=\"3030-27919\">Rock Band 3</a> remixed tracks are available for download via <a href=\"/rock-band-network/3015-7161\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7161\">Rock Band Network</a>:</p><ul><li>The Battle of Lil' Slugger (Remix) ( <a href=\"/xbox-live-marketplace/3045-86\" data-ref-id=\"3045-86\">XBL</a> &amp; <a href=\"/playstation-network-ps3/3045-88\" data-ref-id=\"3045-88\">PSN</a>)</li><li>Betus Blues (Retro Remix) (XBL &amp; PSN)</li><li>Can o' Salt (Remix) (XBL)</li></ul><h3>Super Meat Boy OST Track List</h3><table><thead><tr><th>No.</th><th>Track Name</th><th>Remix Artist Name</th><th>Track Length</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>1</td><td>Boy Meats Girl (Intro Movie)</td><td>1:04</td></tr><tr><td>2</td><td>Super Meat Boy! {"duration": "0:10:00", "runner": "ArcanicEight", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/boson-x/3030-45546/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Boson X is an endless runner game which is similar in concept to the special stages of <a href=\"/knuckles-chaotix/3030-8284\" data-ref-id=\"3030-8284\">Chaotix</a>. Like in that game, the player is running inside a 360 loop with platforms on all side, the goal of each level is to discover the element within each level, the player accomplishes this by running on certain blue platforms spread across each level until a meter reaches 100% or above. Reaching the blue spaces are easier said than done, each level is randomly generated and platforms constantly fall from the sky, meaning that it is impossible to view too much of the course up ahead.Players can jump in three directions (Forward, left or right) jumping left or right causes the level to rotate however it can only rotate once per jump.</p><h2 style=\"margin-right:0px;margin-left:0px;\">Gameplay</h2><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Players may choose their protagonist, given the option of a male scientist, a female scientist, and a robot. Character choice does not affect gameplay in any way.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Levels are broken down into three groups of six. There are the standard particles, Dark particles, and Anti-particles, each group being progressively more difficult. Within each group, the same six particles are found: Geon, Acceleron, Radion, Graviton, Y Boson, and X Boson.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Levels vary significantly in pattern, speed, additional hazards, and shape. Each level has a different set of patterns and speed at which those patterns approach to challenge the player with, as is expected of any runner. Some levels, however, include not only platforms of various heights and gaps between them, but a rotating beam that must be dodged or walls that prevent the player from moving or seeing through that section. Certain levels will also include red platforms that begin to fall once the player lands their character on them. Additionally, some levels have fewer than the standard eight or ten platform lanes to bounce between, reaching all the way down to two lanes.</p><p data-right-indent=\"0\" data-left-indent=\"0\">Once the player has filled the completion bar for a given level, it does not end, but rather speeds up. Players may compete for a top spot on the global leaderboards by continuing to progress through the level and filling up the meter even more, however, this is not necessary. Players may also choose to simply fall off the platform or run into a wall to end the level and move on to the next one.</p><h2 style=\"margin-right:0px;margin-left:0px;\">Achievements</h2><p>Steam {"duration": "0:33:00", "runner": "cwolf20", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/braid/3030-20716/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Braid is a <a href=\"/side-scrolling/3015-299\" data-ref-id=\"3015-299\">side-scrolling</a> <a href=\"/puzzle-platformer/3015-3124\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3124\">platformer</a> that was released on the <a href=\"/xbox-live-marketplace/3045-86\" data-ref-id=\"3045-86\">Xbox Live Arcade</a> on August 6, 2008. Developed by independent developer <a href=\"/jonathan-blow/3040-89596\" data-ref-id=\"3040-89596\">Jonathan Blow</a>; players must manipulate time to solve complex puzzles. The <a href=\"/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> version of Braid was released on April 10, 2009. A <a href=\"/mac/3045-17\" data-ref-id=\"3045-17\">Mac</a> version of Braid was also released on May 20, 2009. A <a href=\"/playstation-3/3045-35\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a> version was released on November 12, 2009.</p><p>On May 24, 2010, Braid was designated as an Arcade Hit on the Xbox Live Marketplace. Its price was reduced from 1200 Microsoft Points to 800 Microsoft points.</p><h2>Story</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2739/503478-braid1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-503478\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/2739/503478-braid1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-503478\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/2739/503478-braid1.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>The Princess is in another castle.</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"/tim/3005-5730\" data-ref-id=\"3005-5730\">Tim</a>, Braid's main character, reflects on his mistakes in life as he searches for a long-lost princess. Delving deeper and deeper into his tragically-ended relationship with the love of his life, Tim reflects on his lost love as he progresses through the game's six worlds, slowly revealing details to the player as he or she progresses.</p><p>The story is told exclusively through text, and is displayed as Tim approaches various pedestal-placed books in the clouds-levels' prologue screen. Each book contains vague, possibly metaphorical information about the protagonist's life. The story is reflective of the gameplay, in that Tim can rewind time to fix his faults, but chose not to/was unable to during what was apparently the biggest mistake of his life. The developers are aiming to reach out to players and evoke an emotional response, and the subtle sadness throughout reflects that concept.</p><p>Although the story told throughout most of the game is about a break up or lost love, it's really only there to give the player a reason to play through and set up the general theme of the level. The story, as told from the prologue/epilogue and hinted at by the hidden ending - in which Tim catches the princess and she explodes - is actually about Tim's obsession and eventual regret with creating the atomic bomb between the two World Wars. The \"princess\" he is trying to find is actually the bomb itself.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/925775-braid6.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-925775\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/925775-braid6.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-925775\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/7465/925775-braid6.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>The primary principle of Braid is that players are to learn from their mistakes, rather than be penalized for them. That said, any time a player in the game dies, they can simply press the Rewind button to go back to the point before they died, and try again. With this concept, the challenge of the game is not in staying alive, but rather learning how time works in that specific world and mastering it to collect puzzle pieces to move on. There is a lobby area in-game for players to choose the world they wish to play. Players can also use the puzzle pieces collected in the various levels to form a picture near each world's finale. These puzzles can be used to manipulate the world as well, such as luring a baddie to low ground with a make-shift bridge formed from a jig-saw puzzle in order to earn the last piece in an unreachable spot at the end of World 2.</p><p>Certain objects cannot be affected by the rewind feature. Anything with a green glow will continue to advance as normal; clouds shot from cannons often illuminate the green aura to create jumping puzzles that require timing and forethought. Keys or platforms that are lit by green sparkles can be moved through time; for example, if Tim picks up a key that is luminescent-green, he can rewind from the pit he picked it up in and hop back to the top of the cliff while still holding on to it. Anything in purple, however, will automatically reset, or continue its desired path regardless of time travel. Lavender-lit keys can't be picked up and carried through time, as Tim drops it where he left it in the Rewind.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5962/641772-braid_screenshot10.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-641772\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5962/641772-braid_screenshot10.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-641772\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5962/641772-braid_screenshot10.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5962/641772-braid_screenshot10.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Tim must manipulate time to solve puzzles.</figcaption></figure><p>Sometimes, Tim will need to duplicate himself by rewinding. As Braid is constantly changing the rules, players will need to be clever enough to figure out the patterns at which Tim's \"shadow\" moves and acts - if players hold still before rewinding time, the clone will while players hold the rewind button. This becomes tricky as players are forced to manipulate multiple levers on various planes of height, and reality. Conquering a specific boss requires dropping shadow-chandeliers, as the enemy requires a half-dozen or so hits to kill, while players are offered but two chandeliers to deal damage with.</p><p>By completing levels entirely - gathering all the puzzle pieces - players can make their way to the attic, the first level, and presumably Tim's origin of regret. Fully completing a jig-saw puzzle unlocks a fifth of a colored ladder that leads to the top of Tim's house, which consists of multiple rooms and five playable worlds (aside from the sixth and last, which is actually World 1). Unlocking the puzzle pieces requires players to simply pick them up, but certain objectives must be met in specific situations, such as manipulating time in specific ways in order to jump higher/repeatedly and eliminating all enemies on screen to unlock a caged piece.</p><h2>Development</h2><p>Developer Jonathon Blow said in an interview with Gamasutra that difficulties with <a href=\"/microsoft-game-studios/3010-340\" data-ref-id=\"3010-340\">Microsoft</a> hindered his development process on Braid. In the interview, he stated \"[Microsoft] removed some of the requirements for XBLA games, but there are still a lot of requirements, and I believe that, at least for a single-player game like my game, the vast majority of these requirements are unnecessary\".</p><p>Art was a huge focal point of Braid's development, and artist <a href=\"/david-hellman/3040-90246\" data-ref-id=\"3040-90246\">David Hellman</a> created a <a href=\"http://www.davidhellman.net/blog/category/art-of-braid/\" rel=\"nofollow\">series</a> of blog entries on the Braid Blog to give readers an insight as to where the game came from conceptually.</p><h2>Influences</h2><figure data-ref-id=\"1300-214699\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/775/214699-1177890880_02.png\" data-size=\"small\" data-align=\"right\" data-ratio=\"0.875\" data-width=\"256\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 256px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/775/214699-1177890880_02.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-214699\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/0/775/214699-1177890880_02.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/0/775/214699-1177890880_02.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Super Mario Bros.</figcaption></figure><p>The game is influenced by, and pays homage to the <a href=\"/super-mario-bros/3030-15544\" data-ref-id=\"3030-15544\">Super Mario Bros</a>. games most of all. There are many similarities, from the pattern of the enemies, to the way players kill them and even the line \"The Princess is in another castle\". However it doesn't just do this as simple homage, it is also a succinct metaphor for Tim's journey. The use of that one phrase signifies Tim's search, and he can't find what he is looking for.</p><p>At certain points in World 4, Tim is to climb a series of ladders to grab a key. In a nod to <a href=\"/donkey-kong/3030-311\" data-ref-id=\"3030-311\">Donkey Kong</a>, the enemy-firing cannons have an ugly gorilla design on their side, representing <a href=\"/nintendo/3010-90\" data-ref-id=\"3010-90\">Nintendo's</a> classic Kong. One such stage is named <a href=\"/jumpman/3030-19687\" data-ref-id=\"3030-19687\">Jumpman</a>, which was Mario's original name in Donkey Kong. But even though Braid appears to be a platformer, it is more of a puzzle game, and its pure gameplay influences come from other platform puzzle games.</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><p>Braid's soundtrack consists of licensed music from artists signed to Magnatune. Artists include <a href=\"/jami-sieber/3040-90110\" data-ref-id=\"3040-90110\">Jami Sieber</a>, <a href=\"/shira-kammen/3040-90111\" data-ref-id=\"3040-90111\">Shira Kammen</a>, and Cheryl Ann Fulton. Links to the songs from the game can be found <a href=\"http://braid-game.com/news/?p=260\" rel=\"nofollow\">here</a>.</p><h2>Reception</h2><p>Braid was well recieved critically and commercially. It earned a Metacritic rating of 93%, making it one of the highest rated XBLA releases. It saw more than 55,000 purchases in the first week of release and Blow has stated that the game was financially \"very profitable\".</p><p>Critically, the game was considered a masterpiece by many. The artwork and puzzle design were universally praised, though the most common downside cited was the game's short length. Braid is frequently <a href=\"http://blogs.suntimes.com/ebert/2010/04/video_games_can_never_be_art.html\" rel=\"nofollow\">brought up</a> in \"games as art\" arguments.</p><h2>System Requirements</h2><h3>PC</h3><ul><li><strong>Operating System:</strong> Microsoft\u00ae Windows\u00ae XP / Vista / 7</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> 1.4GHz or faster</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 768 MB or more</li><li><strong>Hard Disk Space:</strong> 200 MB or more</li><li><strong>Video Card:</strong> Pixel Shader 2.0</li><li><strong>DirectX\u00ae Version:</strong> DirectX\u00ae 9.0c</li><li><strong>Controller Support:</strong> Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller for Windows</li></ul><h3>Mac</h3><ul><li><strong>OS:</strong> OS X version Leopard 10.5.8, Snow Leopard 10.6.3, or later.</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> Intel Mac 1.0 GHz or better</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 512 MB RAM</li><li><strong>Graphics:</strong> ATI Radeon(TM) 9500 or better, NVIDIA GeForce(TM) FX 5900 or better, Intel GMA 950 or better</li><li><strong>Hard Drive:</strong> 185 MB free space</li></ul>", "deck": "Manipulate time to complete puzzles in this 2D {"duration": "0:25:00", "runner": "TheDrifter18", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/contra-iii-the-alien-wars/3030-3016/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Contra III: The Alien Wars (Contra Spirits in Japan and Super Probotector: Alien Rebels in Europe) is a 1992 Super Nintendo Entertainment System game developed and published by <a href=\"/konami-corporation/3010-87\" data-ref-id=\"3010-87\">Konami</a>. It is the third console iteration of Contra, hence the title \"Contra III\". Originally, <a href=\"/contra-force/3030-845\" data-ref-id=\"3030-845\">Contra Force</a> was planned to be released first, but it ended up being released afterward.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/452307-contra_iii___the_alien_wars045.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-452307\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.875\" data-width=\"256\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 256px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/452307-contra_iii___the_alien_wars045.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-452307\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/7465/452307-contra_iii___the_alien_wars045.png\"/></a><figcaption>  </figcaption></figure><p>In 1994, the game was ported to the Game Boy by <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/factor-5-llc/3010-2695\" data-ref-id=\"3010-2695\">Factor 5</a>. It featured numerous differences, such as the removal of the ability to hold two weapons simultaneously. In 2002, the game was ported to the Game Boy Advance as <a href=\"/contra-advance-the-alien-wars-ex/3030-692\" data-ref-id=\"3030-692\">Contra Advance: The Alien Wars EX</a>. The two top-down levels were cut out and replaced with stages from <a href=\"/contra-hard-corps/3030-13902\" data-ref-id=\"3030-13902\">Contra: Hard Corps</a>. The game was also ported to the Wii Virtual Console in 2007. Contra III: The Alien Wars is also one of the few games to be on the Nintendo Super System, an arcade system used to preview upcoming Super Nintendo games.</p><p>In the game's story, the year is 2636. Aliens are once again invading, so it's up to <a href=\"/bill-rizer/3005-2584\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2584\">Bill Rizer</a> and <a href=\"/lance-bean/3005-2586\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2586\">Lance Bean</a> to beat sweet justice into the aliens. In the American version of the game, Bill and Lance are named Jimbo and Sully. Since the original NES Contra games take place in modern times, Jimbo and Sully are explained to be Bill and Lance's descendants. In the European version of the game, they were considered cyborgs named RD008 and RC011.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/452302-contra_iii___the_alien_wars041.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-452302\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.875\" data-width=\"256\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 256px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/7465/452302-contra_iii___the_alien_wars041.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-452302\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/7465/452302-contra_iii___the_alien_wars041.png\"/></a><figcaption>A mutated turtle creature, and the first boss</figcaption></figure><p>Contra III: The Alien Wars is a traditional <a href=\"/contra/3025-605\" data-ref-id=\"3025-605\">Contra</a> title. It has fast-paced, gritty, old-school action. Contra III is the first game in the Contra series to allow the player to hold two weapons, making it a landmark title in the franchise. In addition to that change, the power of the Super Nintendo allowed for larger, more detailed sprites and much more complex level design. Players can now jump on bars and climb on them monkey-bar style, climb walls and ladders, destroy various objects (such as the car right in front of the player in the very first level), and vehicles (such as a tank in the first level). New levels include one in which the player must jump between missiles while destroying an enemy ship, riding on a motorcycle while speeding down a road, riding on a jet ski, and two <a href=\"/mode-7/3015-184\" data-ref-id=\"3015-184\">Mode 7</a> top-down levels.</p><p>In the Mode 7 levels, the player controls the view using the two shoulder buttons (R and L). By pressing these buttons, the camera rotates around. At the start of the stage, the player gets to choose where to be dropped in. Navigating around the area and destroying various targets eventually leads the player to a boss, which must be disposed of in a fashion similar to the 2D side-scrolling bosses.</p><h2>Weapons</h2><p>If the Contra series has been known for anything, it's the wide variety of weapon power-ups available to the player. The letter next to each weapon in parenthesis detonates which lettered power-up awards the weapon to the player. By tapping the X button (standard controls), the player can swap between two weapon slots. If killed, only the weapon in the current slot will be taken away from the player as a penalty. Note that tapping X while shooting will rapidly switch weapons, allowing the player to fire anything twice as fast (within the physical limits of the player in question). Also, holding both shoulder buttons and pressing fire will result in a spinning attack with both equipped weapons being fired 360 degrees.</p><ol><li><b>Machine Gun (N/A)</b> - The starting weapon of Contra III. Has a high rate of fire, but only shoots in one direction and has very low damage.</li><li><b>Spread Shot (S)</b> - Essentially the shotgun of the game. Fires out five weak shots that shoot out in five directions in front of the shooter. Excellent for clearing out crowds of foes and does good damage to bosses at close range. Not nearly as overpowered as in previous games in the series.</li><li><b>Homing Missiles (H)</b> - Weak missiles that seek out enemy targets.</li><li><b>Laser (L)</b> - A powerful gun that fires out one shot in side-scrolling levels, but turns into a continuous beam when in a top-down level. Takes down bosses with great speed.</li><li><b>Shield (B)</b> - Gives the player temporary invincibility to everything except for falling off the screen.</li><li><b>Bomb</b> <b>(has the appearance of a bomb)</b> - Sends out a circular wave of destruction that slowly spreads over the entire screen. Damages bosses and will instantly destroy most normal enemies. After each death, players will respawn with one bomb, and more can be obtained as weapon pickups.</li><li><b>Crush Missile (C)</b> - With the exception of the bomb, the strongest weapon in the game. It has short range, but incredible splash damage to compensate. When paired with another Crush Missile, it can take down bosses faster than any other weapon.</li><li><b>Flame (F)</b> - A flamethrower. Short range but can pass through barriers, making it ideal for certain situations. Also, when holding the fire button and switching the direction of fire, the flame will move in a waving pattern instead of snapping to the new direction like other weapons, providing a wider range of fire.</li></ol><h2>Mode 7</h2><p>Contra III: The Alien Wars made use of the <a href=\"/mode-7/3015-184\" data-ref-id=\"3015-184\">Mode 7</a> graphics mode of the Super Nintendo throughout the game. An example of its use within the game is within the first stage as the low-flying plane which appears mid-stage forms part of the background layer and is animated using Mode 7 (as it comes towards the player its size increases while its wings bank slightly). The bombs which it drops however are sprites.</p><p>A second example would be the turtle boss at the end of the first stage which also sits in the background but its moving legs and the bullets that it fires are sprites.</p>", "deck": "Players control either Jimbo or Sully as they destroy aliens in this fast-paced shooter.", "aliases": "Super Probotector: Alien Rebels\nContra Spirits\nContra 3: The Alien Wars\nProbotector 2", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/87790/1841702-box_contra3.png", "medium_url":
