{"duration": "0:55:00", "runner": "LP3Cinema", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/demons-crest/3030-791/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017674-demon_scresttitlescreen.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017674\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.87109375\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017674-demon_scresttitlescreen.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017674\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017674-demon_scresttitlescreen.png\"/></a><figcaption>Demon's Crest Title Card</figcaption></figure><p>Developed and published by <a href=\"/capcom/3010-367\" data-ref-id=\"3010-367\">Capcom</a> and released in 1994 for the <a href=\"/snes/3045-9\" data-ref-id=\"3045-9\">Super Nintendo Entertainment System</a>, Demon's Crest is the third iteration in the <a href=\"/gargoyles-quest/3025-911\" data-ref-id=\"3025-911\">Gargoyle's Quest franchise</a>, an offshoot of the popular <a href=\"/ghosts-n-goblins/3025-243\" data-ref-id=\"3025-243\">Ghosts 'n Goblins series</a>. As was the case with the series' previous titles, <a href=\"/gargoyles-quest/3030-13688\" data-ref-id=\"3030-13688\">Gargoyle's Quest</a> and <a href=\"/gargoyles-quest-ii-the-demon-darkness/3030-16653\" data-ref-id=\"3030-16653\">Gargoyle's Quest II: The Demon Darkness</a>, Demon's Crest is a <a href=\"/side-scrolling/3015-299\" data-ref-id=\"3015-299\">side-scrolling</a> <a href=\"/platform/3055-1179\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1179\">platform</a> game which places players in the role of the <a href=\"/anti-hero/3015-424\" data-ref-id=\"3015-424\">anti-hero</a> <a href=\"/firebrand/3005-2548\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2548\">Firebrand</a>, a member of the very same Red Arremer <a href=\"/demon/3015-557\" data-ref-id=\"3015-557\">demon</a> clan often found antagonizing the valiant <a href=\"/sir-arthur/3005-6110\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6110\">Arthur</a> in the Ghost 'n Goblin franchise. Its gameplay utilizes mechanics commonly seen in <a href=\"/metroidvania/3015-2440\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2440\">Metroidvania</a> action-adventure games, such as areas which are inaccessible until later upgrades are obtained, and furthermore it shares similarities with Capcom's own <a href=\"/mega-man/3025-523\" data-ref-id=\"3025-523\">Mega Man series</a>, as evidenced by its <a href=\"/level-selection/3015-178\" data-ref-id=\"3015-178\">level selection</a> mechanics and <a href=\"/bosses/3015-229\" data-ref-id=\"3015-229\">bosses</a>, which often become much easier to defeat with certain weapons. In addition, the game features a rudimentary <a href=\"/economy/3015-2425\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2425\">economy</a> that allows Firebrand to purchase <a href=\"/spell/3055-807\" data-ref-id=\"3055-807\">spells</a> and <a href=\"/potion/3055-79\" data-ref-id=\"3055-79\">potions</a> with <a href=\"/currency/3015-575\" data-ref-id=\"3015-575\">currency</a> found within destructible environmental items or after defeating opponents. In a similar fashion to the <a href=\"/metroid/3030-21761\" data-ref-id=\"3030-21761\">Metroid series</a>, Demon's Crest features multiple endings which unfurl differently depending upon the player's item collection percentage at the time they choose to access the game's final battle against Phalanx, which opens up fairly early on.</p><h2>Plot</h2><p>In a time long past, the world was divided into two realms, with one realm ruled by <a href=\"/human/3015-810\" data-ref-id=\"3015-810\">man</a>, and the other the dominion of demons. For many years the two kingdoms were peaceful, until one fateful day six powerful crests fell from the sky into the demons' lands. The demons began to fight amongst themselves over the control of these mysterious artifacts, as it was rumored their combined magics were sufficient to make those who possessed them powerful beyond measure. Eventually, a single red demon by the name of Firebrand proved to be more cunning and vicious than his brethren, securing the Crests of Fire, Earth, Air, Water, and Time for himself. Not content to have only five of the six crests, however, Firebrand challenged the demon <a href=\"/dragons/3015-551\" data-ref-id=\"3015-551\">dragon</a> Somulo for possession of the final crest, the Crest of Heaven. The ensuing battle tested both combatants to their limits, but ultimately the demon dragon succumbed, and Firebrand emerged as the undisputed master of the crests.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020402-phalanx_crests.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020402\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.87109375\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020402-phalanx_crests.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020402\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2020402-phalanx_crests.png\"/></a><figcaption>Phalanx obtains the coveted crests.</figcaption></figure><p>Firebrand's control over the six crests was brief, however. Taking to the skies following his battle with Somulo, Firebrand finds himself attacked unexpectedly by another of his kind, the scheming Phalanx, who took advantage of his weakened state in order to pry the crests from him. Though his exact motives are unclear, Phalanx harbors ambitions of ruling over both the human and demon realms, and he knows that the crests will give him the power to do so. Phalanx successfully wrests all six crests from his wounded opponent, though a single shard of the Crest of Fire, which splintered into five pieces during the fight, still remains in Firebrand's possession at the end of their confrontation.</p><p>Defeated but still alive, Firebrand swears to take revenge against the opportunistic Phalanx and reacquire the crests. His vengeance will not be easy, though. Wary that some jealous demon would come to take the crests from him in the same manner that he took them from Firebrand, Phalanx separates the crests and spreads them arcross the demon realm, keeping only the Crest of Heaven on his person. Before he can properly challenge Phalanx for the Crest of Heaven, Firebrand must first search the land for the four hidden crests while also recovering the shattered remnants of the Crest of Fire. Time is of the essence. Phalanx intends to use the six crests to create the Crest of Infinity, which would make him unstoppable. Only the small sliver of the Crest of Fire which remains in Firebrand's possession prevents him from doing so.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>The main action of Demon's Crest takes place on traditional side-scrolling levels, many of which contain archetypal stage themes (<a href=\"/lava-stage/3015-532\" data-ref-id=\"3015-532\">fire level</a>, <a href=\"/water-level/3015-1713\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1713\">water level</a>, <a href=\"/ice-stage/3015-2076\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2076\">ice level</a>, etc.), in which players must travel from left to right, defeating or avoiding enemies, navigating environmental hazards like <a href=\"/spikes/3055-183\" data-ref-id=\"3055-183\">spikes</a> and <a href=\"/fire/3015-1443\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1443\">flames</a>, and occasionally squaring off against bosses. While the game's introductory stage is predetermined, after its completion players are allowed to choose their next location by flying Firebrand there via an <a href=\"/overworld/3015-1004\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1004\">overworld</a>, which essentially acts as a level selection interface. Important locations (that is, those that are tied to the player's main quest) are marked on the map in order to indicate their significance, while a number of other secondary shops and hidden locales can be access through exploration. While accessible stages can be played in any order, their difficulty, and thus their intended order of completion, is signified by a numeric indicator on the game's <a href=\"/world-map/3015-611\" data-ref-id=\"3015-611\">world map</a>. Progress is furthermore gated by levels which will only unlock once certain conditions have been met within the currently available levels.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020487-overworldtravel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020487\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.87109375\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:87.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020487-overworldtravel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020487\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2020487-overworldtravel.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2020487-overworldtravel.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Firebrand performs a flyby over Phalanx's Tower.</figcaption></figure><p>The main reward of level completion comes in the form of upgrades to the <a href=\"/player-character/3015-968\" data-ref-id=\"3015-968\">player character</a>, Firebrand. Bosses typically yield boons such as crests, new abilities, or health upgrades upon defeat, and the levels themselves often hide additional items such as talismans, which provide passive benefits, as well as urns and vellum, which can be used for potions and spellcasting respectively. Many levels include branching pathways which encourage additional playthroughs, and it is often necessary to revisit earlier levels with abilities acquired later on, as completion of certain side paths may be extremely difficult or entirely impossible without a particular item. Once a player has completed a certain amount of the game, the Tower of Phalanx is unlocked. From that point forward, the player is free to engage the game's final battle when they see fit. Players who resist the urge to challenge Phalanx immediately are rewarded with better endings and the possibility of additional post-ending content based on their completion percentage upon finishing the final battle.</p><p>When not tackling the game's main stages, the player can access several non-combat areas via the overworld. These mostly consist of shops which allow players to purchase one-time use potions and spells for Firebrand with currency gathered throughout the game. Additional urns and vellum increase the maximum number of potions and spells that can be stored at one time, though ultimately gold is also required in order to purchase them. Outside of purchasing items, activities in these neutral areas is somewhat limited. A few <a href=\"/non-player-character/3015-967\" data-ref-id=\"3015-967\">non-player characters</a> can be engaged with, and an additional <a href=\"/headbutt/3015-3215\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3215\">headbutting</a> <a href=\"/minigames/3015-116\" data-ref-id=\"3015-116\">mini-game</a> can be played for fun and profit. It is in the player's best interest to use what currency they find, as the game's <a href=\"/password/3015-38\" data-ref-id=\"3015-38\">password</a> system does not carry over money or consumable items when continuing a game.</p><h2>Fire Crest Projectiles</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017678-firebrand.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017678\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.5925925925926\" data-width=\"54\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 54px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:159.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017678-firebrand.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017678\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017678-firebrand.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017678-firebrand.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Normal Gargoyle</figcaption></figure><p>Broken into five pieces at the game's outset, the Crest of Fire is tied intrinsically to Firebrand's default form, the Normal Gargoyle. The player starts with only one fragment of the crest in their possession at the game's commencement, and unlike other crests, each additional piece of the Crest of Fire must be gathered individually before the crest can be considered whole. The basic abilities of his normal form include the use of his wings to hover after jumping, utilization of his talons to indefinitely cling to non-spiked wall surfaces, and headbutting, which breaks certain background items. These traits do not change with the acquisition of additional fire shards, nor does Firebrand's appearance, but new shards grant Firebrand access to additional projectiles while in his default state, each with their own properties. Only one of the available projectile types can be in active use at any given time, and furthermore these cannot be used concurrently with other crests, though players can cycle between the different projectile types at will through the game's menu.</p><table><tbody><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017677-fire.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017677\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.29166666666667\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 48px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:29.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017677-fire.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017677\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017677-fire.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017677-fire.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Fire</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Fire</h3> The fireball is a staple of the Red Arremer clan, and the only ability which Firebrand starts the game with. It is fairly weak, and has no special properties outside of causing damage, and thus is outshined by most later projectiles. It is more than enough to handle the game's early bosses, though, and is sufficient for breaking pots when in town or when one is otherwise not in harm's way.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017669-buster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017669\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"24\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 24px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017669-buster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017669\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017669-buster.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017669-buster.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Buster</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Buster</h3> Obtained by defeating Ovununu, the Buster is a moderately damaging projectile attack which gives the appearance of being electrically charged. Outside of giving a damage boost over Fire, it is also a major exploratory tool. The Buster attack is the first weapon obtained that is capable of breaking through the stone barriers that populate many of the game's levels, barriers which can hide additional items and pathways to new areas and bosses.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017692-tornado.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017692\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.52173913043478\" data-width=\"46\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 46px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:52.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017692-tornado.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017692\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017692-tornado.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017692-tornado.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Tornado</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Tornado</h3> One of two \"specialty\" weapons in the Fire category, Tornado is a fairly underwhelming as an offensive measure due to limited range and power, though up to two projectiles can be on-screen at once, which Firebrand can use as temporary platforms. Using the Tornado's platform property successfully can be somewhat tricky, however, and once the Crest of Air is obtained, it presents a much easier way to access most areas.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017670-claw.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017670\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.94117647058824\" data-width=\"34\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 34px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:94.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017670-claw.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017670\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017670-claw.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017670-claw.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Claw</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Claw</h3> The second of two specialty projectiles, the Claw attack adheres to any wall spikes it comes in contact with, converting them into safe surfaces for Firebrand to cling to. More so than the Tornado, the Claw's special property has limited practical use in most areas, and also like the Tornado, it is made more or less obsolete once the the player has access to the Crest of Air and its highly mobile Aerial Gargoyle form.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017673-demonfire.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017673\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.325\" data-width=\"80\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 80px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:32.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017673-demonfire.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017673\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017673-demonfire.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017673-demonfire.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Demon Fire</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Demon Fire</h3> The most powerful projectile in the Fire category, Demon Fire is acquired late in the game after defeating Grewon, and, once received, it essentially outclasses all other Fire Crest projectiles, save for a few specialized instances. The Demon Fire projectile takes the form of a long, blue, dragon-like gout of flame with blazing red eyes.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Crests of Power</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020488-thesixcrests.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020488\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.1\" data-width=\"160\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 160px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:110.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2020488-thesixcrests.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2020488\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2020488-thesixcrests.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2020488-thesixcrests.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Six Crests</figcaption></figure><p>With the exception of the Fire shards, which change only his base projectile, each of the crests obtained by Firebrand over the course of his journey yields several tangible changes when used. Once an individual crest is found, Firebrand may use it at any later point to transform into a version of himself which is imbued with the powers of that particular crest. He may then stay in any of these forms indefinitely, though it is often prudent to switch between crests frequently depending on the situation. Additional forms grant abilities that Firebrand's default form does not have access to, and in fact many areas of the game are designed such that certain crests will be better suited than others.</p><p>As powerful as they are, It is worth noting that switching to new forms may cause the player to lose abilities that are available to them in the default form. For instance, certain transformations are wingless, and therefor have no ability to hover, while several forms also lack Firebrand's basic headbutt ability, which is accessible to him from the start of the game. This means that it can sometimes be wise to fall back on Firebrand's basic gargoyle form, which has a more well-rounded set of abilities. This is especially true of forms which are more specialized in nature, such as the Tidal Gargoyle.</p><table><tbody><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017680-ground_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017680\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.56\" data-width=\"50\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 50px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:156.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017680-ground_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017680\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017680-ground_gargoyle.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017680-ground_gargoyle.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Ground Gargoyle</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crest of Earth</h3> Received after the player's first confrontation with Arma, the Crest of Earth transforms Firebrand into a mighty Ground Gargoyle. The main attribute of this form is its superior strength, which is evidenced by Firebrand's ability to charge straight through certain obstacles while in it. The Ground Gargoyle form is also notable for having one of the more unique projectile properties in the game. While in the air, it flies in a horizontal line like all other projectiles, but on the ground, it closely follows the contours of the landscape instead.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017667-aerial_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017667\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.7142857142857\" data-width=\"56\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 56px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:171.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017667-aerial_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017667\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017667-aerial_gargoyle.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017667-aerial_gargoyle.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Aerial Gargoyle</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crest of Air</h3> The Crest of Air morphs Firebrand into the second of his alternate forms, the Aerial Gargoyle. Not surprisingly given its name and more avian appearance, the Aerial Gargoyle gives Firebrand mastery over the skies. In this form, he may not only hover, but also may gain altitude whilst hovering, making it possible to access nearly any part of a level. In addition, any areas or enemies that make use of heavy wind which might otherwise buffet the player will have no affect on Firebrand while using the Crest of Air.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017691-tidal_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017691\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.8260869565217\" data-width=\"46\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 46px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:182.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017691-tidal_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017691\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017691-tidal_gargoyle.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017691-tidal_gargoyle.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Tidal Gargoyle</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crest of Water</h3> Dominion over the powerful Tidal Gargoyle awaits any player lucky enough to capture the Crest of Water. While most forms sustain damage while submerged, the Tidal Gargoyle thrives underwater, gaining significant speed and a powerful attack. Additionally, certain underwater barriers can only be broken in this form. Until the Ultimate Gargoyle is unlocked upon defeating the game, the Tidal Gargoyle is the only form one should consider entering the water with.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017685-legendary_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017685\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.6296296296296\" data-width=\"54\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 54px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:163.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017685-legendary_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017685\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017685-legendary_gargoyle.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017685-legendary_gargoyle.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Legendary Gargoyle</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crest of Time</h3> Granting power over time itself, the Crest of Time transmogrifies Firebrand into the Legendary Gargoyle. He is in this form gifted with a powerful projectile attack, as well as amazing durability. The player only takes half of the normal damage they otherwise would while in Legendary form. Outside of these boosts, the Legendary Gargoyle behaves much more like Firebrand's default self than any of the previous forms, and is the first alternate form to have the headbutt ability.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017693-ultimate_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017693\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.6296296296296\" data-width=\"54\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 54px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:163.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017693-ultimate_gargoyle.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017693\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017693-ultimate_gargoyle.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017693-ultimate_gargoyle.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Ultimate Gargoyle</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crest of Heaven</h3> Obtained by defeating Phalanx, the Crest of Heaven is the ultimate crest acquired in the game, and fittingly grants Firebrand access to the Ultimate Gargoyle form. It does not disappoint, as it combines all of the powers accessible through the previous crests: the charge skill of the Crest of Earth, the sky mastery of the Crest of Air, the water affinity of the Crest of Water, and the damage mitigation of the Crest of Time. In fact, there is very little cause to use previous crests once the Crest of Heaven has been acquired.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Spells</h2><p>The spell system on Demon's Crest is in place to allow players the means to create and cast various spells to augment their usual offensive abilities. Before a spell can be cast, Firebrand is first required to obtain vellum, which is essentially a blank scrap of parchment which a spell can be inscribed upon. Once a player possesses vellum, spells can be inscribed upon them by special vendors within the game world, provided the player has enough money for the particular spell. Once the spell has been used, the vellum returns to a blank state, and must be inscribed with a spell once again before it can be reused. The player can have up to five spells of their choosing at one time.</p><table><tbody><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017687-shadow.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017687\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.9375\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 32px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017687-shadow.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017687\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017687-shadow.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017687-shadow.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Shadow</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Shadow</h3> Invoking the Shadow spell conjures an ominous spectral barrier around Firebrand which grants him temporary protection from harm for a short time by boosting his defensive abilities. Given that the Armor talisman gives a constant defensive benefit, though, the utility of Shadow is somewhat lessened once it is obtained.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017683-hold.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017683\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.9375\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 32px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017683-hold.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017683\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017683-hold.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017683-hold.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Hold</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Hold</h3> Casting the Hold spell inflicts temporary paralysis upon any enemies near to Firebrand. This can be useful mainly early on, when players have less mobility, though later transformations provide a significant amount of maneuverability, enough to make Hold somewhat less attractive.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017684-imp.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017684\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.9375\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 32px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017684-imp.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017684\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017684-imp.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017684-imp.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Imp</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Imp</h3> The Imp spell summons a lesser demon to aid Firebrand for a time. This helper flies overhead, swooping in to attack any foes that close in on its master. Being a demon, the Imp is not without certain expectations of its host. Gold will constantly drain away from Firebrand as long as the Imp is present, and it will quickly abandon him should he run out of currency.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017688-shock.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017688\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.9375\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 32px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017688-shock.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017688\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017688-shock.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017688-shock.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Shock</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Shock</h3> The Shock spell conjures a localized earthquake to damage enemies around Firebrand. The obvious downside to this incantation is that targets must touch the ground in order to sustain damage, thus the game's myriad airborne foes are essentially immune to its effects.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017672-death.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017672\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.9375\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 32px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:93.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017672-death.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017672\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017672-death.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017672-death.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Death</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Death</h3> Simply put, the Death spell kills any enemies on-screen at the time of its casting by calling forth Death itself. This is obviously most useful when there are a large number of foes within Firebrand's immediate vicinity, although certain boss monsters can also feel its effect.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Potions</h2><p>The more defensive counterpart of the spell system, Demon's Crest's potion system operates in exactly the same fashion. Players are required before making a potion to collect at least a single urn, which acts as the vessel for a potion. With sufficient funds, players can then purchase potions from designated potion vendors in the game world in order to fill these urns. Each potion can be used only once before needing to be repurchased, and as with spells, a player can possess a maximum of five different potions at one time, depending on the number of urns they have collected. Only one potion or spell may be equipped at a given moment, and, once used, the player must manually equip a new one from their inventory in order to use it.</p><table><tbody><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017686-mercury.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017686\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4545454545455\" data-width=\"22\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 22px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:145.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017686-mercury.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017686\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017686-mercury.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017686-mercury.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mercury</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Mercury</h3> Quaffing the Mercury potion immediately transports the player back the to beginning of their current stage. This is of somewhat dubious usefulness, unfortunately, as only one stage allows the player access to the overworld from there, so in most cases this simply forces the player to replay their current stage.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017690-sulfur.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017690\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4545454545455\" data-width=\"22\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 22px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:145.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017690-sulfur.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017690\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017690-sulfur.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017690-sulfur.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Sulfur</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Sulfur</h3> The Sulfur potion is a more useful version of the Mercury potion, transporting its imbiber to the overworld rather than the beginning of the stage. This can be handy when Firebrand is critically low on health, or when the player has accomplished their objective within a stage and has no need to continue.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017682-herb.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017682\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4545454545455\" data-width=\"22\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 22px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:145.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017682-herb.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017682\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017682-herb.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017682-herb.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Herb</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Herb</h3> A basic healing potion, Herb restores five points to the player's health bar. While not nearly as useful as the Ginseng potion, it has the advantage of being a great deal less expensive, and early on, before Firebrand's health is upgraded, it can represent a full heal, or close to it.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017675-elixir.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017675\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4545454545455\" data-width=\"22\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 22px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:145.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017675-elixir.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017675\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017675-elixir.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017675-elixir.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Elixir</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Elixir</h3> The Elixir acts as an emergency restorative upon death, automatically reviving a downed player and granting them four points of health. While nice to have, it is worth pointing out that an Herb potion costs considerably less while also restoring more health, making an Elixir preferable only if one plans on being careless.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017679-ginseng.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017679\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4545454545455\" data-width=\"22\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 22px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:145.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017679-ginseng.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017679\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017679-ginseng.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017679-ginseng.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Ginseng</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Ginseng</h3> The most useful potion during the late game, and accordingly the most expensive, the Ginseng potion restores Firebrand to full health. The cost can be hard to justify early on when Firebrand's pool of health is shallow, and Herb potions work nearly as well, but as the pool deepens, Ginseng's utility grows exponentially.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Talismans</h2><p>The artifacts known as talismans are quite different from other Demon's Crest collectibles in that they are entirely passive. Talismans can be equipped from the inventory page much like potions or spells, but once done, they provide a constant benefit to the player which does not diminish over time. Each talisman must be found in the game world rather than bought, and though the unique properties of each are not immediately explained in-game, a certain helpful NPC will offer to explain the benefits of whichever talisman the player happens to have equipped.</p><table><tbody><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017671-crown.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017671\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.84615384615385\" data-width=\"26\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 26px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:84.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017671-crown.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017671\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017671-crown.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017671-crown.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Crown</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crown</h3> The Crown talisman significantly increases the probability of gold drops. This can be useful in many situations, such as when resuming a game through a password. Since continuing a game starts the player with no money, the Crown presents an easy way to quickly gather gold for potions and spells.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017689-skull.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017689\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.1538461538462\" data-width=\"26\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 26px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:115.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017689-skull.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017689\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017689-skull.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017689-skull.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Skull</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Skull</h3> Useful mostly during the early game, when overall health is low, the Skull talisman greatly improves the chances of health restoration drops. In most cases, having a good supply of potions on hand is a better way to restore health, but in their absence, the Skull can help keep Firebrand alive.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017668-armour.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017668\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.92307692307692\" data-width=\"26\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 26px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:92.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017668-armour.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017668\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017668-armour.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017668-armour.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Armor</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Armor</h3> Likely to be the default talisman for most players, the Armor talisman bestows a significant amount of damage mitigation to its user. When combined with defense-boosting forms like the Legendary or Ultimate Gargoyle, Firebrand will be able to stand up to a fair amount of punishment.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017676-fang.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017676\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"26\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 26px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017676-fang.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017676\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017676-fang.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017676-fang.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Fang</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Fang</h3> Armor's offensive counterpart, the Fang talisman boosts Firebrand's damage output considerably. For those who value finishing their enemies quickly more so than protecting themselves, it can be a more alluring option, especially if one has a deep stock of health potions to back it up.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017681-hand.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017681\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"24\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 24px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2017681-hand.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2017681\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017681-hand.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2017681-hand.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Hand</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Hand</h3> The Hand talisman increases Firebrand's damage by accelerating his rate of fire. It can be obtained earlier than either the Fang or Armor talismans, so until then it is more or less the de facto combat talisman. Once those talismans are available, though, the Hand becomes less of an asset.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Mode 7</h2><p>Demon's Crest was another game which utilised the <a href=\"/mode-7/3015-184\" data-ref-id=\"3015-184\">Mode 7</a> graphical mode of the Super Nintendo primarily for its world map.</p>", "deck": "Demon's Crest is the third game in the Gargoyle's Quest series, a spin-off of the Ghosts 'n Goblins franchise. The action once again focuses on the demon Firebrand, who must this time collect six magical crests in order to defeat the ambitions of Phalanx.", "aliases": "Demon's Blazon: Makaimura Monshou Hen", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/9/93770/2363720-snes_demonscrest_2.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2015-08-06 04:47:21", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-791/", "number_of_user_reviews": 0, "original_release_date": "1994-10-21 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": null, "date_added": "2008-04-01 01:37:36", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-9/", "abbreviation": "SNES", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/super-nintendo-entertainment-system/3045-9/", "id": 9, "name": "Super Nintendo Entertainment System"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-139/", "abbreviation": "WIIU", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/wii-u/3045-139/", "id": 139, "name": "Wii U"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 791, "resource_type": "game", "name": "Demon's Crest"}, "platform": "SNES", "title": "Demon's Crest"}
{"duration": "0:25:00", "runner": "Mecha Richter", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/dinocity/3030-29459/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>DinoCity is a Super Nintendo platformer game developed by Irem based on the TV movie <em>Adventures in Dinosaur City </em>from Smart Egg Pictures. The player assumes the role of Timmy or Jamie, two human children who are accidentally teleported to an alternate version of Earth where dinosaurs are sentient. In order to return home, they need to team up with two friendly dinosaurs (Rex helps Timmy and Tops helps Jamie) and recover a vital component from the Rockeys, a gang of villainous Neanderthals.</p><p>Like <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/konami-corporation/3010-87\" data-ref-id=\"3010-87\">Konami</a>'s <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/the-adventures-of-bayou-billy/3030-12536\" data-ref-id=\"3030-12536\">The Adventures of Bayou Billy</a>, DinoCity is known for its high difficulty level which in part is due to its US release being considerably more challenging than the original Japanese version. The Japanese title, Dinowars: Kyouryuu Oukoku e no Daibouken, is the same name used for the Japanese version of the movie the game is based on.</p><p> </p>", "deck": "A platformer game loosely based on the 1992 direct-to-video American film, Adventures in Dinosaur City.", "aliases": "Dinowars: Kyouryuu Oukoku e no Daibouken", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/22/229960/2651254-dino+city.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2016-02-12 09:45:15", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-29459/", "number_of_user_reviews": 0, "original_release_date": "1992-07-17 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": null, "date_added": "2009-12-14 00:22:57", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-9/", "abbreviation": "SNES", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/super-nintendo-entertainment-system/3045-9/", "id": 9, "name": "Super Nintendo Entertainment System"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 29459, "resource_type": "game", "name": "DinoCity"}, "platform": "SNES", "title": "DinoCity"}

At launch, it was an exclusive to Windows 8 and continued to be available only for Windows 8 and 10 in the Microsoft Store until August 2015, when it was released on <a href=\"/steam/3015-718\" data-ref-id=\"3015-718\">Steam</a>.</p><p>As the titular Ty, players must use survive in the great Aussie Outback by using their wits, platforming skills, and assortment of boomerangs to find hidden treasures, help locals in trouble, defeat Frills, and uncover the mysteries of the land Down Under.</p><p>There are multiple game modes:</p><ul><li style=\"margin-right:0px;\">Adventure</li><li {"duration": "0:55:00", "runner": "Bawkbasoup", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/silent-hill-3/3030-10369/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Silent Hill 3 continues the series' trademark brand of psychologically-driven <a href=\"/survival-horror/3015-4801\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4801\">survival horror</a> gameplay. As a teenage girl named Heather, players explore and unravel the mysterious connection between the godforsaken town and her own inner fears.  </p><h2>Story</h2><h3>Main Characters</h3><h4><a href=\"/heather-mason/3005-2723\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2723\"><b>Heather Mason</b></a></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517602-heather.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517602\" data-ratio=\"1.3515151515152\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:135.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517602-heather.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517602\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517602-heather.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Heather is the 17-year-old heroine of Silent Hill 3. Heather is essentially drawn into the nightmare that Claudia created for her. Despite not being Harry's biological daughter, Heather lived a happy life for 17 years. That love easily caused the god inside of Heather to be dormant for 17 years.</p><h4><a href=\"/douglas-cartland/3005-6298\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6298\"><b>Douglas Cartland</b></a></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517603-douglas.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517603\" data-ratio=\"1.3326885880077\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:133.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517603-douglas.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517603\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517603-douglas.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>A 50-year-old detective, Douglas meets Heather in a mall. He tries to get Heather to go with him to have a conversation about her birth, but Heather refuses. Douglas definitely knows something about Heather, and is also very persistent. Claudia Wolf hired Douglas to find Heather. Over the course of the game, Douglas and Heather become friends and allies in this nightmare.</p><p>Douglas also had a son, who was killed trying to rob a bank because Douglas was poor and penniless.</p><h4><a href=\"/claudia-wolf/3005-6299\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6299\"><b>Claudia Wolf</b></a></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517604-claudia.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517604\" data-ratio=\"1.4008438818565\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:140.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517604-claudia.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517604\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517604-claudia.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517604-claudia.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>An old woman with long hair, and clothing similar to what Dahlia wore.</p><p>She definitely knows a lot about Silent Hill, Alessa and the cult itself. Claudia is a force to be reckoned with, stopping at nothing to summon the God of Silent Hill. As a young girl, she was friends with Alessa. Her father, Leonard, abused her when she was young, although she eventually had him committed to Brookhaven Hospital. The abuse she endured as a child reinforced her belief in the cult, believing that her suffering would be reversed upon the arrival of <a href=\"/samael/3005-3129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3129\">Samael</a>.</p><h4><a href=\"/vincent/3005-6300\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6300\"><b>Vincent</b></a></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517608-vincent2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517608\" data-ratio=\"1.3228571428571\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:132.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/19/192184/2517608-vincent2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2517608\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517608-vincent2.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/19/192184/2517608-vincent2.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Vincent is another cult-member with his own agenda. He seems to favor the whole cult, but seems to be a bit more realistic than Claudia is. He's glad to believe in the religion, but he opposes the summoning of the god as it would mean the end of his world as he knows it, a world he enjoys - thanks to money and mundane pleasures.</p><h4><a href=\"/leonard-wolf/3005-13334\" data-ref-id=\"3005-13334\"><b>Leonard Wolf</b></a></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14036/617631-question.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-617631\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.99228791773779\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:99.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14036/617631-question.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-617631\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14036/617631-question.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14036/617631-question.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Leonard is Claudia's father and is mentally insane. He was a cult member before being committed to Brookhaven Hospital. He abused the young Claudia and as a result, was despised by his own daughter and people who knew him. </p><h4><strong>Stanley Coleman</strong></h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/16944/1642322-question_mark.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1642322\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.99228791773779\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:99.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/16944/1642322-question_mark.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1642322\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/16944/1642322-question_mark.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/16944/1642322-question_mark.jpg\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Stanley was a patient in the Brookhaven Hospital. He may or may not be dead as Heather enters the hospital and his diaries are scattered everywhere in the vicinity. Although Heather has never met Stanley in person, he is madly in love with her and expresses his feelings for her in his diaries. There is always a doll that accompanies the notes. In the Alternate Hospital's basement, Stanley calls Heather by the telephone to wish her happy birthday even though it wasn't her birthday.</p><p> </p><p> </p><h3>Plot</h3><p>As a direct sequel to the first game Silent Hill 3 begins 17 years after the events of <a href=\"/silent-hill/3030-4312\" data-ref-id=\"3030-4312\">Silent Hill</a>. This time around <a href=\"/heather-mason/3005-2723\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2723\">Heather Mason</a>, daughter of <a href=\"/harry-mason/3005-1109\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1109\">Harry Mason</a>, finds her world infested with bizarre monsters. The game starts with Heather in a nightmarish version of <a href=\"/lakeside-amusement-park/3035-1393\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1393\">Silent Hill's Amusement Park</a>; and is where the main character Heather Mason understands something has gone horribly wrong: she sees that the Amusement Park has gone to hell; with blood all over the place, and monsters a-lurkin'. After a shocking moment, Heather wakes up just to find herself in a burger shop- but was it really a nightmare?</p><p>She later stumbles upon a person called <a href=\"/douglas-cartland/3005-6298\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6298\">Douglas Cartland</a> in a mall; the 50 year-old-detective tries to get Heather to go with him to have a conversation about her birth, but Heather refuses. Due to Douglas's persistence, Heather decides to save herself by going into the lady's room. From there she sees the first weird sign right over a mirror: that sign was the same one she saw in her nightmares.</p><p>Later, Heather stumbles upon a monster, and from there she experiences a ride into hell. She then meets a woman called <a href=\"/claudia-wolf/3005-6299\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6299\">Claudia</a>, a lady who asks Heather : \"Remember me and your true self as well\". To the question \"What are those monsters,\" she responds: \"They have come to witness the beginning of the world spoiled by mankind.\"</p><p>After surviving from the deadly mall by killing a split worm, Heather finds herself in the normal world again. She encounters Douglas again, but this time he is scared and has seen the monsters himself. Heather decides to take the subway home, but as you might expect, she again encounters the weird monsters. After getting out of the subway and reaching her apartment, Heather witnesses the most bitter scene of her entire life: her father, <a href=\"/harry-mason/3005-1109\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1109\">Harry Mason</a> (protagonists of the first game), lies on a couch- bloody and lifeless. After crying over his dead body, Heather follows the trail of blood to the rooftop just to find her father's killer standing beside Claudia. She asks the reason behind this evil deed and Claudia in return says: <i>\"Someday you'll understand the reason in</i> <i>Silent Hill</i>.\" Heather manages to kill his father's murderer and vowed to avenge her father's death, but must travel to Silent Hill. Douglas gives her a ride to Silent Hill, where she finds out she was adopted by Harry mason as a child.</p><p>After arriving in Silent Hill, she starts looking for clues on how to find Claudia. She visits various places like <a href=\"/alchemilla-hospital/3035-1599\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1599\">Alchemila Hospital</a> and <a href=\"/lakeside-amusement-park/3035-1393\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1393\">Lakeside Amusement Park</a>. She also meets two new characters, one called Leonard Wolf- the father of Claudia- and the other is a sneaky monk called <a href=\"/vincent/3005-6300\" data-ref-id=\"3005-6300\">Vincent</a>. Later Heather understands that she needs to find Claudia in the town's <a href=\"/church/3035-1395\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1395\">Church</a>. The reason behind all these monsters, nightmares and pain would be explained by Claudia as the means to make Heather angry and full of hatred, resulting in <i>\"God's birth\"</i>.</p><p>Heather then learns that she carries God (Satan) in her womb. At the end of the church Heather meets Claudia and Vincent talking about the God's Birth which ends up with Vincent being stabbed and killed by Claudia. Heather then swallows a ruby (<a href=\"/aglaophotis/3055-454\" data-ref-id=\"3055-454\">Aglaophotis</a>) that Harry once gave her, and throws up the God. The desperate Claudia attempts to give birth to God herself soon after, which leads to Heather killing them and avenging her father's death. At the final scene we understand that Heather Mason was indeed <a href=\"/cheryl-mason/3005-2724\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2724\">Cheryl</a>/ <a href=\"/alessa-gillespie/3005-1102\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1102\">Alessa</a>, the girl whom Harry was looking for throughout the events of first Silent Hill game. Silent Hill 3 ends with the God finally destroyed and the cult officially gone from Silent Hill.</p><h2>Enemies</h2><h3>Common enemies</h3><ul><li><a href=\"/numb-body/3015-6013\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6013\">Numb Body</a></li><li><a href=\"/double-head/3015-6015\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6015\">Double Head</a></li><li><a href=\"/pendulum/3015-6016\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6016\">Pendulum</a></li><li><a href=\"/insane-cancer/3015-6017\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6017\">Insane Cancer</a></li><li><a href=\"/closer/3015-6014\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6014\">Closer</a></li><li><a href=\"/slurper/3015-6018\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6018\">Slurper</a></li><li><a href=\"/alchemilla-nurses/3015-5724\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5724\">Nurse</a></li><li><a href=\"/scrapers/3015-6019\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6019\">Scraper</a></li><li><a href=\"/valtiel/3005-7419\" data-ref-id=\"3005-7419\">Valtiel</a></li></ul><h3>Bosses</h3><ul><li><a href=\"/split-head/3005-16599\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16599\">Split Head</a></li><li><a href=\"/glutton/3015-6059\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6059\">Glutton</a></li><li><a href=\"/missionary/3015-6060\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6060\">Missionary</a></li><li><a href=\"/leonard-wolf/3005-13334\" data-ref-id=\"3005-13334\">Leonard Wolf</a></li><li>Memory of <a href=\"/alessa-gillespie/3005-1102\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1102\">Alessa</a></li><li><a href=\"/the-god/3005-16604\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16604\">The God</a></li></ul><h2>Endings</h2><p>As with past games, there are multiple endings available in Silent Hill 3. Which ending the player receives depends on criteria such as choices, damage taken, number of enemies killed, and whether or not certain items were used.</p><p>Note that upon a first completion, only the Normal ending is possible.</p><h3>Normal</h3><p>Heather goes back to the amusement park and the town has returned to its normal state. She approaches Douglas wielding a knife and acting strangely. It seems like she plans to kill him, but stops and laughs that it was just a joke. Douglas thinks she has a twisted sense of humor. Heather then insists he call her Cheryl, the name given by her father Harry. When Douglas asks if this means she plans to go back to her original hair color of black, she replies that blonds have more fun. The game ends with a shot of Heather visiting Harry's grave.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/57879/1465883-normal.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1465883\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.6137339055794\" data-width=\"466\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 466px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:61.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/57879/1465883-normal.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1465883\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/5/57879/1465883-normal.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/5/57879/1465883-normal.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>HOW TO OBTAIN: Awarded on a first completion. If playing on Extra New Game, players must not exceed 4,000 points over the course of the game. To do this simply avoid killing enemies unless necessary, take little health damage, and say nothing to the confessor in the church.</p><h3>Possessed</h3><p>In the amusement park, blood is dripping onto the ground and the camera shows Heather standing motionless wielding a knife<i>,</i> while the town remains in its alternate state. Slowly the scene pans to reveal Douglas dead and bloodied, apparently having been murdered by Heather. The game ends with Heather standing over his lifeless body.</p><p>HOW TO OBTAIN: Players must earn 4,000 points over the course of the game. Ten points are received for each enemy the player kills, and a single point is obtained each time the player takes damage. Forgiving the confessor in the church awards players with an additional 1,000 points.</p><h3>Revenge</h3><p>This is the goofy ending in line with the UFO endings from past games. After arriving at Daisy Villa Apartments, storyboard-style scenes take place. Heather returns home to find that her father Harry isn't dead at all, but sitting at a table having tea with an alien. He addresses her as Cheryl and his voice is oddly distorted. James Sunderland, the protagonist from <a href=\"/silent-hill-2/3030-10780\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10780\">Silent Hill 2</a>, is in the background hiding behind a curtain. She explains to Harry about her experiences, then he suddenly goes into a rage and jump-kicks a wooden plank held by James into two pieces. Harry declares that he's going to go to Silent Hill and bust some heads; Heather and the alien cheer him on. Cut to a shot of the town being obliterated by a UFO attack. The game ends with a comical 'Silent Hill song' in Japanese, making comments about characters from the game.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/57879/1465870-revenge.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1465870\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.64495798319328\" data-width=\"476\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 476px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:64.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/5/57879/1465870-revenge.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1465870\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/5/57879/1465870-revenge.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/5/57879/1465870-revenge.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>HOW TO OBTAIN: Players first need to unlock the Heather Beam/Sexy Beam by killing at least 333 enemies in total. Note that the kills are cumulative across multiple games. After it is unlocked, players will automatically use it when no weapons are equipped since it can't actually be selected. Should at least thirty enemies have been killed with the Sexy Beam before reaching Daisy Villa Apartments, the ending will trigger at the end.</p><h2>Unlockable Weapons</h2><p><b>Heather Beam/Sexy Beam</b></p><p>This will automatically be active when players have no other weapon equipped since it can't be selected. Heather fires varied laser beams from her eyes; not very powerful and mostly for show. The Sexy Beam is a slightly enhanced version that only applies if Heather is wearing the 'Transform' costume.</p><ul><li><strong>REQUIREMENT:</strong> Kill at least 333 enemies in total. This number is cumulative across multiple games.</li></ul><p><b>Unlimited Submachine Gun</b></p><p>This is an SMG with infinite ammo that never has to be reloaded.</p><ul><li><strong>REQUIREMENT: </strong>Finish the game at least once and deliver the last blow to the final boss with a melee weapon. Note that players can damage the boss any way they choose, but the killing hit must be with a melee weapon.</li><li><strong>LOCATION: </strong>On top of some boxes in an alleyway near the very beginning of the game.</li></ul><p><b>Flamethrower</b></p><p>A flamethrower with unlimited fuel that works similar to the SMG; it is very weak however.</p><ul><li><strong>REQUIREMENT: </strong>Finish the game at least once and kill the majority of enemies by using firearms.</li><li><strong>LOCATION:</strong> On the counter in Helen's Bakery, on the second floor of the Central Square Shopping Center.</li></ul><p><b>Beam Saber</b></p><p>Melee weapon very similar to a lightsaber seen in Star Wars.</p><ul><li><strong>REQUIREMENT: </strong>Finish the game at least once and kill the majority of enemies by using melee weapons.</li><li><strong>LOCATION: </strong>As a doorknob at the end of the north corridor, on the second floor of the Central Square Shopping Center.</li></ul><p><b>Gold and Silver Pipes</b></p><p>Aside from color, these are actually no different than the standard steel pipe.</p><ul><li><strong>REQUIREMENT: </strong>Finish the game at least once.</li><li><strong>LOCATION:</strong> After defeating the creature in the sewers with the hairdryer/water combination,  the player must then examine the water there and throw their steel pipe in. The figure of a fairy will appear and question the player about it. Answering honestly will reward players with both the gold and silver pipes.</li></ul><h2>Silent Hill 2 References</h2><p>If a memory card containing a save file from <a href=\"/silent-hill-2/3030-10780\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10780\">Silent Hill 2</a> is being used, players will be able to find several references to the previous game.</p><ul><li>Dirty toilet scene in one of the restrooms of the alternate Central Square Shopping Center.</li><li>A poster of Maria in Heaven's Night.</li><li>No 'letter from a dead wife' in the Daisy Villa Apartments.</li><li>A certain sturdy fence on the Brookhaven Hospital rooftop</li></ul><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14036/817817-sh3os.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-817817\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.0044444444444\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14036/817817-sh3os.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-817817\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14036/817817-sh3os.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14036/817817-sh3os.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Silent Hill Original Soundtracks</figcaption></figure><p>The music for Silent Hill 3 was composed by <a href=\"/akira-yamaoka/3040-40927\" data-ref-id=\"3040-40927\">Akira Yamaoka</a> with the participation of guest musicians <a href=\"/mary-elizabeth-mcglynn/3040-22864\" data-ref-id=\"3040-22864\">Mary Elizabeth McGlynn</a> and <a href=\"/joe-romersa/3040-73904\" data-ref-id=\"3040-73904\">Joe Romersa</a>.</p><h3>Tracklist:</h3><p><b>01<i>.</i></b> <i>Lost Carol</i> (0:37)</p><p><b>02.</b> <i>You\u2019re Not Here</i> (3:46)</p><p><b>03.</b> <i>Float Up From Dream</i> (1:22)</p><p><b>04.</b> <i>End Of Small Sanctuary</i> (1:43)</p><p><b>05.</b> <i>Breeze - In Monochrome Night</i> (4:15)</p><p><b>06.</b> <i>Sickness Unto Foolish Death</i> (3:06)</p><p><b>07.</b> <i>Clockwork Little</i> <i>Happiness</i> (3:25)</p><p><b>08.</b> <i>Please Love Me\u2026Once More</i> (1:54)</p><p><b>09.</b> <i>A Stray Child</i> (5:29)</p><p><b>10.</b> <i>Innocent Moon</i> (1:38)</p><p><b>11.</b> <i>Maternal Heart</i> (3:02)</p><p><b>12.</b> <i>Letter - From The Lost Days</i> (3:55)</p><p><b>13.</b> <i>Dance With Night Wind</i> (5:22)</p><p><b>14.</b> <i>Never Forgive Me, Never Forget Me</i> (2:19)</p><p><b>15.</b> <i>Prayer</i> (1:41)</p><p><b>16.</b> <i>Walk On Vanity Ruins</i> (2:45)</p><p><b>17.</b> <i>I Want Love</i> (2:46)</p><p><b>18.</b> <i>Heads No. 2</i> (1:13)</p><p><b>19.</b> <i>Memory Of The Waters</i> (1:47)</p><p><b>20.</b> <i>Rain Of Blass Petals</i> (3:39)</p><p><b>21.</b> <i>Flower Crown Of Poppy</i> (2:14)</p><p><b>22.</b> <i>Sun</i> (1:48)</p><p><b>23.</b> <i>Uneternal Sleep</i> (1:01)</p><p><b>24.</b> <i>Hometown</i> (6:05)</p><p><b>25.</b> <i>I Want Love</i> (Studio Mix) (4:40)</p><p><b>26.</b> <i>Rain of Brass Petals - Three Voice Edit</i> (Bonus Track) (5:01)</p><h2>Konami Code</h2><p>After finishing the game at least once, highlight Extra New Game on the title screen and enter the following code. A sigh will play to note that the code has been input correctly. This makes Douglas appear in his underwear during cutscenes.</p><ul><li>PS2: Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, Circle, X</li><li>PC: W, W, S, S, Q, E, Q, E, ESC, ENTER</li></ul><h2>PC Requirements</h2><ul><li>Windows 98/ME/2000/XP</li><li>1 GHz Pentium III (minimum) or 1.4 GHz Pentium 4 (recommended)</li><li>256 MB RAM (minimum) or 512 MB RAM (recommended)</li><li>4X CD-ROM drive or 2X DVD-ROM drive (minimum)</li><li>32 MB DirectX 8.1b compatible 3D graphics card (minimum)</li><li>DirectX 8.1 compatible sound card</li><li>4.7 GB hard drive space (minimum)</li></ul>", "deck": in a local shopping mall.", "aliases": "SH3", "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/8/87790/2360880-box_sh3.png", "medium_url": "expected_release_year": null, "id": 10369, "resource_type": "game", "name": "Silent Hill 3"}, "platform": "PS2", "title": "Silent Hill 3"}
{"duration": "1:05:00", "runner": "Bawkbasoup", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/resident-evil-2/3030-9418/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/10354/2767989-resident-evil-claire-chris.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2767989\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/10354/2767989-resident-evil-claire-chris.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2767989\"><img src=\"/uploads/scale_small/1/10354/2767989-resident-evil-claire-chris.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Resident Evil 2 (or Biohazard 2 in Japan) is a <a href=\"/survival-horror/3015-4801\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4801\">survival horror </a>game that was originally released in 1998 by <a href=\"/capcom/3010-367\" data-ref-id=\"3010-367\">Capcom</a>.
