Launcher</h3><ul><li><u>Ammunition Types</u>: Explosive Grenades, Phosphorous Grenades</li></ul> Capable of delivering two varieties of heavy ordinance, the double-barreled Grenade Launcher is a powerful tool that unloads two grenades with each shot. High explosive rounds create devastating concussive blasts, while phosphorous rounds create intense flames around their point of impact that are quite adept at killing clustered groups of enemies in a single volley. Whichever variety is being used, it is advisable to stand well outside of the targeted area when firing, and to be mindful of grenade trajectory as well.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 148px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092673-flamethrower.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092673\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.69594594594595\" data-width=\"148\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:69.6%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092673-flamethrower.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092673\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092673-flamethrower.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092673-flamethrower.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Flamethrower</figcaption></figure></td><td><figure style=\"width: 84px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092674-flamethrower_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092674\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.38095238095238\" data-width=\"84\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:38.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092674-flamethrower_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092674\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092674-flamethrower_icon.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092674-flamethrower_icon.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Flamethrower Icon</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Flamethrower</h3><ul><li><u>Ammunition Type</u>: Energy Cells</li></ul> The Flamethrower is a short-range weapon that excels in handling individual foes, though it regrettably loses some of its punch when multiple hostiles are present. Even against larger foes (including some bosses), the Flamethrower deals enough sustained damage to prevent an enemy from being able to counterattack. Once additional enemies enter the equation, though, its ability to stun lock a single foe is not as attractive, as there are other weapons that are more conducive to crowd control.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 270px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092681-mauler.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092681\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.36666666666667\" data-width=\"270\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:36.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092681-mauler.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092681\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092681-mauler.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092681-mauler.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mauler</figcaption></figure></td><td><figure style=\"width: 96px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092682-mauler_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092682\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.33333333333333\" data-width=\"96\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:33.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092682-mauler_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092682\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092682-mauler_icon.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092682-mauler_icon.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mauler Icon</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Mauler</h3><ul><li><u>Ammunition Type</u>: Energy Cells, Hit Points</li></ul> Exemplifying the pinnacle of man-made weaponry in Strife, the Mauler is a heavy weapon with two firing methods. In primary mode, the Mauler functions as an energy-based shotgun that can tear apart most foes with a few hits, while its secondary firing mode expels a <a href=\"/bfg9000/3055-26\" data-ref-id=\"3055-26\">BFG</a>-like green plasma ball that is nearly guaranteed to kill a target upon direct hit, though it also costs the player health to use it. Upon impact, the plasma ball will release a secondary shock wave that damages those near the blast, including the player if they are too close.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 191px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092694-sigil.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092694\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.52879581151832\" data-width=\"191\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:52.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092694-sigil.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092694\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092694-sigil.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092694-sigil.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Completed Sigil</figcaption></figure></td><td><figure style=\"width: 42px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092695-sigil_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092695\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4285714285714\" data-width=\"42\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:142.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092695-sigil_icon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092695\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092695-sigil_icon.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092695-sigil_icon.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Sigil Icon</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>The Sigil</h3><ul><li><u>Ammunition Type</u>: Hit Points</li></ul> Representing advanced and poorly-understood alien technology, The Sigil (also known as The Sigil of The One God) is both a tool of destruction and an object of reverence for the cultlike Order. It is the key to defeating the force behind The Order and the plague, and as such The Order has split it into five pieces, with each being entrusted to an important person within their hierarchy. The device grows in strength with each fragment the player collects, and it is not until all five have been assembled that the doorway to the final encounter can be opened. Depending upon its level of completion, The Sigil consumes between four and twenty hit points per use.<br /><b>Phases</b><br /><ul><li><u>One Piece</u>: Causes lightning bolts to fall within a radius of the targeted area.</li><li><u>Two Pieces</u>: Casts a single lighting bolt from the user toward a target.</li><li><u>Three Pieces</u>: Projects a stream of ball lightning in a 180\u00b0 arc in front of the player.</li><li><u>Four Pieces</u>: Propels a lighting bolt toward a target which has tracking capability.</li><li><u>Five Pieces</u>: Releases a ball of lightning that additional lightning bolts emanate from.</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Items</h2><p>Strife uses a player inventory system similar in style to that of Raven's <a href=\"/heretic/3030-10469\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10469\">Heretic</a>. Upon pickup, most usable items will go into the player's inventory rather than being consumed outright. The game will automatically activate certain health and armor items if the player's hit points drop below a certain threshold or their armor points have been reduced to zero, though aside from this it is up to the player to decide when best to use their accumulated items. Health packs, armor, and other beneficial items can often be found in the field, though the game also encourages the player to plan ahead for their next mission by purchasing items from various shops within its hub areas. Most support items that can be found in the world can also be acquired through vendors, and, if the player has enough money, it is often much more convenient to obtain rarer items this way than to search for them within the environment.</p><h3><u>Health &amp; Armor</u></h3><table><tbody><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 48px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092684-med_patch.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092684\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:50.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092684-med_patch.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092684\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092684-med_patch.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092684-med_patch.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Med Patch</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Med Patch</h3> The default unit of healing within Strife is the Med Patch, which restores up to ten hit points to the player per use. The amount healed may never exceed the player's maximum hit point capacity, which is the sum of their initial hit point value (100) and their current stamina value (between zero and 100). Up to twenty can be held at one time.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 40px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092683-med_kit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092683\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.2\" data-width=\"40\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:120.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092683-med_kit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092683\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092683-med_kit.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092683-med_kit.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Med Kit</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Med Kit</h3> The upgraded version of the Med Patch restores a potential of twenty-five hit points upon use, up to but not in excess of the player's health cap. Up to fifteen can be stored in inventory for later use, and Med Kits are the preferred health item to be used (provided they are available) by the game's automatic health recovery system.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 64px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092699-surgery_kit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092699\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"64\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092699-surgery_kit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092699\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092699-surgery_kit.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092699-surgery_kit.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Field Surgery Kit</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Field Surgery Kit</h3> As Strife's ultimate in health restoratives, the Field Surgery Kit automatically boosts the player to full health, regardless of their current hit points. As the player's health cap gradually increases over the course of the game, they become increasingly useful, though unlike Med Patches and Med Kits, Field Surgery Kits must always be used manually.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 64px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092672-enviro_suit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092672\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5\" data-width=\"64\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:50.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092672-enviro_suit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092672\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092672-enviro_suit.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092672-enviro_suit.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Environmental Suit</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Environmental Suit</h3> Under normal circumstances, biohazardous materials (which are brought to the player's attention by way of intermittent green flashes) will gradually reduce hit points after thirty seconds of exposure. The Environmental Suit will prevent this type of damage from occurring, and additionally nullifies all damage from the Crusader's flamethrower attack.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 48px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092678-leather_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092678\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092678-leather_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092678\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092678-leather_armor.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092678-leather_armor.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Leather Armor</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Leather Armor</h3> Strife's standard unit of protection, Leather Armor grants 100 armor points while reducing all damage taken by a third. Leather Armor can be purchased rather inexpensively while in town, and up to five sets can be stacked in the player's inventory for use at a later time. It is used automatically upon reaching zero armor points if Metal Armor is unavailable.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 48px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092685-metal_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092685\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092685-metal_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092685\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092685-metal_armor.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092685-metal_armor.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Metal Armor</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Metal Armor</h3> The superior of Strife's two physical armor types, Metal Armor bestows 200 armor points and halves all damage received. It is somewhat more expensive to purchase, though it should be noted that it also last longer and offers greater protection. Up to three sets can be carried on top of whatever armor type the player might currently be wearing.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 48px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092693-shadow_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092693\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.3333333333333\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:133.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092693-shadow_armor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092693\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092693-shadow_armor.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092693-shadow_armor.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Shadow Armor</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Shadow Armor</h3> A player can hold up to two sets of Shadow Armor at a given time, and may use one to gain partial invisibility for a fifty-second duration. After activating the first set, if the player is in possession of a second set, and activates it while the first is still in effect, they will become fully invisible and also immune to damage for a short period of time.</td></tr></tbody></table><h3><u>Miscellaneous</u></h3><table><tbody><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 32px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092669-currency.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092669\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"32\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092669-currency.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092669\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092669-currency.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092669-currency.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Currency</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Currency</h3> Money is obtained in a number of ways throughout Strife, but completing missions is certainly the largest and most consistent source of income. Spending this currency is one of the player's primary goals between missions, and while certain items are universally useful, its best use is also heavily dependent on individual play style.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 28px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092665-com_unit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092665\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"28\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092665-com_unit.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092665\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092665-com_unit.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092665-com_unit.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Com Unit</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Com Unit</h3> Given to the player early on, the Com Unit is the main means of communication with The Front when not at one of their strongholds. Blackbird, the player's handler, frequently uses it to keep the wanderer updated with important mission-specific information, though she just as often utilizes it as a means to interject her own thoughts on a particular situation.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 48px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092661-ammo_satchel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092661\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"48\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092661-ammo_satchel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092661\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092661-ammo_satchel.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092661-ammo_satchel.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Ammo Satchel</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Ammo Satchel</h3> The Ammo Satchel functions exactly as the Doom Backpack does by permanently doubling the maximum ammo capacity of the player. This is one of the more common-sense early upgrade that the player can purchase, as it allows more ammo to be picked up while on missions, thus reducing the need to purchase ammo when outside of them.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 26px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092700-targeter.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092700\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.76923076923077\" data-width=\"26\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:76.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092700-targeter.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092700\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092700-targeter.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092700-targeter.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Targeter</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Targeter</h3> Using the Targeter causes a reticle framed by two bars to appear when using any ranged weapon save for The Sigil. The distance of the two bars from the central targeting reticle is determined by the player's accuracy statistic, and is meant to convey an accurate sense of the weapon's field of fire when accounting for the possibly of errant shots.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 38px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092701-teleport_beacon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092701\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.6842105263158\" data-width=\"38\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:168.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092701-teleport_beacon.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092701\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092701-teleport_beacon.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092701-teleport_beacon.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Teleporter Beacon</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Teleporter Beacon</h3> The Teleporter Beacon is a support item that, when placed, can spawn up to six friendly resistance fighters to its location. Naturally, these Front soldiers will do their best to attack any enemies nearby. While reinforcements do not trigger alarms, any creatures triggered by them will attack the player as well, which may force the player in turn to break stealth.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 56px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092680-map.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092680\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.96428571428571\" data-width=\"56\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:96.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092680-map.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092680\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092680-map.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092680-map.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Map</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Map</h3> Reminiscent in effect (and appearance) to the Doom Computer Map power-up, the Map reveals the entirety of a specific level's layout to the player by way of their <a href=\"/automap/3015-3689\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3689\">automap</a>. Each instance of the Map power-up will only reveal the map layout for a single level, and unlike most items, it is automatically used once the player picks it up.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 58px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092691-scanner.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092691\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.75862068965517\" data-width=\"58\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092691-scanner.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092691\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092691-scanner.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092691-scanner.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Scanner</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Scanner</h3> The Scanner pickup is unique in that it is the only inventory item which requires the possession of another item, namely the Map, before it can be used. Once activated, a wealth of additional information is displayed for the player via their automap, including the locations of enemies, items, and other entities, though this lasts for scarcely more than a minute.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 58px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092670-degnin_ore.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092670\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.55172413793103\" data-width=\"58\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092670-degnin_ore.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092670\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092670-degnin_ore.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092670-degnin_ore.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Degnin Ore</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Degnin Ore</h3> Found within the mines adjacent to the Order Commons, Degnin Ore possesses special properties that allow it to emit a powerful magnetic blast under the right circumstances. By placing it on the ground and shooting it with any weapon, it is possible to use it as an improvised land mine, and it will also disable force fields if detonated close enough to them.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 28px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092659-accu_booster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092659\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.1428571428571\" data-width=\"28\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:114.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092659-accu_booster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092659\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092659-accu_booster.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092659-accu_booster.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Accuracy Booster</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Accuracy Booster</h3> The rare Accuracy Booster item does nothing in and of itself, however it can be turned in at a friendly weapon trainer in order to increase one's accuracy rating. Once done, this raises accuracy by ten points, improving overall skill with most ranged weapons. This improvement is most noticeable with rapid-fire weapons such as the Assault Gun.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 28px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092698-stam_booster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092698\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.1428571428571\" data-width=\"28\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:114.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092698-stam_booster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092698\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092698-stam_booster.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092698-stam_booster.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Stamina Booster</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Stamina Booster</h3> The Stamina Booster is quite similar vis-\u00e0-vis the Accuracy Booster, being essentially a voucher to be turned in in exchange for a service. The service in this instance is a ten point increase in stamina, which directly boosts the player's maximum hit points. Higher stamina values also cause the Punch Dagger to do far more damage than usual.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Enemies</h2><p>Opposition in Strife takes various forms, though no matter the size and shape, they are all affiliates of The Order and its agenda. One commonality between them is the use of cybernetic or robotic components, as The Order seems to view traditional human biology as imperfect. Many of The Order's agents are a hybrid of man and machine, while others are completely devoid of any identifiable human components. Having their basis in the worship of The One God, The Order has also taken to lending the names of many of its creations an overtly religious bent, with titles like Crusader and Acolyte likely intended to cement the righteousness of its cause in the minds of The Order's followers. In total, Strife includes eight standard foes that are encountered with varying degrees of frequency, and five boss-level opponents that are either entirely unique or seen only on rare occasions. Initiates within The Order tend to be the most identifiably human, whereas it is not uncommon for higher-ranking foes to incorporate mechanical or alien physiology to a much larger degree.</p><h3><u>Standard Enemies</u></h3><table><tbody><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 60px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092703-turret.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092703\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5\" data-width=\"60\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:50.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092703-turret.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092703\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092703-turret.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092703-turret.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Turret</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Turret</h3> Encountered frequently throughout the game, Turrets are placed in any area The Order wishes to protect from encroachment. They are not extremely durable or powerful, though they can still be somewhat vexing, as oftentimes they are easy to miss, especially when other enemies are attacking. Another problem when encountering them is positioning, as the fact that they are ceiling-mounted can make them difficult to target in many instances. As defensive constructs, if no general alert has been raised, Turrets will not attack the player, though once they have been activated, they will open fire whenever the player is within its line-of-sight.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 64px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092660-acolyte.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092660\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.9375\" data-width=\"64\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:193.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092660-acolyte.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092660\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092660-acolyte.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092660-acolyte.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Acolyte</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Acolyte</h3> Acting as The Order's standard grunt, the Acolyte is a cybernetically \"enhanced\" human that follows its directives without question. They are seen in significant numbers in Strife from beginning to end, and several different varieties of Acolyte exist, being distinguished from one another primarily by slight variations in color. Regardless of appearance, all Acolytes behave similarly, and are equipped with an Assault Gun and a shield (though the latter does not appear to offer any real damage mitigation). As is evidenced by their susceptibility to poison bolts, Acolytes still rely to a significant degree upon normal biological functions in order to survive, which is uncommon among Order enemies.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 126px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092697-stalker.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092697\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.3968253968254\" data-width=\"126\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:39.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092697-stalker.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092697\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092697-stalker.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092697-stalker.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Stalker</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Stalker</h3> The spiderlike Stalker (aka the Hatspider) is a melee enemy with the ability to cling to ceilings and drop down on top of its victim. While positioned above the player, they can at times be hard to target in much the same way that Turrets can, though thankfully it is under normal circumstances quite clear that there are Stalkers about due to the distinctive sound they make when walking. When on the ground, their relatively low health and lack of ranged options makes them fairly simple to deal with, though if they catch the player unawares by attacking from the back or sides, they can do a considerable amount of damage in a short span of time.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 90px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092692-sentinel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092692\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.86666666666667\" data-width=\"90\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:86.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092692-sentinel.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092692\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092692-sentinel.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092692-sentinel.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Sentinel</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Sentinel</h3> Best thought of as levitating mobile Turrets, the spheroid Sentinels will go hostile upon sighting the player regardless of the current threat level for the area. Due to their aerial nature, they are able to pursue a foes in ways that most Order drones cannot. They are, however, possessed of a somewhat sluggish pace, and by themselves, they don't present much of a threat with their middling hit points and moderately damaging attack. In groups, they can present more of a challenge, and much like Turrets and Hatspiders, Sentinels are at their most troublesome when attacking from high positions which aren't naturally easy to target.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 120px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092690-reaver.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092690\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.95\" data-width=\"120\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:95.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092690-reaver.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092690\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092690-reaver.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092690-reaver.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Reaver</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Reaver</h3> The mechanoid Reaver occupies the middle ground within Strife's enemy menagerie, with more durability and damage potential than lighter entrants, but less lethal weaponry and hit points than the game's true heavy hitters. The one area in which it truly excels is it speed. Reavers are perhaps the fastest enemy in the game, capable of firing upon the player from afar before closing the distance to attack within melee range. In fact, their affinity for close-quarters fights can lead to trouble for more careless players, as their death animation involves a rupture and explosion of their internal components, which can cause damage to anything nearby.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 88px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092702-templar.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092702\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.3409090909091\" data-width=\"88\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:134.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092702-templar.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092702\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092702-templar.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092702-templar.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Templar</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Templar</h3> A Templar is a human body encased within a large, mechanical, humanoid exoskeleton. They each come with a Mauler (used in it primary mode) and several hundred hit points, and for these two reasons they are to be taken seriously. Their main attack essentially behaves as a shotgun would, so keeping one's distance is one of the best means of mitigating damage when fighting them. Heavier weapons are usually preferred against them due to their durability and substantial pool of health. They possess an additional pair of claw arms for melee attacks when the player gets close to them, though ideally one should stay well outside of this range.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 162px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092668-crusader.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092668\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.79012345679012\" data-width=\"162\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:79.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092668-crusader.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092668\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092668-crusader.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092668-crusader.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Crusader</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Crusader</h3> The deadly Crusader is a massive bipedal automaton that protects areas of crucial significance to The Order. Places in which they patrol are off limits to all but those who are trusted members of The Order, thus they will attack unknown personnel on sight even when unprovoked. Each of the Crusader's arms is affixed with a different weapon, which it alternates between depending on the circumstances. At a distance, it utilizes a triple-rocket launcher, while in close it possesses a potent flamethrower attack. Thankfully, the Crusader is a good wide target, so staying safely behind cover and attacking effectively while at range is not especially difficult.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 294px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092677-inquisitor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092677\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.83673469387755\" data-width=\"294\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:83.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092677-inquisitor.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092677\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092677-inquisitor.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092677-inquisitor.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Inquisitor</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Inquisitor</h3> The pinnacle of automated Order technology, the skyscraping Inquisitor is a walking army, a veritable ambulatory weapons platform capable of killing even a healthy player within seconds. It is equipped both with a Mauler and a Grenade Launcher, and the latter is, of the two, the one to be most feared. As if high explosives and advanced energy weaponry wasn't enough, the Inquisitor is also surprisingly mobile due to the inclusion of jump jets that allow it to scale walls or cross chasms that other foes might not be able to. Needless to say, using the best weaponry available in order to take it down quickly is highly recommended when encountering an Inquisitor.</td></tr></tbody></table><h3><u>Bosses</u></h3><table><tbody><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 280px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092688-programmer.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092688\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.67142857142857\" data-width=\"280\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:67.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092688-programmer.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092688\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092688-programmer.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092688-programmer.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Programmer</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>The Programmer</h3> The individual supposedly responsible for coding the control program that keeps The Order's Acolytes in line, The Programmer is Strife's first boss enemy and also the first Sigil-bearer the player will face (his Sigil piece can in fact be seen around his neck). Compared to later bosses, The Programmer's attack is fairly easy to avoid, as it affects a fixed position on the ground rather than targeting the player. He is also notable for being the only non-Spectre boss in the game (aside from the final boss) without a secondary Spectre form. This is likely due to the fact that the player lacks any Sigil pieces at the time he is encountered, as they are requisite items when fighting Spectres.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 116px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092664-bishop.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092664\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.948275862069\" data-width=\"116\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:194.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092664-bishop.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092664\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092664-bishop.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092664-bishop.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Bishop</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>The Bishop</h3> Being half human and half machine, The Bishop is The Order's primary military commander, and also a formidable opponent by himself. He bears the second of the game's Sigil pieces around his neck and hoists a rocket launcher over his right shoulder. The rockets he fires have heat-seeking capabilities, so smart use of cover is very important when tackling him. Contrary to what might be expected, he goes down faster than the previously-encountered Programmer, though upon death he releases a Spectre which had been inhabiting his body. Once the Spectre is defeated as well, the player gains their second Sigil Piece.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 64px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092679-loremaster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092679\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"2\" data-width=\"64\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:200.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092679-loremaster.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092679\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092679-loremaster.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092679-loremaster.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Loremaster</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>The Loremaster</h3> The Order's spiritual leader and the most exalted personage in their religion (save for The One God itself), The Loremaster is encountered close to the game's climax deep within an Order laboratory. He is able to levitate above the battlefield and damages the player primarily by grabbing them with a hooklike projectile and flinging them across the arena. While not the most difficult of foes to defeat, his inner sanctum is guarded by two Inquisitors, and furthermore he unleashes upon death the most powerful Spectre in the game, one that possesses the power of the completed symbol and has more hit points than any previous Spectre.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 316px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092696-spectre.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092696\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.58227848101266\" data-width=\"316\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:58.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092696-spectre.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092696\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092696-spectre.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092696-spectre.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Spectre</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>Spectre</h3> The Spectres are bizarre, amorphous, floating creatures that are encountered a total of five times throughout Strife. They are physical representations of the corruption that has infested The Order, and their apparent purpose within the world is to inhabit the corporeal forms of important individuals in order to bend them toward the will of The One God. Four out of the five Spectres appear after a specified character has been killed, indicating that that person had been possessed. Each of the five uses an attack that corresponds with one of the five phases of The Sigil, and due to their nature, only The Sigil is capable of defeating them. In many cases, the player gains a Sigil piece as a direct result of killing a Spectre.</td></tr><tr><td><figure style=\"width: 320px\" data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092671-entity.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092671\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.74074074074074\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/11/118253/2092671-entity.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2092671\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092671-entity.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/11/118253/2092671-entity.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The Entity</figcaption></figure></td><td><h3>The Entity</h3> The Entity (or The One God, as he is known by The Order) is an extraterrestrial being that is eventually revealed to be the driving force behind The Order's mad crusade. After The Loremaster's demise, it is unveiled that he protected the entrance to a downed spacecraft (presumably the comet mentioned at the beginning of the game). If the player has collected all pieces of The Sigil at this point, it is possible to enter this ship and confront The Entity within its own lair. After expressing displeasure at the unraveling of its plans, The Entity assaults the player in a boss battle that is similar to the previous Spectre fights. Only the completed Sigil is capable of damaging it.</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>Source Ports</h2><p>While the original source code for Strife has never been released, and is now presumably lost forever due to the closure of Rogue Entertainment, enterprising <a href=\"/source-port/3015-4367\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4367\">source port</a> engine authors have been able to take advantage of the shared code between Strife and Doom to reverse engineer compatibility for the engine. At the present time, several source ports exist which allow the game to be played on modern systems, from those which include a range of features not present in the original game, like <a href=\"http://zdoom.org\" rel=\"nofollow\">ZDoom</a>, to those that attempt to emulate the exact performance of the original game executable, such as <a href=\"http://www.chocolate-doom.org/wiki/index.php?title=Strife-branch&amp;redirect=no\" rel=\"nofollow\">Chocolate Strife </a>(which was the basis for Night Dive Studios' Veteran Edition, released in 2014).</p>", "deck": "Strife is a first-person action game based on id's Doom engine that is notable for marrying a number of role-playing mechanics with its shooter gameplay, including NPC interaction, skill progression, and item vendors.", "aliases": null, "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "tiny_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "thumb_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_avatar/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "screen_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/screen_medium/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg", "super_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_large/3/33863/1452286-strife_box_cover.jpg"}, "date_last_updated": "2015-04-14 09:24:44", "expected_release_month": null, "api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-10565/", "number_of_user_reviews": 1, "original_release_date": "1996-05-15 00:00:00", "original_game_rating": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/game_rating/3065-5/", "id": 5, "name": "BBFC: 15"}], "date_added": "2008-04-01 15:55:34", "platforms": [{"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-17/", "abbreviation": "MAC", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/mac/3045-17/", "id": 17, "name": "Mac"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-94/", "abbreviation": "PC", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/pc/3045-94/", "id": 94, "name": "PC"}, {"api_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/api/platform/3045-152/", "abbreviation": "LIN", "site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/linux/3045-152/", "id": 152, "name": "Linux"}], "expected_release_day": null, "expected_release_year": null, "id": 10565, "resource_type": "game", "name": "Strife"}, "platform": "PC", "title": "Strife"}
{"duration": "0:45:00", "runner": "Cubeface", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/hexen/3030-22548/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4865/853045-gfs_67985_2_6.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-853045\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 319px\" data-ratio=\"0.74921630094044\" data-width=\"319\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4865/853045-gfs_67985_2_6.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-853045\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4865/853045-gfs_67985_2_6.jpg\"/></a></figure><p>Hexen (sometimes known as HeXen: Beyond Heretic) is a fantasy <a data-ref-id=\"3015-330\" href=\"/first-person-perspective/3015-330\">first-person</a> shooter developed by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-1841\" href=\"/raven-software/3010-1841\">Raven</a> and published by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-347\" href=\"/id-software/3010-347\">id</a> on October 30, 1995 for the <a data-ref-id=\"3045-94\" href=\"/pc/3045-94\">PC</a>. It is the second game in the <a data-ref-id=\"3025-302\" href=\"/heretic/3025-302\">Serpent Riders</a> trilogy (between <a data-ref-id=\"3030-10469\" href=\"/heretic/3030-10469\">Heretic</a> and <a data-ref-id=\"3030-15660\" href=\"/hexen-ii/3030-15660\">Hexen II</a>). The story takes place in the realm of <a data-ref-id=\"3035-2192\" href=\"/cronos/3035-2192\">Cronos,</a> which was overtaken by the Serpent Rider <a data-ref-id=\"3005-10592\" href=\"/korax/3005-10592\">Korax</a>. The player controls one of three <a data-ref-id=\"3015-315\" href=\"/heroes/3015-315\">heroes</a> ( <a data-ref-id=\"3005-10604\" href=\"/baratus/3005-10604\">Baratus</a> <a data-ref-id=\"3015-2648\" href=\"/fighter/3015-2648\">the Fighter</a>, <a data-ref-id=\"3005-10606\" href=\"/parias/3005-10606\">Parias</a> <a data-ref-id=\"3015-4055\" href=\"/clerics/3015-4055\">the Cleric</a>, or <a data-ref-id=\"3005-10605\" href=\"/daedolon/3005-10605\">Daedolon</a> <a data-ref-id=\"3015-1694\" href=\"/wizards/3015-1694\">the Mage</a>) as they set out to destroy Korax.</p><p>The game builds upon the same engine used in Heretic (which uses a heavily-modified <a data-ref-id=\"3015-3803\" href=\"/id-tech-1/3015-3803\">id Tech 1</a>, the same engine used in <a data-ref-id=\"3030-7326\" href=\"/doom/3030-7326\">Doom</a>). In addition to the modifications found in Heretic, Hexen also includes <a data-ref-id=\"3015-379\" href=\"/jump/3015-379\">jumping</a>, <a data-ref-id=\"3015-405\" href=\"/classes/3015-405\">multiple classes</a>, rotating/moveable walls, <a data-ref-id=\"3015-1551\" href=\"/weather/3015-1551\">weather effects</a>, a level scripting system, <a data-ref-id=\"3055-2133\" href=\"/compact-disc/3055-2133\">CD</a> audio, FMV <a data-ref-id=\"3015-22\" href=\"/cutscene/3015-22\">cutscenes</a> (for the CD version only), eight player multiplayer, and a system of interconnected levels (called \"hubs\"). The source code for this engine was released twice: one in 1999 under a restrictive license and one in 2008 under the GNU General Public License.</p><p>The game was published for the <a data-ref-id=\"3045-17\" href=\"/mac/3045-17\">Mac</a> in 1996 by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-479\" href=\"/gt-interactive-software-corp/3010-479\">GT Interactive</a> (who also oversaw distribution of the PC version). In early 1997, the game was ported to the <a data-ref-id=\"3045-43\" href=\"/nintendo-64/3045-43\">Nintendo 64</a>, <a data-ref-id=\"3045-22\" href=\"/playstation/3045-22\">PlayStation</a>, and <a data-ref-id=\"3045-42\" href=\"/saturn/3045-42\">Sega Saturn</a> (all which were published by GT Interactive). The Nintendo 64 version, ported by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-6069\" href=\"/acclaim-studios-manchester/3010-6069\">Software Creations</a>, includes <a data-ref-id=\"3015-322\" href=\"/split-screen-multiplayer/3015-322\">split-screen multi-player</a> ( <a data-ref-id=\"3015-2563\" href=\"/4-player-co-op/3015-2563\">for up to four players</a>) and text narratives in the <a data-ref-id=\"3015-106\" href=\"/loading-screens/3015-106\">loading screens</a> of each level (describing each level). The PlayStation and Sega Saturn versions were ported by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-89\" href=\"/acclaim-studios-cheltenham/3010-89\">Probe</a>, and includes graphical restrictions (less detailed architecture, less monster sprites, etc.) and lower frame rate. The PlayStation version does not support multi-player, while the Sega Saturn version includes two-player link-up multiplayer only accessible via a hidden <a data-ref-id=\"3015-237\" href=\"/cheat-code/3015-237\">cheat code</a>.</p><h2>Characters</h2><p>Hexen was one of the first first-person shooters to let the player choose between one of three unique classes, each with their own unique attributes, weapons, and item effects.</p><h3><a data-ref-id=\"3005-10604\" href=\"/baratus/3005-10604\"><b>Fighter</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969394-menu_fighter.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969394\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 224px\" data-ratio=\"1.21875\" data-width=\"224\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:121.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969394-menu_fighter.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969394\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34856/969394-menu_fighter.png\"/></a></figure><p>Tougher and more agile than the other classes, the fighter specializes in melee combat. His only weakness is his lack of ranged attacks.</p><ul><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2017\" href=\"/spiked-gauntlets/3055-2017\"><b>Spiked Gauntlets</b></a> - The fighter's starting weapon. Deals three powerful punches in quick succession at very close range.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2018\" href=\"/timons-axe/3055-2018\"><b>Timon's Axe</b></a> - Its power and effectiveness is determined by how much blue mana you have. Although you do not need blue mana to swing the weapon, blue mana is required for a powerful electric swing.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2019\" href=\"/hammer-of-retribution/3055-2019\"><b>Hammer of Retribution</b></a> - On close range, it's slow and does great damage. But if you have green mana, the hammer can fire an exploding projectile, making it an ideal long-range weapon for the class.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2020\" href=\"/quietus/3055-2020\"><b>Quietus</b></a> - A big sword surrounded by green flames. Throws five green fireballs across the screen in a single swing. Uses up both green and blue mana and cannot be used like a melee weapon.</li></ul><h3><a data-ref-id=\"3005-10606\" href=\"/parias/3005-10606\"><b>Cleric</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969396-menu_cleric.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969396\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 224px\" data-ratio=\"1.2142857142857\" data-width=\"224\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:121.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969396-menu_cleric.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969396\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34856/969396-menu_cleric.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34856/969396-menu_cleric.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Despite the class name, the cleric does not heal others. A balanced character with a lot of specialized weapons.</p><ul><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2124\" href=\"/mace-of-contrition/3055-2124\"><b>Mace of Contrition</b></a> - Although it is less powerful than the fighter's spiked gauntlets, this mace has a longer range.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2127\" href=\"/serpent-staff/3055-2127\"><b>Serpent Staff</b></a> - Uses blue mana for two purposes. At long range, it fires two green fireballs in a wave that, while weak, deals poisonous damage. At short range, it drains the health of the opponent, healing you in the process.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2128\" href=\"/firestorm/3055-2128\"><b>Firestorm</b></a> - Uses green mana to shoot a streak of fire from your hands across a set distance, causing explosion damage in the process.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2132\" href=\"/wraithverge/3055-2132\"><b>Wraithverge</b></a> - Uses both blue and green mana to fire a gray cloud that immediately splits into four powerful ghosts. Shrieking, these fast ghosts lock in to enemies and drain a lot of damage before moving on to the next enemy. (Or disappearing once the attack is over)</li></ul><h3><a data-ref-id=\"3005-10605\" href=\"/daedolon/3005-10605\"><b>Mage</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969395-menu_mage.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969395\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 224px\" data-ratio=\"1.2142857142857\" data-width=\"224\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:121.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34856/969395-menu_mage.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-969395\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34856/969395-menu_mage.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/3/34856/969395-menu_mage.png\"/></noscript></a></figure><p>Weak and slow, the mage specializes in powerful long-range weapons.</p><ul><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2038\" href=\"/sapphire-wand/3055-2038\"><b>Sapphire Wand</b></a> - Similar to the starting weapon in Heretic, this wand fires weak (but fast) energy blasts. It has infinite ammo, even though it's a long-range weapon.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2039\" href=\"/frost-shards/3055-2039\"><b>Frost Shards</b></a> - Uses blue mana to fire a blast of ice shards in a diamond formation from your hand. When the enemy dies from it, it freezes and then shatters.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2040\" href=\"/arc-of-death/3055-2040\"><b>Arc of Death</b></a> - Uses green mana to fire a powerful bolt of electricity from your hand. The bolt follows a straight path along both the floor and the ceiling, over cliff sides and under arches before reaching an enemy, dealing electrical damage to that enemy.</li><li><a data-ref-id=\"3055-2041\" href=\"/bloodscourge/3055-2041\"><b>Bloodscourge</b></a> - Uses both blue and green mana to fire three incredibly powerful fireballs.</li></ul><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>Hexen splits the levels into five key episodes, also known as \"hubs.\" Each episode requires you to solve a very large puzzle.</p><ul><li><p><b>Seven Portals</b> - After completing the prologue level (Winnowing Hall), players must venture through the guardians of Fire, Ice, and Steel to open all seven gates.</p></li><li><p><b>Shadow Wood</b> - Players must access a temple by finding the right keys in the Darkmere swamp, the rocky Wastelands, and the Caves of Circe. At the end, you must fight the Death Wyvern.</p></li><li><p><b>Heresiarch's Seminary</b> - Players must find gems in the Silent Refectory and the Orchard of Lamentations and place them in an astrological chart, then solve the puzzles of the Wolf, Dragon, and Griffin chapels. After solving these puzzles, you fight the first Heresiarch.</p></li><li><p><b>Castle of Grief</b> - Players must repair a big clock by finding gears scattered across the castle. After getting the clock to work, you must solve a string of puzzles to reach a key to fight the second Heresiarch.</p></li><li><p><b>Necropolis</b> - Players must travel to the tombs of their former masters (brought back from the dead by Korax) and kill them. After that, you must travel to the Dark Crucible to face the final battle with Korax.</p></li></ul><p>Timon's Axe, Serpent Staff and Frozen Shards are first found in the Seven Portals episode. Hammer of Retribution, Firestorm, and Arc of Death are first found in the Shadow Wood episode. Quietus, Wraithverge, and Bloodscourge require three components scattered throughout the game. The first component is found in the Seven Portals, the second component is found in the Shadow Wood episode, the third component is found in the Heresiarch's Seminary episode, and all three components can be found in the secret level of the Castle of Grief episode.</p><p>The game also supports multiplayer in both co-operative and deathmatch settings for up to eight players. Some weapons, such as the Wraithverge, have been nerfed to keep deathmatch balanced.</p><h2>Deathkings of the Dark Citadel</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1678942-hexen_dkotdc.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1678942\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"1.159375\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:115.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/1678942-hexen_dkotdc.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1678942\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1678942-hexen_dkotdc.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/1678942-hexen_dkotdc.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Box art for Deathkings of the Dark Citadel</figcaption></figure><p>Hexen received one official expansion pack, named <a data-ref-id=\"3030-10220\" href=\"/hexen-deathkings-of-the-dark-citadel/3030-10220\">Deathkings of the Dark Citadel</a>. Requiring the original Hexen to play, it added 20 new levels, split into three hubs, with new puzzles. It also featured six new deathmatch levels. The hubs include:</p><ul><li><b>Blight</b></li><li><b>Constable's Gate</b></li><li><b>Nave</b></li></ul>", "deck": "Hexen is a fantasy first-person shooter that builds upon its predecessor, Heretic, by incorporating three character classes, multi-level puzzles, and eight-player network play.", "aliases": "Hexen: Beyond Heretic", "image": {"icon_url":
