Jedi Academy"}, "platform": "PC", "title": "Star Wars: Jedi Knight - Jedi Academy"}
{"duration": "1:40:00", "runner": "glasnonck", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/star-wars-knights-of-the-old-republic/3030-18741/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Star Wars: Knights of the old Republic is a role-playing game developed by <a href=\"/bioware/3010-98\" data-ref-id=\"3010-98\">BioWare</a> using the <a href=\"/odyssey-engine/3015-1472\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1472\">Odyssey Engine</a> and published by <a href=\"/lucasarts-entertainment-company-llc/3010-644\" data-ref-id=\"3010-644\">LucasArts</a> for <a href=\"/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a> and <a href=\"/xbox/3045-32\" data-ref-id=\"3045-32\">Xbox</a> in 2003. A <a href=\"/mac/3045-17\" data-ref-id=\"3045-17\">Mac</a> version, developed and published by <a href=\"/aspyr-media-inc/3010-388\" data-ref-id=\"3010-388\">Aspyr</a>, was released in 2004 and an <a href=\"/iphone/3045-96\" data-ref-id=\"3045-96\">iOS</a> version, also by Aspyr, was released in 2013.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5150/2211210-swkotor_keyart_04.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2211210\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.58108108108108\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:58.1%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5150/2211210-swkotor_keyart_04.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2211210\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/5150/2211210-swkotor_keyart_04.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Darth Malak</figcaption></figure><p>Set thousands of years before the events of the original Star Wars trilogy, KOTOR has the player take on the role of a Republic solider, who eventually goes on to discover his <a href=\"/the-jedi/3015-655\" data-ref-id=\"3015-655\">Jedi</a> heritage, and confront the evil <a href=\"/sith/3015-1407\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1407\">Sith</a> Lord, <a href=\"/darth-malak/3005-1048\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1048\">Darth Malak</a>.</p><p>Because of the game's vast time gap from the events of the films, BioWare's writers had free reign to develop a completely new story that could be part of the Star Wars canon without having to draw directly from the films. The result is an RPG with many of the most common Star Wars themes, such as good versus evil, and tropes (everything from starships to <a href=\"/lightsaber/3055-70\" data-ref-id=\"3055-70\">lightsabers</a> are present).</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>KOTOR's gameplay consists of two parts, combat and dialog. The combat is <a href=\"/turn-based/3015-192\" data-ref-id=\"3015-192\">turn based</a>, although the animations give the illusion of <a href=\"/real-time-combat/3015-2332\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2332\">real-time combat</a>. The player may pause the game at any point during combat to get their bearings and rethink their strategy. The combat is based on Wizard of the Coast's d20 system. Your character may be equipped with a long-range weapon such as a <a href=\"/blaster/3055-478\" data-ref-id=\"3055-478\">blaster</a>, or a short-range weapon such as a <a href=\"/sword/3055-1\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1\">sword</a> or a <a href=\"/lightsaber/3055-70\" data-ref-id=\"3055-70\">lightsaber</a>. In addition to your weapons, you can use force powers that your character has learned throughout the course of the game, as well as those of your companions. Special combat moves such as \"Flurry\" may be activated at any time during combat, which will increase your attack speed, your damage, or your chance of dealing a critical hit. To unlock abilities such as these, one must earn them through points gained by leveling up. There is a good variety of abilities and there are many options for customizing a character to fit the desires of the player.</p><p>The other half of gameplay is the dialog where you interact with the NPC's through complex <a href=\"/dialogue-trees/3015-77\" data-ref-id=\"3015-77\">dialog trees</a>. The game allows for a wide range of <a href=\"/moral-decisions/3015-93\" data-ref-id=\"3015-93\">moral choices</a> and options so that even after multiple playthroughs new content may still be discovered. The player is encouraged to build an emotional connection with their companions by learning their back-stories and potentially even fall in love with them. The game tracks the player's choices throughout the game to determine their alignment to either the dark or light side. The player's alignment can alter the appearance of their character, and affects how companions react to you. All characters in KOTOR are voiced with exception of the main character, who remains unheard during dialogue sequences, though the player may hear numerous grunts and battles cries during combat.</p><h3>Character Creation</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/596651-facesoffemrevans.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-596651\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 190px\" data-ratio=\"1.6789473684211\" data-width=\"190\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:167.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/596651-facesoffemrevans.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-596651\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/118/596651-facesoffemrevans.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Female character faces</figcaption></figure><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/596652-facesofrevan.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-596652\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 190px\" data-ratio=\"1.6789473684211\" data-width=\"190\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:167.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/596652-facesofrevan.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-596652\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/118/596652-facesofrevan.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/118/596652-facesofrevan.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Male character faces</figcaption></figure><p>The main character in KOTOR has a <a href=\"/customizable-characters/3015-155\" data-ref-id=\"3015-155\">customizable appearance</a> and skillset, with the ability to be either male or female at the outset, as well as the choice of three player classes. Players were also asked to assign attributes to the character such as their Strength, Willpower and Intelligence.</p><p>The character creation system in KOTOR is drawn primarily from <a href=\"/wizards-of-the-coast-inc/3010-595\" data-ref-id=\"3010-595\">Wizards of the Coast's</a> paper and pencil d20 Star Wars RPG rules. Character classes, defense, hit points, feats, ability scores, experience points and even the level cap are all largely identical to the tabletop game.</p><p>Since the d20 system was used for third edition of <a href=\"/dungeons-dragons/3025-167\" data-ref-id=\"3025-167\">Dungeons and Dragons</a>, that means KOTOR is indirectly descended from <a href=\"/dungeons-dragons/3025-167\" data-ref-id=\"3025-167\">D&amp;D</a>, whose first edition tabletop rules formed the backbone of Bioware's <a href=\"/baldurs-gate/3025-44\" data-ref-id=\"3025-44\">Baldur's Gate series</a>.</p><h2>Story</h2><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3318/340593-screenshot13.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340593\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3318/340593-screenshot13.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-340593\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3318/340593-screenshot13.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3318/340593-screenshot13.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Sith Trooper</figcaption></figure><p>KOTOR is set immediately following the a war between the <a href=\"/mandalorian/3015-2770\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2770\">Mandalorians</a> and the <a href=\"/galactic-republic/3015-1230\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1230\">Old Republic</a>. The Jedi Council refused to allow Jedi to fight in the war with the Mandalorians which was going badly. A small group of Jedi, led by <a href=\"/darth-revan/3005-959\" data-ref-id=\"3005-959\">Revan</a> and <a href=\"/darth-malak/3005-1048\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1048\">Malak</a>, left to fight in the war anyway. Through their actions, they turned the tide of the war and won it, becoming heroes in the process. For reasons unknown at the time, Revan and Malak left known space leaving no traces. They returned as <a href=\"/sith/3015-1407\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1407\">Sith</a> and waged war against what remained of the Republic. In a moment of desperation, a Jedi strike force led by Jedi Knight <a href=\"/bastila-shan/3005-846\" data-ref-id=\"3005-846\">Bastila Shan</a> succeeded in boarding <a href=\"/darth-revan/3005-959\" data-ref-id=\"3005-959\">Revan's</a> ship but before he could be captured, Malak fired on his own master. The game opens as the Republic is on the verge of defeat by Malak's seemingly limitless forces.</p><blockquote><p>Four thousand years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, the Republic verges on collapse. DARTH MALAK, last surviving apprentice of the Dark Lord Revan, has unleashed an invincible <a href=\"/sith/3015-1407\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1407\">Sith</a> armada upon an unsuspecting galaxy.</p><p>Crushing all resistance, Malak's <a href=\"/great-jedi-purge/3015-3776\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3776\">war of conquest</a> has left the Jedi Order scattered and vulnerable as countless Knights fall in battle, and many more swear allegiance to the new <a href=\"/sith/3015-1407\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1407\">Sith</a> Master.</p><p>In the skies above the <a href=\"/outer-rim/3035-2059\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2059\">Outer Rim</a> world of Taris, a Jedi battle fleet engages the forces of Darth Malak in a desperate effort to halt the Sith's galactic domination\u2026</p><cite>Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Opening Crawl</cite></blockquote><p>After escaping from the tutorial area, players will learn of their Force-sensitivity, and begin training as a Jedi, under the tutelage of the Jedi masters on Dantooine. While learning the ways of the Force, the player will begin to have shared visions with Bastilla of mysterious ruins on the planet's surface, which they are sent to investigate. Here, they discover an ancient Rakatan Star Map, which alludes to something that Revan and Malak found called \"The Star Forge\". Fearing that the star forge is a weapon, Bastilla and the player analyze the Star map, noting several other planets which should have Star Maps on them, according to the original. After speaking to the Jedi Council, the pair is assigned to re-assemble the Star Map and ascertain the location of the <a href=\"/the-star-forge/3035-367\" data-ref-id=\"3035-367\">Star Forge</a>, so that the republic may destroy it. Setting off from Dantooine in the Ebon Hawk with the allies they gathered on Taris, the pair heads off in search of more Star Maps. The various Star Maps are located across various planets, which can be done in whatever order the player chooses, although set events will always happen on the player's first and third planets. </p><h3>Plot Twist</h3><p>While KOTOR is known for it's gameplay and remarkable story, it is also known to have one of the most unseen and best plot twists in any video game. In the closing hours of the main character's campaign, it is revealed to you that the player controlled character is not just a random soldier/scoundrel/scout but rather <a href=\"/darth-revan/3005-959\" data-ref-id=\"3005-959\">Darth Revan</a>, a dark lord of the <a href=\"/sith/3015-1407\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1407\">Sith</a>, and former master to the antagonist, <a href=\"/darth-malak/3005-1048\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1048\">Darth Malak</a>. Hints are dropped throughout the game, which you fully understand once playing through it again.</p><p>It is explained that the Jedi used the Force to wipe the main character's mind completely clean of knowledge of their past, and the knowledge of the Dark Side of the Force, and the Sith ways of using the force.</p><p>When this occurs, the player must choose how they receive this news. They can either choose to follow their dark past, or try to redeem themselves with the Light Side and Jedi. The canon path is the path of redemption (light side path).</p><h2>Planets</h2><p>KOTOR has several large planets populated with interactive NPC's that serve as the backdrop for the game. These planets are:</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5973/264733-32.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-264733\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/5973/264733-32.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-264733\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5973/264733-32.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/5973/264733-32.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Jedi Enclave on Dantooine</figcaption></figure><ul><li><a href=\"/taris/3035-394\" data-ref-id=\"3035-394\"><b>Taris</b></a> <b>:</b> The beginning area, a futuristic urban hub that is under blockade by the Sith armada while they search for Republic soldiers escaped from a nearby space battle. The player must evade detection by the Sith, rescue <a href=\"/bastila-shan/3005-846\" data-ref-id=\"3005-846\">Bastila Shan</a> from a gang that has taken her hostage, and find a way off-planet.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/dantooine/3035-241\" data-ref-id=\"3035-241\"><b>Dantooine</b></a> <b>:</b> A rural world that is the home of the Jedi council, and some mysterious ancient ruins. On Dantooine, the player will undertake their Jedi training here, including building their first <a href=\"/lightsaber/3055-70\" data-ref-id=\"3055-70\">Lightsaber</a> and choosing their Jedi class. After completing Dantooine, the player may proceed to anywhere they want in the <a href=\"/the-ebon-hawk/3055-490\" data-ref-id=\"3055-490\">Ebon Hawk</a>.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/korriban/3035-366\" data-ref-id=\"3035-366\"><b>Korriban</b></a>: The Sith home world, including the tombs of ancient Sith Lords, and a Sith academy where Dark Jedi are trained. The player must infiltrate the Sith Academy and win the favor of the master, who will then grant the player access to a Star Map.</li></ul><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6742/259670-manaan.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-259670\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.46428571428571\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:46.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6742/259670-manaan.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-259670\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/6742/259670-manaan.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/6742/259670-manaan.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Manaan</figcaption></figure><ul><li><a href=\"/kashyyyk/3035-252\" data-ref-id=\"3035-252\"><b>Kashyyyk</b></a> <b>:</b> The Wookie home world, which has been overrun by the slaving Czerka corporation. The player will step into the middle of this conflict, further complicated by <a href=\"/zaalbar/3005-1794\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1794\">Zaalbar's</a> relationship with the <a href=\"/wookiees/3015-1440\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1440\">Wookiee</a> leadership.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/manaan/3035-428\" data-ref-id=\"3035-428\"><b>Manaan</b></a> <b>:</b> A neutral world in the Republic-Sith conflict, Manaan is an aquatic world with a valuable healing substance called Kolto, which the native Selkath use as leverage against both factions in an attempt to remain neutral. The player will venture below the water to a secret Republic science facility, where something has gone wrong with the operation.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/tatooine/3035-319\" data-ref-id=\"3035-319\"><b>Tatooine</b></a> <b>:</b> The iconic Star Wars world, Tatooine holds an ancient secret that the player must uncover to complete their quest. The player must slay a legendary Krayt dragon and search its lair for a Star Map, but only after they have traversed the deadly Dune Sea.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/yavin-iv/3035-512\" data-ref-id=\"3035-512\"><b>Yavin IV</b></a> <b>:</b> A space station orbiting the Yavin system, wherein the character can purchase rare items not available anywhere else in the world. This item was a piece of free DLC for the Xbox game. This store offers one new quest and two valuable <a href=\"/lightsaber/3055-70\" data-ref-id=\"3055-70\">Lightsaber</a> <a href=\"/color-crystals/3055-1698\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1698\">Crystals</a> that cannot be found anywhere else in the game, in addition to other exclusive armor.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Rakata Prime:</b> A planet near the end of the game which holds two sparring Rakatan tribes, the last remnants of the ancient Infinite Empire that once ruled the galaxy. The Ebon Hawk is pulled down to this world when it jumps into the space around the Star Forge.</li></ul><ul><li><a href=\"/the-star-forge/3035-367\" data-ref-id=\"3035-367\"><b>The Star Forge</b></a><b>:</b> A massive factory, it is Malak's base of operations. It floats above Rakata Prime in space.</li></ul><h2>Party</h2><p>KOTOR, as do most RPGs, allowed the player to gather a party of friends and allies who would travel with them, KOTORs party included nine NPCs who would join the player character on the Ebon Hawk. The party members are as follows:</p><h3><a href=\"/carth-onasi/3005-1790\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1790\">Carth Onasi</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/352460-carthfull.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-352460\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 250px\" data-ratio=\"2.4\" data-width=\"250\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:240.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/352460-carthfull.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-352460\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/352460-carthfull.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/352460-carthfull.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Carth</figcaption></figure><p>A Republic war hero, and commander of the Endar Spire before it is attacked. Carth rescues the player after their escape pod crashes down to the surface of Taris. Carth will pilot the Ebon Hawk for the player once they obtain the ship. Carth is guarded when it comes to personal relationships, since his previous mentor in the Republic fleet betrayed him and joined the Sith. The very same mentor was responsible for the death of his wife, so Carth is understandably cautious of making deep bonds. If the player character is female, Carth is a major love interest.</p><h3><a href=\"/mission-vao/3005-2589\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2589\">Mission Vao</a></h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350526-missionprofilebig.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350526\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 282px\" data-ratio=\"1.0141843971631\" data-width=\"282\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:101.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350526-missionprofilebig.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350526\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350526-missionprofilebig.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350526-missionprofilebig.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mission</figcaption></figure><p>A Twi'lek teenager, Mission is a member of the Hidden Bek gang, and friends with Zaalbar. The player finds her in the Undercity of Taris, panicking because Zaalbar has been taken by slavers. She will join up with the player when he promises to help her rescue Zaalbar if she'll help infiltrate the Black Vulkar base. Mission is an orphan who was raised by her brother. However, her brother left her on Taris when he left to chase his get-rich quick schemes. She learned to fend for herself in the slums of Taris, and is greatly incensed when it is suggested that she is incompetent because she is \"Just a kid\".</p><h3><a href=\"/zaalbar/3005-1794\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1794\">Zaalbar</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350566-zaalbarportrait.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350566\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 285px\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"285\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350566-zaalbarportrait.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350566\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350566-zaalbarportrait.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350566-zaalbarportrait.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Zaalbar</figcaption></figure><p>A powerful Wookiee, Zaalbar is friends with Mission Vao and a member of the Hidden Beks. He is captured by Gammorean slavers in the Undercity of Taris, but is rescued by the player. This act leads Zaalbar to swear a life-debt to the player, having him join the party. Zaalbar was cast out of his home world of <a href=\"/kashyyyk/3035-252\" data-ref-id=\"3035-252\">Kashyyyk</a> because he used his claws on his brother Chuundar after he discovered he was working with slavers, which is taboo on the Wookiee world.</p><h3><a href=\"/bastila-shan/3005-846\" data-ref-id=\"3005-846\">Bastila Shan</a></h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11864/401540-kotor_1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-401540\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.74418604651163\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:74.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11864/401540-kotor_1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-401540\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/11864/401540-kotor_1.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/11864/401540-kotor_1.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Bastila</figcaption></figure><p>A young, ambitious Jedi who possesses the incredibly rare power of Battle Meditation. This ability allowed her to be chosen for the Jedi strike team that neutralized Darth Revan. She will join the player on Taris after they win the gang swoop race. She is strong, but proud and often arrogant, and her masters warn her against the dark side. She will form a force-bond with the player over the course of the game. She is a major love interest if the player character is male.</p><h3><a href=\"/t3-m4/3005-1863\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1863\">T3-M4</a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350657-t3.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350657\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"1.2771855010661\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:127.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/118/350657-t3.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-350657\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350657-t3.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/118/350657-t3.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>T3-M4</figcaption></figure><p>A special utility droid commissioned by crime lord Davik Kang on Taris. The player must buy him from a shop, after which he will join the party. T3 is incredibly skilled with machines, and he is able to hack doors and computer systems others can't. T3 also has combat attachments, but they aren't very effective.</p><h3><a href=\"/canderous-ordo/3005-1852\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1852\">Canderous Ordo</a></h3><p>A Mandalorian mercenary, Canderous is working for Davik Kang on Taris during the Sith blockade. However, wishing to make it off world, Canderous partners with the player to steal the <a href=\"/the-ebon-hawk/3055-490\" data-ref-id=\"3055-490\">Ebon</a> <a href=\"/the-ebon-hawk/3055-490\" data-ref-id=\"3055-490\">Hawk</a>. They are successful, and Canderous agrees to travel with the player on their quest to find the Star Forge. Canderous is a veteran of the Mandalorian Wars, and he has many war stories he will tell the player. He greatly respects the Jedi who fought in the Mandalorian Wars, especially Revan. Canderous appears in KOTOR II as the Mandalore, who is reuniting the scattered Mandalorian clans.</p><h3><a href=\"/juhani/3005-2588\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2588\">Juhani</a></h3><p>Juhani is a Carthar Jedi pupil on <a href=\"/dantooine/3035-241\" data-ref-id=\"3035-241\">Dantooine</a>. Before the player arrives on planet, she attacks her master in a fit of rage, and believing herself lost to the dark side, flees to a grove a short distance away from the academy. The player, upon completing their Jedi trials at the academy, was given the final task of \"purifying\" the grove. When the player arrives</p><p>at the grove Juhani attacks. After she is defeated, Juhani stops to talk. Here, the player could learn about what had happened to her, and convince her to return to the academy, or kill her. She is a potential love interest to the player, regardless of gender.</p><h3><a href=\"/hk-47/3005-828\" data-ref-id=\"3005-828\">HK-47</a></h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/130/538954-hk472.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-538954\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 299px\" data-ratio=\"1.0066889632107\" data-width=\"299\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.7%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/130/538954-hk472.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-538954\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/130/538954-hk472.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/130/538954-hk472.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>\"Meatbags\" HK-47</figcaption></figure><p>A Hunter-Killer Droid built by Revan HK-47 can be found in a shop on Tatooine, and bought for an exorbitant sum of credits. HK-47 has a Tusken language packet installed, which enables him to communicate with the Tusken raider native to Tatooine. He will join the player's party if purchased from the shop. HK-47 prefaces its statements with the tone it wishes to use, making it a comic relief character in some situations. HK-47 is irrationally violent, and loves to kill, which is his sole purpose. He calls all organics \"Meatbag\".</p><h3><a href=\"/jolee-bindo/3005-1884\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1884\">Jolee Bindo</a></h3><p>An old Jedi hermit living in the Shadowlands of Kashyyyk, Jolee does not believe in the Light and Dark sides of the force, instead holding a view similar to that of <a href=\"/kreia/3005-1367\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1367\">Kreia</a>, that there is neither Light side, nor Dark side. He will have the player deal with a group of Czerka poachers who are in the Shadowlands, before agreeing to accompany them on their quest through the forest floor. Jolee will join the player's party after they complete their tasks on Kashyyyk. Jolee has wandered the Galaxy as a Jedi, and has many interesting stories that he will share with the player if they express interest. Having Jolee in your party will also activate an investigative side quest on Manaan.</p><h2>Sequels</h2><p>Due to its enormous success, KOTOR spawned a sequel within a year. This sequel, <a href=\"/star-wars-knights-of-the-old-republic-ii-the-sith-lords/3030-8852\" data-ref-id=\"3030-8852\">The Sith Lords</a>, was not handled by Bioware, but instead by <a href=\"/obsidian-entertainment/3010-1520\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1520\">Obsidian Entertainment</a>. This sequel was generally well-regarded, but was often criticized for its lack of polish and lackluster ending, both the results of a rushed production schedule. Large portions of the game, including a whole planet and many more options on Malachor were excised from the game at the last minute due to deadline concerns. Obsidian included many of the cut assets on the PC game disc, allowing mod teams to recreate the content they were forced to cut. The gameplay was greatly improved, but most players simply did not regard KOTOR II as highly as they did with the original.</p><p>Rumors circulated that BioWare would be making a Knights of the Old Republic MMO. On the last day of E3 2008, <a href=\"/electronic-arts/3010-1\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1\">Electronic Arts</a> CEO, <a href=\"/john-riccitiello/3040-65707\" data-ref-id=\"3040-65707\">John Riccitiello</a> made several comments about a KOTOR MMO, suggesting that it had been the MMO Bioware had been working on. On October 21, 2008, Bioware and <a href=\"/lucasarts-entertainment-company-llc/3010-644\" data-ref-id=\"3010-644\">LucasArts</a> officially announced <a href=\"/star-wars-the-old-republic/3030-24205\" data-ref-id=\"3030-24205\">Star Wars: The Old Republic</a>, the much rumored KOTOR MMO. <a href=\"/star-wars-the-old-republic/3030-24205\" data-ref-id=\"3030-24205\">Star Wars: The Old Republic</a> was released on the December 20, 2011 in North America and Europe, for PC only. The game takes place 300 years after the original Knights of the Old Republic series, and takes place aproxamitly 3,600 years before '<a href=\"/star-wars/3025-551\" data-ref-id=\"3025-551\">Star Wars: Episodes I-VI</a>'.</p><h2>Cut Content</h2><p>Although the cut content in the original Knights of the Old Republic was not as significant as the content that had to be cut from The Sith Lords, a few things were, including one planet that was mentioned in pre-release videos, a dark side romance option, and a brief encounter with Dead-Eye Duncan on Manaan.</p><p>The planet, called Sleyheron, was going to be a volcanic world controlled by the Hutts, a slaving center. This planet was supposed to have a Star Map on it, but was likely removed early in the development process to allow Bioware to focus more on their other five main planets. The planet Sleyheron is briefly mentioned in the game on Korriban by Yuthura Ban. It is also mentioned in a side-quest in KOTOR II, where Vogga the Hutt agrees to ship some of his fuel reserves from Sleyheron to Citadel Station, above Telos IV.</p><p>Also cut was an option for female Dark Side players who had fallen in love with Carth to repent at the very end of the game. After defeating Malak, Carth would board the Star Forge alone and convince Revan to give up her dark ways. Revan would kill Bastila, and remain with Carth aboard the Star Forge as the Republic forces destroyed it. In this ending, the Ebon Hawk would be destroyed, and all of her crew would be dead by the end of the game. This ending has been recreated via fan-made mods for the PC release of KOTOR.</p><p>The other known piece of cut content is on Manaan. If the player defeats Bendak Starkiller in the deathmatch on Taris, later on Manaan, Dead-Eye Duncan will appear in the hangar, having escaped the destruction of Taris, and will ask if he can use your duelist name from Taris, The Mysterious Stranger. This has also been re-created via PC mods.</p><p>Also, an early development idea was for there to be a subplot involving clones in KOTOR, but the idea was nixed by LucasArts so that KOTOR would not steal the thunder from the upcoming 'Attack of the Clones' film.</p><h2>System Requirements</h2><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li>Windows 98 / 98SE / ME / 2000 / XP / 7</li><li>Intel Pentium III 1.00 GHz or AMD Athlon 1.00 GHz</li><li>128 MB RAM required for Windows 98, 256 MB RAM required for Windows ME/2000/XP</li><li>32 MB OpenGL 1.4 compatible PCI or AGP</li><li>DirectX 9.0b compatible Audio Device required</li><li>4.0 GB of free hard drive space required</li><li>4X Speed CD-ROM drive required</li><li>Keyboard and mouse required</li></ul><p><i>*3D Transform Lighting (T&amp;L) Capability required</i></p><p><i>**Microsoft DirectX 9.0b is included on this CD.</i></p><h3><b>Recommended</b></h3><ul><li>1.60 GHZ AMD or equivalent Intel processor</li><li>ATI Radeon 9200 or better, NVIDIA GeForce4 Ti or better</li><li>512 MB RAM</li></ul><h3>Supported Chipsets</h3><ul><li>ATI Radeon 8500 / 9000 / 9200 / 9500 / 9600 / 9700 / 9800</li><li>NVIDIA GeForce 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 FX family</li></ul>", "deck": "Star Wars: KOTOR is a role-playing game set 4000 years before \"A New Hope,\" featuring a Republic soldier who fights to stop Darth Malak and the Sith fleet from destroying the Republic. The game sports such innovations as turn-based combat that appears to run in real time and light or dark side alignment.", "aliases": "KOTOR", "image": {"icon_url": {"duration": "0:38:00", "runner": "saintmillion", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/max-payne-2-the-fall-of-max-payne/3030-3547/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2><b>Gameplay</b></h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1550/182165-maxpayne2_006_large.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-182165\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1550/182165-maxpayne2_006_large.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-182165\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1550/182165-maxpayne2_006_large.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Max Payne reloading after killing an enemy.</figcaption></figure><p>Max Payne 2 is a <a href=\"/third-person-perspective/3015-464\" data-ref-id=\"3015-464\">third-person</a> shooter like its predecessor. It was the first series to incorporate slow motion <a href=\"/bullet-time/3015-78\" data-ref-id=\"3015-78\">bullet time</a> into the gameplay. With a tap of the button, time slows down for Max's enemies while his reaction abilities remain the same. Max can also leap in any direction in slow motion whilst firing his guns, which is called a shoot dodge. Entering bullet time drains the hour glass meter but, unlike the first game, the meter regenerates on its own given enough time. Dubbed 'Bullet Time 2.0', the meter no longer drains while shoot dodging and killing several enemies in quick succession is rewarded with a bullet time reload involving Max ducking while the camera spins around him.</p><h2><b>Plot</b></h2><p><a href=\"/max-payne/3005-697\" data-ref-id=\"3005-697\">Max Payne</a> 2 is a mature <a href=\"/film-noir/3015-1732\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1732\">film noir</a> love story. It deals with themes like love, depression and choices. Following the story of the first game, Max is now a detective for the NYPD, having been cleared of the charges he faced thanks to <a href=\"/alfred-woden/3005-4129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4129\">Alfred Woden</a>. He is still suffering from depression over his wife and daughter's murder and has turned to <a href=\"/alcoholic-beverages/3055-698\" data-ref-id=\"3055-698\">alcohol</a>. When investigating a shots fired call, he runs into a gang of heavily armed men disguised as cleaners. Along the way, he runs into <a href=\"/mona-sax/3005-1129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1129\">Mona Sax</a>, but she disappears before he can get to her. The cleaners escape the scene. Mona later comes to Max's apartment to tell him someone wants them both dead, shortly after which a sniper tries to kill them. Mona runs off on her own and Max fights the cleaners in his apartment building. They blow up his apartment.</p><p>This time, Max approaches Mona in a run-down amusement park, which she has made her home. She tells him about a possible lead, a member of the Inner Circle, a group of powerful men. However, by the time they arrive he is already dead and the cleaners are all over the building. When the police arrive, they arrest Mona. Back at the precinct, the cleaners have assaulted the building trying to kill Mona. Max manages to follow them in one of their own vans and they arrive at a <a href=\"/construction-site/3035-2393\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2393\">construction site</a>, where Mona soon joins him. The cleaners have a huge arsenal of weapons hidden on the site. <a href=\"/valerie-winterson/3005-4131\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4131\">Winterson</a>, another detective, confronts Max and threatens to shoot Mona. Max shoots her first, but she manages to shoot Max when she is on the ground.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1480/312302-max_payne_2_graphic_novel.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-312302\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1480/312302-max_payne_2_graphic_novel.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-312302\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1480/312302-max_payne_2_graphic_novel.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Max Payne 2's story is mostly told through graphic novel vignettes.</figcaption></figure><p>Max wakes up in the hospital and finds Winterson dead. The cleaners, this time without their disguises, try to kill him once more. Max escapes the hospital and returns to the <a href=\"/amusement-park/3035-1755\" data-ref-id=\"3035-1755\">amusement park</a>, only to find his enemies waiting for him there. He is confronted by <a href=\"/vladimir-lem/3005-2933\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2933\">Vlad</a>, an old friend, who turns out to be the leader of the cleaners. Vlad shoots Max and blows up the amusement park. Mona makes her way through the burning park and arrives just in time to rescue Max, who survived the shot.</p><p>They find out Vlad is after all members of the Inner Circle so he can take control of the group and seize power. At Alfred Woden's mansion, Mona reveals she was working for him all along and was hired to kill Max, but she couldn't do it. However, Vlad appears and shoots her, before setting off charges in the building and killing Woden. Max resolves to end this once and for all and sets out to kill Vlad. He chases him through the mansion, dispatching his henchmen along the way, and confronts him on the roof over a skylight. Vlad has the high ground and throws <a href=\"/molotov-cocktail/3055-75\" data-ref-id=\"3055-75\">molotov cocktails</a> at Max, but Max manages to shoot out the platform he is standing on and Vlad falls to his death, burning because of his own molotovs.</p><p>Max returns to Mona just in time to hear her last words: \"God, I turned out to be such a <a href=\"/damsel-in-distress/3015-100\" data-ref-id=\"3015-100\">damsel in distress</a>.\" He kisses her, and she dies, but Max has put the demons of his past to rest. If playing the game under Dead on Arrival difficulty, Mona lives in an alternate ending.</p><h2><b>Characters</b></h2><h3><a href=\"/max-payne/3005-697\" data-ref-id=\"3005-697\"><b>Max Payne</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/211706-screen18.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-211706\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0\"><a  href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/211706-screen18.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-211706\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/211706-screen18.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/api/image/original/211706-screen18.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Max and Mona</figcaption></figure><p>Having walked free after the events of the first game due to the influence of <a href=\"/alfred-woden/3005-4129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4129\">Alfred Woden</a>, Max is once again back on the force as a detective for the NYPD. Still haunted by his inner demons and unable to forget losing his wife and daughter, he is thrust once again into the criminal underworld. Max remains introverted and deeply thoughtful about the events that unfold in the second game, constantly expressing his situation and feelings with clever and complex metaphors. The actual in game character is different from the one seen in the first game. In the original Max Payne, the 3D model was based off <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/sami-jarvi/3040-47155\" data-ref-id=\"3040-47155\">Sam Lake</a>,  while in the sequel the developers were able to hire professional actors, choosing <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/timothy-gibbs/3040-98134\" data-ref-id=\"3040-98134\">Timothy Gibbs</a> to be the new model for Max.</p><h3><a href=\"/mona-sax/3005-1129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-1129\"><b>Mona Sax</b></a></h3><p>A killer who used to work for the mob, presumably killed in the previous game. She resurfaces, hired to kill Vladimir Lem by Alfred Woden. However, Vladimir Lem has sent his \"cleaners\" after her. She develops a relationship with Max, as they both lived through the events of the first game. She is a suspect in the murder of a senator. She may or may not have a bullet lodged somewhere in her body. She revealed she was also instructed to kill Max. During the latter stages of the game Mona becomes a playable character and portions of the story told from Max's perspective are revisited from the point of view of Mona.</p><h3><a href=\"/vladimir-lem/3005-2933\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2933\"><b>Vladimir Lem</b></a></h3><p>A one-time Russian mob boss who has allegedly cleaned up his act and started a legitimate business, Club Vodka, a restaurant. In truth he is plotting to wipe out the competing Italian gang and the Inner Circle so he can take it over and control the city's underworld. Tries to have Max and Mona killed and controls the gang of hitmen disguised as cleaners. By the resolution of the game Vlad is revealed to be the power hungry former protege of Alfred Woden.</p><h3><a href=\"/vinnie-gognitti/3005-3628\" data-ref-id=\"3005-3628\"><b>Vinnie Gognitti</b></a></h3><p>Leader of the Italian mafia, rival to Vlad's own gang. A fan and collector of Captain Baseball Bat Boy memorabilia. First seen in the previous game, where Max left him wounded in an alley. He was killed by Vlad while wearing a Captain Baseball Bat Boy suit with a bomb in it which Vlad detonated.</p><h3><a href=\"/alfred-woden/3005-4129\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4129\"><b>Alfred Woden</b></a></h3><p>The last remaining member of the Inner Circle, Alfred Woden has ties to the murdered senator and other influential people. He hired Mona to kill Max, Vladimir and anyone else tied to the Inner Circle in order to preserve his power base.</p><h3><a href=\"/valerie-winterson/3005-4131\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4131\"><b>Detective Valerie Winterson</b></a></h3><p>Single mother to a blind child and Vladimir's mistress, which is how she was constantly one step ahead of the police. She agreed to kill Max and Mona for Vlad, but was shot by Max and died in the hospital. Valerie at times acts as a foil for Max's character; she is rational and does things by the book, qualities that Max admires but ultimately create conflict between the two detectives.</p><h3><a href=\"/jim-bravura/3005-4134\" data-ref-id=\"3005-4134\"><b>Lieutenant Jim Bravura</b></a></h3><p>Max's commanding officer who arrested him at the end of the first game. A former alcoholic. He assigns Max to a desk job because he aided Mona, a fugitive. Jim attempts to empathize with Max's emotional and mental state by encouraging him to attend AA meetings. He gets shot in the hospital as Vlad's men try to kill Max, but survives the attack.</p><h2>Themes</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/8879/234507-mp2_photograph_07.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-234507\" data-size=\"small\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.2222222222222\" data-width=\"320\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:122.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/8879/234507-mp2_photograph_07.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-234507\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/8879/234507-mp2_photograph_07.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/8879/234507-mp2_photograph_07.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The real life actors posing</figcaption></figure><p>The game carries the moniker 'A <a href=\"/film-noir/3015-1732\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1732\">Film Noir</a> Love Story' and it is suitably set up to deliver these codes and conventions. Visually the game is gritty and dark, featuring many low key lit locations that allow the extensive use of shadows. The in-game graphic novels are also a perfect example of conventional film noir visuals. Max's face is frequently covered in shadows during the graphic novels helping externalize his deeply troubled feelings.</p><p>Structurally, the game also plays to film noir conventions. For example, the game begins in media res and makes extensive use of flashbacks and internalization (Max's dreams). The story also features many <a href=\"/plot-twist/3015-442\" data-ref-id=\"3015-442\">plot twists</a> and conspiracies, also a staple of film noir.</p><p>As for character types, the game suitably fulfills these as well. Max Payne is a brooding detective whose monologues are deep and thought provoking, while Mona Sax is the stock <a href=\"/femme-fatale/3015-1898\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1898\">femme fatale</a> who acts as Max's love interest but also provides further twists to the complex story.</p><p>When you beat the game, the song in the background is called \"Late Goodbye\" by Poets of the Fall.</p><h2>Story Chapters</h2><p><b>Part I: The Darkness Inside</b></p><ol><li>Elevator Doors</li><li>A Criminal Mastermind</li><li>The Depths of My Brain</li><li>No \"Us\" in This</li><li>A Sign of Her Passage</li><li>A Linear Sequence of Scares</li><li>The Million Dollar Question</li></ol><p><b>Part II: A Binary Choice</b></p><ol><li>The Things That I Want</li><li>In the Middle of Something</li><li>Blowing Up</li><li>Routing Her Synapses</li><li>Out of the Window</li><li>The Genius of the Hole</li></ol><p><b>Part III: Waking Up from the American Dream</b></p><ol><li>Too Stubborn to Die</li><li>On a Crash Course</li><li>A Mob-War</li><li>Dearest of All My Friends</li><li>A Losing Game</li><li>There Are No Happy Endings</li><li>Love Hurts</li><li>That Old Familiar Feeling</li></ol><h2>Modes and Features</h2><p>As well as the standard story mode, the game also has a new mode and a new feature.</p><h3>Previously</h3><p>Located in the main menu, this mode recaps the story from the original Max Payne using a series of graphic novels.</p><h3>Jump to Chapter</h3><p>After completing the game, the player can start a new game and choose any chapter from the story mode.</p><h3>Dead Man Walking</h3><p>This mode places the player in an enclosed space surrounded by enemy spawn points. The aim of this mode is to stay alive as long as possible while killing the waves of enemies that continuously appear. The mode starts out with a single enemy and further enemies are introduced, escalating in difficulty.</p><h3>New York Minute</h3><p>The speed-run mode. The aim here is to complete each chapter in the fastest possible time. Each chapter starts with a timer that counts upward; killing enemies reduces the time as does using bullet time. This mode is a revamp of the New York Minute mode in the original Max Payne where players had to complete a level before the timer ran down.</p><h2>Weapons</h2><h3>9mm Pistol</h3><p>A simple handgun which is very reliable. It has 16 rounds and a medium rate of fire. It works well in most situations and, if dual-wielded, can be very effective in dispatching most enemies standing in Max's way.</p><h3><a href=\"/desert-eagle/3055-90\" data-ref-id=\"3055-90\"><b>Desert Eagle</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1550/182153-maxpayne2_004_large.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-182153\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"0.75\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:75.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1550/182153-maxpayne2_004_large.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-182153\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/1550/182153-maxpayne2_004_large.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/1550/182153-maxpayne2_004_large.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Mona Sax shooting dual desert eagles.</figcaption></figure><p>A more powerful handgun. It has fewer rounds than the 9mm at 10 and also has a slow rate of fire. The advantage of the gun is that it is more powerful than the 9mm and, when dual-wielded, can clear out a room very quickly.</p><h3><a href=\"/mp5/3055-289\" data-ref-id=\"3055-289\"><b>MP5</b></a></h3><p>A good gun for most situations. Has a very high rate of fire and large clip size of 30. It also has a scope, which makes it more useful for long-range targets. With bullet time enabled, the MP5 can become a low-class sniper rifle with its faster rate of fire.</p><h3>Ingram</h3><p>The Ingram is the fastest weapon in the game with a phenomenal rate of fire and huge clip size of 32. The downside is that the gun is very inaccurate and is not good for precision aiming. The gun is most useful in clearing out rooms and with bullet time enabled you can aim more easily.</p><h3><a href=\"/shotgun/3055-114\" data-ref-id=\"3055-114\"><b>Pump-Action Shotgun</b></a></h3><p>The most basic shotgun in the game. It has a clip size of 7 and a medium firing rate. The gun is most effective at close range and against enemies who are grouped together.</p><h3>Striker</h3><p>A very powerful weapon. It has a fast rate of fire and a relatively large clip size of 10. The gun also has a large spread which again makes it useful against packs of enemies.</p><h3><a href=\"/sawed-off-shotgun/3055-1993\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1993\"><b>Sawed-off Shotgun</b></a></h3><p>The sawed-off is a quick burst of power. It has small clip size of 2, but a fast rate of fire and reload time. It is best used while taking heat from a group of enemies and you need a quick breather. Use this to blast them away and get to some cover.</p><h3><a href=\"/grenade/3055-111\" data-ref-id=\"3055-111\"><b>Grenade</b></a></h3><p>As simple as the name suggests. Grenades can cause havoc in groups of enemies or, if you're really cruel, a poor man on his own.</p><h3><a href=\"/molotov-cocktail/3055-75\" data-ref-id=\"3055-75\"><b>Molotov Cocktail</b></a></h3><p>Another explosive weapon. This weapon can cause a good fire and is useful when taking fire behind some cover. Just toss this over your head and watch the enemies sizzle.</p><h3><a href=\"/sniper-rifle/3055-67\" data-ref-id=\"3055-67\"><b>Sniper Rifle</b></a></h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/233210-screen15.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-233210\" data-size=\"medium\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-ratio=\"1.3333333333333\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:133.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/56/233210-screen15.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-233210\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/56/233210-screen15.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/56/233210-screen15.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Max with a Sniper Rifle</figcaption></figure><p>A basic sniper rifle. It can hold 5 rounds at once and has a slow firing rate. Best used from long range and can cause a kill in a single shot.</p><h3>Drugunov</h3><p>A more advanced sniper rifle. Has a larger clip size than the basic sniper at 10. Only really useful in long range situations but again can get you one shot kills.</p><h3><a href=\"/m4-carbine/3055-622\" data-ref-id=\"3055-622\"><b>M4 Carbine</b></a></h3><p>A nice powerful assault rifle. Fires quickly and can hold 30 rounds. Not much ammo for the gun in the game so it is best used sparingly. Can get a one shot kill to the head.</p><h3>Kalashnikov</h3><p>Similar to the M4 but with more ammo available. Has a clip size of 30 and a fast rate of fire. Useful in almost every situation in the game and packs a reasonable punch.</p><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><p><i>As displayed on the box</i>*Supported Operating Systems are:</p><ul><li>Windows 98 ( and Windows 98 Second Edition).</li><li>Windows Millennium.</li><li>Windows 2000 Professional (Workstation, Service Pack 3 required).</li><li>Windows XP (Home and Professional, Service Pack 1 required).</li></ul><h3>Generic Requirements</h3><ul><li>1.7GB Hard Drive space</li><li>Windows 98 / ME / 2000 / XP.</li><li>DirectX 9.0.</li><li>Mouse and Keyboard.</li></ul><h3>Minimum System Requirements</h3><ul><li><b>CPU (Processor):</b> 1GHz Pentium 3 / Athlon or 1.2GHz Celeron or Duron processor.</li><li><b>RAM:</b> 256MB.</li><li><b>GPU (Video Card):</b> 32MB DirectX 9 compatible AGP graphics card with hardware transform and lighting support.</li></ul><h3>Recommended System Requirements</h3><ul><li><b>CPU (Processor):</b> 1.4GHz Athlon or 1.7GHz Pentium 4, Celeron or Duron processor.</li><li><b>RAM:</b> 512MB.</li><li><b>GPU (Video Card):</b> 64MB DirectX 9 compatible AGP graphics card with hardware transform and lighting support.</li></ul><h2>Xbox Originals</h2><p>On April 27, 2009, Max Payne 2: The Fall of Max Payne became available on the Xbox 360's Xbox Originals service for 1200 Microsoft Points.</p>", "deck": "Max Payne 2 is a film-noir action game in which Part of the <a data-ref-id=\"3025-1985\" href=\"/serious-sam-indie-series/3025-1985\">Serious Sam Indie Series</a>, Serious Sam: Double D takes the <a data-ref-id=\"3025-373\" href=\"/serious-sam/3025-373\">original franchise's</a> 3D over-the-top shooting gameplay to 2D, while adding a unique \"gun stacking\" concept (in which <a data-ref-id=\"3005-1620\" href=\"/sam-serious-stone/3005-1620\">Sam \"Serious\" Stone</a> can carry and fire up to six weapons simultaneously) and new ridiculous enemies (such as the Vuvuzelators, mutant stacks of anthromorphic <a data-ref-id=\"3055-1080\" href=\"/pancake/3055-1080\">pancakes</a> with <a data-ref-id=\"3055-3983\" href=\"/vuvuzela/3055-3983\">vuvuzelas</a> attached to them).</p><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><ul><li><strong>OS:</strong> XP, Vista, 7</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> 2.0 GHz or faster (Dual-core recommended)</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 1GB</li><li><strong>Hard Disk sound card</li><li><strong>Additional:</strong> Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller or XInput controller</li></ul>", "deck": "Part of the Serious Sam Indie Series, Serious Sam: Double D brings the ridiculously over-the-top gunplay to 2D, allowing you to stack bodies... with stacked guns.", "aliases": "Serious Sam: Double D XXL", "image": {"icon_url": {"duration": "0:30:00", "runner": "altabiscuit", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/serious-sam-the-random-encounter/3030-34402/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Serious Sam: The Random Encounter is a role-playing game developed by <a data-ref-id=\"3010-7731\" href=\"/vlambeer/3010-7731\" slug=\"vlambeer\">Vlambeer</a> and is the third game in the <a data-ref-id=\"3025-1985\" href=\"/serious-sam-indie-series/3025-1985\" slug=\"serious-sam-indie-series\">Serious Sam Indie Series</a>. The game forgoes typical RPG conventions such as <a data-ref-id=\"3015-39\" href=\"/experience-points/3015-39\" slug=\"experience-points\">experience points</a>; likely a homage to the lack of modern first-person shooter systems like <a data-ref-id=\"3015-83\" href=\"/regenerating-health/3015-83\" slug=\"regenerating-health\">regenerating health</a> in the main Serious Sam games.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>Battles take place with <a href=\"../../sam-serious-stone/94-1620/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Sam \"Serious\" Stone</a> and his party running backwards towards the right of the screen while enemies flood in from the left. At the start of the fight the enemies and Sam's party freeze in place and the player is asked to select weapons for the party and designate where to shoot. Players are also able to use items to help the party in various way such as refiling health and shields or increasing the damage of all weapons for one turn. The game then resumes the action with the party firing their weapons automatically and players have to move the party up and down to dodge incoming missiles and enemies in melee range. After five seconds the action freezes again to allow players to switch weapons and adjust their aim before resuming. This cycle repeats until either Sam's party is knocked out or all enemies are defeated.</p><h3>Weapons</h3><p>Many of the weapons iconic to the Serious Sam games are included in The Random Encounter. To accommodate the turn-based fighting system they have unique abilities and firing patterns.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/80973/2019258-tre_fight.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2019258\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ratio=\"0.625\" data-width=\"480\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:62.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/80973/2019258-tre_fight.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2019258\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/80973/2019258-tre_fight.png\"/></a><figcaption>The player carefully readies his missile salvo</figcaption></figure><ul><li>Revolver: Fires at the closest enemy.</li><li>Shotgun: Players designate how close enemies must close in before the party member will fire on them.</li><li>Minigun: Fires in a straight line. Has a slow firing speed at the start of a turn but speeds up before resetting at the start of the next turn.</li><li>Grenade Launcher: Lobs a single grenade.</li><li>Rocket Launcher: Fires three missiles in a spread at the start of the round.</li><li>Laser: Continuously fires 3 parallel laser beams in a in a straight line. Enemies hit with it are slown down.</li><li>Sniper: Fires a shot that pierces enemies in a straight line.</li><li>Cannon: Spends one turn charging to fire a devastating cannon ball on the next turn.</li></ul><h3>Items</h3><p>Many items are taken from the previous Serious Sam games. If a party member uses an item then they can not fire or swap weapons for that turn.</p><ul><li>Heal All: Heals all party members health</li><li>Armor: Fills the armor meter for the party member that uses it.</li><li>Armor All: Fills the armor meter for all party members.</li><li>Revive: Revives all fallen party members to full health.</li><li>Serious Speed: The party runs backwards faster allowing them to get distance from the horde.</li><li>Serious Bomb: All enemies take continuous damage for the duration of the turn.</li><li>Kamikaze Bait: Summons a giant swarm of <a data-ref-id=\"3015-4076\" href=\"/beheaded-kamikaze/3015-4076\" slug=\"beheaded-kamikaze\">Beheaded Kamikazes</a>.</li></ul><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><ul><li><strong>OS:</strong> Windows XP, Vista, 7</li><li><strong>Processor:</strong> 2.0Ghz or faster processor</li><li><strong>Memory:</strong> 1GB RAM</li><li><strong>Hard Disk Space:</strong> 100MB free space</li><li><strong>Video Card:</strong> 256MB Video Memory or higher, DirectX 8 or later</li><li><strong>DirectX\u00ae:</strong> 8.0 or later</li></ul>", "deck": "An RPG set in the Serious Sam universe.", "aliases": null, "image": {"icon_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_avatar/0/8960/1996759-serious_sam_the_random_encounter.png", "medium_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/square_mini/0/8960/1996759-serious_sam_the_random_encounter.png", "small_url": "http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/8960/1996759-serious_sam_the_random_encounter.png", "thumb_url":
