{"duration": "0:48:00", "runner": "DrTChops", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/the-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim/3030-33394/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Taking place in the eponymous province of <a href=\"/skyrim/3035-684\" data-ref-id=\"3035-684\">Skyrim</a>, home of the <a href=\"/nord/3015-1015\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1015\">Nords</a>, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim continues the series' tradition of open-ended gameplay and also introduces <a href=\"/dragons/3015-551\" data-ref-id=\"3015-551\">dragons</a> to the franchise. The game is set two centuries after the end of the Third Era and the closing of the <a href=\"/oblivion-gate/3055-871\" data-ref-id=\"3055-871\">Oblivion gates</a> in <a href=\"/the-elder-scrolls-iv-oblivion/3030-20238\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20238\">Elder Scrolls IV</a>. Skyrim's gameplay expands on <a href=\"/the-elder-scrolls-iv-oblivion/3030-20238\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20238\">Oblivion</a> with the addition of dual-wielding, a new perk system, new <a href=\"/thuum/3015-6677\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6677\">Dragon Shout</a> (Thu'um) abilities and a variety of changes to character progression. Additionally, the old quest system has been updated to produce more varied content.</p><h2>Development and Technology</h2><h3>Creation Engine</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1712424\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/9/97594/1712424-skyrim8.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/9/97594/1712424-skyrim8.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1712424\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/9/97594/1712424-skyrim8.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Longer draw distances and improved foliage</figcaption></figure><p><a href=\"../../todd-howard/72-57173/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Todd Howard</a> mentioned on Bethesda's podcast that the ideas for Skyrim took form immediately after Oblivion's launch but principal development began after the release of <a href=\"/fallout-3/3030-20504\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20504\">Fallout 3</a>. It uses a new gameplay and graphics engine, dubbed the <a href=\"/creation-engine/3015-6593\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6593\">Creation Engine</a>, developed internally at Bethesda. The new engine aims to improve draw distances and shadowing on all objects in the world. It also features dynamic weather effects like snow falls and improved animations for trees, like leaves and branches reacting to violent winds. There are also meteorological effects like clouds gathering around mountain tops. Since the new engine incorporates foliage animations, Bethesda has dropped <a href=\"/speedtree/3015-1684\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1684\">SpeedTree</a> for Skyrim.</p><p>Skyrim uses DirectX-9 shaders and is authored on PCs. The PC version contains standard features like higher resolution textures and anti-aliasing, but the engine's graphical development was first done for the Xbox 360. The <a href=\"../../the-elder-scrolls-v-skyrim-in-motion/17-3831/\" rel=\"nofollow\">first gameplay trailer</a> showed footage from the Xbox 360 version of the game.</p><h3>Animation</h3><p>The game also uses <a href=\"/havok-behavior/3015-6594\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6594\">Havok Behavior</a> for its animations. Howard also <a href=\"http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2010-08-16-bethesdas-todd-howard-interview?page=2\" rel=\"nofollow\">stated</a> that Bethesda has invested a lot of time and 'people and talent' to improve their animations. Unlike Oblivion, only important NPCs in Skyrim carry unique names and are fully voiced. The extreme close-up dialogue system (seen in previous Bethesda games) has been dropped in favor of a more fluid perspective. <a href=\"/non-player-character/3015-967\" data-ref-id=\"3015-967\">NPCs</a> no longer stand static on the screen; instead, they continue with their normal routines, occasionally glancing at the player while making conversation. Players can also cut off NPCs by walking away from them mid-conversation.</p><p>For Skyrim, Bethesda took inspiration from various sources. The magic combat was influenced by the plasmids in Irrational Games' <a href=\"/bioshock/3030-17280\" data-ref-id=\"3030-17280\">BioShock</a>. The new deadlier bow-and-arrow mechanic is based on an Oblivion mod that drastically altered the pace of ranged combat by slowing down the draw time for bows. The new menu system was inspired by <a href=\"/apple-inc/3010-5815\" data-ref-id=\"3010-5815\">Apple</a> products and has been drastically changed to be more user friendly. Any item obtained can be viewed in player inventory with a full 3D perspective, and the objects can even be rotated and zoomed in on in order to get a closer look.</p><h3>Art Design</h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1749789\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1749789-lakemountains.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/11986/1749789-lakemountains.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1749789\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/1/11986/1749789-lakemountains.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Skyrim's Nordic art design</figcaption></figure><p>Compared to previous installments in the series, Skyrim's art design has been changed significantly to make the world feel more realistic. Art director <a href=\"/matthew-carofano/3040-57176\" data-ref-id=\"3040-57176\">Matthew Carofano</a> described Skyrim's art design as \"epic reality\" when compared to Oblivion's Imperial cities and \"standard European fantasy\" design. Bethesda aimed to give all the big settlements and quest hubs a unique geographical and architectural setting, offering \"dramatic views.\" There are multiple Nord factions within Skyrim featuring their own unique customs and colors, similar to the different colors and insignias for the towns in Oblivion.</p><h3>Mod Support</h3><p>On February 7th, 2012, Bethesda released a tool called \"Creation Kit,\" for the PC version of Skyrim, allowing players to alter the world of Skyrim in any way that they see fit similar to the Construction Sets for previous Elder Scrolls titles such as <a href=\"/the-elder-scrolls-iv-oblivion/3030-20238\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20238\">The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion</a>. The Creation Kit is available as a free download through Steam.</p><p>Steam recently launched the Workshop, a brand new addition to the program, allowing modders to showcase and share their work with other gamers. Skyrim was selected to be one of the very first games featured within the Workshop. To date, there are over 21,000 Skyrim mods that are available in the Steam Workshop. Players can subscribe to any Skyrim mod that they wish to download from the Workshop and once Skyrim is launched, any mods that you subscribed to are automatically downloaded and updated on the Skyrim Launcher. Should a player decide they no longer wish to use a particular mod, they can unsubscribe from the mod in the Workshop and the mod will automatically be uninstalled from the game.</p><p>The distribution of mods is not restricted to just those downloaded through the the Steam Workshop, and can also be downloaded from various community sites such as the <a href=\"http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/?\" rel=\"nofollow\" data-ref-id=\"false\">Skyrim Nexus</a>.</p><h2>Setting</h2><h3>Plot</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1684742\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1684742-untitled.png\" data-ratio=\"0.25819826611383\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:25.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1684742-untitled.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1684742\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1684742-untitled.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1684742-untitled.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Prophecy on Alduin's Wall</figcaption></figure><p>Just as foretold in the <a href=\"../../elder-scroll/93-1515/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Elder Scrolls</a>, the time for the dragons to return to <a href=\"../../tamriel/95-92/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Tamriel</a> has come, led by <a href=\"/alduin/3005-21456\" data-ref-id=\"3005-21456\">Alduin</a>, a dragon of godly proportions whose victory would mean the end of Tamriel. Players take the role of the <a href=\"/dovahkiin/3005-17606\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17606\">Dovahkiin</a>, a person that possesses the power to defy the powerful beasts and absorb their power. There have been several signs indicating the dragons' inevitable return as prophesied by the Elder Scrolls, such as the opening of the Oblivion gates some two centuries ago. The final sign is a Nordic civil war between the Imperial Legion from Cyrodiil, who wish to retain authority their over Skyrim, and the <a href=\"/stormcloaks/3015-7274\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7274\">Stormcloaks</a>, a group of Nordic rebels aiming to remove all Imperial presence from their land. The protagonist starts his/her journey during the said events, and in keeping with Elder Scrolls tradition the player begins as a prisoner. The game is set 200 years after the events of Oblivion.</p><h4>Main Characters</h4><ul><li><a href=\"../../dovahkiin/94-17606/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Dovahkiin</a> - The player-created character is the \"Dragonborn\", a man or woman with a sacred power somehow tied into that of the Dragons. They can learn the dragons' language and use magical \"Shouts\", just like the dragons do. Often referred as <a href=\"/dovahkiin/3005-17606\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17606\">the Dragonborn</a> in the game, the Dragonborn is able to permanently kill a dragon by absorbing their soul.</li><li><a href=\"../../esbern/94-17611/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Esbern</a> - One of the last surviving members of the Blades, an elite group of soldiers in service of the Emperor of Tamriel. Esbern is an expert in dragon lore and helps Dovahkiin figure out the mystery behind Alduin's return. He is voiced by <a href=\"../../max-von-sydow/72-99343/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Max Von Sydow</a>.</li><li><a href=\"../../alduin/94-21456/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Alduin</a> - The world-devouring dragon is the primary antagonist in Skyrim. The \"World-Eater\" is reviving dead dragons all around Skyrim to prepare for his take over.</li><li><a href=\"/arngeir/3005-21457\" data-ref-id=\"3005-21457\">Arngeir</a> - A Greybeard elder, an order of philosopher monks who mastered the Way of the Voice ( <a href=\"/thuum/3015-6677\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6677\">Dragon Shouts</a>). He helps Dovahkiin in understanding Dragon Shouts.</li><li>Delphine - An undercover member of the Blades, investigating the return of the dragons.</li><li><a href=\"/paarthurnax/3005-21458\" data-ref-id=\"3005-21458\">Paarthurnax</a> - Leader of the Greybeards, who guides Dovahkiin in his quest to defeat Alduin.</li></ul><h3>Companions</h3><p>Players will be able to hire/ be given followers, similar to <a href=\"../../fallout-3/61-20504/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Fallout 3</a> and <a href=\"/fallout-new-vegas/3030-25933\" data-ref-id=\"3030-25933\">Fallout: New Vegas</a>, though they do not have well developed back-stories of their own. Players can have relationships with other characters in the game and get married to any NPC, regardless of their race or sex. These spouses will stay within the confines of the player's house unless asked to do otherwise. Spouses will even cook food, and sleeping next to them will grant various bonuses and perks.</p><p>Followers will follow the player wherever they go in Skyrim. When battling an enemy, they will also take part in the battle, aiding and assisting in anyway they can. Followers can also be used to carry various weapons, apparel, books and other items. This can be accomplished by engaging in conversation with the follower and then selecting the option to trade items with said follower.</p><p>Followers are not immortal and can die should they take to much damage. The same applies to horses.</p><h3>World of Skyrim</h3><p>The world of Skyrim is roughly the same size as Oblivion's <a href=\"/cyrodiil/3035-127\" data-ref-id=\"3035-127\">Cyrodiil</a> (16 square miles), but features a more rugged, mountainous terrain with Nordic architecture and surroundings. The entire realm, however, isn't completely mountainous and snowy; it includes varied environments such as an arctic tundra to lush forests. The world is divided into nine \"holds\" (similar to counties), five of which contain larger cities and the remaining four being rural areas. The in-game world map is rendered in the game engine, giving the impression of a bird's eye view of the world. Skyrim also sees the return of <a href=\"/horse/3015-3114\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3114\">horses</a> as <a href=\"/mounts/3015-409\" data-ref-id=\"3015-409\">mounts</a>, a feature introduced in Oblivion.</p><p>Skyrim contains 150 handcrafted dungeons for players to explore and even more points of interest. The dungeons can get quite complicated, with multiple paths and even puzzles that players must solve to reach other areas of the dungeon.</p><h3>Radiant A.I.</h3><p>The artificial intelligence for both NPCs and creatures has been updated with the aim to create a more believable environment. The general behavior of the NPCs is less static than previous Elder Scrolls titles, as they follow schedules, perform tasks, and adapt to changes in their surroundings. Quest givers often continue with their regular work while talking to players. NPCs can now have specific jobs and will perform those jobs during the day.</p><h3>Radiant Story and Side-Quests</h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1761587\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33529/1761587-es_5.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33529/1761587-es_5.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1761587\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33529/1761587-es_5.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33529/1761587-es_5.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>NPC interactions have been sharpened for more seamless conversations</figcaption></figure><p>An extension of <a href=\"/radiant-ai/3015-6702\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6702\">Radiant A.I.</a>, Skyrim uses the Radiant Story tool to manage all of the side quests, which incorporates certain aspects of <a href=\"../../procedural-generation/92-328/\" rel=\"nofollow\">procedural generation</a>. The game constantly tracks how players play the game, and modifies side quests to suit their strengths, weaknesses, past experiences, and play-style. For example, a <a href=\"../../kill-quest/92-3184/\" rel=\"nofollow\">kill quest</a> might relocate its target to an unexplored dungeon, making sure players are visiting new and unknown territories. The system is tooled to reduce repetitiveness, making sure the player isn't offered the same type of quest multiple times in a row. Certain quests only unlock if the player reaches a certain level or meets a certain skill requirement such as a high stealth skill. Quests also change based on previous experiences and already completed <a href=\"../../side-quests/92-338/\" rel=\"nofollow\">side quests</a>. Players can also pick up quests by overhearing conversations in taverns.</p><h3>Guilds</h3><p>Skyrim features the same guild structure as previous Elder Scrolls games, but some of them have been given unique names and histories specific to the Skyrim region:</p><ul><li><a href=\"/college-of-winterhold/3015-7299\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7299\">College of Winterhold</a>: Filling the same role as the Mages' Guild in Skyrim, they are located in Winterhold. Their college shares the same name as their guild, <a href=\"/college-of-winterhold/3035-3963\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3963\">College of Winterhold (location).</a></li><li><a href=\"/the-companions/3015-7294\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7294\">The Companions</a>: A Nordic faction that stands-in for the old Fighters Guild. They are located in the guild halll <a href=\"/jorrvaskr/3035-3952\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3952\">Jorrvaskr</a> in the <a href=\"/wind-district/3035-3944\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3944\">Wind district</a> in <a href=\"/whiterun/3035-3901\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3901\">Whiterun</a>. There is also secret group inside the guild, they are called \" <a href=\"/the-circle/3015-7298\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7298\">The Circle</a>\".</li><li><a href=\"/the-thieves-guild/3015-2321\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2321\">Thieves Guild</a>: An organization of thieves located in <a href=\"/riften/3035-3911\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3911\">Riften</a>, a branch of the same organization featured in previous Elder Scrolls games.</li><li><a href=\"/the-dark-brotherhood/3015-2307\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2307\">Dark Brotherhood:</a> A secret group of assassins located in the <a href=\"/dark-brotherhood-sanctuary/3035-3953\" data-ref-id=\"3035-3953\">Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary</a>, related to the organizations of the same name in previous titles.</li></ul><h3>Gameplay</h3><p>Skyrim retains the <a href=\"/open-world/3015-207\" data-ref-id=\"3015-207\">open-world</a> gameplay and <a href=\"/real-time-combat/3015-2332\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2332\">real-time combat</a> that has become a hallmark of the Elder Scroll games. Players can explore the world freely and engage in combat in first or third person point of view. The third person point of view has been updated to feel more cinematic with an <a href=\"/over-the-shoulder/3015-2621\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2621\">over-the-shoulder camera</a> and a minimalistic <a href=\"/heads-up-display/3015-180\" data-ref-id=\"3015-180\">HUD</a> that only becomes visible during combat. Player attributes have been simplified into three major categories:</p><ul><li><b>Health -</b> Increases player health</li><li><b>Stamina -</b> Governs the use of melee and ranged attacks. Players can also sprint by expending stamina. Increasing stamina also increases encumbrance limit.</li><li><b>Magicka -</b> Governs the use of magic spells and attacks. Also increases resistance to magic.</li></ul><p>Skyrim contains nine major cities and various small settlements spread throughout the Nordic countryside, where players can interact with the townsfolk, pick up quests or carry out activities such as cooking, farming, woodcutting etc. There are over 150 dungeons within Skyrim, that contain creatures who scale with player level. According to Bethesda, Skyrim's <a href=\"/level-scaling/3015-608\" data-ref-id=\"3015-608\">level scaling</a> is similar to Fallout 3 and not Oblivion. As a result, minor creatures like rats won't become exceedingly powerful at higher levels. Also, once the player visits a dungeon, the creatures within get locked to a certain level for the rest of the campaign.</p><h3>Combat</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1703557\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33529/1703557-tes51_1.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/33529/1703557-tes51_1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1703557\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33529/1703557-tes51_1.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/3/33529/1703557-tes51_1.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Dual wielding weapon and magic</figcaption></figure><p>Players can bind independent weapons and spells to both hands. This allows for dual-wielding diverse weapons and even spells to create unique combos. Spells can be bound on one hand, while wielding a weapon in the other. However, only players using a 2-handed weapon, a shield and a weapon, or a shield and a spell can <a href=\"/block/3015-1843\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1843\">block</a> incoming attacks. Items and abilities can be switched during combat through a pop-up favorites menu, as opposed to the directional pad mapping in Oblivion.</p><p>The run speed while going backwards has been reduced to cut down on \"cheap tricks\" and improve the visual experience. Howard mentions that running backward at full speed in Oblivion \"looked ridiculous\" in third person. <a href=\"/stealth/3015-24\" data-ref-id=\"3015-24\">Stealth</a> has also been modified to give players a small window of opportunity to hide upon detection.</p><p>Attacks gravitate towards enemies to reduce the possibility of friendly fire. In addition, all three types of attacks have been modified in the following manner:</p><ul><li><b>Melee -</b> While retaining the hack'n'slash nature seen in previous games, the melee combat has been updated with finishing moves and kill animations unique to each weapon and opponent. Staggering enemies and positional attacks are important to the core combat. Weapon-specific perks increase their respective effectiveness. For example: sword perks increase the critical strike rate, axe perks results in a bleeding effect, mace perks provide armor penetration and shield perks improve spell resistance.</li><li><b>Ranged -</b> Ranged combat still relies on bows and arrows, but the draw time for the bow has been slowed down, resulting in heavier damage per shot. Archers can use bash moves to gain distance between themselves and their targets. They can also hold their breath now to gain accuracy at the cost of stamina.</li><li><b>Magic -</b> Players have to equip spells in weapon slots to use them in combat, forcing a choice between magic or melee proficiency. The spell mechanics have been changed accordingly to allow use of magic in close combat and each magic spell can be used in varied manners. For example, the fire spell can be dual-wielded to produce a giant bomb-like effect; or used as a flame thrower in a short arc; or place runes on the ground to create a fire trap.</li></ul><h2>Spell Schools</h2><p>The number of spell schools have been reduced from six (in Oblivion) to five after the removal of Mysticism, which was deemed redundant and folded into the remaining schools:</p><ul><li><a href=\"/alteration/3015-2822\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2822\">Alteration</a></li><li><a href=\"/conjuration/3015-5729\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5729\">Conjuration</a></li><li><a href=\"/evocation/3015-5737\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5737\">Destruction</a></li><li><a href=\"/illusion/3015-5734\" data-ref-id=\"3015-5734\">Illusion</a></li><li><a href=\"/healer/3015-188\" data-ref-id=\"3015-188\">Restoration</a></li></ul><h3>Conjuration</h3><table><thead><tr><th>Rank</th><th>Spell Name</th><th>Description</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Bound Sword</td><td>Creates a magic sword for 120 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Conjure Familiar</td><td>Summons a Familiar for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Raise Zombie</td><td>Reanimate a weak dead body to fight for you for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Bound Battleaxe</td><td>Creates a magic battle axe for 120 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Conjure <a href=\"/flame-atronach/3015-3082\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3082\">Flame Atronach</a></td><td>Summons a Flame Atronach for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Reanimate Corpse</td><td>Reanimate a more powerful dead body to fight for you for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Soul Trap</td><td>Soul traps If a target dies within 60 seconds, fills a soul gem.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Banish <a href=\"/daedra/3015-1826\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1826\">Daedra</a></td><td>Weaker summoned daedra are sent back to Oblivion.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Bound Bow</td><td>Creates a magic bow for 120 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Conjure <a href=\"/frost-atronach/3015-3083\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3083\">Frost Atronach</a></td><td>Summons a Frost Atronach to fight for you for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Revenant</td><td>Reanimate a powerful dead body to fight for you for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Command Daedra</td><td>Powerful summoned and raised creatures are put under your control.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Conjure <a href=\"/dremora/3015-3551\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3551\">Dremora</a> Lord</td><td>Summons a Dremora Lord for 120 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Conjure <a href=\"/storm-atronach/3015-3085\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3085\">Storm Atronach</a></td><td>Summons a Frost Atronach for 60 seconds.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Dread Zombie</td><td>Reanimate a very powerful dead body to fight for you.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Expel Daedra</td><td>Powerful summoned daedra are sent back to Oblivion.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Dead Thrall</td><td>Reanimate a dead body permanently to fight for you.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Flame Thrall</td><td>Summons a Flame Atronach permanently.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Frost Thrall</td><td>Summons a Frost Atronach permanently.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Storm Thrall</td><td>Summons a Storm Atronach permanently.</td></tr></tbody></table><h3>Destruction</h3><table><thead><tr><th>Rank</th><th>Spell Name</th><th>Description</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Flames</td><td>A gout of fire inflicting a base damage of 8 points of fire damage per second.</td></tr><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Frostbite</td><td>A blast of cold inflicting a base damage of 8 points of frost damage per second to Health and Stamina.</td></tr><tr><td>Novice</td><td>Sparks</td><td>Lightning which inflicts a base damage of 8 points of shock damage per second to Health and Magicka.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Firebolt</td><td>A bolt of fire that inflicts 25 points of fire damage. Targets on fire take extra damage.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Ice Spike</td><td>A spike of ice that inflicts 25 points of ice damage to Health and Stamina.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Lightning Bolt</td><td>A bolt of lightning that inflicts 25 points of shock damage to Health and half as much to Magicka.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Fire Rune</td><td>Cast on a nearby surface, it explodes for 50 points of damage when enemies come near.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Frost Rune</td><td>Cast on a nearby surface, it explodes for 50 points of damage to Health and Stamina when enemies come near.</td></tr><tr><td>Apprentice</td><td>Lightning Rune</td><td>Cast on a nearby surface, it explodes for 50 points of damage to Health and half as much to Magicka when enemies come near.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Chain Lightning</td><td>A lighting bolt inflicting 40 points of damage to Health and half as much to Magicka, then leaps to a new target.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Fireball</td><td>A fireball which explodes on impact for 40 points of damage in a 15 foot radius.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Ice Storm</td><td>A freezing whirlwind that does 40 points of damage per second to Health and Stamina.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Flame Cloak</td><td>For 60 seconds, opponents in melee range take 8 points of damage per second to Health and sets targets on fire.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Frost Cloak</td><td>For 60 seconds, opponents in melee range take 8 points of damage per second to Health and Stamina.</td></tr><tr><td>Adept</td><td>Lightning Cloak</td><td>For 60 seconds, opponents in melee range take 8 points of damage per second to Health and half as much to Magicka.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Icy Spear</td><td>A spear of ice that does 60 points of frost damage to Health and Stamina.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Incinerate</td><td>A blast of fire that does 60 points of fire damage. Targets on fire take extra damage.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Thunderbolt</td><td>A thunderbolt that does 60 points of shock damage to Health and half that to Magicka.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Wall of Flames</td><td>Sprayed on the ground, it creates a wall of fire that does 50 points of fire damage per second.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Wall of Frost</td><td>Sprayed on the ground, it creates a wall of frost that does 50 points of frost damage per second.</td></tr><tr><td>Expert</td><td>Wall of Storms</td><td>Sprayed on the ground, it creates a wall of lightning that does 50 points of shock damage per second.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Blizzard</td><td>Creates a blizzard that surronds the caster. Targets take 20 points of frost damage every second for 10 seconds and stamina damage.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Fire Storm</td><td>A 100 point fiery explosion centered on the caster. The closer a target is, the more damage they take.</td></tr><tr><td>Master</td><td>Lightning Storm</td><td>Fires a continuous stream of lightning. Target takes 75 points of shock damage to health, and half that to Magicka.</td></tr></tbody></table><h3>Dragons</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717412\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717412-wmplayer_2011_02_24_12_23_58_35.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717412-wmplayer_2011_02_24_12_23_58_35.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717412\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717412-wmplayer_2011_02_24_12_23_58_35.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717412-wmplayer_2011_02_24_12_23_58_35.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>A duel with a dragon</figcaption></figure><p>The world of Skyrim contains legendary creatures from folklore like mammoths, trolls, sabre-toothed cats, <a href=\"/undead/3015-1155\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1155\">undead</a>, and dragons - a new addition. With the return of Alduin, a big focus is on dragon encounters. They are the most feared creatures in the game and each encounter is akin to a <a href=\"/boss-fight/3015-50\" data-ref-id=\"3015-50\">boss fight</a>. Howard <a href=\"http://gamerant.com/elder-scrolls-skyrim-dragon-details-dyce-64808/\" rel=\"nofollow\">described</a> them as, \"a mix between a <a href=\"/big-daddy/3015-624\" data-ref-id=\"3015-624\">Big Daddy</a> and a helicopter in <a href=\"/half-life-2/3030-1539\" data-ref-id=\"3030-1539\">Half-life 2</a>\". Using Dragon Shouts, they can speak directly to the Dragonborn.</p><p>Players face different races and types of dragons, either alone or in small groups. These encounters can be in the wilderness, within a city, or in a town. During these encounters, the dragons will frequently circle the player utilizing it's unique \"breath\" attacks. While on ground, they will engage the player in direct melee combat.</p><h3>Dragon Shouts (Thu'um)</h3><p>Throughout the game, players can acquire Dragon Shouts, which are rare and powerful abilities. This skillset is learned through the \"Way of the Voice\" and is separate from magic and more closely related to battle cries. Players learn these abilities by learning the words from one of the game's word walls, often hidden in dungeons or other hard to reach areas. They then \"unlock\" the words they want by killing a dragon and absorbing its soul. These shouts are unique to <a href=\"/dovahkiin/3005-17606\" data-ref-id=\"3005-17606\">the Dragonborn</a> and the players character is one of the few in the world capable of using them.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717386\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717386-wmplayer_2011_02_24_11_30_06_56.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717386-wmplayer_2011_02_24_11_30_06_56.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717386\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717386-wmplayer_2011_02_24_11_30_06_56.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717386-wmplayer_2011_02_24_11_30_06_56.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>The protagonist learning a Dragon Shout</figcaption></figure><p>Each of the 20 Dragon Shouts are made up of three unique words, with each word representing a power level of the shout. An example can be seen in the first gameplay trailer where Dovahkiin yells \u201cFus, Ro, Dah!\u201d (at 1:08 mark); Fus meaning force, Ro meaning balance and Dah meaning push, the result of which is a mighty shockwave. These words are in Bethesda's dragon language, created specifically for this purpose, with fonts designed as if a creature with three talons (i.e. dragon) could write them. The language has been designed to rhyme both in its original version and in English. The first example of this was the Nordic choir used towards the end of the teaser trailer.</p><h4>Known Dragon Shouts:</h4><ul><li>Whirlwind Sprint (WULD NAH KEST): Gives the player a quick burst of speed to get past deadly obstacles or enemies. It also allows crossing of small abysses.</li><li>Fire Breath (YOL TOOR SHUL): Allows the player to breath fire like a dragon.</li><li>Slow Motion (TIID KLO UL): Slows down time briefly.</li><li>Unrelenting Force (FUS RO DAH): Push back enemies.</li><li>Storm Call (STRUN BAH QO): Creates a storm that zaps enemies with lightning.</li><li>Elemental Fury (SU GRAH DUN): Shouts at weapon to make attacks faster.</li><li>Ice Form (IIZ SLEN NUS): Encases enemies in a block of ice.</li><li>Dragon Call (OD AH VIING): Summon a dragon ally to assist the player.</li><li>Animal allegiance (RAAN MIR TAH): Summon beasts to help players in combat.</li><li>Become Ethereal (FEIM ZI GRON): Makes the player immune to damage but also, unable to attack.</li><li>Frost Breath (FO KRAH DIIN): Cold ice damage breath.</li><li>Throw Voice (ZUL MEY GUT): Make enemies think you are somewhere else allowing you to regain stealth.</li><li>Disarm (ZUN HAAL VIIK): Disarms enemies.</li><li>Clear Skies (LOK VAH KOOR): Clears skies.</li><li>Call of Valor (HUN KAAR ZOOL): Summons heroes to help players in combat.</li><li>Dragonrend (JOOR ZAH FRUL): Forces the dragon to land.</li><li>Marked for Death (KRII LUN AUS): Damage max health and stamina of target.</li><li>Aura Whisper (LAAS YA NIR): Detect life.</li><li>Kyne's Peace (KAAN DREM OV): Creature(s) lose the will to fight or flee.</li><li>Dismaying Shout (FAAS RU MAAR): Enemies flee from the player.</li><li>Bend Will (GOL HAH DOV): Purges All-Maker stones, makes people allies, taming and riding dragons.</li><li>Battle Fury (MID VUR SHAAN):</li><li>Cyclone (VEN GAAR NOS): Send a cyclone in an upward motion towards enemies.</li><li>Dragon Aspect (MUL QAH DIIV): Using ethreal dragon armor for a period of time.</li><li>Drain Vitality (GAAN LAH HAAS):</li><li>Soul Tear (RII VAAZ ZOL): Rips out an enemy's soul.</li><li>Summon Durnehviir (DUR NEH VIIR): Summons the undead dragon, Durnehviir for a temporary period. Although both the \"Dragon Call\" shout (OD AH VIING) and this shout summon a dragon, Durnehviir counts as a conjured creature, such as a Flame Thrall.</li></ul><h3>Character Progression</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717366\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717366-skillsmenu_wlegal.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1717366-skillsmenu_wlegal.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1717366\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717366-skillsmenu_wlegal.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1717366-skillsmenu_wlegal.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>New UI system for perks</figcaption></figure><p>The class system and leveling arc has been modified to avoid locking players into a particular mold early on. Like previous Elder Scroll games, players become more proficient with a skill by simply using it more often. But this time, the major/minor skill classification has been dropped in favor of a more flexible system. Each level increase allows the player to improve their health, magicka, or stamina.</p><p>Leveling is affected by all skills. The higher the skill, the more it contributes to leveling. Raising a certain skill from 30 to 31 can level up a character faster than raising another from 10 to 11, for example. As a result, players can still specialize in any of the 18 available skills and continue leveling at a good pace. Every skill can be raised up to 100. The game doesn't have a level cap, but the progression is designed on a 1 to 50 level curve (as opposed to the 1-25 curve in Oblivion). The aim of the longer curve is to give players more choice and support more divergent archetypes as they progress.</p><p>With the 1.9 Skyrim Update, a new feature called Legendary Skills was released, which lets you make Skills \"Legendary\". This will reset the skills to 15, reset all perks, and refund the perk points, which allows the skill to affect levelling again. This removes the overall level cap, which allows you to level up almost infinitely.</p><h3>Perks</h3><p>Like Fallout 3, players also get the choice of a <a href=\"/perks/3015-366\" data-ref-id=\"3015-366\">perk</a> on each level up. These perks are special power-ups tied to the skill system and allow mastery of abilities, weapons etc. Some perks have tiered levels, allowing players to choose them again, usually with added bonuses. The game contains 280 perks (including multiple levels of the same perk) that bolster corresponding skills in drastic manners.</p><h2>Character Creation</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1703364\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/80045/1703364-content14091_136_0_1297163320.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.6795523906409\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:68.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/80045/1703364-content14091_136_0_1297163320.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1703364\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/80045/1703364-content14091_136_0_1297163320.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/8/80045/1703364-content14091_136_0_1297163320.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Character models have been redone to improve facial structure and animation</figcaption></figure><p>Character creation has been expanded to offer more variety. <a href=\"/beard/3055-304\" data-ref-id=\"3055-304\">Beards</a> and different body types are now present, although facial customization has more limitations. There are no longer hundreds of sliders, but rather in-place presets that can be tweaked to certain limits. This allows Bethesda to make higher quality textures and models at the cost of less customization options.</p><p>Skyrim is a <a href=\"/classes/3015-405\" data-ref-id=\"3015-405\">class</a>-less RPG and players begin the game by simply picking their race, gender and appearance and deciding on the remaining attributes, skills, perks etc. as they level up.</p><h3><b>Races</b></h3><p>As in the previous main Elder Scrolls installments, Skyrim features ten playable races:</p><table><thead><tr><th>Race</th><th>Home Province</th><th>Resistances/Powers</th><th>Skill Bonueses</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><a href=\"/high-elves/3015-3914\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3914\">Altmer</a><br />(High Elves)</td><td><a href=\"/summerset-isle/3035-301\" self in fire for 60 secs, causing fire damage per second to nearby enemies</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>+10 Destruction</li><li>+5 Alchemy, Alteration, Illusion, Light Armor, Destruction, Enchanting, Heavy Armor, One-handed</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"/khajiit/3015-294\" data-ref-id=\"3015-294\">Khajiit</a></td><td><a href=\"/elsweyr/3035-295\" data-ref-id=\"3035-295\">Elsweyr</a></td><td><ul><li>Claw Attacks</li><li>Night Eye: Improved night vision for 60 secs</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>+10 Sneak</li><li>+5 Alchemy, Archery, Lockpicking, Pickpocket, One-handed</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"/nord/3015-1015\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1015\">Nord</a></td><td><a href=\"/skyrim/3035-684\" data-ref-id=\"3035-684\">Skyrim</a></td><td><ul><li>Resist Frost 50%</li><li>Battlecry: Cause target to flee for 30 secs</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>+10 Two-handed</li><li>+5 Block, Light Armor, One-handed, Smithing, Speech</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"/orsimer/3015-2779\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2779\">Orsimer</a><br />(Orc)</td><td>Orsinium</td><td><ul><li>Berserk: Deal double damage, while taking half for 60 secs</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>+10 Heavy Armor</li><li>+5 Block, Enchanting, One-handed, Smithing, Two-handed</li></ul></td></tr><tr><td><a href=\"/redguard/3015-1107\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1107\">Redguard</a></td><td><a href=\"/hammerfell/3035-683\" data-ref-id=\"3035-683\">Hammerfell</a></td><td><ul><li>Resist Poison 50%</li><li>Adrenaline Rush - Tenfold stamina regeneration for 60 secs</li></ul></td><td><ul><li>+10 One-handed</li><li>+5 Alteration, Archery, Block, Destruction, Smithing</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p><i>*All racial powers are available only once per day, with the exception of the Khajiit ability Night Eye, which can be cast over and over again without delay.</i></p><h2>Sound</h2><h3>Voicework</h3><p>The sounds for the dragon shouts were created by applying reverberation to a recorded voice. A unique voice-actor was used for each race and gender's dragon shout. Bethesda hired over 70 voice actors to record the game's 60,000 plus lines of dialogues, some of them being famous actors and actresses including <a href=\"/max-von-sydow/3040-99343\" data-ref-id=\"3040-99343\">Max Von Sydow</a>, <a href=\"/christopher-plummer/3040-101042\" data-ref-id=\"3040-101042\">Christopher Plummer</a>, <a href=\"/joan-allen/3040-101043\" data-ref-id=\"3040-101043\">Joan Allen</a> and <a href=\"/lynda-carter/3040-57217\" data-ref-id=\"3040-57217\">Lynda Carter</a>.</p><h3>Soundtrack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"medium\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2018577\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/2018577-skyrimmusicsetgatefoldinside.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.31328125\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 480px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:31.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/2018577-skyrimmusicsetgatefoldinside.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2018577\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/2018577-skyrimmusicsetgatefoldinside.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/2018577-skyrimmusicsetgatefoldinside.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Skyrim's 4-disc OST</figcaption></figure><p>Skyrim's music is composed by series veteran, <a href=\"../../jeremy-soule/72-17632/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Jeremy Soule</a>. Todd Howard's idea for the score was \"The Elder Scrolls theme, but sung by a barbarian choir\". A developer diary by sound engineer <a href=\"../../mark-lampert/72-90562/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Mark Lampert</a> <a href=\"http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2011/01/14/the-sounds-of-skyrim.aspx\" rel=\"nofollow\">revealed</a> that Skyrim's resultant main theme (called \"Sons of Skyrim\") picks various elements from past themes like Nerevar Rising (Morrowind) and Reign of the Septims (Oblivion), with a Nordic choir layered on top to give it the heavier and more brutal sound Howard required. The music also makes heavy use of drums and chanting to distinguish itself from previous iterations. For the choir, Bethesda recorded about 30 people multiple times and then synced them in post-processing to create the final effect of a 90+ choir.</p><p>The final soundtrack will be released on a massive four-disc set, available initially through Soule's own Directsong service and eventually on iTunes as well.</p><h2>Announcement</h2><p>On December 11, 2010, The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim was announced during the <a href=\"../../spike-video-game-awards-2010/92-6348/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Spike TV Video Game Awards</a>. Todd Howard took the stage during the awards show to show a teaser trailer that referenced Oblivion's ending. The trailer was narrated by Swedish veteran actor Max Von Sydow.</p><p>Transcript for the teaser:</p><blockquote><p>You should have acted.</p><p>They're already here.</p><p>The Elder Scrolls told of their return.</p><p>Their defeat was merely a delay.</p><p>Till the time after Oblivion opened.</p><p>When the sons of Skyrim would spill their own blood.</p><p>But no-one wanted to believe.</p><p>Believe they even existed.</p><p>And when the truth finally dawns, it dawns in fire.</p><p>But.</p><p>There's one they fear.</p><p>In their tongue, he's Dovahkiin: Dragonborn!</p></blockquote><h2><b>Release</b></h2><h3>Pre-order Bonus</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1821393\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1821393-3d_skyrim_wmap_v51.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.41916666666667\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:41.9%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1821393-3d_skyrim_wmap_v51.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1821393\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/3661/1821393-3d_skyrim_wmap_v51.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/3661/1821393-3d_skyrim_wmap_v51.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Pre-order bonus: Premium map</figcaption></figure><p>Players who pre-ordered the game received a premium map with their copies of Skyrim at no extra cost. All regular copies of the game include a paper map.</p><h3>Collector's Edition</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"small\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1856062\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1856062-skyrim_ce_items_x360.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.77375\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 320px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:77.4%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1856062-skyrim_ce_items_x360.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1856062\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/3661/1856062-skyrim_ce_items_x360.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/3661/1856062-skyrim_ce_items_x360.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Collector's Edition</figcaption></figure><p>The collector's edition contained the following bonuses:</p><ul><li>Alduin Statue: A 12 inch PVC model of the game's antagonist Alduin, The World Eater</li><li>The Art of Skyrim: A 200 page coffee table book featuring the game's art.</li><li>Making of Skyrim DVD: A behind-the-scenes look at the game's development with exclusive interviews.</li></ul><h2>Post-Launch Support</h2><p>Similar to previous Bethesda releases, Skyrim launched with a number of bugs affecting all three platforms. Bethesda has since begun the process of releasing patches to fix such issues. However, while Patch 1.2 fixed issues such as a bug in the Xbox 360 version that prevented high resolution textures from loading when the game was installed, it also caused problems of its own. The patch broke all magic resistances, rendering them null. Dragons populating the game world would also sometimes fly backwards. Bethesda plans to fix these new problems and other issues in upcoming patches. Another bug that Bethesda is currently attempting to fix that is specific to the PS3 version affects the game's framerate. The longer the player plays the game and the larger the save file becomes, the more likely it is for the player to experience significant framerate drops.</p><p>Bethesda also plans to release the official SDK, the Creation Kit, for mod development in January, 2012. The Creation Kit will use Steam Workshop, so users can pick and download mods directly from their Steam interface. The Creation Kit was released in February, 2012, one month later than expected.</p><h2>Reception</h2><p>The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is one of the most universally acclaimed games of this generation. It achieved both critical and commercial success.</p><p>Skyrim has an average score of 96/100 on Metacritic (Xbox 360 version). Beyond the high score reviews, Skyrim was awarded 2011 Game Of The Year by multiple renowned publications, such as 1UP, Game Informer, Gamespot and our own Giant Bomb.</p><p>Skyrim sales number were also through the roof, with 7 million copies shipped worldwide on the 1st week, and more than 10 million by the end of 2011. <a href=\"/valve-corporation/3010-1374\" data-ref-id=\"3010-1374\">Valve</a> also announced that Skyrim was the fastest selling game to date on their <a href=\"/steam/3015-718\" data-ref-id=\"3015-718\">Steam</a> platform.</p><h2>DLC</h2><p>Bethesda announced that they would be developing DLC for Skyrim before the gam was released. It entered into a contract with Microsoft for three timed exclusives, meaning three DLCs would first be released on Xbox 360 and made available for other platforms later. Bethesda indicated that their DLC would have more substance like later releases for Oblivion and Fallout 3, though smaller DLC would still appear in between larger ones. Possible features of future DLC were teased in a video entitled \"Skyrim Jam\", some of which have already made it into DLC such as Vampire Lords and house construction.</p><p>Notably, none of the DLC released so far have been made available for the PS3. When Dawnguard was released, Bethesda announced that they were unable to get it to work with Skyrim and said they were working with SCEA to get it working. The same issue came up with Hearthfire, which has yet to be released for PS3 either. As of November, Bethesda has still been unable to get the DLC working for PS3 users.</p><h3>Dawnguard</h3><p>Speculation on the first DLC began shortly after the release of patch Patch 1.5.26 in April, which contained references to new animations and other content prefixed with \"DLC01_\". Bethesda formally announced Dawnguard in May 2012 with the release of a trailer. It was released on June 26th for the Xbox 360 for 1600 MS points, and later for the PC on August 2nd through Steam for $19.99. Called Dawnguard, the expansion pack comes with new gameplay features, locations, and content. The plot introduces a vampire lord named Harkon, who seeks to \"end the tyranny of the sun\" (referring to the weaknesses that vampires have while in the sunlight). A group of vampire hunters, called the Dawnguard set out to stop him. The player can choose which faction to support, with both routes open to vampires and vampire hunters.</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-size=\"large\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2282890\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/76708/2282890-Skyrim-Dawnguard-beta-testers-talk-vampires.jpg\" data-ratio=\"0.55\" data-width=\"600\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 600px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/76708/2282890-Skyrim-Dawnguard-beta-testers-talk-vampires.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2282890\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/7/76708/2282890-Skyrim-Dawnguard-beta-testers-talk-vampires.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_super/7/76708/2282890-Skyrim-Dawnguard-beta-testers-talk-vampires.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Vampire Perk Tree</figcaption></figure><p>The player has the option to become a vampire lord him/herself, or remain a werewolf. Each path has it's own unique skill trees and abilities, which one levels up by slaying enemies while in their respective forms. The expansion introduces Dragonbone weapons, which are stronger than their daedric counterparts, arrow crafting, and crossbows for the player to use. Horse-mounted combat is also featured in this add-on, as well as new dragon shouts, weapons, and armor for the player.</p><p>The add-on introduces a new type of dragon, known as legendary dragons, which far surpass the skill of the previous highest level of dragon (elder dragons).</p><p>The main quest takes the player to some new locations in Skyrim, and reveals more about the mysterious past of the race known as the Falmer. The story also gives further meaning and explanation to the Elder Scrolls, their purpose, their origin, and what makes them so special, and above all, dangerous.</p><p>The add-on introduces a new member of the Thieves Guild, who can be found in the Ragged Flagon, who will change the player's appearance for a mere 1000 gold.</p><h3>Hearthfire</h3><p>Hearthfire was released on September 4, 2012 for the Xbox 360, priced at 400 MS points, and on October 4th, 2012 on PC through Steam for $4.99. Hearthfire is a small DLC, allowing the player to involve themselves in the construction of three possible homes by gathering the necessary supplies. Once built, the house can be expanded with three possible wings. The player can hire NPCs to carry out duties in their new house and also receive a Housecarl from the Jarl of the hold they constructed their home in. Hearthfire also makes it possible to adopt children in the game, who can be housed in any of the new homes as well as the existing ones in Skyrim. Small radiant quests are also added, giving the player tasks such as defending their home from a bandit raid or giant attack.</p><h3>Dragonborn</h3><p>Like with Dawnguard, speculation for the third DLC began with the release of Patch 1.8 for beta testing on October 24th. The patch contained references to new locations, animations, and armors prefixed with \"DLC02\". On November 4th, Bethesda announced the DLC with the release of a trailer, with a release date of December 4th for the Xbox 360 priced at 1600 MS points. Like with Dawnguard and Hearthfire, Dragonborn is a timed exclusive. Bethesda has not commented on the features of Dragonborn directly, but the trailer indicates the player will travel to the island Solstheim which was previously featured in the Morrowind expansion, Bloodmoon. The island will contain new locations, including refugee sites set up by Dunmer after the eruption of the Red Mountain, and see the return of Rieklings, a common enemy from Bloodmoon. The main quest will concern itself with Miraak on the island who is described as the \"first\" Dragonborn.</p><h2>English to Dragon Language Converter</h2><p>Using the English alphabet as a common language its possible to translate common English words into their Dragon equivalent.</p><p>For a full list see the following Giant Bomb guide table (link) which outlines the English to Dragon conversions.</p><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><p><b><strong>Minimum System </strong>Requirements</b></p><ul><li>Windows 7/Vista/XP PC (32 or 64 bit)</li><li>Processor: Dual Core 2.0GHz or equivalent processor</li><li>2GB System RAM</li><li>6GB free HDD Space</li><li>Direct X 9 compliant video card with 512 MB of RAM</li><li>DirectX compatible sound card</li><li>Internet access for Steam activation</li></ul><p><b><strong>Recommended System Requirements</strong></b></p><ul><li>Windows 7/Vista/XP PC (32 or 64 bit)</li><li>Processor: Quad-core Intel or AMD CPU</li><li>4GB System RAM</li><li>6GB free HDD space</li><li>DirectX 9 compatible NVIDIA or AMD ATI video card with 1GB of RAM (Nvidia GeForce GTX 260 or higher; ATI Radeon 4890 or higher).</li><li>DirectX compatible sound card</li><li>Internet access for Steam activation</li></ul><h2>External Links</h2><ul><li><a href=\"http://www.elderscrolls.com/\" rel=\"nofollow\">Official Website</a></li><li><a href=\"http://twitter.com/ElderScrolls\" rel=\"nofollow\">Official Twitter account</a></li></ul>", "deck": "The fifth installment in Bethesda's Elder Scrolls franchise is set in the eponymous province of Skyrim, where the ancient threat of dragons, led by the sinister Alduin, is rising again to threaten all mortal races. {"duration": "0:18:00", "runner": "progamingwithed", "data": {"site_detail_url": "http://www.giantbomb.com/fallout-3/3030-20504/", "expected_release_quarter": null, "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Fallout 3 is the third game in the <a href=\"/fallout/3025-183\" data-ref-id=\"3025-183\">Fallout</a> series and the first to feature a first person perspective. Developed and published by <a href=\"/bethesda-softworks/3010-786\" data-ref-id=\"3010-786\">Bethesda Softworks</a>, it was released on October 28, 2008 on the <a href=\"/pc/3045-94\" data-ref-id=\"3045-94\">PC</a>, <a href=\"/xbox-360/3045-20\" data-ref-id=\"3045-20\">Xbox 360</a> and <a href=\"/playstation-3/3045-35\" data-ref-id=\"3045-35\">PlayStation 3</a>; the game takes place approximately thirty years after the events in <a href=\"/fallout-2/3030-5559\" data-ref-id=\"3030-5559\">Fallout 2</a>. Although set in the same universe, Fallout 3 takes place in the <a href=\"/the-capital-wasteland/3035-2158\" data-ref-id=\"3035-2158\">Capital Wasteland</a> in and around the <a href=\"/washington-dc/3035-255\" data-ref-id=\"3035-255\">Washington D.C.</a> area, rather than California. The game blends design elements and approaches from both the Fallout and <a href=\"/elder-scrolls/3025-174\" data-ref-id=\"3025-174\">Elder Scrolls</a> franchises, resulting in fan debate about Fallout 3's legitimacy as a \"real\" Fallout game.</p><p>Like <a href=\"/the-elder-scrolls-iv-oblivion/3030-20238\" data-ref-id=\"3030-20238\">Oblivion</a>, enemies and items spawn relative to the player's current level. This keeps the difficulty of the game consistent, along with opening the majority of the game up to the player from the beginning. This is a change from the previous Fallout games, which featured zones that posed a huge risk to a low-level character if visited too early by the player. However, the system is markedly different from that of Oblivion in that, once an area is discovered, the environment is locked down to the level at which the player found it, preventing unrealistic jumps in enemy levels over the course of the game.</p><p>Bethesda supported the game post-release with a number of <a href=\"/downloadable-content/3015-329\" data-ref-id=\"3015-329\">downloadable content</a> packs. Most of the pieces took place outside of the <a href=\"/the-wasteland/3035-777\" data-ref-id=\"3035-777\">Wasteland</a>. The downloadable content was initially exclusive to the Xbox 360 and PC versions of the game, but was later released on the PlayStation 3.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><h3>Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System (V.A.T.S.)</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1326/780737-screenshot27.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-780737\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:62.5%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/1326/780737-screenshot27.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-780737\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/1326/780737-screenshot27.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>V.A.T.S. in action</figcaption></figure><p>In addition to the real-time first person action, Fallout 3 introduced a feature called <a href=\"/vault-tec-assisted-targeting-system/3015-1807\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1807\">V.A.T.S</a>. (<b>V</b>ault-Tec <b>A</b>ssisted <b>T</b>argeting <b>S</b>ystem) which pauses the game and allows the character to queue attacks on specific enemy body parts while calculating the odds of each shot hitting the target. The percentage chance of a hit and the damage done by each queued attack depend on several factors including player level, distance from target, perks obtained and skills, and weapon used. Each shot queued in V.A.T.S. requires a certain number of action points (AP) depending on weapon power; expending slightly less than a quarter with a single shot with some pistols, while expending them all with weapons such as the Fat Man. After use, the AP must then regenerate in real-time. However, continued combat in real-time while they are regenerating will cause them to fill up slower. Players can also take Jet, a Chem that briefly increases the amount of AP available to their character.</p><h3>Health &amp; Item Degradation</h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6843/870170-deathclaw_model.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-870170\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"1.3875338753388\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:138.8%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/6843/870170-deathclaw_model.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-870170\"><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/6843/870170-deathclaw_model.jpg\"/></a><figcaption>Shoot their legs to slow them down</figcaption></figure><p>When taking damage, the player's general health or limb health may be affected. General health meaning, of course, the life bar that shrinks as they take damage. However, Fallout 3 also has a specific limb system in place that can affect several things. Each limb has its own health bar, and when a player takes damage to that limb, it may become crippled. A crippled limb will affect certain things depending on which limb it is. For example, if the player has a crippled leg, they will walk much slower. If one of their arms is crippled, their accuracy will suffer. If the head gets crippled, the perception (ability to see enemies on the compass/radar) will decrease. The crippled system means that shooting for the head in V.A.T.S. may not always be the best idea. An example of this would be for <a href=\"/deathclaw/3015-1650\" data-ref-id=\"3015-1650\">Deathclaws</a>. Deathclaws are extremely fast and strong opponents, so shooting and crippling their legs will prevent them from getting close. <a href=\"/stimpak/3055-1133\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1133\">Stimpaks</a> can be applied to individual limbs (rather than used to heal general health) to fix them.</p><p>Radiation is also common in Fallout 3. Food and untreated water will give the player small amounts of radiation when they are consumed. There are also areas throughout the game that may be contaminated, such as nasty radiation pools, that will affect the player. The effects of radiation exposure are cumulative, and after being exposed beyond certain thresholds of tolerance, the player will get different levels of radiation sickness. The sicknesses will affect the players stats, or can kill the player if it's untreated and builds to extreme levels, although certain perks mitigate the penalties or even provide benefits through mutation such as repairing broken limbs when suffering from advanced radiation poisoning. Radiation levels can be reduced or brought back to zero by using certain medicines or getting treated by a doctor or home medical station.</p><p>Another very important aspect of the game is item degradation. Equipped armor and weapons will become damaged over time. The condition is represented by a bar. As an item becomes more and more damaged, it becomes less effective. Weapons lose damage and jam, and armor loses damage resistance. Items can be repaired by using parts of another item that is the same (for example, an assault rifle can be repaired by using parts of another assault rifle) or by paying certain people to do it. The repair skill dictates how much the player can repair their equipment (up to a certain percentage of full condition).</p><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/88339/1419592-psycho_f2.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1419592\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 115px\" data-ratio=\"0.78260869565217\" data-width=\"115\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:78.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/88339/1419592-psycho_f2.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1419592\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/88339/1419592-psycho_f2.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/8/88339/1419592-psycho_f2.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Just like real life, take it easy with the Chems</figcaption></figure><p>Throughout their travels, players will encounter Chems (also known as drugs in the real world) that can be used to affect their performance. There are several different kinds, and if used too much, the player may become addicted. This leads to negative withdrawal symptoms if they don't take some of the drugs they are addicted to at regular intervals. The player can also become addicted to alcohol, and addictions can be cured by a doctor.</p><h3>Interaction</h3><p>Fallout 3 features an extensive dialogue system in which players can interact with almost every <a href=\"/non-player-character/3015-967\" data-ref-id=\"3015-967\">NPC</a> in the game. Players are presented with multiple lines of speech to choose from, and the person they are talking to will react accordingly to the one they choose. Most dialogue options will have a \"good\" line and a \"bad\" line. Through interactions, players can pick up quests and gain information. They also have the potential to talk themselves out of certain situations. Occasionally, players are presented with a Speech challenge, represented by a dialog option marked \"Speech\" with a percentage next to it. The percentage represents the player's chance of success, based on their current Speech level. If they succeed, the player can often gain information about whatever they are talking about. If they fail, they will get nothing from it. Passing a Speech challenge also awards the player with <a href=\"/experience-points/3015-39\" data-ref-id=\"3015-39\">experience points</a>.</p><h3>Lockpicking and Hacking</h3><p>Lockpicking and hacking are two ways of accessing areas, containers, information, or functions that would otherwise be inaccessible. Each is associated with a skill (Lockpicking and Science), dictating whether the player can attempt each of the 5 difficulty levels of locks and terminals (Very Easy, Easy, Average, Hard, and Very Hard). The player can also attempt to force the lock.</p><p>The player can try to pick locks on many objects throughout the Wasteland, including doors, ammunition boxes, and safes. Having at least one <a href=\"/bobby-pin/3055-1744\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1744\">bobby pin</a> is required to pick a lock.</p><h4>Lockpicking Minigame</h4><p>The game will pause and an image of the lock will appear along with a bobby pin and a screwdriver. Using the left stick, the player can move the bobby pin around the keyhole. With the right stick, the player applies torque to the bobby pin to try and open it. If in the right spot, the lock will completely turn. If in the wrong spot, the lock will stop and the controller will vibrate. If one continues moving the bobby pin down in the same direction and the lock stops sooner, one is going the wrong way.</p><p>Hacking is less frequent than lockpicking and is a bit more difficult. Computers that must be hacked can contain backstory or important quest-related info, or allow environment-related functions like unlocking doors or deactivating <a href=\"/turret/3055-43\" data-ref-id=\"3055-43\">turrets</a>.</p><h4>Hacking Minigame</h4><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14220/621291-vlcsnap_4617300.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-621291\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width: 320px\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"320\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/1/14220/621291-vlcsnap_4617300.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-621291\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14220/621291-vlcsnap_4617300.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/1/14220/621291-vlcsnap_4617300.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Hacking a terminal</figcaption></figure><p>When the player chooses an incorrect password, they'll see a fraction on the screen like 2/9 correct. This does not just mean that two of the letters are correct; rather, two of the letters are in the correct position. For example, suppose that the real password is FALLOUT. The player chooses ROLLOUT, and is 5/7 correct, because LLOUT is in the same position in both words. Conversely, if EFFECTS was chosen, it would be 0/7 correct, because while it shares letters with FALLOUT, none of the positions are the same. Some groups of characters are inside square brackets or parentheses. If the player clicks on these groups of characters, the terminal will either remove one incorrect password from the screen or it will replenish the amount of attempts. By doing this, the player can sometimes narrow down the amount of choices to just one word, allowing them to unlock the computer within a minute.</p><h3>Karma</h3><p>The <a href=\"/reputation/3015-2741\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2741\">Karma</a> system implemented in Fallout 3 rates the player's actions throughout the game and portrays them as either a Good, Neutral, or Evil character depending on their choices. For instance, stealing, killing innocents and generally being horrible will earn bad Karma resulting in an Evil character.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1247102-1156109_800px_karmaf3_super.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247102\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 480px\" data-ratio=\"0.36\" data-width=\"480\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:36.0%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1247102-1156109_800px_karmaf3_super.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247102\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1247102-1156109_800px_karmaf3_super.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1247102-1156109_800px_karmaf3_super.png\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>Karma Levels range from Very Evil to Very Good</figcaption></figure><p>Whereas good deeds, such as helping hobos and treating people well will result in positive Karma and a Good character. A balance of these actions means the character will stay neutral. Many quests have different outcomes, and the player can usually choose which of these to pursue. The easiest way to do something often ends up with a lot of dead people and bad Karma, but the more skill based, reasonable or long winded methods usually have a reward of positive Karma. Being a Good character leads to helpful items and such from Neutral or Good NPCs, and vice versa for evil characters. The flip side to this is that evil or good characters will also run into heavily-armed hit groups with a contract for their head. Also, the karma status of the player can determine what kind of followers they can acquire. For example, Evil characters get <a href=\"/jericho/3005-8651\" data-ref-id=\"3005-8651\">Jericho</a> and Clover, Good characters get <a href=\"/fawkes/3005-8633\" data-ref-id=\"3005-8633\">Fawkes</a> and <a href=\"/star-paladin-cross/3005-9399\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9399\">Star Paladin Cross</a>, and Neutral characters get <a href=\"/butch/3005-9245\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9245\">Butch</a> and <a href=\"/sergeant-rl-3/3005-9384\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9384\">Sergeant RL-3</a>. The player's Karma is points based and starts at zero. As the player performs Good and Evil actions they are evaluated and given the appropriate status:</p><h3>Actions that alter Karma</h3><ul><li>Killing an Evil character or creature: No gain or loss in Karma</li><li>Killing a very Evil character or creature: 100 Karma gain</li><li>Killing a good creature: -50 Karma</li><li>Killing a good person: -100 Karma</li><li>Stealing: -5/item</li><li>Good act during a quest: 50</li><li>Evil act during a quest: -50</li><li>Consuming a dead body: -1 (Perk needed)</li></ul><h3>Karma Classification</h3><p>Based on the number of points, the Karma system classifies the player as:</p><ul><li>Below -750 : Very Evil</li><li>-750 to -250: Evil</li><li>-250 to 250: Neutral</li><li>250 to 750: Good</li><li>Above 750: Very Good</li></ul><p>Furthermore, the Vault Dweller will be given a title based on their karma and current level, with Neutral, Evil and Good Karma titles unique for each level. There are 30 different Karma levels in Fallout 3.</p><h3>S.P.E.C.I.A.L. System</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1247100-965208_you_re_special_super.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247100\" data-size=\"medium\" style=\"width: 275px\" data-ratio=\"1.0218181818182\" data-width=\"275\" data-embed-type=\"image\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:102.2%\" href=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/3661/1247100-965208_you_re_special_super.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1247100\"><img class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1247100-965208_you_re_special_super.jpg\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_medium/0/3661/1247100-965208_you_re_special_super.jpg\"/></noscript></a><figcaption>That's right, Sonny, you're special!</figcaption></figure><p>The SPECIAL system used in Fallout 3 is similar to that found in previous Fallout games. It is a set of seven attributes that govern each of the game's skills, as well as certain character stats. They are first encountered during early childhood, when the player finds a picture book called \"You're SPECIAL\" and assigns points to the SPECIAL attributes. Each one starts at a level of 5, and at this moment the player is asked to split up a further 5 total points between the skills. There is little use in leveling one attribute up to 10, because then it cannot be improved later in the game. SPECIAL can't exceed 10 or drop lower than 1, so if they reach these caps even if an item is equipped or a chem or foodstuff consumed that could add a point to one of them, there will be no change.</p><p>SPECIAL stands for:</p><ul><li><b>Strength</b><br />Affects: Melee Weapons, Carry Weight, Melee damage bonus</li><li><b>Perception<br /></b>Affects: Explosives, Lock-pick, Energy Weapons, minimum distance for red compass markers</li><li><b>Endurance<br /></b>Affects: Hit Points, Poison Resistance, Radiation Resistance, Big Guns, Unarmed, oxygen counter when diving</li><li><b>Charisma<br /></b>Affects: NPC disposition towards player, Barter, Speech</li><li><b>Intelligence<br /></b>Affects: Number of new skill points per level, Medicine, Repair, Science</li><li><b>Agility<br /></b>Affects: Action Points available for V.A.T.S., Small Guns, Sneak</li><li><b>Luck<br /></b>Affects: All skills, Critical chance, Accuracy, random encounters</li></ul><h3>Skills</h3><p>Skills dictate the player character's effectiveness in specific elements of gameplay. They are affected by the player's SPECIAL stats, as well as certain equipment, perks, and temporary effects. The player is asked to \"tag\" three skills at the beginning of the game, which grants a bonus of fifteen points to each.</p><p>While Fallout 1 and 2 both had 18 skills in total, Fallout 3 reduces the number to 13, partly by merging similar skills - Doctor and First Aid are replaced by a general Medicine skill, for instance, and disarming traps is governed by Explosives or Repair, rather than a dedicated Traps skill. The Gambling and Outdoorsman skills are not carried forward in any form.</p><p>A Vault Boy bobblehead for each skill can be found hidden somewhere in the game world, adding 10 points to that skill when used.</p><table><tbody><tr><th>Skill</th><th>Description</th></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4527/1618027-1.png\" data-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4527/1618027-1.png\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\"><noscript><img Pistol, Laser Rifle, Plasma Rifle, etc.)</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4527/1618037-1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1618037\" dialogue options.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4527/1618044-_.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1618044\" data-size=\"small\" Dweller.</td></tr><tr><td><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/0/4527/1618046-_.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1618046\" data-size=\"small\" style=\"width:
